verse:24:15 It happened, before he had finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher on her shoulder. 
verse:24:16 The young lady was very beautiful to look at, a virgin, neither had any man known her. She went down to the spring, filled her pitcher, and came up. 
verse:24:17 The servant ran to meet her, and said, "Please give me a drink, a little water from your pitcher."
verse:24:18 She said, "Drink, my lord." She hurried, and let down her pitcher on her hand, and gave him drink. 
verse:24:19 When she had done giving him drink, she said, "I will also draw for your camels, until they have done drinking." 
verse:24:20 She hurried, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.
verse:24:21 The man looked steadfastly at her, remaining silent, to know whether HASHEM had made his journey prosperous or not. 
verse:24:22 It happened, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold, 
verse:24:23 and said, "Whose daughter are you? Please tell me. Is there room in your father's house for us to lodge in?"
verse:24:24 She said to him, "I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor." 
verse:24:25 She said moreover to him, "We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in."
verse:24:26 The man bowed his head, and worshiped HASHEM. 
verse:24:27 He said, "Blessed be HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken his loving kindness and his truth toward my master. As for me, HASHEM has led me in the way to the house of my master's relatives."
verse:24:28 The young lady ran, and told her mother's house about these words. 
verse:24:29 Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man, to the spring. 
verse:24:30 It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, "This is what the man said to me," that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring. 
verse:24:31 He said, "Come in, you blessed of HASHEM. Why do you stand outside? For I have prepared the house, and room for the camels."
verse:24:32 The man came into the house, and he unloaded the camels. He gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him. 
verse:24:33 Food was set before him to eat, but he said, "I will not eat until I have told my message."
He said, "Speak on."
verse:24:34 He said, "I am Abraham's servant. 
verse:24:35 HASHEM has blessed my master greatly. He has become great. He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male servants and female servants, and camels and donkeys. 
verse:24:36 Sarah, my master's wife, bore a son to my master when she was old. He has given all that he has to him. 
verse:24:37 My master made me swear, saying, 'You shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live, 
verse:24:38 but you shall go to my father's house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.' 
verse:24:39 I asked my master, 'What if the woman will not follow me?' 
verse:24:40 He said to me, 'HASHEM, before whom I walk, will send his angel with you, and prosper your way. You shall take a wife for my son of my relatives, and of my father's house. 
verse:24:41 Then will you be clear from my oath, when you come to my relatives. If they don't give her to you, you shall be clear from my oath.' 
verse:24:42 I came this day to the spring, and said, 'HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go--
verse:24:43 behold, I am standing by this spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes out to draw, to whom I will say, "Please give me a little water from your pitcher to drink," 
verse:24:44 and she will tell me, "Drink, and I will also draw for your camels,"--let her be the woman whom HASHEM has appointed for my master's son.' 
verse:24:45 Before I had finished speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her pitcher on her shoulder. She went down to the spring, and drew. I said to her, 'Please let me drink.' 
verse:24:46 She hurried and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, 'Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink.' So I drank, and she also gave the camels a drink. 
verse:24:47 I asked her, and said, 'Whose daughter are you?' She said, 'The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.' I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her hands. 
verse:24:48 I bowed my head, and worshiped HASHEM, and blessed HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter for his son. 
verse:24:49 Now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me. If not, tell me, that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left."
verse:24:50 Then Laban and Bethuel answered, "The thing proceeds from HASHEM. We can't speak to you bad or good. 
verse:24:51 Behold, Rebekah is before you. Take her, and go, and let her be your master's son's wife, as HASHEM has spoken."
verse:24:52 It happened that when Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth to HASHEM. 
verse:24:53 The servant brought out jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah. He also gave precious things to her brother and her mother. 
verse:24:54 They ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed all night. They rose up in the morning, and he said, "Send me away to my master."
verse:24:55 Her brother and her mother said, "Let the young lady stay with us a few days, at least ten. After that she will go."
verse:24:56 He said to them, "Don't hinder me, since HASHEM has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master."
verse:24:57 They said, "We will call the young lady, and ask her." 
verse:24:58 They called Rebekah, and said to her, "Will you go with this man?"
She said, "I will go."
verse:24:59 They sent away Rebekah, their sister, with her nurse, Abraham's servant, and his men. 
verse:24:60 They blessed Rebekah, and said to her, "Our sister, may you be the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let your seed possess the gate of those who hate them."
verse:24:61 Rebekah arose with her ladies. They rode on the camels, and followed the man. The servant took Rebekah, and went his way. 
verse:24:62 Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, for he lived in the land of the South. 
verse:24:63 Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening. He lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming. 
verse:24:64 Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel. 
verse:24:65 She said to the servant, "Who is the man who is walking in the field to meet us?"
The servant said, "It is my master."
She took her veil, and covered herself. 
verse:24:66 The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done. 
verse:24:67 Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife. He loved her. Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
verse:25:1 Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah. 
verse:25:2 She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. 
verse:25:3 Jokshan became the father of Sheba, and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim. 
verse:25:4 The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah. 
verse:25:5 Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac, 
verse:25:6 but to the sons of Abraham's concubines, Abraham gave gifts. He sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, to the east country. 
verse:25:7 These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years. 
verse:25:8 Abraham gave up the spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years, and was gathered to his people. 
verse:25:9 Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre, 
verse:25:10 the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth. Abraham was buried there with Sarah, his wife. 
verse:25:11 It happened after the death of Abraham that God blessed Isaac, his son. Isaac lived by Beer Lahai Roi.
verse:25:12 Now this is the history of the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bore to Abraham. 
verse:25:13 These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to the order of their birth: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, 
verse:25:14 Mishma, Dumah, Massa, 
verse:25:15 Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. 
verse:25:16 These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments: twelve princes, according to their nations. 
verse:25:17 These are the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred thirty-seven years. He gave up the spirit and died, and was gathered to his people. 
verse:25:18 They lived from Havilah to Shur that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria. He lived opposite all his relatives.
portion:Genesis 25:19 - 28:9
verse:25:19 This is the history of the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son. Abraham became the father of Isaac. 
verse:25:20 Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Paddan Aram, the sister of Laban the Syrian, to be his wife. 
verse:25:21 Isaac entreated HASHEM for his wife, because she was barren. HASHEM was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived. 
verse:25:22 The children struggled together within her. She said, "If it be so, why do I live?" She went to inquire of HASHEM. 
verse:25:23 HASHEM said to her, "Two nations are in your womb. Two peoples will be separated from your body. The one people will be stronger than the other people. The elder will serve the younger."
verse:25:24 When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb. 
verse:25:25 The first came out red all over, like a hairy garment. They named him Esau. 
verse:25:26 After that, his brother came out, and his hand had hold on Esau's heel. He was named Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.
verse:25:27 The boys grew. Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field. Jacob was a quiet man, living in tents. 
verse:25:28 Now Isaac loved Esau, because he ate his venison. Rebekah loved Jacob. 
verse:25:29 Jacob boiled stew. Esau came in from the field, and he was famished. 
verse:25:30 Esau said to Jacob, "Please feed me with that same red stew, for I am famished." Therefore his name was called Edom.
verse:25:31 Jacob said, "First, sell me your birthright."
verse:25:32 Esau said, "Behold, I am about to die. What good is the birthright to me?"
verse:25:33 Jacob said, "Swear to me first."
He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob. 
verse:25:34 Jacob gave Esau bread and stew of lentils. He ate and drank, rose up, and went his way. So Esau despised his birthright.
verse:26:1 There was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines, to Gerar. 
verse:26:2 HASHEM appeared to him, and said, "Don't go down into Egypt. Live in the land I will tell you about. 
verse:26:3 Live in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you. For to you, and to your seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore to Abraham your father. 
verse:26:4 I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and will give to your seed all these lands. In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, 
verse:26:5 because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my requirements, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws."
verse:26:6 Isaac lived in Gerar. 
verse:26:7 The men of the place asked him about his wife. He said, "She is my sister," for he was afraid to say, "My wife," lest, he thought, "the men of the place might kill me for Rebekah, because she is beautiful to look at." 
verse:26:8 It happened, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was caressing Rebekah, his wife. 
verse:26:9 Abimelech called Isaac, and said, "Behold, surely she is your wife. Why did you say, 'She is my sister?'"
Isaac said to him, "Because I said, 'Lest I die because of her.'"
verse:26:10 Abimelech said, "What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt on us!"
verse:26:11 Abimelech commanded all the people, saying, "He who touches this man or his wife will surely be put to death."
verse:26:12 Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year one hundred times what he planted. HASHEM blessed him. 
verse:26:13 The man grew great, and grew more and more until he became very great. 
verse:26:14 He had possessions of flocks, possessions of herds, and a great household. The Philistines envied him. 
verse:26:15 Now all the wells which his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped, and filled with earth. 
verse:26:16 Abimelech said to Isaac, "Go from us, for you are much mightier than we."
verse:26:17 Isaac departed from there, encamped in the valley of Gerar, and lived there.
verse:26:18 Isaac dug again the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father. For the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham. He called their names after the names by which his father had called them. 
verse:26:19 Isaac's servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water. 
verse:26:20 The herdsmen of Gerar argued with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, "The water is ours." He called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him. 
verse:26:21 They dug another well, and they argued over that, also. He called its name Sitnah. 
verse:26:22 He left that place, and dug another well. They didn't argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, "For now HASHEM has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land."
verse:26:23 He went up from there to Beersheba. 
verse:26:24 HASHEM appeared to him the same night, and said, "I am the God of Abraham your father. Don't be afraid, for I am with you, and will bless you, and multiply your seed for my servant Abraham's sake."
verse:26:25 He built an altar there, and called on the name of HASHEM, and pitched his tent there. There Isaac's servants dug a well.
verse:26:26 Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his army. 
verse:26:27 Isaac said to them, "Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?"
verse:26:28 They said, "We saw plainly that HASHEM was with you. We said, 'Let there now be an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you, 
verse:26:29 that you will do us no harm, as we have not touched you, and as we have done to you nothing but good, and have sent you away in peace.' You are now the blessed of HASHEM."
verse:26:30 He made them a feast, and they ate and drank. 
verse:26:31 They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace. 
verse:26:32 It happened the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had dug, and said to him, "We have found water." 
verse:26:33 He called it Shibah. Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.
verse:26:34 When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite. 
verse:26:35 They grieved Isaac's and Rebekah's spirits.
verse:27:1 It happened, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, "My son?"
He said to him, "Here I am."
verse:27:2 He said, "See now, I am old. I don't know the day of my death. 
verse:27:3 Now therefore, please take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison. 
verse:27:4 Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die."
verse:27:5 Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it. 
verse:27:6 Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, "Behold, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying, 
verse:27:7 'Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before HASHEM before my death.' 
verse:27:8 Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command you. 
verse:27:9 Go now to the flock, and get me from there two good young goats. I will make them savory food for your father, such as he loves. 
verse:27:10 You shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death."
verse:27:11 Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, "Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man. 
verse:27:12 What if my father touches me? I will seem to him as a deceiver, and I would bring a curse on myself, and not a blessing."
verse:27:13 His mother said to him, "Let your curse be on me, my son. Only obey my voice, and go get them for me."
verse:27:14 He went, and got them, and brought them to his mother. His mother made savory food, such as his father loved. 
verse:27:15 Rebekah took the good clothes of Esau, her elder son, which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob, her younger son. 
verse:27:16 She put the skins of the young goats on his hands, and on the smooth of his neck. 
verse:27:17 She gave the savory food and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
verse:27:18 He came to his father, and said, "My father?"
He said, "Here I am. Who are you, my son?"
verse:27:19 Jacob said to his father, "I am Esau your firstborn. I have done what you asked me to do. Please arise, sit and eat of my venison, that your soul may bless me."
verse:27:20 Isaac said to his son, "How is it that you have found it so quickly, my son?"
He said, "Because HASHEM your God gave me success."
verse:27:21 Isaac said to Jacob, "Please come near, that I may feel you, my son, whether you are really my son Esau or not."
verse:27:22 Jacob went near to Isaac his father. He felt him, and said, "The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau." 
verse:27:23 He didn't recognize him, because his hands were hairy, like his brother, Esau's hands. So he blessed him. 
verse:27:24 He said, "Are you really my son Esau?"
He said, "I am."
verse:27:25 He said, "Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless you."
He brought it near to him, and he ate. He brought him wine, and he drank. 
verse:27:26 His father Isaac said to him, "Come near now, and kiss me, my son." 
verse:27:27 He came near, and kissed him. He smelled the smell of his clothing, and blessed him, and said, "Behold, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which HASHEM has blessed. 
verse:27:28 God give you of the dew of the sky, of the fatness of the earth, and plenty of grain and new wine. 
verse:27:29 Let peoples serve you, and nations bow down to you. Be lord over your brothers. Let your mother's sons bow down to you. Cursed be everyone who curses you. Blessed be everyone who blesses you."
verse:27:30 It happened, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob had just gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting. 
verse:27:31 He also made savory food, and brought it to his father. He said to his father, "Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that your soul may bless me."
verse:27:32 Isaac his father said to him, "Who are you?"
He said, "I am your son, your firstborn, Esau."
verse:27:33 Isaac trembled violently, and said, "Who, then, is he who has taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before you came, and have blessed him? Yes, he will be blessed."
verse:27:34 When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said to his father, "Bless me, even me also, my father."
verse:27:35 He said, "Your brother came with deceit, and has taken away your blessing."
verse:27:36 He said, "Isn't he rightly named Jacob? For he has supplanted me these two times. He took away my birthright. See, now he has taken away my blessing." He said, "Haven't you reserved a blessing for me?"
verse:27:37 Isaac answered Esau, "Behold, I have made him your lord, and all his brothers have I given to him for servants. With grain and new wine have I sustained him. What then will I do for you, my son?"
verse:27:38 Esau said to his father, "Have you but one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, my father." Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
verse:27:39 Isaac his father answered him, "Behold, of the fatness of the earth will be your dwelling, and of the dew of the sky from above. 
verse:27:40 By your sword will you live, and you will serve your brother. It will happen, when you will break loose, that you shall shake his yoke from off your neck."
verse:27:41 Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him. Esau said in his heart, "The days of mourning for my father are at hand. Then I will kill my brother Jacob."
verse:27:42 The words of Esau, her elder son, were told to Rebekah. She sent and called Jacob, her younger son, and said to him, "Behold, your brother Esau comforts himself about you by planning to kill you. 
verse:27:43 Now therefore, my son, obey my voice. Arise, flee to Laban, my brother, in Haran. 
verse:27:44 Stay with him a few days, until your brother's fury turns away; 
verse:27:45 until your brother's anger turn away from you, and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will send, and get you from there. Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?"
verse:27:46 Rebekah said to Isaac, "I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good will my life do me?"
verse:28:1 Isaac called Jacob, blessed him, and commanded him, "You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan. 
verse:28:2 Arise, go to Paddan Aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father. Take a wife from there from the daughters of Laban, your mother's brother. 
verse:28:3 May God Almighty bless you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, that you may be a company of peoples, 
verse:28:4 and give you the blessing of Abraham, to you, and to your seed with you, that you may inherit the land where you travel, which God gave to Abraham."
verse:28:5 Isaac sent Jacob away. He went to Paddan Aram to Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, Rebekah's brother, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
verse:28:6 Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan Aram, to take him a wife from there, and that as he blessed him he gave him a command, saying, "You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan," 
verse:28:7 and that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Paddan Aram. 
verse:28:8 Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan didn't please Isaac, his father. 
verse:28:9 Esau went to Ishmael, and took, besides the wives that he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebaioth, to be his wife.
portion:Genesis 28:10 - 32:3
verse:28:10 Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran. 
verse:28:11 He came to a certain place, and stayed there all night, because the sun had set. He took one of the stones of the place, and put it under his head, and lay down in that place to sleep. 
verse:28:12 He dreamed. Behold, a stairway set upon the earth, and its top reached to heaven. Behold, the angels of God ascending and descending on it. 
verse:28:13 Behold, HASHEM stood above it, and said, "I am HASHEM, the God of Abraham your father, and the God of Isaac. The land whereon you lie, to you will I give it, and to your seed. 
verse:28:14 Your seed will be as the dust of the earth, and you will spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south. In you and in your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed. 
verse:28:15 Behold, I am with you, and will keep you, wherever you go, and will bring you again into this land. For I will not leave you, until I have done that which I have spoken of to you."
verse:28:16 Jacob awakened out of his sleep, and he said, "Surely HASHEM is in this place, and I didn't know it." 
verse:28:17 He was afraid, and said, "How dreadful is this place! This is none other than God's house, and this is the gate of heaven."
verse:28:18 Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil on its top. 
verse:28:19 He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first. 
verse:28:20 Jacob vowed a vow, saying, "If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and clothing to put on, 
verse:28:21 so that I come again to my father's house in peace, and HASHEM will be my God, 
verse:28:22 then this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, will be God's house. Of all that you will give me I will surely give the tenth to you."
verse:29:1 Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east. 
verse:29:2 He looked, and behold, a well in the field, and, behold, three flocks of sheep lying there by it. For out of that well they watered the flocks. The stone on the well's mouth was large. 
verse:29:3 There all the flocks were gathered. They rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone again on the well's mouth in its place. 
verse:29:4 Jacob said to them, "My relatives, where are you from?"
They said, "We are from Haran."
verse:29:5 He said to them, "Do you know Laban, the son of Nahor?"
They said, "We know him."
verse:29:6 He said to them, "Is it well with him?"
They said, "It is well. See, Rachel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep."
verse:29:7 He said, "Behold, it is still the middle of the day, not time to gather the livestock together. Water the sheep, and go and feed them."
verse:29:8 They said, "We can't, until all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well's mouth. Then we water the sheep."
verse:29:9 While he was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she kept them. 
verse:29:10 It happened, when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban, his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban, his mother's brother, that Jacob went near, and rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother. 
verse:29:11 Jacob kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept. 
verse:29:12 Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother, and that he was Rebekah's son. She ran and told her father.
verse:29:13 It happened, when Laban heard the news of Jacob, his sister's son, that he ran to meet Jacob, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. Jacob told Laban all these things. 
verse:29:14 Laban said to him, "Surely you are my bone and my flesh." He lived with him for a month. 
verse:29:15 Laban said to Jacob, "Because you are my brother, should you therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what will your wages be?"
verse:29:16 Laban had two daughters. The name of the elder was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel. 
verse:29:17 Leah's eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful in form and attractive. 
verse:29:18 Jacob loved Rachel. He said, "I will serve you seven years for Rachel, your younger daughter."
verse:29:19 Laban said, "It is better that I give her to you, than that I should give her to another man. Stay with me."
verse:29:20 Jacob served seven years for Rachel. They seemed to him but a few days, for the love he had for her.
verse:29:21 Jacob said to Laban, "Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her."
verse:29:22 Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast. 
verse:29:23 It happened in the evening, that he took Leah his daughter, and brought her to him. He went in to her. 
verse:29:24 Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid. 
verse:29:25 It happened in the morning that, behold, it was Leah. He said to Laban, "What is this you have done to me? Didn't I serve with you for Rachel? Why then have you deceived me?"
verse:29:26 Laban said, "It is not done so in our place, to give the younger before the firstborn. 
verse:29:27 Fulfill the week of this one, and we will give you the other also for the service which you will serve with me yet seven other years."
verse:29:28 Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week. He gave him Rachel his daughter as wife. 
verse:29:29 Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her handmaid. 
verse:29:30 He went in also to Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served with him yet seven other years.
verse:29:31 HASHEM saw that Leah was hated, and he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren. 
verse:29:32 Leah conceived, and bore a son, and she named him Reuben. For she said, "Because HASHEM has looked at my affliction. For now my husband will love me." 
verse:29:33 She conceived again, and bore a son, and said, "Because HASHEM has heard that I am hated, he has therefore given me this son also." She named him Simeon. 
verse:29:34 She conceived again, and bore a son. Said, "Now this time will my husband be joined to me, because I have borne him three sons." Therefore was his name called Levi. 
verse:29:35 She conceived again, and bore a son. She said, "This time will I praise HASHEM." Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.
verse:30:1 When Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister. She said to Jacob, "Give me children, or else I will die."
verse:30:2 Jacob's anger was kindled against Rachel, and he said, "Am I in God's place, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?"
verse:30:3 She said, "Behold, my maid Bilhah. Go in to her, that she may bear on my knees, and I also may obtain children by her." 
verse:30:4 She gave him Bilhah her handmaid as wife, and Jacob went in to her. 
verse:30:5 Bilhah conceived, and bore Jacob a son. 
verse:30:6 Rachel said, "God has judged me, and has also heard my voice, and has given me a son." Therefore called she his name Dan. 
verse:30:7 Bilhah, Rachel's handmaid, conceived again, and bore Jacob a second son. 
verse:30:8 Rachel said, "With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed." She named him Naphtali.
verse:30:9 When Leah saw that she had finished bearing, she took Zilpah, her handmaid, and gave her to Jacob as a wife. 
verse:30:10 Zilpah, Leah's handmaid, bore Jacob a son. 
verse:30:11 Leah said, "How fortunate!" She named him Gad. 
verse:30:12 Zilpah, Leah's handmaid, bore Jacob a second son. 
verse:30:13 Leah said, "Happy am I, for the daughters will call me happy." She named him Asher.
verse:30:14 Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother, Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, "Please give me some of your son's mandrakes."
verse:30:15 She said to her, "Is it a small matter that you have taken away my husband? Would you take away my son's mandrakes, also?"
Rachel said, "Therefore he will lie with you tonight for your son's mandrakes."
verse:30:16 Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, "You must come in to me; for I have surely hired you with my son's mandrakes."
He lay with her that night. 
verse:30:17 God listened to Leah, and she conceived, and bore Jacob a fifth son. 
verse:30:18 Leah said, "God has given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband." She named him Issachar. 
verse:30:19 Leah conceived again, and bore a sixth son to Jacob. 
verse:30:20 Leah said, "God has endowed me with a good dowry. Now my husband will live with me, because I have borne him six sons." She named him Zebulun. 
verse:30:21 Afterwards, she bore a daughter, and named her Dinah.
verse:30:22 God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her, and opened her womb. 
verse:30:23 She conceived, bore a son, and said, "God has taken away my reproach." 
verse:30:24 She named him Joseph, saying, "May HASHEM add another son to me."
verse:30:25 It happened, when Rachel had borne Joseph, that Jacob said to Laban, "Send me away, that I may go to my own place, and to my country. 
verse:30:26 Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you."
verse:30:27 Laban said to him, "If now I have found favor in your eyes, stay here, for I have divined that HASHEM has blessed me for your sake." 
verse:30:28 He said, "Appoint me your wages, and I will give it."
verse:30:29 He said to him, "You know how I have served you, and how your livestock have fared with me. 
verse:30:30 For it was little which you had before I came, and it has increased to a multitude. HASHEM has blessed you wherever I turned. Now when will I provide for my own house also?"
verse:30:31 He said, "What shall I give you?"
Jacob said, "You shall not give me anything. If you will do this thing for me, I will again feed your flock and keep it. 
verse:30:32 I will pass through all your flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted one, and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats. This will be my hire. 
verse:30:33 So my righteousness will answer for me hereafter, when you come concerning my hire that is before you. Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and black among the sheep, that might be with me, will be counted stolen."
verse:30:34 Laban said, "Behold, let it be according to your word."
verse:30:35 That day, he removed the male goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons. 
verse:30:36 He set three days' journey between himself and Jacob, and Jacob fed the rest of Laban's flocks.
verse:30:37 Jacob took to himself rods of fresh poplar, almond, plane tree, peeled white streaks in them, and made the white appear which was in the rods. 
verse:30:38 He set the rods which he had peeled opposite the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink. They conceived when they came to drink. 
verse:30:39 The flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks produced streaked, speckled, and spotted. 
verse:30:40 Jacob separated the lambs, and set the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the black in the flock of Laban: and he put his own droves apart, and didn't put them into Laban's flock. 
verse:30:41 It happened, whenever the stronger of the flock conceived, that Jacob laid the rods before the eyes of the flock in the gutters, that they might conceive among the rods; 
verse:30:42 but when the flock were feeble, he didn't put them in. So the feebler were Laban's, and the stronger Jacob's. 
verse:30:43 The man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.
verse:31:1 He heard the words of Laban's sons, saying, "Jacob has taken away all that was our father's. From that which was our father's, has he gotten all this wealth." 
verse:31:2 Jacob saw the expression on Laban's face, and, behold, it was not toward him as before. 
verse:31:3 HASHEM said to Jacob, "Return to the land of your fathers, and to your relatives, and I will be with you."
verse:31:4 Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock, 
verse:31:5 and said to them, "I see the expression on your father's face, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me. 
verse:31:6 You know that I have served your father with all of my strength. 
verse:31:7 Your father has deceived me, and changed my wages ten times, but God didn't allow him to hurt me. 
verse:31:8 If he said this, 'The speckled will be your wages,' then all the flock bore speckled. If he said this, 'The streaked will be your wages,' then all the flock bore streaked. 
verse:31:9 Thus God has taken away your father's livestock, and given them to me. 
verse:31:10 It happened during mating season that I lifted up my eyes, and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats which leaped on the flock were streaked, speckled, and grizzled. 
verse:31:11 The angel of God said to me in the dream, 'Jacob,' and I said, 'Here I am.' 
verse:31:12 He said, 'Now lift up your eyes, and behold, all the male goats which leap on the flock are streaked, speckled, and grizzled, for I have seen all that Laban does to you. 
verse:31:13 I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar, where you vowed a vow to me. Now arise, get out from this land, and return to the land of your birth.'"
verse:31:14 Rachel and Leah answered him, "Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house? 
verse:31:15 Aren't we accounted by him as foreigners? For he has sold us, and has also quite devoured our money. 
verse:31:16 For all the riches which God has taken away from our father, that is ours and our children's. Now then, whatever God has said to you, do."
verse:31:17 Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives on the camels, 
verse:31:18 and he took away all his livestock, and all his possessions which he had gathered, including the livestock which he had gained in Paddan Aram, to go to Isaac his father, to the land of Canaan. 
verse:31:19 Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father's.
verse:31:20 Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian, in that he didn't tell him that he was running away. 
verse:31:21 So he fled with all that he had. He rose up, passed over the River, and set his face toward the mountain of Gilead.
verse:31:22 Laban was told on the third day that Jacob had fled. 
verse:31:23 He took his relatives with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey. He overtook him in the mountain of Gilead. 
verse:31:24 God came to Laban, the Syrian, in a dream of the night, and said to him, "Take heed to yourself that you don't speak to Jacob either good or bad."
verse:31:25 Laban caught up with Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain, and Laban with his relatives encamped in the mountain of Gilead. 
verse:31:26 Laban said to Jacob, "What have you done, that you have deceived me, and carried away my daughters like captives of the sword? 
verse:31:27 Why did you flee secretly, and deceive me, and didn't tell me, that I might have sent you away with mirth and with songs, with tambourine and with harp; 
verse:31:28 and didn't allow me to kiss my sons and my daughters? Now have you done foolishly. 
verse:31:29 It is in the power of my hand to hurt you, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, 'Take heed to yourself that you don't speak to Jacob either good or bad.' 
verse:31:30 Now, you want to be gone, because you greatly longed for your father's house, but why have you stolen my gods?"
verse:31:31 Jacob answered Laban, "Because I was afraid, for I said, 'Lest you should take your daughters from me by force.' 
verse:31:32 Anyone you find your gods with shall not live. Before our relatives, discern what is yours with me, and take it." For Jacob didn't know that Rachel had stolen them.
verse:31:33 Laban went into Jacob's tent, into Leah's tent, and into the tent of the two female servants; but he didn't find them. He went out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent. 
verse:31:34 Now Rachel had taken the teraphim, put them in the camel's saddle, and sat on them. Laban felt about all the tent, but didn't find them. 
verse:31:35 She said to her father, "Don't let my lord be angry that I can't rise up before you; for I'm having my period." He searched, but didn't find the teraphim.
verse:31:36 Jacob was angry, and argued with Laban. Jacob answered Laban, "What is my trespass? What is my sin, that you have hotly pursued after me? 
verse:31:37 Now that you have felt around in all my stuff, what have you found of all your household stuff? Set it here before my relatives and your relatives, that they may judge between us two.
verse:31:38 "These twenty years I have been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not cast their young, and I haven't eaten the rams of your flocks. 
verse:31:39 That which was torn of animals, I didn't bring to you. I bore its loss. Of my hand you required it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night. 
verse:31:40 This was my situation: in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep fled from my eyes. 
verse:31:41 These twenty years I have been in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flock, and you have changed my wages ten times. 
verse:31:42 Unless the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely now you would have sent me away empty. God has seen my affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked you last night."
verse:31:43 Laban answered Jacob, "The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine: and what can I do this day to these my daughters, or to their children whom they have borne? 
verse:31:44 Now come, let us make a covenant, you and I; and let it be for a witness between me and you."
verse:31:45 Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar. 
verse:31:46 Jacob said to his relatives, "Gather stones." They took stones, and made a heap. They ate there by the heap. 
verse:31:47 Laban called it Jegar Sahadutha, but Jacob called it Galeed. 
verse:31:48 Laban said, "This heap is witness between me and you this day." Therefore it was named Galeed 
verse:31:49 and Mizpah, for he said, "HASHEM watch between me and you, when we are absent one from another. 
verse:31:50 If you afflict my daughters, or if you take wives besides my daughters, no man is with us; behold, God is witness between me and you." 
verse:31:51 Laban said to Jacob, "See this heap, and see the pillar, which I have set between me and you. 
verse:31:52 May this heap be a witness, and the pillar be a witness, that I will not pass over this heap to you, and that you will not pass over this heap and this pillar to me, for harm. 
verse:31:53 The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us." Then Jacob swore by the fear of his father, Isaac. 
verse:31:54 Jacob offered a sacrifice in the mountain, and called his relatives to eat bread. They ate bread, and stayed all night in the mountain. 
verse:32:1 Early in the morning, Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them. Laban departed and returned to his place. 
verse:32:2 Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him. 
verse:32:3 When he saw them, Jacob said, "This is God's army." He called the name of that place Mahanaim.
portion:Genesis 32:4 - 36:43
verse:32:4 Jacob sent messengers in front of him to Esau, his brother, to the land of Seir, the field of Edom. 
verse:32:5 He commanded them, saying, "This is what you shall tell my lord, Esau: 'This is what your servant, Jacob, says. I have lived as a foreigner with Laban, and stayed until now. 
verse:32:6 I have cattle, donkeys, flocks, male servants, and female servants. I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find favor in your sight.'" 
verse:32:7 The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, "We came to your brother Esau. Not only that, but he comes to meet you, and four hundred men with him." 
verse:32:8 Then Jacob was greatly afraid and was distressed. He divided the people who were with him, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two companies; 
verse:32:9 and he said, "If Esau comes to the one company, and strikes it, then the company which is left will escape." 
verse:32:10 Jacob said, "God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, HASHEM, who said to me, 'Return to your country, and to your relatives, and I will do you good,' 
verse:32:11 I am not worthy of the least of all the loving kindnesses, and of all the truth, which you have shown to your servant; for with just my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I have become two companies. 
verse:32:12 Please deliver me from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he come and strike me, and the mothers with the children. 
verse:32:13 You said, 'I will surely do you good, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which can't be numbered because there are so many.'"
verse:32:14 He lodged there that night, and took from that which he had with him, a present for Esau, his brother: 
verse:32:15 two hundred female goats and twenty male goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams, 
verse:32:16 thirty milk camels and their colts, forty cows, ten bulls, twenty female donkeys and ten foals. 
verse:32:17 He delivered them into the hands of his servants, every herd by itself, and said to his servants, "Pass over before me, and put a space between herd and herd." 
verse:32:18 He commanded the foremost, saying, "When Esau, my brother, meets you, and asks you, saying, 'Whose are you? Where are you going? Whose are these before you?' 
verse:32:19 Then you shall say, 'They are your servant, Jacob's. It is a present sent to my lord, Esau. Behold, he also is behind us.'" 
verse:32:20 He commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the herds, saying, "This is how you shall speak to Esau, when you find him. 
verse:32:21 You shall say, 'Not only that, but behold, your servant, Jacob, is behind us.'" For, he said, "I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face. Perhaps he will accept me."
verse:32:22 So the present passed over before him, and he himself lodged that night in the camp.
verse:32:23 He rose up that night, and took his two wives, and his two handmaids, and his eleven sons, and passed over the ford of the Jabbok. 
verse:32:24 He took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which he had. 
verse:32:25 Jacob was left alone, and wrestled with a man there until the breaking of the day. 
verse:32:26 When he saw that he didn't prevail against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh, and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was strained, as he wrestled. 
verse:32:27 The man said, "Let me go, for the day breaks."
Jacob said, "I won't let you go, unless you bless me."
verse:32:28 He said to him, "What is your name?"
He said, "Jacob." 
verse:32:29 He said, "Your name will no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have fought with God and with men, and have prevailed."
verse:32:30 Jacob asked him, "Please tell me your name."
He said, "Why is it that you ask what my name is?" He blessed him there.
verse:32:31 Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for, he said, "I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved." 
verse:32:32 The sun rose on him as he passed over Peniel, and he limped because of his thigh. 
verse:32:33 Therefore the children of Israel don't eat the sinew of the hip, which is on the hollow of the thigh, to this day, because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh in the sinew of the hip.
verse:33:1 Jacob lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. He divided the children between Leah, Rachel, and the two handmaids. 
verse:33:2 He put the handmaids and their children in front, Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear. 
verse:33:3 He himself passed over in front of them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
verse:33:4 Esau ran to meet him, embraced him, fell on his neck, kissed him, and they wept. 
verse:33:5 He lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, "Who are these with you?"
He said, "The children whom God has graciously given your servant." 
verse:33:6 Then the handmaids came near with their children, and they bowed themselves. 
verse:33:7 Leah also and her children came near, and bowed themselves. After them, Joseph came near with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.
verse:33:8 Esau said, "What do you mean by all this company which I met?"
Jacob said, "To find favor in the sight of my lord."
verse:33:9 Esau said, "I have enough, my brother; let that which you have be yours."
verse:33:10 Jacob said, "Please, no, if I have now found favor in your sight, then receive my present at my hand, because I have seen your face, as one sees the face of God, and you were pleased with me. 
verse:33:11 Please take the gift that I brought to you, because God has dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough." He urged him, and he took it.
verse:33:12 Esau said, "Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before you."
verse:33:13 Jacob said to him, "My lord knows that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds with me have their young, and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die. 
verse:33:14 Please let my lord pass over before his servant, and I will lead on gently, according to the pace of the livestock that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come to my lord to Seir."
verse:33:15 Esau said, "Let me now leave with you some of the folk who are with me."
He said, "Why? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord."
verse:33:16 So Esau returned that day on his way to Seir. 
verse:33:17 Jacob traveled to Succoth, built himself a house, and made shelters for his livestock. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
verse:33:18 Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan Aram; and encamped before the city. 
verse:33:19 He bought the parcel of ground where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for one hundred pieces of money. 
verse:33:20 He erected an altar there, and called it El Elohe Israel.
verse:34:1 Dinah, the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land. 
verse:34:2 Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her. He took her, lay with her, and humbled her. 
verse:34:3 His soul joined to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the young lady, and spoke kindly to the young lady. 
verse:34:4 Shechem spoke to his father, Hamor, saying, "Get me this young lady as a wife."
verse:34:5 Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah, his daughter; and his sons were with his livestock in the field. Jacob held his peace until they came. 
verse:34:6 Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to talk with him. 
verse:34:7 The sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it. The men were grieved, and they were very angry, because he had done folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; a which thing ought not to be done. 
verse:34:8 Hamor talked with them, saying, "The soul of my son, Shechem, longs for your daughter. Please give her to him as a wife. 
verse:34:9 Make marriages with us. Give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves. 
verse:34:10 You shall dwell with us, and the land will be before you. Live and trade in it, and get possessions in it."
verse:34:11 Shechem said to her father and to her brothers, "Let me find favor in your eyes, and whatever you will tell me I will give. 
verse:34:12 Ask me a great amount for a dowry, and I will give whatever you ask of me, but give me the young lady as a wife."
verse:34:13 The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with deceit, and spoke, because he had defiled Dinah their sister, 
verse:34:14 and said to them, "We can't do this thing, to give our sister to one who is uncircumcised; for that is a reproach to us. 
verse:34:15 Only on this condition will we consent to you. If you will be as we are, that every male of you be circumcised; 
verse:34:16 then will we give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people. 
verse:34:17 But if you will not listen to us, to be circumcised, then we will take our sister, and we will be gone."
verse:34:18 Their words pleased Hamor and Shechem, Hamor's son. 
verse:34:19 The young man didn't wait to do this thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter, and he was honored above all the house of his father. 
verse:34:20 Hamor and Shechem, his son, came to the gate of their city, and talked with the men of their city, saying, 
verse:34:21 "These men are peaceful with us. Therefore let them live in the land and trade in it. For behold, the land is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters. 
verse:34:22 Only on this condition will the men consent to us to live with us, to become one people, if every male among us is circumcised, as they are circumcised. 
verse:34:23 Won't their livestock and their possessions and all their animals be ours? Only let us give our consent to them, and they will dwell with us."
verse:34:24 All who went out of the gate of his city listened to Hamor, and to Shechem his son; and every male was circumcised, all who went out of the gate of his city. 
verse:34:25 It happened on the third day, when they were sore, that two of Jacob's sons, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, each took his sword, came upon the unsuspecting city, and killed all the males. 
verse:34:26 They killed Hamor and Shechem, his son, with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went away. 
verse:34:27 Jacob's sons came on the dead, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister. 
verse:34:28 They took their flocks, their herds, their donkeys, that which was in the city, that which was in the field, 
verse:34:29 and all their wealth. They took captive all their little ones and their wives, and took as plunder everything that was in the house. 
verse:34:30 Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, "You have troubled me, to make me odious to the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites. I am few in number. They will gather themselves together against me and strike me, and I will be destroyed, I and my house."
verse:34:31 They said, "Should he deal with our sister as with a prostitute?"
verse:35:1 God said to Jacob, "Arise, go up to Bethel, and live there. Make there an altar to God, who appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother."
verse:35:2 Then Jacob said to his household, and to all who were with him, "Put away the foreign gods that are among you, purify yourselves, change your garments. 
verse:35:3 Let us arise, and go up to Bethel. I will make there an altar to God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went."
verse:35:4 They gave to Jacob all the foreign gods which were in their hands, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the oak which was by Shechem. 
verse:35:5 They traveled, and a terror of God was on the cities that were around them, and they didn't pursue the sons of Jacob. 
verse:35:6 So Jacob came to Luz (that is, Bethel), which is in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him. 
verse:35:7 He built an altar there, and called the place El Beth El; because there God was revealed to him, when he fled from the face of his brother. 
verse:35:8 Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak; and its name was called Allon Bacuth.
verse:35:9 God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Paddan Aram, and blessed him. 
verse:35:10 God said to him, "Your name is Jacob. Your name shall not be Jacob any more, but your name will be Israel." He named him Israel. 
verse:35:11 God said to him, "I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply. A nation and a company of nations will be from you, and kings will come out of your body. 
verse:35:12 The land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac, I will give it to you, and to your seed after you will I give the land."
verse:35:13 God went up from him in the place where he spoke with him. 
verse:35:14 Jacob set up a pillar in the place where he spoke with him, a pillar of stone. He poured out a drink offering on it, and poured oil on it. 
verse:35:15 Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him "Bethel."
verse:35:16 They traveled from Bethel. There was still some distance to come to Ephrath, and Rachel travailed. She had hard labor. 
verse:35:17 When she was in hard labor, the midwife said to her, "Don't be afraid, for now you will have another son."
verse:35:18 It happened, as her soul was departing (for she died), that she named him Benoni, but his father named him Benjamin. 
verse:35:19 Rachel died, and was buried in the way to Ephrath (the same is Bethlehem). 
verse:35:20 Jacob set up a pillar on her grave. The same is the Pillar of Rachel's grave to this day. 
verse:35:21 Israel traveled, and spread his tent beyond the tower of Eder. 
verse:35:22 It happened, while Israel lived in that land, that Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father's concubine, and Israel heard of it.
Now the sons of Jacob were twelve. 
verse:35:23 The sons of Leah: Reuben (Jacob's firstborn), Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun. 
verse:35:24 The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin. 
verse:35:25 The sons of Bilhah (Rachel's handmaid): Dan and Naphtali. 
verse:35:26 The sons of Zilpah (Leah's handmaid): Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Paddan Aram. 
verse:35:27 Jacob came to Isaac his father, to Mamre, to Kiriath Arba (which is Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac lived as foreigners.
verse:35:28 The days of Isaac were one hundred eighty years. 
verse:35:29 Isaac gave up the spirit, and died, and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. Esau and Jacob, his sons, buried him.
verse:36:1 Now this is the history of the generations of Esau (that is, Edom). 
verse:36:2 Esau took his wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon, the Hittite; and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, the Hivite; 
verse:36:3 and Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebaioth. 
verse:36:4 Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz. Basemath bore Reuel. 
verse:36:5 Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan. 
verse:36:6 Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the members of his household, with his livestock, all his animals, and all his possessions, which he had gathered in the land of Canaan, and went into a land away from his brother Jacob. 
verse:36:7 For their substance was too great for them to dwell together, and the land of their travels couldn't bear them because of their livestock. 
verse:36:8 Esau lived in the hill country of Seir. Esau is Edom.
verse:36:9 This is the history of the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir: 
verse:36:10 these are the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, the wife of Esau; and Reuel, the son of Basemath, the wife of Esau. 
verse:36:11 The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz. 
verse:36:12 Timna was concubine to Eliphaz, Esau's son; and she bore to Eliphaz Amalek. These are the sons of Adah, Esau's wife. 
verse:36:13 These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These were the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife. 
verse:36:14 These were the sons of Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon, Esau's wife: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verse:36:15 These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: chief Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz, 
verse:36:16 chief Korah, chief Gatam, chief Amalek: these are the chiefs who came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah. 
verse:36:17 These are the sons of Reuel, Esau's son: chief Nahath, chief Zerah, chief Shammah, chief Mizzah: these are the chiefs who came of Reuel in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife. 
verse:36:18 These are the sons of Oholibamah, Esau's wife: chief Jeush, chief Jalam, chief Korah: these are the chiefs who came of Oholibamah the daughter of Anah, Esau's wife. 
verse:36:19 These are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and these are their chiefs.
verse:36:20 These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, 
verse:36:21 Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. These are the chiefs who came of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom. 
verse:36:22 The children of Lotan were Hori and Heman. Lotan's sister was Timna. 
verse:36:23 These are the children of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam. 
verse:36:24 These are the children of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. This is Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness, as he fed the donkeys of Zibeon his father. 
verse:36:25 These are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah. 
verse:36:26 These are the children of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran. 
verse:36:27 These are the children of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan. 
verse:36:28 These are the children of Dishan: Uz and Aran. 
verse:36:29 These are the chiefs who came of the Horites: chief Lotan, chief Shobal, chief Zibeon, chief Anah, 
verse:36:30 chief Dishon, chief Ezer, and chief Dishan: these are the chiefs who came of the Horites, according to their chiefs in the land of Seir.
verse:36:31 These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom, before any king reigned over the children of Israel. 
verse:36:32 Bela, the son of Beor, reigned in Edom. The name of his city was Dinhabah. 
verse:36:33 Bela died, and Jobab, the son of Zerah of Bozrah, reigned in his place. 
verse:36:34 Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place. 
verse:36:35 Husham died, and Hadad, the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place. The name of his city was Avith. 
verse:36:36 Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place. 
verse:36:37 Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the river, reigned in his place. 
verse:36:38 Shaul died, and Baal Hanan, the son of Achbor reigned in his place. 
verse:36:39 Baal Hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his place. The name of his city was Pau. His wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
verse:36:40 These are the names of the chiefs who came from Esau, according to their families, after their places, and by their names: chief Timna, chief Alvah, chief Jetheth, 
verse:36:41 chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon, 
verse:36:42 chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar, 
verse:36:43 chief Magdiel, and chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom, according to their habitations in the land of their possession. This is Esau, the father of the Edomites.
portion:Genesis 37:1 - 40:23
verse:37:1 Jacob lived in the land of his father's travels, in the land of Canaan. 
verse:37:2 This is the history of the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brothers. He was a boy with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father's wives. Joseph brought an evil report of them to their father. 
verse:37:3 Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age, and he made him a coat of many colors. 
verse:37:4 His brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, and they hated him, and couldn't speak peaceably to him.
verse:37:5 Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brothers, and they hated him all the more. 
verse:37:6 He said to them, "Please hear this dream which I have dreamed: 
verse:37:7 for behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and behold, my sheaf arose and also stood upright; and behold, your sheaves came around, and bowed down to my sheaf."
verse:37:8 His brothers said to him, "Will you indeed reign over us? Or will you indeed have dominion over us?" They hated him all the more for his dreams and for his words. 
verse:37:9 He dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brothers, and said, "Behold, I have dreamed yet another dream: and behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars bowed down to me." 
verse:37:10 He told it to his father and to his brothers. His father rebuked him, and said to him, "What is this dream that you have dreamed? Will I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow ourselves down to you to the earth?" 
verse:37:11 His brothers envied him, but his father kept this saying in mind.
verse:37:12 His brothers went to feed their father's flock in Shechem. 
verse:37:13 Israel said to Joseph, "Aren't your brothers feeding the flock in Shechem? Come, and I will send you to them." He said to him, "Here I am."
verse:37:14 He said to him, "Go now, see whether it is well with your brothers, and well with the flock; and bring me word again." So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem. 
verse:37:15 A certain man found him, and behold, he was wandering in the field. The man asked him, "What are you looking for?"
verse:37:16 He said, "I am looking for my brothers. Tell me, please, where they are feeding the flock."
verse:37:17 The man said, "They have left here, for I heard them say, 'Let us go to Dothan.'"
Joseph went after his brothers, and found them in Dothan. 
verse:37:18 They saw him afar off, and before he came near to them, they conspired against him to kill him. 
verse:37:19 They said one to another, "Behold, this dreamer comes. 
verse:37:20 Come now therefore, and let's kill him, and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say, 'An evil animal has devoured him.' We will see what will become of his dreams."
verse:37:21 Reuben heard it, and delivered him out of their hand, and said, "Let's not take his life." 
verse:37:22 Reuben said to them, "Shed no blood. Throw him into this pit that is in the wilderness, but lay no hand on him"--that he might deliver him out of their hand, to restore him to his father. 
verse:37:23 It happened, when Joseph came to his brothers, that they stripped Joseph of his coat, the coat of many colors that was on him; 
verse:37:24 and they took him, and threw him into the pit. The pit was empty. There was no water in it.
verse:37:25 They sat down to eat bread, and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and saw a caravan of Ishmaelites was coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing spices and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Egypt. 
verse:37:26 Judah said to his brothers, "What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood? 
verse:37:27 Come, and let's sell him to the Ishmaelites, and not let our hand be on him; for he is our brother, our flesh." His brothers listened to him. 
verse:37:28 Midianites who were merchants passed by, and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. They brought Joseph into Egypt.
verse:37:29 Reuben returned to the pit; and saw that Joseph wasn't in the pit; and he tore his clothes. 
verse:37:30 He returned to his brothers, and said, "The child is no more; and I, where will I go?" 
verse:37:31 They took Joseph's coat, and killed a male goat, and dipped the coat in the blood. 
verse:37:32 They took the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father, and said, "We have found this. Examine it, now, whether it is your son's coat or not."
verse:37:33 He recognized it, and said, "It is my son's coat. An evil animal has devoured him. Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces." 
verse:37:34 Jacob tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his waist, and mourned for his son many days. 
verse:37:35 All his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted. He said, "For I will go down to Sheol to my son mourning." His father wept for him. 
verse:37:36 The Midianites sold him into Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard.
verse:38:1 It happened at that time, that Judah went down from his brothers, and visited a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah. 
verse:38:2 Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua. He took her, and went in to her. 
verse:38:3 She conceived, and bore a son; and he named him Er. 
verse:38:4 She conceived again, and bore a son; and she named him Onan. 
verse:38:5 She yet again bore a son, and named him Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bore him. 
verse:38:6 Judah took a wife for Er, his firstborn, and her name was Tamar. 
verse:38:7 Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of HASHEM. HASHEM killed him. 
verse:38:8 Judah said to Onan, "Go in to your brother's wife, and perform the duty of a husband's brother to her, and raise up seed to your brother." 
verse:38:9 Onan knew that the seed wouldn't be his; and it happened, when he went in to his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother. 
verse:38:10 The thing which he did was evil in the sight of HASHEM, and he killed him also. 
verse:38:11 Then Judah said to Tamar, his daughter-in-law, "Remain a widow in your father's house, until Shelah, my son, is grown up;" for he said, "Lest he also die, like his brothers." Tamar went and lived in her father's house.
verse:38:12 After many days, Shua's daughter, the wife of Judah, died. Judah was comforted, and went up to his sheepshearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah, the Adullamite. 
verse:38:13 It was told Tamar, saying, "Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep." 
verse:38:14 She took off of her the garments of her widowhood, and covered herself with her veil, and wrapped herself, and sat in the gate of Enaim, which is by the way to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, and she wasn't given to him as a wife. 
verse:38:15 When Judah saw her, he thought that she was a prostitute, for she had covered her face. 
verse:38:16 He turned to her by the way, and said, "Please come, let me come in to you," for he didn't know that she was his daughter-in-law.
She said, "What will you give me, that you may come in to me?"
verse:38:17 He said, "I will send you a young goat from the flock."
She said, "Will you give me a pledge, until you send it?"
verse:38:18 He said, "What pledge will I give you?"
She said, "Your signet and your cord, and your staff that is in your hand."
He gave them to her, and came in to her, and she conceived by him. 
verse:38:19 She arose, and went away, and put off her veil from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood. 
verse:38:20 Judah sent the young goat by the hand of his friend, the Adullamite, to receive the pledge from the woman's hand, but he didn't find her. 
verse:38:21 Then he asked the men of her place, saying, "Where is the prostitute, that was at Enaim by the road?"
They said, "There has been no prostitute here."
verse:38:22 He returned to Judah, and said, "I haven't found her; and also the men of the place said, 'There has been no prostitute here.'" 
verse:38:23 Judah said, "Let her keep it, lest we be shamed. Behold, I sent this young goat, and you haven't found her."
verse:38:24 It happened about three months later, that it was told Judah, saying, "Tamar, your daughter-in-law, has played the prostitute; and moreover, behold, she is with child by prostitution."
Judah said, "Bring her out, and let her be burnt." 
verse:38:25 When she was brought out, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, "By the man, whose these are, I am with child." She also said, "Please discern whose are these--the signet, and the cords, and the staff."
verse:38:26 Judah acknowledged them, and said, "She is more righteous than I, because I didn't give her to Shelah, my son."
He knew her again no more. 
verse:38:27 It happened in the time of her travail, that behold, twins were in her womb. 
verse:38:28 When she travailed, one put out a hand, and the midwife took and tied a scarlet thread on his hand, saying, "This came out first." 
verse:38:29 It happened, as he drew back his hand, that behold, his brother came out, and she said, "Why have you made a breach for yourself?" Therefore his name was called Perez. 
verse:38:30 Afterward his brother came out, that had the scarlet thread on his hand, and his name was called Zerah.
verse:39:1 Joseph was brought down to Egypt. Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him from the hand of the Ishmaelites that had brought him down there. 
verse:39:2 HASHEM was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man. He was in the house of his master the Egyptian. 
verse:39:3 His master saw that HASHEM was with him, and that HASHEM made all that he did prosper in his hand. 
verse:39:4 Joseph found favor in his sight. He ministered to him, and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand. 
verse:39:5 It happened from the time that he made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that HASHEM blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake; and the blessing of HASHEM was on all that he had, in the house and in the field. 
verse:39:6 He left all that he had in Joseph's hand. He didn't concern himself with anything, except for the food which he ate.
Joseph was well-built and handsome. 
verse:39:7 It happened after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes on Joseph; and she said, "Lie with me."
verse:39:8 But he refused, and said to his master's wife, "Behold, my master doesn't know what is with me in the house, and he has put all that he has into my hand. 
verse:39:9 He isn't greater in this house than I, neither has he kept back anything from me but you, because you are his wife. How then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?"
verse:39:10 As she spoke to Joseph day by day, he didn't listen to her, to lie by her, or to be with her. 
verse:39:11 About this time, he went into the house to do his work, and there were none of the men of the house inside. 
verse:39:12 She caught him by his garment, saying, "Lie with me!"
He left his garment in her hand, and ran outside. 
verse:39:13 When she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and had run outside, 
verse:39:14 she called to the men of her house, and spoke to them, saying, "Behold, he has brought in a Hebrew to us to mock us. He came in to me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice. 
verse:39:15 It happened, when he heard that I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and ran outside." 
verse:39:16 She laid up his garment by her, until his master came home. 
verse:39:17 She spoke to him according to these words, saying, "The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought to us, came in to me to mock me, 
verse:39:18 and it happened, as I lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment by me, and ran outside."
verse:39:19 It happened, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, "This is what your servant did to me," that his wrath was kindled. 
verse:39:20 Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, the place where the king's prisoners were bound, and he was there in custody. 
verse:39:21 But HASHEM was with Joseph, and showed kindness to him, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison. 
verse:39:22 The keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners who were in the prison. Whatever they did there, he was responsible for it. 
verse:39:23 The keeper of the prison didn't look after anything that was under his hand, because HASHEM was with him; and that which he did, HASHEM made it prosper.
verse:40:1 It happened after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker offended their lord, the king of Egypt. 
verse:40:2 Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker. 
verse:40:3 He put them in custody in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound. 
verse:40:4 The captain of the guard assigned them to Joseph, and he took care of them. They stayed in prison many days. 
verse:40:5 They both dreamed a dream, each man his dream, in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were bound in the prison. 
verse:40:6 Joseph came in to them in the morning, and saw them, and saw that they were sad. 
verse:40:7 He asked Pharaoh's officers who were with him in custody in his master's house, saying, "Why do you look so sad today?"
verse:40:8 They said to him, "We have dreamed a dream, and there is no one who can interpret it."
Joseph said to them, "Don't interpretations belong to God? Please tell it to me."
verse:40:9 The chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, "In my dream, behold, a vine was in front of me, 
verse:40:10 and in the vine were three branches. It was as though it budded, it blossomed, and its clusters produced ripe grapes. 
verse:40:11 Pharaoh's cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand."
verse:40:12 Joseph said to him, "This is its interpretation: the three branches are three days. 
verse:40:13 Within three more days, Pharaoh will lift up your head, and restore you to your office. You will give Pharaoh's cup into his hand, the way you did when you were his cupbearer. 
verse:40:14 But remember me when it will be well with you, and please show kindness to me, and make mention of me to Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house. 
verse:40:15 For indeed, I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews, and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon."
verse:40:16 When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, "I also was in my dream, and behold, three baskets of white bread were on my head. 
verse:40:17 In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head."
verse:40:18 Joseph answered, "This is its interpretation. The three baskets are three days. 
verse:40:19 Within three more days, Pharaoh will lift up your head from off you, and will hang you on a tree; and the birds will eat your flesh from off you." 
verse:40:20 It happened the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants, and he lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker among his servants. 
verse:40:21 He restored the chief cupbearer to his position again, and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand; 
verse:40:22 but he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them. 
verse:40:23 Yet the chief cupbearer didn't remember Joseph, but forgot him.
portion:Genesis 41:1 - 44:17
verse:41:1 It happened at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and behold, he stood by the river. 
verse:41:2 Behold, there came up out of the river seven cattle, sleek and fat, and they fed in the marsh grass. 
verse:41:3 Behold, seven other cattle came up after them out of the river, ugly and thin, and stood by the other cattle on the brink of the river. 
verse:41:4 The ugly and thin cattle ate up the seven sleek and fat cattle. So Pharaoh awoke. 
verse:41:5 He slept and dreamed a second time: and behold, seven heads of grain came up on one stalk, healthy and good.
