verse:7:67 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering; 
verse:7:68 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense; 
verse:7:69 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering; 
verse:7:70 one male goat for a sin offering; 
verse:7:71 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verse:7:72 On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ochran, prince of the children of Asher 
verse:7:73 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering; 
verse:7:74 one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense; 
verse:7:75 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering; 
verse:7:76 one male goat for a sin offering; 
verse:7:77 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.
verse:7:78 On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali 
verse:7:79 gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering; 
verse:7:80 one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense; 
verse:7:81 one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering; 
verse:7:82 one male goat for a sin offering; 
verse:7:83 and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two head of cattle, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
verse:7:84 This was the dedication of the altar, on the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, twelve golden ladles; 
verse:7:85 each silver platter weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the vessels two thousand four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; 
verse:7:86 the twelve golden ladles, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, after the shekel of the sanctuary; all the gold of the ladles weighed one hundred twenty shekels; 
verse:7:87 all the cattle for the burnt offering twelve bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs a year old twelve, and their meal offering; and the male goats for a sin offering twelve; 
verse:7:88 and all the cattle for the sacrifice of peace offerings twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, the male lambs a year old sixty. This was the dedication of the altar, after it was anointed.
verse:7:89 When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with HASHEM, he heard his voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim: and he spoke to him.
portion:Numbers 8:1 - 12:16
verse:8:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:8:2 "Speak to Aaron, and tell him, 'When you light the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the menorah.'"
verse:8:3 Aaron did so. He lit its lamps to light the area in front of the menorah, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:8:4 This was the workmanship of the menorah, beaten work of gold. From its base to its flowers, it was beaten work: according to the pattern which HASHEM had shown Moses, so he made the menorah.
verse:8:5 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:8:6 "Take the Levites from among the children of Israel, and cleanse them. 
verse:8:7 You shall do this to them, to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of cleansing on them, let them shave their whole bodies with a razor, and let them wash their clothes, and cleanse themselves. 
verse:8:8 Then let them take a young bull, and its meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil; and another young bull you shall take for a sin offering. 
verse:8:9 You shall present the Levites before the Tent of Meeting. You shall assemble the whole congregation of the children of Israel. 
verse:8:10 You shall present the Levites before HASHEM. The children of Israel shall lay their hands on the Levites, 
verse:8:11 and Aaron shall offer the Levites before HASHEM for a wave offering, on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of HASHEM.
verse:8:12 "The Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and you shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering to HASHEM, to make atonement for the Levites. 
verse:8:13 You shall set the Levites before Aaron, and before his sons, and offer them as a wave offering to HASHEM. 
verse:8:14 Thus you shall separate the Levites from among the children of Israel, and the Levites shall be mine.
verse:8:15 "After that, the Levites shall go in to do the service of the Tent of Meeting: and you shall cleanse them, and offer them as a wave offering. 
verse:8:16 For they are wholly given to me from among the children of Israel; instead of all who open the womb, even the firstborn of all the children of Israel, I have taken them to me. 
verse:8:17 For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are mine, both man and animal. On the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for myself. 
verse:8:18 I have taken the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel. 
verse:8:19 I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the Tent of Meeting, and to make atonement for the children of Israel; that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come near to the sanctuary."
verse:8:20 Moses, and Aaron, and all the congregation of the children of Israel did so to the Levites. According to all that HASHEM commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them. 
verse:8:21 The Levites purified themselves from sin, and they washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them for a wave offering before HASHEM; and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them. 
verse:8:22 After that, the Levites went in to do their service in the Tent of Meeting before Aaron, and before his sons: as HASHEM had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so they did to them.
verse:8:23 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:8:24 "This is that which belongs to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall go in to wait on the service in the work of the Tent of Meeting; 
verse:8:25 and from the age of fifty years they shall cease waiting on the work, and shall serve no more, 
verse:8:26 but shall minister with their brothers in the Tent of Meeting, to perform the duty, and shall do no service. You shall do thus to the Levites concerning their duties."
verse:9:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying, 
verse:9:2 "Moreover let the children of Israel keep the Passover in its appointed season. 
verse:9:3 On the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you shall keep it in its appointed season--according to all its statutes, and according to all its ordinances, you shall keep it."
verse:9:4 Moses spoke to the children of Israel, that they should keep the Passover. 
verse:9:5 They kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, in the wilderness of Sinai. According to all that HASHEM commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did. 
verse:9:6 There were certain men, who were unclean because of the dead body of a man, so that they could not keep the Passover on that day, and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day. 
verse:9:7 Those men said to him, "We are unclean because of the dead body of a man. Why are we kept back, that we may not offer the offering of HASHEM in its appointed season among the children of Israel?"
verse:9:8 Moses answered them, "Wait, that I may hear what HASHEM will command concerning you."
verse:9:9 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:9:10 "Say to the children of Israel, 'If any man of you or of your generations is unclean by reason of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, he shall still keep the Passover to HASHEM. 
verse:9:11 In the second month, on the fourteenth day at evening they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs. 
verse:9:12 They shall leave none of it until the morning, nor break a bone of it. According to all the statute of the Passover they shall keep it. 
verse:9:13 But the man who is clean, and is not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people. Because he didn't offer the offering of HASHEM in its appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.
verse:9:14 "'If a foreigner lives among you, and desires to keep the Passover to HASHEM; according to the statute of the Passover, and according to its ordinance, so shall he do. You shall have one statute, both for the foreigner, and for him who is born in the land.'"
verse:9:15 On the day that the tabernacle was raised up, the cloud covered the tabernacle, even the Tent of the Testimony: and at evening it was over the tabernacle as it were the appearance of fire, until morning. 
verse:9:16 So it was continually. The cloud covered it, and the appearance of fire by night. 
verse:9:17 Whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Tent, then after that the children of Israel traveled; and in the place where the cloud remained, there the children of Israel encamped. 
verse:9:18 At the commandment of HASHEM, the children of Israel traveled, and at the commandment of HASHEM they encamped. As long as the cloud remained on the tabernacle they remained encamped. 
verse:9:19 When the cloud stayed on the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept HASHEM's command, and didn't travel. 
verse:9:20 Sometimes the cloud was a few days on the tabernacle; then according to the commandment of HASHEM they remained encamped, and according to the commandment of HASHEM they traveled. 
verse:9:21 Sometimes the cloud was from evening until morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they traveled: or by day and by night, when the cloud was taken up, they traveled. 
verse:9:22 Whether it was two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud stayed on the tabernacle, remaining on it, the children of Israel remained encamped, and didn't travel; but when it was taken up, they traveled. 
verse:9:23 At the commandment of HASHEM they encamped, and at the commandment of HASHEM they traveled. They kept HASHEM's command, at the commandment of HASHEM by Moses.
verse:10:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:10:2 "Make two shofars of silver. You shall make them of beaten work. You shall use them for the calling of the congregation, and for the journeying of the camps. 
verse:10:3 When they blow them, all the congregation shall gather themselves to you at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:10:4 If they blow just one, then the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather themselves to you. 
verse:10:5 When you blow an alarm, the camps that lie on the east side shall go forward. 
verse:10:6 When you blow an alarm the second time, the camps that lie on the south side shall go forward. They shall blow an alarm for their journeys. 
verse:10:7 But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall blow, but you shall not sound an alarm.
verse:10:8 "The sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the shofars. This shall be to you for a statute forever throughout your generations. 
verse:10:9 When you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the shofars. Then you will be remembered before HASHEM your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.
verse:10:10 "Also in the day of your gladness, and in your set feasts, and in the beginnings of your months, you shall blow the shofars over your burnt offerings, and over the sacrifices of your peace offerings; and they shall be to you for a memorial before your God. I am HASHEM your God."
verse:10:11 It happened in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth day of the month, that the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle of the testimony. 
verse:10:12 The children of Israel went forward according to their journeys out of the wilderness of Sinai; and the cloud stayed in the wilderness of Paran. 
verse:10:13 They first went forward according to the commandment of HASHEM by Moses.
verse:10:14 First, the standard of the camp of the children of Judah went forward according to their armies. Nahshon the son of Amminadab was over his army. 
verse:10:15 Nethanel the son of Zuar was over the army of the tribe of the children of Issachar. 
verse:10:16 Eliab the son of Helon was over the army of the tribe of the children of Zebulun. 
verse:10:17 The tabernacle was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who bore the tabernacle, went forward. 
verse:10:18 The standard of the camp of Reuben went forward according to their armies. Elizur the son of Shedeur was over his army. 
verse:10:19 Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai was over the army of the tribe of the children of Simeon. 
verse:10:20 Eliasaph the son of Deuel was over the army of the tribe of the children of Gad.
verse:10:21 The Kohathites set forward, bearing the sanctuary. The others set up the tabernacle before they arrived.
verse:10:22 The standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set forward according to their armies. Elishama the son of Ammihud was over his army. 
verse:10:23 Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur was over the army of the tribe of the children of Manasseh. 
verse:10:24 Abidan the son of Gideoni was over the army of the tribe of the children of Benjamin.
verse:10:25 The standard of the camp of the children of Dan, which was the rear guard of all the camps, set forward according to their armies. Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai was over his army. 
verse:10:26 Pagiel the son of Ochran was over the army of the tribe of the children of Asher. 
verse:10:27 Ahira the son of Enan was over the army of the tribe of the children of Naphtali. 
verse:10:28 Thus were the travels of the children of Israel according to their armies; and they went forward.
verse:10:29 Moses said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses' father-in-law, "We are journeying to the place of which HASHEM said, 'I will give it to you.' Come with us, and we will treat you well; for HASHEM has spoken good concerning Israel."
verse:10:30 He said to him, "I will not go; but I will depart to my own land, and to my relatives."
verse:10:31 He said, "Don't leave us, please; because you know how we are to encamp in the wilderness, and you can be our eyes. 
verse:10:32 It shall be, if you go with us, yes, it shall be, that whatever good HASHEM does to us, we will do the same to you."
verse:10:33 They set forward from the Mount of HASHEM three days' journey. The ark of the covenant of HASHEM went before them three days' journey, to seek out a resting place for them. 
verse:10:34 The cloud of HASHEM was over them by day, when they set forward from the camp. 
verse:10:35 It happened, when the ark went forward, that Moses said, "Rise up, HASHEM, and let your enemies be scattered! Let those who hate you flee before you!" 
verse:10:36 When it rested, he said, "Return, HASHEM, to the ten thousands of the thousands of Israel."
verse:11:1 The people were complaining in the ears of HASHEM. When HASHEM heard it, his anger was kindled; and HASHEM's fire burnt among them, and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp. 
verse:11:2 The people cried to Moses; and Moses prayed to HASHEM, and the fire abated. 
verse:11:3 The name of that place was called Taberah, because HASHEM's fire burnt among them.
verse:11:4 The mixed multitude that was among them lusted exceedingly: and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, "Who will give us flesh to eat? 
verse:11:5 We remember the fish, which we ate in Egypt for nothing; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlic; 
verse:11:6 but now we have lost our appetite. There is nothing at all except this manna to look at." 
verse:11:7 The manna was like coriander seed, and its appearance like the appearance of bdellium. 
verse:11:8 The people went around, gathered it, and ground it in mills, or beat it in mortars, and boiled it in pots, and made cakes of it. Its taste was like the taste of fresh oil. 
verse:11:9 When the dew fell on the camp in the night, the manna fell on it.
verse:11:10 Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, every man at the door of his tent; and the anger of HASHEM was kindled greatly; and Moses was displeased. 
verse:11:11 Moses said to HASHEM, "Why have you treated with your servant so badly? Why haven't I found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of all this people on me? 
verse:11:12 Have I conceived all this people? Have I brought them forth, that you should tell me, 'Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which you swore to their fathers?' 
verse:11:13 Where could I get meat to give to all this people? For they weep to me, saying, 'Give us meat, that we may eat.' 
verse:11:14 I am not able to bear all this people alone, because it is too heavy for me. 
verse:11:15 If you treat me this way, please kill me right now, if I have found favor in your sight; and don't let me see my wretchedness."
verse:11:16 HASHEM said to Moses, "Gather to me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom you know to be the elders of the people, and officers over them; and bring them to the Tent of Meeting, that they may stand there with you. 
verse:11:17 I will come down and talk with you there. I will take of the Spirit which is on you, and will put it on them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with you, that you not bear it yourself alone.
verse:11:18 "Say to the people, 'Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow, and you will eat flesh; for you have wept in the ears of HASHEM, saying, "Who will give us flesh to eat? For it was well with us in Egypt." Therefore HASHEM will give you flesh, and you will eat. 
verse:11:19 You will not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days, 
verse:11:20 but a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it is loathsome to you; because that you have rejected HASHEM who is among you, and have wept before him, saying, "Why did we come out of Egypt?"'"
verse:11:21 Moses said, "The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, 'I will give them flesh, that they may eat a whole month.' 
verse:11:22 Shall flocks and herds be slaughtered for them, to be sufficient for them? Shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to be sufficient for them?"
verse:11:23 HASHEM said to Moses, "Has HASHEM's hand grown short? Now you will see whether my word will happen to you or not."
verse:11:24 Moses went out, and told the people the words of HASHEM; and he gathered seventy men of the elders of the people, and set them around the Tent. 
verse:11:25 HASHEM came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and put it on the seventy elders: and it happened that when the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did so no more. 
verse:11:26 But two men remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad: and the Spirit rested on them; and they were of those who were written, but had not gone out to the Tent; and they prophesied in the camp. 
verse:11:27 A young man ran, and told Moses, and said, "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!"
verse:11:28 Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his chosen men, answered, "My lord Moses, forbid them!"
verse:11:29 Moses said to him, "Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all HASHEM's people were prophets, that HASHEM would put his Spirit on them!"
verse:11:30 Moses went into the camp, he and the elders of Israel. 
verse:11:31 A wind from HASHEM went out and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, about a day's journey on this side, and a day's journey on the other side, around the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth. 
verse:11:32 The people rose up all that day, and all the night, and all the next day, and gathered the quails. He who gathered least gathered ten omers; and they spread them all abroad for themselves around the camp. 
verse:11:33 While the flesh was yet between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of HASHEM was kindled against the people, and HASHEM struck the people with a very great plague. 
verse:11:34 The name of that place was called Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who lusted.
verse:11:35 From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth; and they stayed at Hazeroth.
verse:12:1 Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married; for he had married a Cushite woman. 
verse:12:2 They said, "Has HASHEM indeed spoken only with Moses? Hasn't he spoken also with us?" And HASHEM heard it.
verse:12:3 Now the man Moses was very humble, above all the men who were on the surface of the earth. 
verse:12:4 HASHEM spoke suddenly to Moses, to Aaron, and to Miriam, "You three come out to the Tent of Meeting!"
The three of them came out. 
verse:12:5 HASHEM came down in a pillar of cloud, and stood at the door of the Tent, and called Aaron and Miriam; and they both came forward. 
verse:12:6 He said, "Hear now my words. If there is a prophet among you, I HASHEM will make myself known to him in a vision. I will speak with him in a dream. 
verse:12:7 My servant Moses is not so. He is faithful in all my house. 
verse:12:8 With him I will speak mouth to mouth, even plainly, and not in riddles; and he shall see HASHEM's form. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?" 
verse:12:9 The anger of HASHEM was kindled against them; and he departed. 
verse:12:10 The cloud departed from over the Tent; and behold, Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. Aaron looked at Miriam, and behold, she was leprous.
verse:12:11 Aaron said to Moses, "Oh, my lord, please don't count this sin against us, in which we have done foolishly, and in which we have sinned. 
verse:12:12 Let her not, I pray, be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother's womb."
verse:12:13 Moses cried to HASHEM, saying, "Heal her, God, I beg you!"
verse:12:14 HASHEM said to Moses, "If her father had but spit in her face, shouldn't she be ashamed seven days? Let her be shut up outside of the camp seven days, and after that she shall be brought in again."
verse:12:15 Miriam was shut up outside of the camp seven days, and the people didn't travel until Miriam was brought in again. 
verse:12:16 Afterward the people traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.
portion:Numbers 13:1 - 15:41
verse:13:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:13:2 "Send men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel. Of every tribe of their fathers, you shall send a man, every one a prince among them."
verse:13:3 Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran according to the commandment of HASHEM: all of them men who were heads of the children of Israel. 
verse:13:4 These were their names: Of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur. 
verse:13:5 Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori. 
verse:13:6 Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh. 
verse:13:7 Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph. 
verse:13:8 Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun. 
verse:13:9 Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu. 
verse:13:10 Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi. 
verse:13:11 Of the tribe of Joseph, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi. 
verse:13:12 Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli. 
verse:13:13 Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael. 
verse:13:14 Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi. 
verse:13:15 Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi. 
verse:13:16 These are the names of the men who Moses sent to spy out the land. Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua. 
verse:13:17 Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, "Go up this way by the South, and go up into the hill country: 
verse:13:18 and see the land, what it is; and the people who dwell therein, whether they are strong or weak, whether they are few or many; 
verse:13:19 and what the land is that they dwell in, whether it is good or bad; and what cities they are that they dwell in, whether in camps, or in strongholds; 
verse:13:20 and what the land is, whether it is fat or lean, whether there is wood therein, or not. Be courageous, and bring of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the first-ripe grapes." 
verse:13:21 So they went up, and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to the entrance of Hamath. 
verse:13:22 They went up by the South, and came to Hebron; and Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were there. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.) 
verse:13:23 They came to the valley of Eshcol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bore it on a staff between two. They also brought some of the pomegranates and figs. 
verse:13:24 That place was called the valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the children of Israel cut down from there. 
verse:13:25 They returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days. 
verse:13:26 They went and came to Moses, and to Aaron, and to all the congregation of the children of Israel, to the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and brought back word to them, and to all the congregation, and showed them the fruit of the land. 
verse:13:27 They told him, and said, "We came to the land where you sent us; and surely it flows with milk and honey; and this is its fruit. 
verse:13:28 However the people who dwell in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. Moreover, we saw the children of Anak there. 
verse:13:29 Amalek dwells in the land of the South: and the Hittite, and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, dwell in the hill country; and the Canaanite dwells by the sea, and along by the side of the Jordan." 
verse:13:30 Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, "Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it." 
verse:13:31 But the men who went up with him said, "We aren't able to go up against the people; for they are stronger than we." 
verse:13:32 They brought up an evil report of the land which they had spied out to the children of Israel, saying, "The land, through which we have gone to spy it out, is a land that eats up its inhabitants; and all the people who we saw in it are men of great stature. 
verse:13:33 There we saw the Nephilim, the sons of Anak, who come of the Nephilim: and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight."
verse:14:1 All the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night. 
verse:14:2 All the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said to them, "Would that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would that we had died in this wilderness! 
verse:14:3 Why does HASHEM bring us to this land, to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will be a prey: wouldn't it be better for us to return into Egypt?" 
verse:14:4 They said one to another, "Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt." 
verse:14:5 Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel. 
verse:14:6 Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were of those who spied out the land, tore their clothes: 
verse:14:7 and they spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, "The land, which we passed through to spy it out, is an exceeding good land. 
verse:14:8 If HASHEM delights in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it to us; a land which flows with milk and honey. 
verse:14:9 Only don't rebel against HASHEM, neither fear the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defense is removed from over them, and HASHEM is with us. Don't fear them." 
verse:14:10 But all the congregation threatened to stone them with stones. The glory of HASHEM appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the children of Israel. 
verse:14:11 HASHEM said to Moses, "How long will this people despise me? and how long will they not believe in me, for all the signs which I have worked among them? 
verse:14:12 I will strike them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they." 
verse:14:13 Moses said to HASHEM, "Then the Egyptians will hear it; for you brought up this people in your might from among them; 
verse:14:14 and they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that you HASHEM are in the midst of this people; for you HASHEM are seen face to face, and your cloud stands over them, and you go before them, in a pillar of cloud by day, and in a pillar of fire by night. 
verse:14:15 Now if you killed this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of you will speak, saying, 
verse:14:16 'Because HASHEM was not able to bring this people into the land which he swore to them, therefore he has slain them in the wilderness.' 
verse:14:17 Now please let the power of my Lord be great, according as you have spoken, saying, 
verse:14:18 'HASHEM is slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, forgiving iniquity and disobedience; and that will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and on the fourth generation.' 
verse:14:19 Please pardon the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of your loving kindness, and according as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now." 
verse:14:20 HASHEM said, "I have pardoned according to your word: 
verse:14:21 but in very deed, as I live, and as all the earth shall be filled with the glory of HASHEM; 
verse:14:22 because all those men who have seen my glory, and my signs, which I worked in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tempted me these ten times, and have not listened to my voice; 
verse:14:23 surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it: 
verse:14:24 but my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and has followed me fully, him will I bring into the land into which he went; and his seed shall possess it. 
verse:14:25 Now the Amalekite and the Canaanite dwell in the valley: tomorrow turn, and go into the wilderness by the way to the Sea of Suf." 
verse:14:26 HASHEM spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, 
verse:14:27 "How long shall I bear with this evil congregation, that murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me. 
verse:14:28 Tell them, 'As I live, says HASHEM, surely as you have spoken in my ears, so will I do to you: 
verse:14:29 your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness; and all who were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against me, 
verse:14:30 surely you shall not come into the land, concerning which I swore that I would make you dwell therein, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun. 
verse:14:31 But your little ones, that you said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which you have rejected. 
verse:14:32 But as for you, your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness. 
verse:14:33 Your children shall be wanderers in the wilderness forty years, and shall bear your prostitution, until your dead bodies be consumed in the wilderness. 
verse:14:34 After the number of the days in which you spied out the land, even forty days, for every day a year, you will bear your iniquities, even forty years, and you will know my alienation.' 
verse:14:35 I, HASHEM, have spoken, surely this will I do to all this evil congregation, who are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die." 
verse:14:36 The men, whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned, and made all the congregation to murmur against him, by bringing up an evil report against the land, 
verse:14:37 even those men who brought up an evil report of the land, died by the plague before HASHEM. 
verse:14:38 But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, remained alive of those men who went to spy out the land. 
verse:14:39 Moses told these words to all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly. 
verse:14:40 They rose up early in the morning, and went up to the top of the mountain, saying, "Behold, we are here, and will go up to the place which HASHEM has promised: for we have sinned." 
verse:14:41 Moses said, "Why now do you disobey the commandment of HASHEM, since it shall not prosper? 
verse:14:42 Don't go up, for HASHEM isn't among you; that you not be struck down before your enemies. 
verse:14:43 For there the Amalekite and the Canaanite are before you, and you shall fall by the sword: because you are turned back from following HASHEM, therefore HASHEM will not be with you."
verse:14:44 But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, and Moses, didn't depart out of the camp. 
verse:14:45 Then the Amalekite came down, and the Canaanite who lived in that mountain, and struck them and beat them down, even to Hormah.
verse:15:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:15:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you have come into the land of your habitations, which I give to you, 
verse:15:3 and will make an offering by fire to HASHEM, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or as a freewill offering, or in your set feasts, to make a pleasant aroma to HASHEM, of the herd, or of the flock; 
verse:15:4 then he who offers his offering shall offer to HASHEM a meal offering of a tenth part of an efah of fine flour mixed with the fourth part of a hin of oil: 
verse:15:5 and wine for the drink offering, the fourth part of a hin, you shall prepare with the burnt offering, or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
verse:15:6 "'Or for a ram, you shall prepare for a meal offering two tenth parts of an efah of fine flour mixed with the third part of a hin of oil: 
verse:15:7 and for the drink offering you shall offer the third part of a hin of wine, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:15:8 When you prepare a bull for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or for peace offerings to HASHEM; 
verse:15:9 then shall he offer with the bull a meal offering of three tenth parts of an efah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil: 
verse:15:10 and you shall offer for the drink offering half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:15:11 Thus shall it be done for each bull, or for each ram, or for each of the male lambs, or of the young goats. 
verse:15:12 According to the number that you shall prepare, so you shall do to everyone according to their number.
verse:15:13 "'All who are native-born shall do these things in this way, in offering an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:15:14 If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you, or whoever may be among you throughout your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM; as you do, so he shall do. 
verse:15:15 For the assembly, there shall be one statute for you, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner, a statute forever throughout your generations: as you are, so shall the foreigner be before HASHEM. 
verse:15:16 One law and one ordinance shall be for you, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner with you.'"
verse:15:17 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:15:18 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you come into the land where I bring you, 
verse:15:19 then it shall be that when you eat of the bread of the land, you shall offer up a wave offering to HASHEM. 
verse:15:20 Of the first of your dough you shall offer up a cake for a wave offering: as the wave offering of the threshing floor, so you shall heave it. 
verse:15:21 Of the first of your dough you shall give to HASHEM a wave offering throughout your generations.
verse:15:22 "'When you shall err, and not observe all these commandments, which HASHEM has spoken to Moses, 
verse:15:23 even all that HASHEM has commanded you by Moses, from the day that HASHEM gave commandment, and onward throughout your generations; 
verse:15:24 then it shall be, if it be done unwittingly, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bull for a burnt offering, for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM, with the meal offering of it, and the drink offering of it, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering. 
verse:15:25 The priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to HASHEM, and their sin offering before HASHEM, for their error: 
verse:15:26 and all the congregation of the children of Israel shall be forgiven, and the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them; for in respect of all the people it was done unwittingly.
verse:15:27 "'If one person sins unwittingly, then he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering. 
verse:15:28 The priest shall make atonement for the soul who errs, when he sins unwittingly, before HASHEM, to make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven. 
verse:15:29 You shall have one law for him who does anything unwittingly, for him who is native-born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them.
verse:15:30 "'But the soul who does anything with a high hand, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, the same blasphemes HASHEM; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people. 
verse:15:31 Because he has despised the word of HASHEM, and has broken his commandment, that soul shall utterly be cut off; his iniquity shall be on him.'"
verse:15:32 While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day. 
verse:15:33 Those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation. 
verse:15:34 They put him in custody, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.
verse:15:35 HASHEM said to Moses, "The man shall surely be put to death: all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside of the camp." 
verse:15:36 All the congregation brought him outside of the camp, and stoned him to death with stones; as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:15:37 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:15:38 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them that they should make themselves tzitzit in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put on the tzitzit of each border a cord of blue: 
verse:15:39 and it shall be to you for a tzitzit, that you may look on it, and remember all the commandments of HASHEM, and do them; and that you not follow after your own heart and your own eyes, after which you use to play the prostitute; 
verse:15:40 that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God. 
verse:15:41 I am HASHEM your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am HASHEM your God."
portion:Numbers 16:1 - 18:32
verse:16:1 Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men: 
verse:16:2 and they rose up before Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred fifty princes of the congregation, called to the assembly, men of renown; 
verse:16:3 and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, "You take too much on yourself, since all the congregation are holy, everyone of them, and HASHEM is among them: why then lift yourselves up above the assembly of HASHEM?"
verse:16:4 When Moses heard it, he fell on his face: 
verse:16:5 and he spoke to Korah and to all his company, saying, "In the morning HASHEM will show who are his, and who is holy, and will cause him to come near to him: even him whom he shall choose he will cause to come near to him. 
verse:16:6 Do this: take censers, Korah, and all his company; 
verse:16:7 and put fire in them, and put incense on them before HASHEM tomorrow: and it shall be that the man whom HASHEM chooses, he shall be holy. You have gone too far, you sons of Levi!"
verse:16:8 Moses said to Korah, "Hear now, you sons of Levi! 
verse:16:9 Is it a small thing to you, that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself, to do the service of the tabernacle of HASHEM, and to stand before the congregation to minister to them; 
verse:16:10 and that he has brought you near, and all your brothers the sons of Levi with you? and do you seek the priesthood also? 
verse:16:11 Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against HASHEM: and Aaron, what is he that you murmur against him?"
verse:16:12 Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab; and they said, "We won't come up: 
verse:16:13 is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, but you must also make yourself a prince over us? 
verse:16:14 Moreover you haven't brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards: will you put out the eyes of these men? We won't come up." 
verse:16:15 Moses was very angry, and said to HASHEM, "Don't respect their offering: I have not taken one donkey from them, neither have I hurt one of them." 
verse:16:16 Moses said to Korah, "You and all your company go before HASHEM, you, and they, and Aaron, tomorrow: 
verse:16:17 and each man take his censer, and put incense on them, and each man bring before HASHEM his censer, two hundred fifty censers; you also, and Aaron, each his censer." 
verse:16:18 They each took his censer, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood at the door of the Tent of Meeting with Moses and Aaron. 
verse:16:19 Korah assembled all the congregation against them to the door of the Tent of Meeting: and the glory of HASHEM appeared to all the congregation. 
verse:16:20 HASHEM spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, 
verse:16:21 "Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment!" 
verse:16:22 They fell on their faces, and said, "God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and will you be angry with all the congregation?"
verse:16:23 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:16:24 "Speak to the congregation, saying, 'Get away from around the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram!'" 
verse:16:25 Moses rose up and went to Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed him. 
verse:16:26 He spoke to the congregation, saying, "Depart, please, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest you be consumed in all their sins!"
verse:16:27 So they went away from the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little ones. 
verse:16:28 Moses said, "Hereby you shall know that HASHEM has sent me to do all these works; for they are not from my own mind. 
verse:16:29 If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men; then HASHEM hasn't sent me. 
verse:16:30 But if HASHEM make a new thing, and the ground open its mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain to them, and they go down alive into Sheol; then you shall understand that these men have despised HASHEM."
verse:16:31 It happened, as he made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground split apart that was under them; 
verse:16:32 and the earth opened its mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and all the men who appertained to Korah, and all their goods. 
verse:16:33 So they, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into Sheol: and the earth closed on them, and they perished from among the assembly. 
verse:16:34 All Israel that were around them fled at their cry; for they said, "Lest the earth swallow us up!" 
verse:16:35 Fire came forth from HASHEM, and devoured the two hundred fifty men who offered the incense.
verse:17:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:17:2 "Speak to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning, and scatter the fire yonder; for they are holy, 
verse:17:3 even the censers of these sinners against their own lives; and let them be made beaten plates for a covering of the altar: for they offered them before HASHEM; therefore they are holy; and they shall be a sign to the children of Israel." 
verse:17:4 Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers, which those who were burnt had offered; and they beat them out for a covering of the altar, 
verse:17:5 to be a memorial to the children of Israel, to the end that no stranger, who isn't of the seed of Aaron, comes near to burn incense before HASHEM; that he not be as Korah, and as his company: as HASHEM spoke to him by Moses. 
verse:17:6 But on the next day all the congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, "You have killed HASHEM's people!" 
verse:17:7 It happened, when the congregation was assembled against Moses and against Aaron, that they looked toward the Tent of Meeting: and behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of HASHEM appeared. 
verse:17:8 Moses and Aaron came to the front of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:17:9 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:17:10 "Get away from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment!" They fell on their faces.
verse:17:11 Moses said to Aaron, "Take your censer, and put fire from off the altar in it, and lay incense on it, and carry it quickly to the congregation, and make atonement for them; for wrath has gone out from HASHEM! The plague has begun."
verse:17:12 Aaron did as Moses said, and ran into the midst of the assembly; and behold, the plague has begun among the people: and he put on the incense, and made atonement for the people. 
verse:17:13 He stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed. 
verse:17:14 Now those who died by the plague were fourteen thousand and seven hundred, besides those who died about the matter of Korah. 
verse:17:15 Aaron returned to Moses to the door of the Tent of Meeting: and the plague was stayed.
verse:17:16 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:17:17 "Speak to the children of Israel, and take of them rods, one for each fathers' house, of all their princes according to their fathers' houses, twelve rods: write every man's name on his rod. 
verse:17:18 You shall write Aaron's name on the rod of Levi; for there shall be one rod for each head of their fathers' houses. 
verse:17:19 You shall lay them up in the Tent of Meeting before the testimony, where I meet with you. 
verse:17:20 It shall happen, that the rod of the man whom I shall choose shall bud: and I will make to cease from me the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against you."
verse:17:21 Moses spoke to the children of Israel; and all their princes gave him rods, for each prince one, according to their fathers' houses, even twelve rods: and the rod of Aaron was among their rods. 
verse:17:22 Moses laid up the rods before HASHEM in the tent of the testimony.
verse:17:23 It happened on the next day, that Moses went into the tent of the testimony; and behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and put forth buds, and produced blossoms, and bore ripe almonds. 
verse:17:24 Moses brought out all the rods from before HASHEM to all the children of Israel: and they looked, and took every man his rod.
verse:17:25 HASHEM said to Moses, "Put back the rod of Aaron before the testimony, to be kept for a token against the children of rebellion; that you may make an end of their murmurings against me, that they not die." 
verse:17:26 Moses did so. As HASHEM commanded him, so he did.
verse:17:27 The children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, "Behold, we perish! We are undone! We are all undone! 
verse:17:28 Everyone who comes near, who comes near to the tabernacle of HASHEM, dies! Will we all perish?"
verse:18:1 HASHEM said to Aaron, "You and your sons and your fathers' house with you shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood. 
verse:18:2 Your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, bring near with you, that they may be joined to you, and minister to you: but you and your sons with you shall be before the tent of the testimony. 
verse:18:3 They shall keep your commands, and the duty of all the Tent: only they shall not come near to the vessels of the sanctuary and to the altar, that they not die, neither they, nor you. 
verse:18:4 They shall be joined to you, and keep the responsibility of the Tent of Meeting, for all the service of the Tent: and a stranger shall not come near to you.
verse:18:5 "You shall perform the duty of the sanctuary, and the duty of the altar; that there be no more wrath on the children of Israel. 
verse:18:6 I, behold, I have taken your brothers the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are a gift, given to HASHEM, to do the service of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:18:7 You and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood for everything of the altar, and for that within the veil; and you shall serve: I give you the priesthood as a service of gift: and the stranger who comes near shall be put to death."
verse:18:8 HASHEM spoke to Aaron, "I, behold, I have given you the command of my wave offerings, even all the holy things of the children of Israel; to you have I given them by reason of the anointing, and to your sons, as a portion forever. 
verse:18:9 This shall be yours of the most holy things from the fire: every offering of theirs, even every meal offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render to me, shall be most holy for you and for your sons. 
verse:18:10 You shall eat of it like the most holy things. Every male shall eat of it. It shall be holy to you.
verse:18:11 "This is yours, too: the wave offering of their gift, even all the wave offerings of the children of Israel. I have given them to you, and to your sons and to your daughters with you, as a portion forever. Everyone who is clean in your house shall eat of it.
verse:18:12 "All the best of the oil, and all the best of the vintage, and of the grain, the first fruits of them which they give to HASHEM, to you have I given them. 
verse:18:13 The first-ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to HASHEM, shall be yours; everyone who is clean in your house shall eat of it.
verse:18:14 "Everything devoted in Israel shall be yours. 
verse:18:15 Everything that opens the womb, of all flesh which they offer to HASHEM, both of man and animal shall be yours: nevertheless you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and you shall redeem the firstborn of unclean animals. 
verse:18:16 You shall redeem those who are to be redeemed of them from a month old, according to your estimation, for five shekels of money, after the shekel of the sanctuary (the same is twenty gerahs).
verse:18:17 "But you shall not redeem the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat. They are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar, and shall burn their fat for an offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:18:18 Their flesh shall be yours, as the wave offering breast and as the right thigh, it shall be yours. 
verse:18:19 All the wave offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer to HASHEM, have I given you, and your sons and your daughters with you, as a portion forever: it is a covenant of salt forever before HASHEM to you and to your seed with you."
verse:18:20 HASHEM said to Aaron, "You shall have no inheritance in their land, neither shall you have any portion among them. I am your portion and your inheritance among the children of Israel.
verse:18:21 "To the children of Levi, behold, I have given all the tithe in Israel for an inheritance, in return for their service which they serve, even the service of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:18:22 Henceforth the children of Israel shall not come near the Tent of Meeting, lest they bear sin, and die. 
verse:18:23 But the Levites shall do the service of the Tent of Meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity: it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations; and among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance. 
verse:18:24 For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they offer as a wave offering to HASHEM, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance: therefore I have said to them, 'Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.'"
verse:18:25 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:18:26 "Moreover you shall speak to the Levites, and tell them, 'When you take of the children of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall offer up a wave offering of it for HASHEM, a tithe of the tithe. 
verse:18:27 Your wave offering shall be reckoned to you, as though it were the grain of the threshing floor, and as the fullness of the winepress. 
verse:18:28 Thus you also shall offer a wave offering to HASHEM of all your tithes, which you receive of the children of Israel; and of it you shall give HASHEM's wave offering to Aaron the priest. 
verse:18:29 Out of all your gifts you shall offer every wave offering of HASHEM, of all its best, even the holy part of it out of it.'
verse:18:30 "Therefore you shall tell them, 'When you heave its best from it, then it shall be reckoned to the Levites as the increase of the threshing floor, and as the increase of the winepress. 
verse:18:31 You shall eat it in every place, you and your households: for it is your reward in return for your service in the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:18:32 You shall bear no sin by reason of it, when you have heaved from it its best: and you shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, that you not die.'"
portion:Numbers 19:1 - 22:1
verse:19:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, 
verse:19:2 "This is the statute of the law which HASHEM has commanded: Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring you a red heifer without spot, in which is no blemish, and which was never yoked. 
verse:19:3 You shall give her to Eleazar the priest, and he shall bring her forth outside of the camp, and one shall kill her before his face: 
verse:19:4 and Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle her blood toward the front of the Tent of Meeting seven times. 
verse:19:5 One shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn: 
verse:19:6 and the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer. 
verse:19:7 Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the evening. 
verse:19:8 He who burns her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the evening.
verse:19:9 "A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up outside of the camp in a clean place; and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water for impurity: it is a sin offering. 
verse:19:10 He who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening: and it shall be to the children of Israel, and to the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them, for a statute forever.
verse:19:11 "He who touches the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days: 
verse:19:12 the same shall purify himself with water on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he doesn't purify himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean. 
verse:19:13 Whoever touches a dead person, the body of a man who has died, and doesn't purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of HASHEM; and that soul shall be cut off from Israel: because the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet on him.
verse:19:14 "This is the law when a man dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent, and everyone who is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days. 
verse:19:15 Every open vessel, which has no covering bound on it, is unclean.
verse:19:16 "Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain with a sword, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verse:19:17 "For the unclean they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the sin offering; and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel: 
verse:19:18 and a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent, and on all the vessels, and on the persons who were there, and on him who touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave: 
verse:19:19 and the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify him; and he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at evening. 
verse:19:20 But the man who shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of HASHEM: the water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean. 
verse:19:21 It shall be a perpetual statute to them: and he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.
verse:19:22 "Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the soul that touches it shall be unclean until evening."
verse:20:1 The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month: and the people stayed in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there. 
verse:20:2 There was no water for the congregation: and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron. 
verse:20:3 The people strove with Moses, and spoke, saying, "We wish that we had died when our brothers died before HASHEM! 
verse:20:4 Why have you brought the assembly of HASHEM into this wilderness, that we should die there, we and our animals? 
verse:20:5 Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink."
verse:20:6 Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces: and the glory of HASHEM appeared to them. 
verse:20:7 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:20:8 "Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it give forth its water; and you shall bring forth to them water out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink."
verse:20:9 Moses took the rod from before HASHEM, as he commanded him. 
verse:20:10 Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said to them, "Hear now, you rebels; shall we bring you water out of this rock for you?" 
verse:20:11 Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice: and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their livestock.
verse:20:12 HASHEM said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you didn't believe in me, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them."
verse:20:13 These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with HASHEM, and he was sanctified in them. 
verse:20:14 Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying:
"Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the travail that has happened to us: 
verse:20:15 how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and our fathers: 
verse:20:16 and when we cried to HASHEM, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt: and behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of your border.
verse:20:17 "Please let us pass through your land: we will not pass through field or through vineyard, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go along the king's highway; we will not turn aside to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed your border."
verse:20:18 Edom said to him, "You shall not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against you."
verse:20:19 The children of Israel said to him, "We will go up by the highway; and if we drink of your water, I and my livestock, then will I give its price: let me only, without doing anything else, pass through on my feet."
verse:20:20 He said, "You shall not pass through." Edom came out against him with many people, and with a strong hand. 
verse:20:21 Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border, so Israel turned away from him.
verse:20:22 They traveled from Kadesh: and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor. 
verse:20:23 HASHEM spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying, 
verse:20:24 "Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah. 
verse:20:25 Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor; 
verse:20:26 and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be taken, and shall die there."
verse:20:27 Moses did as HASHEM commanded: and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation. 
verse:20:28 Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there on the top of the mountain: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain. 
verse:20:29 When all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verse:21:1 The Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the South, heard tell that Israel came by the way of Atharim; and he fought against Israel, and took some of them captive. 
verse:21:2 Israel vowed a vow to HASHEM, and said, "If you will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities." 
verse:21:3 HASHEM listened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and the name of the place was called Hormah.
verse:21:4 They traveled from Mount Hor by the way to the Sea of Suf, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way. 
verse:21:5 The people spoke against God, and against Moses, "Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread, and there is no water; and our soul loathes this light bread."
verse:21:6 HASHEM sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and many people of Israel died. 
verse:21:7 The people came to Moses, and said, "We have sinned, because we have spoken against HASHEM, and against you. Pray to HASHEM, that he take away the serpents from us." Moses prayed for the people.
verse:21:8 HASHEM said to Moses, "Make a fiery serpent, and set it on a standard: and it shall happen, that everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live." 
verse:21:9 Moses made a serpent of brass, and set it on the standard: and it happened, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked to the serpent of brass, he lived. 
verse:21:10 The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in Oboth. 
verse:21:11 They traveled from Oboth, and encamped at Iyeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrise. 
verse:21:12 From there they traveled, and encamped in the valley of Zered. 
verse:21:13 From there they traveled, and encamped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness, that comes out of the border of the Amorites: for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites. 
verse:21:14 Therefore it is said in the book of the Wars of HASHEM, "Vaheb in Suphah, the valleys of the Arnon, 
verse:21:15 the slope of the valleys that incline toward the dwelling of Ar, leans on the border of Moab."
verse:21:16 From there they traveled to Beer: that is the well of which HASHEM said to Moses, "Gather the people together, and I will give them water."
verse:21:17 Then sang Israel this song: "Spring up, well; sing to it: 
verse:21:18 the well, which the princes dug, which the nobles of the people dug, with the scepter, and with their poles." 
From the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah; 
verse:21:19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth; 
verse:21:20 and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the field of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks down on the desert. 
verse:21:21 Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying, 
verse:21:22 "Let me pass through your land: we will not turn aside into field, or into vineyard; we will not drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king's highway, until we have passed your border."
verse:21:23 Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and came to Jahaz; and he fought against Israel. 
verse:21:24 Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, even to the children of Ammon; for the border of the children of Ammon was strong. 
verse:21:25 Israel took all these cities: and Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its towns. 
verse:21:26 For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even to the Arnon. 
verse:21:27 Therefore those who speak in proverbs say, "Come to Heshbon. Let the city of Sihon be built and established; 
verse:21:28 for a fire has gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon. It has devoured Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of the Arnon. 
verse:21:29 Woe to you, Moab! You are undone, people of Chemosh! He has given his sons as fugitives, and his daughters into captivity, to Sihon king of the Amorites. 
verse:21:30 We have shot at them. Heshbon has perished even to Dibon. We have laid waste even to Nophah, Which reaches to Medeba."
verse:21:31 Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites. 
verse:21:32 Moses sent to spy out Jazer; and they took its towns, and drove out the Amorites who were there. 
verse:21:33 They turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verse:21:34 HASHEM said to Moses, "Don't fear him: for I have delivered him into your hand, and all his people, and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon."
verse:21:35 So they struck him, and his sons and all his people, until there was none left him remaining: and they possessed his land.
verse:22:1 The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho. 
portion:Numbers 22:2 - 25:9
verse:22:2 Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites. 
verse:22:3 Moab was very afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel. 
verse:22:4 Moab said to the elders of Midian, "Now this multitude will lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field."
Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time. 
verse:22:5 He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, "Behold, there is a people who came out from Egypt. Behold, they cover the surface of the earth, and they are staying opposite me. 
verse:22:6 Please come now therefore curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me: perhaps I shall prevail, that we may strike them, and that I may drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed."
verse:22:7 The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand; and they came to Balaam, and spoke to him the words of Balak. 
verse:22:8 He said to them, "Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as HASHEM shall speak to me." The princes of Moab stayed with Balaam. 
verse:22:9 God came to Balaam, and said, "Who are these men with you?" 
verse:22:10 Balaam said to God, "Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has said to me, 
verse:22:11 'Behold, the people that has come out of Egypt, it covers the surface of the earth: now, come curse me them; perhaps I shall be able to fight against them, and shall drive them out.'"
verse:22:12 God said to Balaam, "You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people; for they are blessed."
verse:22:13 Balaam rose up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, "Go to your land; for HASHEM refuses to permit me to go with you."
verse:22:14 The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak, and said, "Balaam refuses to come with us."
verse:22:15 Balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honorable than they. 
verse:22:16 They came to Balaam, and said to him, "Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, 'Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me: 
verse:22:17 for I will promote you to very great honor, and whatever you say to me I will do. Please come therefore, and curse this people for me.'"
verse:22:18 Balaam answered the servants of Balak, "If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can't go beyond the word of HASHEM my God, to do less or more. 
verse:22:19 Now therefore, please wait also here this night, that I may know what HASHEM will speak to me more."
verse:22:20 God came to Balaam at night, and said to him, "If the men have come to call you, rise up, go with them; but only the word which I speak to you, that you shall do."
verse:22:21 Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab. 
verse:22:22 God's anger was kindled because he went; and the angel of HASHEM placed himself in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him. 
verse:22:23 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and the donkey turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the way. 
verse:22:24 Then the angel of HASHEM stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side. 
verse:22:25 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM, and she thrust herself to the wall, and crushed Balaam's foot against the wall: and he struck her again.
verse:22:26 The angel of HASHEM went further, and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left. 
verse:22:27 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM, and she lay down under Balaam: and Balaam's anger was kindled, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verse:22:28 HASHEM opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, "What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?"
verse:22:29 Balaam said to the donkey, "Because you have mocked me, I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now I would have killed you."
verse:22:30 The donkey said to Balaam, "Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long to this day? Was I ever in the habit of doing so to you?"
He said, "No."
verse:22:31 Then HASHEM opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of HASHEM standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed his head, and fell on his face. 
verse:22:32 The angel of HASHEM said to him, "Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come forth as an adversary, because your way is perverse before me: 
verse:22:33 and the donkey saw me, and turned aside before me these three times. Unless she had turned aside from me, surely now I would have killed you, and saved her alive."
verse:22:34 Balaam said to the angel of HASHEM, "I have sinned; for I didn't know that you stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases you, I will go back again."
verse:22:35 The angel of HASHEM said to Balaam, "Go with the men; but only the word that I shall speak to you, that you shall speak."
So Balaam went with the princes of Balak. 
verse:22:36 When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him to the City of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, which is in the utmost part of the border. 
verse:22:37 Balak said to Balaam, "Didn't I earnestly send to you to call you? Why didn't you come to me? Am I not able indeed to promote you to honor?"
verse:22:38 Balaam said to Balak, "Behold, I have come to you: have I now any power at all to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that shall I speak."
verse:22:39 Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth. 
verse:22:40 Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him. 
verse:22:41 It happened in the morning, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal; and he saw from there the utmost part of the people.
verse:23:1 Balaam said to Balak, "Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bulls and seven rams."
verse:23:2 Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram. 
verse:23:3 Balaam said to Balak, "Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go: perhaps HASHEM will come to meet me; and whatever he shows me I will tell you."
He went to a bare height. 
verse:23:4 God met Balaam: and he said to him, "I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on every altar."
verse:23:5 HASHEM put a word in Balaam's mouth, and said, "Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak."
verse:23:6 He returned to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab. 
verse:23:7 He took up his parable, and said, "From Aram has Balak brought me, the king of Moab from the mountains of the East. Come, curse Jacob for me. Come, defy Israel. 
verse:23:8 How shall I curse whom God has not cursed? How shall I defy whom HASHEM has not defied? 
verse:23:9 For from the top of the rocks I see him. From the hills I see him. Behold, it is a people that dwells alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations. 
verse:23:10 Who can count the dust of Jacob, or number the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous! Let my last end be like his!"
verse:23:11 Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed them altogether."
verse:23:12 He answered and said, "Must I not take heed to speak that which HASHEM puts in my mouth?"
verse:23:13 Balak said to him, "Please come with me to another place, where you may see them; you shall see but the utmost part of them, and shall not see them all: and curse me them from there."
verse:23:14 He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar. 
verse:23:15 He said to Balak, "Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet over there."
verse:23:16 HASHEM met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, "Return to Balak, and say this."
verse:23:17 He came to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. Balak said to him, "What has HASHEM spoken?"
verse:23:18 He took up his parable, and said, "Rise up, Balak, and hear! Listen to me, you son of Zippor. 
verse:23:19 God is not a man, that he should lie, nor the son of man, that he should repent. Has he said, and will he not do it? Or has he spoken, and will he not make it good? 
verse:23:20 Behold, I have received a command to bless. He has blessed, and I can't reverse it. 
verse:23:21 He has not seen iniquity in Jacob. Neither has he seen perverseness in Israel. HASHEM his God is with him. The shout of a king is among them. 
verse:23:22 God brings them out of Egypt. He has as it were the strength of the wild ox. 
verse:23:23 Surely there is no enchantment with Jacob; Neither is there any divination with Israel. Now it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What has God done! 
verse:23:24 Behold, the people rises up as a lioness, As a lion he lifts himself up. He shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drinks the blood of the slain."
verse:23:25 Balak said to Balaam, "Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all."
verse:23:26 But Balaam answered Balak, "Didn't I tell you, saying, 'All that HASHEM speaks, that I must do?'"
verse:23:27 Balak said to Balaam, "Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse me them from there."
verse:23:28 Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that looks down on the desert. 
verse:23:29 Balaam said to Balak, "Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bulls and seven rams."
verse:23:30 Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verse:24:1 When Balaam saw that it pleased HASHEM to bless Israel, he didn't go, as at the other times, to meet with enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness. 
verse:24:2 Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came on him. 
verse:24:3 He took up his parable, and said, "Balaam the son of Beor says, the man whose eye was closed says; 
verse:24:4 he says, who hears the words of God, who sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down, and having his eyes open: 
verse:24:5 How goodly are your tents, Jacob, and your tents, Israel! 
verse:24:6 As valleys they are spread forth, as gardens by the riverside, as aloes which HASHEM has planted, as cedar trees beside the waters. 
verse:24:7 Water shall flow from his buckets. His seed shall be in many waters. His king shall be higher than Agag. His kingdom shall be exalted.
