verse:6:19 Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female. 
verse:6:20 Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort shall come to you, to keep them alive. 
verse:6:21 Take with you of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them." 
verse:6:22 Thus Noah did. According to all that God commanded him, so he did.
portion:Genesis 7:1 - 7:16
verse:7:1 HASHEM said to Noah, "Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation. 
verse:7:2 You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female. 
verse:7:3 Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth. 
verse:7:4 In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. Every living thing that I have made, I will destroy from the surface of the ground."
verse:7:5 Noah did everything that HASHEM commanded him.
verse:7:6 Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth. 
verse:7:7 Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives, because of the waters of the flood. 
verse:7:8 Clean animals, animals that are not clean, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground 
verse:7:9 went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah. 
verse:7:10 It happened after the seven days, that the waters of the flood came on the earth. 
verse:7:11 In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day all the fountains of the great deep were burst open, and the sky's windows were opened. 
verse:7:12 The rain was on the earth forty days and forty nights.
verse:7:13 In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship; 
verse:7:14 they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort. 
verse:7:15 They went to Noah into the ship, by pairs of all flesh with the breath of life in them. 
verse:7:16 Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and HASHEM shut him in.
portion:Genesis 7:17 - 8:14
verse:7:17 The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth. 
verse:7:18 The waters prevailed, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters. 
verse:7:19 The waters prevailed exceedingly on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered. 
verse:7:20 The waters prevailed fifteen cubits upward, and the mountains were covered. 
verse:7:21 All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man. 
verse:7:22 All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, of all that was on the dry land, died. 
verse:7:23 Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship. 
verse:7:24 The waters prevailed on the earth one hundred fifty days.
verse:8:1 God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided. 
verse:8:2 The deep's fountains and the sky's windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained. 
verse:8:3 The waters receded from the earth continually. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters decreased. 
verse:8:4 The ship rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat's mountains. 
verse:8:5 The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were seen.
verse:8:6 It happened at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ship which he had made, 
verse:8:7 and he sent out a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth. 
verse:8:8 He sent out a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground, 
verse:8:9 but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned to him into the ship; for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put out his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ship. 
verse:8:10 He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship. 
verse:8:11 The dove came back to him at evening, and, behold, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth. 
verse:8:12 He stayed yet another seven days, and sent out the dove; and she didn't return to him any more.
verse:8:13 It happened in the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dried. 
verse:8:14 In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
portion:Genesis 8:15 - 9:7
verse:8:15 God spoke to Noah, saying, 
verse:8:16 "Go out of the ship, you, and your wife, and your sons, and your sons' wives with you. 
verse:8:17 Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth."
verse:8:18 Noah went out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives with him. 
verse:8:19 Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went out of the ship.
verse:8:20 Noah built an altar to HASHEM, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar. 
verse:8:21 HASHEM smelled the pleasant aroma. HASHEM said in his heart, "I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake, because the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I ever again strike everything living, as I have done. 
verse:8:22 While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease."
verse:9:1 God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth. 
verse:9:2 The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that the ground teems with, and all the fish of the sea are delivered into your hand. 
verse:9:3 Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As the green herb, I have given everything to you. 
verse:9:4 But flesh with its life, its blood, you shall not eat. 
verse:9:5 I will surely require your blood of your lives. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man's brother, I will require the life of man. 
verse:9:6 Whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image. 
verse:9:7 Be fruitful and multiply. Increase abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it."
portion:Genesis 9:8 - 9:17
verse:9:8 God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying, 
verse:9:9 "As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you, 
verse:9:10 and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ship, even every animal of the earth. 
verse:9:11 I will establish my covenant with you: all flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood, neither will there ever again be a flood to destroy the earth." 
verse:9:12 God said, "This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations: 
verse:9:13 I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be for a sign of a covenant between me and the earth. 
verse:9:14 It will happen, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud, 
verse:9:15 and I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh. 
verse:9:16 The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth." 
verse:9:17 God said to Noah, "This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth."
portion:Genesis 9:18 - 10:32
verse:9:18 The sons of Noah who went out from the ship were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan. 
verse:9:19 These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.
verse:9:20 Noah began to be a farmer, and planted a vineyard. 
verse:9:21 He drank of the wine and got drunk. He was uncovered within his tent. 
verse:9:22 Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside. 
verse:9:23 Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn't see their father's nakedness. 
verse:9:24 Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him. 
verse:9:25 He said, "Canaan is cursed. He will be servant of servants to his brothers."
verse:9:26 He said, "Blessed be HASHEM, the God of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant. 
verse:9:27 May God enlarge Japheth. Let him dwell in the tents of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant."
verse:9:28 Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood. 
verse:9:29 All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, then he died.
verse:10:1 Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.
verse:10:2 The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras. 
verse:10:3 The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah. 
verse:10:4 The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim. 
verse:10:5 Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.
verse:10:6 The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan. 
verse:10:7 The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan. 
verse:10:8 Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth. 
verse:10:9 He was a mighty hunter before HASHEM. Therefore it is said, "Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before HASHEM." 
verse:10:10 The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar. 
verse:10:11 Out of that land he went into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah, 
verse:10:12 and Resen between Nineveh and Calah (the same is the great city). 
verse:10:13 Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, 
verse:10:14 Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.
verse:10:15 Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth, 
verse:10:16 the Jebusite, the Amorite, the Girgashite, 
verse:10:17 the Hivite, the Arkite, the Sinite, 
verse:10:18 the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad. 
verse:10:19 The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as you go toward Gerar, to Gaza; as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, to Lasha. 
verse:10:20 These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, in their nations.
verse:10:21 To Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, to him also were children born. 
verse:10:22 The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram. 
verse:10:23 The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash. 
verse:10:24 Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber. 
verse:10:25 To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother's name was Joktan. 
verse:10:26 Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, 
verse:10:27 Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, 
verse:10:28 Obal, Abimael, Sheba, 
verse:10:29 Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan. 
verse:10:30 Their dwelling was from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east. 
verse:10:31 These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their languages, in their lands, after their nations.
verse:10:32 These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations. Of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
portion:Genesis 11:1 - 11:32
verse:11:1 The whole earth was of one language and of one speech. 
verse:11:2 It happened, as they traveled east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there. 
verse:11:3 They said one to another, "Come, let's make bricks, and burn them thoroughly." They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar. 
verse:11:4 They said, "Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."
verse:11:5 HASHEM came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built. 
verse:11:6 HASHEM said, "Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do. 
verse:11:7 Come, let's go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another's speech." 
verse:11:8 So HASHEM scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city. 
verse:11:9 Therefore its name was called Babel, because there HASHEM confused the language of all the earth. From there, HASHEM scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.
verse:11:10 This is the history of the generations of Shem. Shem was one hundred years old and became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood. 
verse:11:11 Shem lived five hundred years after he became the father of Arpachshad, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:12 Arpachshad lived thirty-five years and became the father of Shelah. 
verse:11:13 Arpachshad lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Shelah, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:14 Shelah lived thirty years, and became the father of Eber: 
verse:11:15 and Shelah lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Eber, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:16 Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg. 
verse:11:17 Eber lived four hundred thirty years after he became the father of Peleg, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:18 Peleg lived thirty years, and became the father of Reu. 
verse:11:19 Peleg lived two hundred nine years after he became the father of Reu, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:20 Reu lived thirty-two years, and became the father of Serug. 
verse:11:21 Reu lived two hundred seven years after he became the father of Serug, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:22 Serug lived thirty years, and became the father of Nahor. 
verse:11:23 Serug lived two hundred years after he became the father of Nahor, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:24 Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and became the father of Terah. 
verse:11:25 Nahor lived one hundred nineteen years after he became the father of Terah, and became the father of sons and daughters.
verse:11:26 Terah lived seventy years, and became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
verse:11:27 Now this is the history of the generations of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran became the father of Lot. 
verse:11:28 Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur-Kasdim. 
verse:11:29 Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran who was also the father of Iscah. 
verse:11:30 Sarai was barren. She had no child. 
verse:11:31 Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son's son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram's wife. They went from Ur-Kasdim, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran and lived there. 
verse:11:32 The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.
portion:Genesis 11:29 - 11:32
verse:11:29 Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran who was also the father of Iscah. 
verse:11:30 Sarai was barren. She had no child. 
verse:11:31 Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son's son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram's wife. They went from Ur-Kasdim, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran and lived there. 
verse:11:32 The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.
portion:Genesis 12:1 - 12:13
verse:12:1 Now HASHEM said to Abram, "Get out of your country, and from your relatives, and from your father's house, to the land that I will show you. 
verse:12:2 I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing. 
verse:12:3 I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. All of the families of the earth will be blessed in you."
verse:12:4 So Abram went, as HASHEM had spoken to him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed out of Haran. 
verse:12:5 Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother's son, all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls whom they had gotten in Haran, and they went to go into the land of Canaan. Into the land of Canaan they came. 
verse:12:6 Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. The Canaanite was then in the land.
verse:12:7 HASHEM appeared to Abram and said, "I will give this land to your seed."
He built an altar there to HASHEM, who appeared to him. 
verse:12:8 He left from there to the mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to HASHEM and called on the name of HASHEM. 
verse:12:9 Abram traveled, going on still toward the South.
verse:12:10 There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was severe in the land. 
verse:12:11 It happened, when he had come near to enter Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, "See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look at. 
verse:12:12 It will happen, when the Egyptians will see you, that they will say, 'This is his wife.' They will kill me, but they will save you alive. 
verse:12:13 Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you."
portion:Genesis 12:14 - 13:4
verse:12:14 It happened that when Abram had come into Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful. 
verse:12:15 The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house. 
verse:12:16 He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels. 
verse:12:17 HASHEM plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife. 
verse:12:18 Pharaoh called Abram and said, "What is this that you have done to me? Why didn't you tell me that she was your wife? 
verse:12:19 Why did you say, 'She is my sister,' so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way."
verse:12:20 Pharaoh commanded men concerning him, and they brought him on the way with his wife and all that he had.
verse:13:1 Abram went up out of Egypt: he, his wife, all that he had, and Lot with him, into the South. 
verse:13:2 Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold. 
verse:13:3 He went on his journeys from the South even to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai, 
verse:13:4 to the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first. There Abram called on the name of HASHEM.
portion:Genesis 13:5 - 13:18
verse:13:5 Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents. 
verse:13:6 The land was not able to bear them, that they might live together: for their substance was great, so that they could not live together. 
verse:13:7 There was a strife between the herdsmen of Abram's livestock and the herdsmen of Lot's livestock: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite lived in the land at that time. 
verse:13:8 Abram said to Lot, "Please, let there be no strife between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are relatives. 
verse:13:9 Isn't the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right hand, then I will go to the left."
verse:13:10 Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before HASHEM destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of HASHEM, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar. 
verse:13:11 So Lot chose the Plain of the Jordan for himself. Lot traveled east, and they separated themselves the one from the other. 
verse:13:12 Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived in the cities of the plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom. 
verse:13:13 Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinners against HASHEM.
verse:13:14 HASHEM said to Abram, after Lot was separated from him, "Now, lift up your eyes, and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward, 
verse:13:15 for all the land which you see, I will give to you, and to your offspring forever. 
verse:13:16 I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered. 
verse:13:17 Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its breadth; for I will give it to you."
verse:13:18 Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to HASHEM.
portion:Genesis 14:1 - 14:20
verse:14:1 It happened in the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim, 
verse:14:2 that they made war with Bera, king of Sodom, and with Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, and Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar). 
verse:14:3 All these joined together in the valley of Siddim (the same is the Salt Sea). 
verse:14:4 Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year, they rebelled. 
verse:14:5 In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came, and the kings who were with him, and struck the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim, 
verse:14:6 and the Horites in their Mount Seir, to Elparan, which is by the wilderness. 
verse:14:7 They returned, and came to En Mishpat (the same is Kadesh), and struck all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that lived in Hazazon Tamar. 
verse:14:8 The king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar) went out; and they set the battle in array against them in the valley of Siddim; 
verse:14:9 against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five. 
verse:14:10 Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and they fell there, and those who remained fled to the hills. 
verse:14:11 They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way. 
verse:14:12 They took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
verse:14:13 One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. Now he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were allies of Abram. 
verse:14:14 When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led out his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan. 
verse:14:15 He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus. 
verse:14:16 He brought back all the goods, and also brought back his relative, Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.
verse:14:17 The king of Sodom went out to meet him, after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley). 
verse:14:18 Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine: and he was priest of God Most High. 
verse:14:19 He blessed him, and said, "Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth: 
verse:14:20 and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand."
Abram gave him a tenth of all.
portion:Genesis 14:21 - 15:6
verse:14:21 The king of Sodom said to Abram, "Give me the people, and take the goods to yourself."
verse:14:22 Abram said to the king of Sodom, "I have lifted up my hand to HASHEM, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth, 
verse:14:23 that I will not take a thread nor a sandal strap nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, 'I have made Abram rich.' 
verse:14:24 I will accept nothing from you except that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. Let them take their portion."
verse:15:1 After these things the word of HASHEM came to Abram in a vision, saying, "Don't be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward."
verse:15:2 Abram said, "My Lord, HASHEM, what will you give me, since I go childless, and he who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?" 
verse:15:3 Abram said, "Behold, to me you have given no seed: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir."
verse:15:4 Behold, the word of HASHEM came to him, saying, "This man will not be your heir, but he who will come out of your own body will be your heir." 
verse:15:5 HASHEM brought him outside, and said, "Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them." He said to Abram, "So shall your seed be." 
verse:15:6 He believed in HASHEM; and he reckoned it to him for righteousness.
portion:Genesis 15:7 - 17:6
verse:15:7 He said to him, "I am HASHEM who brought you out of Ur-Kasdim, to give you this land to inherit it."
verse:15:8 He said, "My Lord, HASHEM GOD, how will I know that I will inherit it?"
verse:15:9 He said to him, "Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon." 
verse:15:10 He brought him all of these, and divided them in the middle, and laid each half opposite the other; but he didn't divide the birds. 
verse:15:11 The birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
verse:15:12 When the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. Now terror and great darkness fell on him. 
verse:15:13 He said to Abram, "Know for sure that your seed will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years. 
verse:15:14 I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth, 
verse:15:15 but you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried in a good old age. 
verse:15:16 In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full." 
verse:15:17 It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch passed between these pieces. 
verse:15:18 In that day HASHEM made a covenant with Abram, saying, "To your seed I have given this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates: 
verse:15:19 the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites, 
verse:15:20 the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim, 
verse:15:21 the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites."
verse:16:1 Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children. She had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar. 
verse:16:2 Sarai said to Abram, "See now, HASHEM has restrained me from bearing. Please go in to my handmaid. It may be that I will obtain children by her." Abram listened to the voice of Sarai. 
verse:16:3 Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar the Egyptian, her handmaid, after Abram had lived ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to Abram her husband to be his wife. 
verse:16:4 He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes. 
verse:16:5 Sarai said to Abram, "This wrong is your fault. I gave my handmaid into your bosom, and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes. HASHEM judge between me and you."
verse:16:6 But Abram said to Sarai, "Behold, your maid is in your hand. Do to her whatever is good in your eyes." Sarai dealt harshly with her, and she fled from her face.
verse:16:7 The angel of HASHEM found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur. 
verse:16:8 He said, "Hagar, Sarai's handmaid, where did you come from? Where are you going?"
She said, "I am fleeing from the face of my mistress Sarai."
verse:16:9 The angel of HASHEM said to her, "Return to your mistress, and submit yourself under her hands." 
verse:16:10 The angel of HASHEM said to her, "I will greatly multiply your seed, that they will not be numbered for multitude." 
verse:16:11 The angel of HASHEM said to her, "Behold, you are with child, and will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael, because HASHEM has heard your affliction. 
verse:16:12 He will be like a wild donkey among men. His hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him. He will live opposite all of his brothers."
verse:16:13 She called the name of HASHEM who spoke to her, "You are a God who sees," for she said, "Have I even stayed alive after seeing him?" 
verse:16:14 Therefore the well was called Beer Lahai Roi. Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
verse:16:15 Hagar bore a son for Abram. Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. 
verse:16:16 Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
verse:17:1 When Abram was ninety-nine years old, HASHEM appeared to Abram, and said to him, "I am God Almighty. Walk before me, and be blameless. 
verse:17:2 I will make my covenant between me and you, and will multiply you exceedingly."
verse:17:3 Abram fell on his face. God talked with him, saying, 
verse:17:4 "As for me, behold, my covenant is with you. You will be the father of a multitude of nations. 
verse:17:5 Neither will your name any more be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham; for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations. 
verse:17:6 I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make nations of you. Kings will come out of you.
portion:Genesis 17:7 - 17:27
verse:17:7 I will establish my covenant between me and you and your seed after you throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God to you and to your seed after you. 
verse:17:8 I will give to you, and to your seed after you, the land where you are traveling, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession. I will be their God."
verse:17:9 God said to Abraham, "As for you, you will keep my covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations. 
verse:17:10 This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your seed after you. Every male among you shall be circumcised. 
verse:17:11 You shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin. It will be a token of the covenant between me and you. 
verse:17:12 He who is eight days old will be circumcised among you, every male throughout your generations, he who is born in the house, or bought with money from any foreigner who is not of your seed. 
verse:17:13 He who is born in your house, and he who is bought with your money, must be circumcised. My covenant will be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant. 
verse:17:14 The uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant."
verse:17:15 God said to Abraham, "As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but her name will be Sarah. 
verse:17:16 I will bless her, and moreover I will give you a son by her. Yes, I will bless her, and she will be a mother of nations. Kings of peoples will come from her."
verse:17:17 Then Abraham fell on his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, "Will a child be born to him who is one hundred years old? Will Sarah, who is ninety years old, give birth?" 
verse:17:18 Abraham said to God, "Oh that Ishmael might live before you!"
verse:17:19 God said, "No, but Sarah, your wife, will bear you a son. You shall call his name Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant for his seed after him. 
verse:17:20 As for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly. He will become the father of twelve princes, and I will make him a great nation. 
verse:17:21 But my covenant I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this set time next year."
verse:17:22 When he finished talking with him, God went up from Abraham. 
verse:17:23 Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money; every male among the men of Abraham's house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the same day, as God had said to him. 
verse:17:24 Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. 
verse:17:25 Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. 
verse:17:26 In the same day both Abraham and Ishmael, his son, were circumcised. 
verse:17:27 All the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
portion:Genesis 17:24 - 17:27
verse:17:24 Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. 
verse:17:25 Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. 
verse:17:26 In the same day both Abraham and Ishmael, his son, were circumcised. 
verse:17:27 All the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
portion:Genesis 18:1 - 18:14
verse:18:1 HASHEM appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day. 
verse:18:2 He lifted up his eyes and looked, and saw that three men stood opposite him. When he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself to the earth, 
verse:18:3 and said, "My lord, if now I have found favor in your sight, please don't go away from your servant. 
verse:18:4 Now let a little water be fetched, wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree. 
verse:18:5 I will get a morsel of bread so you can refresh your heart. After that you may go your way, now that you have come to your servant."
They said, "Very well, do as you have said."
verse:18:6 Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah, and said, "Quickly prepare three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes." 
verse:18:7 Abraham ran to the herd, and fetched a tender and good calf, and gave it to the servant. He hurried to dress it. 
verse:18:8 He took butter, milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them. He stood by them under the tree, and they ate.
verse:18:9 They asked him, "Where is Sarah, your wife?"
He said, "See, in the tent."
verse:18:10 He said, "I will certainly return to you when the season comes round. Behold, Sarah your wife will have a son."
Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him. 
verse:18:11 Now Abraham and Sarah were old, well advanced in age. Sarah had passed the age of childbearing. 
verse:18:12 Sarah laughed within herself, saying, "After I have grown old will I have pleasure, my lord being old also?"
verse:18:13 HASHEM said to Abraham, "Why did Sarah laugh, saying, 'Will I really bear a child, yet I am old?' 
verse:18:14 Is anything too hard for HASHEM? At the set time I will return to you, when the season comes round, and Sarah will have a son."
portion:Genesis 18:15 - 18:33
verse:18:15 Then Sarah denied, saying, "I didn't laugh," for she was afraid.
He said, "No, but you did laugh."
verse:18:16 The men rose up from there, and looked toward Sodom. Abraham went with them to see them on their way. 
verse:18:17 HASHEM said, "Will I hide from Abraham what I do, 
verse:18:18 since Abraham has surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him? 
verse:18:19 For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of HASHEM, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that HASHEM may bring on Abraham that which he has spoken of him." 
verse:18:20 HASHEM said, "Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous, 
verse:18:21 I will go down now, and see whether their deeds are as bad as the reports which have come to me. If not, I will know."
verse:18:22 The men turned from there, and went toward Sodom, but Abraham stood yet before HASHEM. 
verse:18:23 Abraham drew near, and said, "Will you consume the righteous with the wicked? 
verse:18:24 What if there are fifty righteous within the city? Will you consume and not spare the place for the fifty righteous who are in it? 
verse:18:25 Be it far from you to do things like that, to kill the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous should be like the wicked. May that be far from you. Shouldn't the Judge of all the earth do right?"
verse:18:26 HASHEM said, "If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sake." 
verse:18:27 Abraham answered, "See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to my Lord, who am but dust and ashes. 
verse:18:28 What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five?"
He said, "I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there."
verse:18:29 He spoke to him yet again, and said, "What if there are forty found there?"
He said, "I will not do it for the forty's sake."
verse:18:30 He said, "Oh don't let my Lord be angry, and I will speak. What if there are thirty found there?"
He said, "I will not do it, if I find thirty there."
verse:18:31 He said, "See now, I have taken it on myself to speak to my Lord. What if there are twenty found there?"
He said, "I will not destroy it for the twenty's sake."
verse:18:32 He said, "Oh don't let my Lord be angry, and I will speak just once more. What if ten are found there?"
He said, "I will not destroy it for the ten's sake."
verse:18:33 HASHEM went his way, as soon as he had finished communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.
portion:Genesis 19:1 - 19:20
verse:19:1 The two angels came to Sodom at evening. Lot sat in the gate of Sodom. Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them. He bowed himself with his face to the earth, 
verse:19:2 and he said, "See now, my lords, please turn aside into your servant's house, stay all night, wash your feet, and you can rise up early, and go on your way."
They said, "No, but we will stay in the street all night."
verse:19:3 He urged them greatly, and they came in with him, and entered into his house. He made them a feast, and baked unleavened bread, and they ate. 
verse:19:4 But before they lay down, the men of the city, the men of Sodom, surrounded the house, both young and old, all the people from every quarter. 
verse:19:5 They called to Lot, and said to him, "Where are the men who came in to you this night? Bring them out to us, that we may have sex with them."
verse:19:6 Lot went out to them to the door, and shut the door after him. 
verse:19:7 He said, "Please, my brothers, don't act so wickedly. 
verse:19:8 See now, I have two virgin daughters. Please let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them what seems good to you. Only don't do anything to these men, because they have come under the shadow of my roof."
verse:19:9 They said, "Stand back!" Then they said, "This one fellow came in to live as a foreigner, and he appoints himself a judge. Now will we deal worse with you, than with them!" They pressed hard on the man Lot, and drew near to break the door. 
verse:19:10 But the men reached out their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and shut the door. 
verse:19:11 They struck the men who were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great, so that they wearied themselves to find the door.
verse:19:12 The men said to Lot, "Do you have anybody else here? Sons-in-law, your sons, your daughters, and whoever you have in the city, bring them out of the place: 
verse:19:13 for we will destroy this place, because the outcry against them has grown great before HASHEM that HASHEM has sent us to destroy it."
verse:19:14 Lot went out, and spoke to his sons-in-law, who were pledged to marry his daughters, and said, "Get up! Get out of this place, for HASHEM will destroy the city."
But he seemed to his sons-in-law to be joking. 
verse:19:15 When the morning came, then the angels hurried Lot, saying, "Get up! Take your wife, and your two daughters who are here, lest you be consumed in the iniquity of the city." 
verse:19:16 But he lingered; and the men grabbed his hand, his wife's hand, and his two daughters' hands, HASHEM being merciful to him; and they took him out, and set him outside of the city. 
verse:19:17 It came to pass, when they had taken them out, that he said, "Escape for your life! Don't look behind you, and don't stay anywhere in the plain. Escape to the mountains, lest you be consumed!"
verse:19:18 Lot said to them, "Oh, not so, my lord. 
verse:19:19 See now, your servant has found favor in your sight, and you have magnified your loving kindness, which you have shown to me in saving my life. I can't escape to the mountain, lest evil overtake me, and I die. 
verse:19:20 See now, this city is near to flee to, and it is a little one. Oh let me escape there (isn't it a little one?), and my soul will live."
portion:Genesis 19:21 - 21:4
verse:19:21 He said to him, "Behold, I have granted your request concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which you have spoken. 
verse:19:22 Hurry, escape there, for I can't do anything until you get there." Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
verse:19:23 The sun had risen on the earth when Lot came to Zoar. 
verse:19:24 Then HASHEM rained on Sodom and on Gomorrah sulfur and fire from HASHEM out of the sky. 
verse:19:25 He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew on the ground. 
verse:19:26 But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.
verse:19:27 Abraham got up early in the morning to the place where he had stood before HASHEM. 
verse:19:28 He looked toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the plain, and looked, and saw that the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace.
verse:19:29 It happened, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the middle of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot lived.
verse:19:30 Lot went up out of Zoar, and lived in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters. 
verse:19:31 The firstborn said to the younger, "Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in to us in the way of all the earth. 
verse:19:32 Come, let's make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve our father's seed." 
verse:19:33 They made their father drink wine that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father. He didn't know when she lay down, nor when she arose. 
verse:19:34 It came to pass on the next day, that the firstborn said to the younger, "Behold, I lay last night with my father. Let us make him drink wine again, tonight. You go in, and lie with him, that we may preserve our father's seed." 
verse:19:35 They made their father drink wine that night also. The younger went and lay with him. He didn't know when she lay down, nor when she got up. 
verse:19:36 Thus both of Lot's daughters were with child by their father. 
verse:19:37 The firstborn bore a son, and named him Moab. He is the father of the Moabites to this day. 
verse:19:38 The younger also bore a son, and called his name Ben Ammi. He is the father of the children of Ammon to this day.
verse:20:1 Abraham traveled from there toward the land of the South, and lived between Kadesh and Shur. He lived as a foreigner in Gerar. 
verse:20:2 Abraham said about Sarah his wife, "She is my sister." Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah. 
verse:20:3 But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to him, "Behold, you are a dead man, because of the woman whom you have taken. For she is a man's wife."
verse:20:4 Now Abimelech had not come near her. He said, "My Lord, will you kill even a righteous nation? 
verse:20:5 Didn't he tell me, 'She is my sister?' She, even she herself, said, 'He is my brother.' In the integrity of my heart and the innocence of my hands have I done this."
verse:20:6 God said to him in the dream, "Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also withheld you from sinning against me. Therefore I didn't allow you to touch her. 
verse:20:7 Now therefore, restore the man's wife. For he is a prophet, and he will pray for you, and you will live. If you don't restore her, know for sure that you will die, you, and all who are yours."
verse:20:8 Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ear. The men were very scared. 
verse:20:9 Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said to him, "What have you done to us? How have I sinned against you, that you have brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? You have done deeds to me that ought not to be done!" 
verse:20:10 Abimelech said to Abraham, "What did you see, that you have done this thing?"
verse:20:11 Abraham said, "Because I thought, 'Surely the fear of God is not in this place. They will kill me for my wife's sake.' 
verse:20:12 Besides, she is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife. 
verse:20:13 It happened, when God caused me to wander from my father's house, that I said to her, 'This is your kindness which you shall show to me. Everywhere that we go, say of me, "He is my brother."'"
verse:20:14 Abimelech took sheep and cattle, male servants and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife, to him. 
verse:20:15 Abimelech said, "Behold, my land is before you. Dwell where it pleases you." 
verse:20:16 To Sarah he said, "Behold, I have given your brother a thousand pieces of silver. Behold, it is for you a covering of the eyes to all that are with you. In front of all you are vindicated."
verse:20:17 Abraham prayed to God. God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his female servants, and they bore children. 
verse:20:18 For HASHEM had closed up tight all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.
verse:21:1 HASHEM visited Sarah as he had said, and HASHEM did to Sarah as he had spoken. 
verse:21:2 Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him. 
verse:21:3 Abraham called his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac. 
verse:21:4 Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
portion:Genesis 21:5 - 21:21
verse:21:5 Abraham was one hundred years old when his son, Isaac, was born to him. 
verse:21:6 Sarah said, "God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears will laugh with me." 
verse:21:7 She said, "Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age."
verse:21:8 The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned. 
verse:21:9 Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking. 
verse:21:10 Therefore she said to Abraham, "Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, Isaac."
verse:21:11 The thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight on account of his son. 
verse:21:12 God said to Abraham, "Don't let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called. 
verse:21:13 I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed." 
verse:21:14 Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder; and gave her the child, and sent her away. She departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba. 
verse:21:15 The water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs. 
verse:21:16 She went and sat down opposite him, a good way off, about a bow shot away. For she said, "Don't let me see the death of the child." She sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept. 
verse:21:17 God heard the voice of the boy.
The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, "What ails you, Hagar? Don't be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is. 
verse:21:18 Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation."
verse:21:19 God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went, filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink. 
verse:21:20 God was with the boy, and he grew. He lived in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer. 
verse:21:21 He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.
portion:Genesis 21:22 - 21:34
verse:21:22 It happened at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in all that you do. 
verse:21:23 Now, therefore, swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son. But according to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall do to me, and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner."
verse:21:24 Abraham said, "I will swear." 
verse:21:25 Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away. 
verse:21:26 Abimelech said, "I don't know who has done this thing. You didn't tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today."
verse:21:27 Abraham took sheep and cattle, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant. 
verse:21:28 Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves. 
verse:21:29 Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"
verse:21:30 He said, "You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well." 
verse:21:31 Therefore he called that place Beersheba, because they both swore there. 
verse:21:32 So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines. 
verse:21:33 Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and called there on the name of HASHEM, the Everlasting God. 
verse:21:34 Abraham lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines many days.
portion:Genesis 22:1 - 22:24
verse:22:1 It happened after these things, that God tested Abraham, and said to him, "Abraham!"
He said, "Here I am."
verse:22:2 He said, "Now take your son, your only son, whom you love, even Isaac, and go into the land of Moriah. Offer him there for a burnt offering on one of the mountains which I will tell you of."
verse:22:3 Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went to the place of which God had told him. 
verse:22:4 On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off. 
verse:22:5 Abraham said to his young men, "Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go yonder. We will worship, and come back to you." 
verse:22:6 Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. He took in his hand the fire and the knife. They both went together. 
verse:22:7 Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, "My father?"
He said, "Here I am, my son."
He said, "Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?"
verse:22:8 Abraham said, "God will provide himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son." So they both went together. 
verse:22:9 They came to the place which God had told him of. Abraham built the altar there, and laid the wood in order, bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar, on the wood. 
verse:22:10 Abraham stretched out his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.
verse:22:11 The angel of HASHEM called to him out of the sky, and said, "Abraham, Abraham!"
He said, "Here I am."
verse:22:12 He said, "Don't lay your hand on the boy, neither do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your only son, from me."
verse:22:13 Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and saw that behind him was a ram caught in the thicket by his horns. Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him up for a burnt offering instead of his son. 
verse:22:14 Abraham called the name of that place HASHEM Will Provide. As it is said to this day, "On HASHEM's mountain, it will be provided."
verse:22:15 The angel of HASHEM called to Abraham a second time out of the sky, 
verse:22:16 and said, "I have sworn by myself, says HASHEM, because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son, 
verse:22:17 that I will bless you greatly, and I will multiply your seed greatly like the stars of the heavens, and like the sand which is on the seashore. Your seed will possess the gate of his enemies. 
verse:22:18 In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice."
verse:22:19 So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba. Abraham lived at Beersheba.
verse:22:20 It happened after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, "Behold, Milcah, she also has borne children to your brother Nahor: 
verse:22:21 Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram, 
verse:22:22 Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel." 
verse:22:23 Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham's brother. 
verse:22:24 His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
portion:Genesis 22:20 - 22:24
verse:22:20 It happened after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, "Behold, Milcah, she also has borne children to your brother Nahor: 
verse:22:21 Uz his firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram, 
verse:22:22 Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel." 
verse:22:23 Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham's brother. 
verse:22:24 His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
portion:Genesis 23:1 - 23:16
verse:23:1 Sarah lived one hundred twenty-seven years. This was the length of Sarah's life. 
verse:23:2 Sarah died in Kiriath Arba (the same is Hebron), in the land of Canaan. Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her. 
verse:23:3 Abraham rose up from before his dead, and spoke to the children of Heth, saying, 
verse:23:4 "I am a stranger and a foreigner living with you. Give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight."
verse:23:5 The children of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him, 
verse:23:6 "Hear us, my lord. You are a prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our tombs. None of us will withhold from you his tomb. Bury your dead."
verse:23:7 Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth. 
verse:23:8 He talked with them, saying, "If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar, 
verse:23:9 that he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he has, which is in the end of his field. For the full price let him give it to me among you for a possession of a burying-place."
verse:23:10 Now Ephron was sitting in the middle of the children of Heth. Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the children of Heth, even of all who went in at the gate of his city, saying, 
verse:23:11 "No, my lord, hear me. I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. In the presence of the children of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead."
verse:23:12 Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land. 
verse:23:13 He spoke to Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, "But if you will, please hear me. I will give the price of the field. Take it from me, and I will bury my dead there."
verse:23:14 Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him, 
verse:23:15 "My lord, listen to me. What is a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver between me and you? Therefore bury your dead."
verse:23:16 Abraham listened to Ephron. Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the current merchants' standard.
portion:Genesis 23:17 - 24:9
verse:23:17 So the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, the cave which was in it, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all of its borders, were deeded 
verse:23:18 to Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all who went in at the gate of his city. 
verse:23:19 After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre (that is, Hebron), in the land of Canaan. 
verse:23:20 The field, and the cave that is in it, were deeded to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.
verse:24:1 Abraham was old, and well stricken in age. HASHEM had blessed Abraham in all things. 
verse:24:2 Abraham said to his servant, the elder of his house, who ruled over all that he had, "Please put your hand under my thigh. 
verse:24:3 I will make you swear by HASHEM, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I live. 
verse:24:4 But you shall go to my country, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son Isaac."
verse:24:5 The servant said to him, "What if the woman isn't willing to follow me to this land? Must I bring your son again to the land you came from?"
verse:24:6 Abraham said to him, "Beware that you don't bring my son there again. 
verse:24:7 HASHEM, the God of heaven, who took me from my father's house, and from the land of my birth, who spoke to me, and who swore to me, saying, 'I will give this land to your seed.' He will send his angel before you, and you shall take a wife for my son from there. 
verse:24:8 If the woman isn't willing to follow you, then you shall be clear from this my oath. Only you shall not bring my son there again."
verse:24:9 The servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning this matter.
portion:Genesis 24:10 - 24:26
verse:24:10 The servant took ten camels, of his master's camels, and departed, having a variety of good things of his master's with him. He arose, and went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor. 
verse:24:11 He made the camels kneel down outside the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that women go out to draw water. 
verse:24:12 He said, "HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, please give me success this day, and show kindness to my master Abraham. 
verse:24:13 Behold, I am standing by the spring of water. The daughters of the men of the city are coming out to draw water. 
verse:24:14 Let it happen, that the young lady to whom I will say, 'Please let down your pitcher, that I may drink,' and she will say, 'Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink,'--let her be the one you have appointed for your servant Isaac. By this I will know that you have shown kindness to my master."
verse:24:15 It happened, before he had finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher on her shoulder. 
verse:24:16 The young lady was very beautiful to look at, a virgin, neither had any man known her. She went down to the spring, filled her pitcher, and came up. 
verse:24:17 The servant ran to meet her, and said, "Please give me a drink, a little water from your pitcher."
verse:24:18 She said, "Drink, my lord." She hurried, and let down her pitcher on her hand, and gave him drink. 
verse:24:19 When she had done giving him drink, she said, "I will also draw for your camels, until they have done drinking." 
verse:24:20 She hurried, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.
verse:24:21 The man looked steadfastly at her, remaining silent, to know whether HASHEM had made his journey prosperous or not. 
verse:24:22 It happened, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold, 
verse:24:23 and said, "Whose daughter are you? Please tell me. Is there room in your father's house for us to lodge in?"
verse:24:24 She said to him, "I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor." 
verse:24:25 She said moreover to him, "We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in."
verse:24:26 The man bowed his head, and worshiped HASHEM.
portion:Genesis 24:27 - 24:52
verse:24:27 He said, "Blessed be HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, who has not forsaken his loving kindness and his truth toward my master. As for me, HASHEM has led me in the way to the house of my master's relatives."
verse:24:28 The young lady ran, and told her mother's house about these words. 
verse:24:29 Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man, to the spring. 
verse:24:30 It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, "This is what the man said to me," that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring. 
verse:24:31 He said, "Come in, you blessed of HASHEM. Why do you stand outside? For I have prepared the house, and room for the camels."
verse:24:32 The man came into the house, and he unloaded the camels. He gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men who were with him. 
verse:24:33 Food was set before him to eat, but he said, "I will not eat until I have told my message."
He said, "Speak on."
verse:24:34 He said, "I am Abraham's servant. 
verse:24:35 HASHEM has blessed my master greatly. He has become great. He has given him flocks and herds, silver and gold, male servants and female servants, and camels and donkeys. 
verse:24:36 Sarah, my master's wife, bore a son to my master when she was old. He has given all that he has to him. 
verse:24:37 My master made me swear, saying, 'You shall not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I live, 
verse:24:38 but you shall go to my father's house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.' 
verse:24:39 I asked my master, 'What if the woman will not follow me?' 
verse:24:40 He said to me, 'HASHEM, before whom I walk, will send his angel with you, and prosper your way. You shall take a wife for my son of my relatives, and of my father's house. 
verse:24:41 Then will you be clear from my oath, when you come to my relatives. If they don't give her to you, you shall be clear from my oath.' 
verse:24:42 I came this day to the spring, and said, 'HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go--
verse:24:43 behold, I am standing by this spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes out to draw, to whom I will say, "Please give me a little water from your pitcher to drink," 
verse:24:44 and she will tell me, "Drink, and I will also draw for your camels,"--let her be the woman whom HASHEM has appointed for my master's son.' 
verse:24:45 Before I had finished speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her pitcher on her shoulder. She went down to the spring, and drew. I said to her, 'Please let me drink.' 
verse:24:46 She hurried and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, 'Drink, and I will also give your camels a drink.' So I drank, and she also gave the camels a drink. 
verse:24:47 I asked her, and said, 'Whose daughter are you?' She said, 'The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.' I put the ring on her nose, and the bracelets on her hands. 
verse:24:48 I bowed my head, and worshiped HASHEM, and blessed HASHEM, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter for his son. 
verse:24:49 Now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me. If not, tell me, that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left."
verse:24:50 Then Laban and Bethuel answered, "The thing proceeds from HASHEM. We can't speak to you bad or good. 
verse:24:51 Behold, Rebekah is before you. Take her, and go, and let her be your master's son's wife, as HASHEM has spoken."
verse:24:52 It happened that when Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth to HASHEM.
portion:Genesis 24:53 - 24:67
verse:24:53 The servant brought out jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing, and gave them to Rebekah. He also gave precious things to her brother and her mother. 
verse:24:54 They ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed all night. They rose up in the morning, and he said, "Send me away to my master."
verse:24:55 Her brother and her mother said, "Let the young lady stay with us a few days, at least ten. After that she will go."
verse:24:56 He said to them, "Don't hinder me, since HASHEM has prospered my way. Send me away that I may go to my master."
verse:24:57 They said, "We will call the young lady, and ask her." 
verse:24:58 They called Rebekah, and said to her, "Will you go with this man?"
She said, "I will go."
verse:24:59 They sent away Rebekah, their sister, with her nurse, Abraham's servant, and his men. 
verse:24:60 They blessed Rebekah, and said to her, "Our sister, may you be the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let your seed possess the gate of those who hate them."
verse:24:61 Rebekah arose with her ladies. They rode on the camels, and followed the man. The servant took Rebekah, and went his way. 
verse:24:62 Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, for he lived in the land of the South. 
verse:24:63 Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening. He lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming. 
verse:24:64 Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel. 
verse:24:65 She said to the servant, "Who is the man who is walking in the field to meet us?"
The servant said, "It is my master."
She took her veil, and covered herself. 
verse:24:66 The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done. 
verse:24:67 Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife. He loved her. Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
portion:Genesis 25:1 - 25:11
verse:25:1 Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah. 
verse:25:2 She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. 
verse:25:3 Jokshan became the father of Sheba, and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim. 
verse:25:4 The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah. 
verse:25:5 Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac, 
verse:25:6 but to the sons of Abraham's concubines, Abraham gave gifts. He sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, to the east country. 
verse:25:7 These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years. 
verse:25:8 Abraham gave up the spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years, and was gathered to his people. 
verse:25:9 Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre, 
verse:25:10 the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth. Abraham was buried there with Sarah, his wife. 
verse:25:11 It happened after the death of Abraham that God blessed Isaac, his son. Isaac lived by Beer Lahai Roi.
portion:Genesis 25:12 - 25:18
verse:25:12 Now this is the history of the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bore to Abraham. 
verse:25:13 These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to the order of their birth: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, 
verse:25:14 Mishma, Dumah, Massa, 
verse:25:15 Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. 
verse:25:16 These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments: twelve princes, according to their nations. 
verse:25:17 These are the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred thirty-seven years. He gave up the spirit and died, and was gathered to his people. 
verse:25:18 They lived from Havilah to Shur that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria. He lived opposite all his relatives.
portion:Genesis 25:16 - 25:18
verse:25:16 These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments: twelve princes, according to their nations. 
verse:25:17 These are the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred thirty-seven years. He gave up the spirit and died, and was gathered to his people. 
verse:25:18 They lived from Havilah to Shur that is before Egypt, as you go toward Assyria. He lived opposite all his relatives.
portion:Genesis 25:19 - 26:5
verse:25:19 This is the history of the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son. Abraham became the father of Isaac. 
verse:25:20 Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Paddan Aram, the sister of Laban the Syrian, to be his wife. 
verse:25:21 Isaac entreated HASHEM for his wife, because she was barren. HASHEM was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived. 
verse:25:22 The children struggled together within her. She said, "If it be so, why do I live?" She went to inquire of HASHEM. 
verse:25:23 HASHEM said to her, "Two nations are in your womb. Two peoples will be separated from your body. The one people will be stronger than the other people. The elder will serve the younger."
verse:25:24 When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb. 
verse:25:25 The first came out red all over, like a hairy garment. They named him Esau. 
verse:25:26 After that, his brother came out, and his hand had hold on Esau's heel. He was named Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.
verse:25:27 The boys grew. Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field. Jacob was a quiet man, living in tents. 
verse:25:28 Now Isaac loved Esau, because he ate his venison. Rebekah loved Jacob. 
verse:25:29 Jacob boiled stew. Esau came in from the field, and he was famished. 
verse:25:30 Esau said to Jacob, "Please feed me with that same red stew, for I am famished." Therefore his name was called Edom.
verse:25:31 Jacob said, "First, sell me your birthright."
verse:25:32 Esau said, "Behold, I am about to die. What good is the birthright to me?"
verse:25:33 Jacob said, "Swear to me first."
He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob. 
verse:25:34 Jacob gave Esau bread and stew of lentils. He ate and drank, rose up, and went his way. So Esau despised his birthright.
verse:26:1 There was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines, to Gerar. 
verse:26:2 HASHEM appeared to him, and said, "Don't go down into Egypt. Live in the land I will tell you about. 
verse:26:3 Live in this land, and I will be with you, and will bless you. For to you, and to your seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore to Abraham your father. 
verse:26:4 I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and will give to your seed all these lands. In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, 
verse:26:5 because Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my requirements, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws."
portion:Genesis 26:6 - 26:12
verse:26:6 Isaac lived in Gerar. 
verse:26:7 The men of the place asked him about his wife. He said, "She is my sister," for he was afraid to say, "My wife," lest, he thought, "the men of the place might kill me for Rebekah, because she is beautiful to look at." 
verse:26:8 It happened, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was caressing Rebekah, his wife. 
verse:26:9 Abimelech called Isaac, and said, "Behold, surely she is your wife. Why did you say, 'She is my sister?'"
Isaac said to him, "Because I said, 'Lest I die because of her.'"
verse:26:10 Abimelech said, "What is this you have done to us? One of the people might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt on us!"
verse:26:11 Abimelech commanded all the people, saying, "He who touches this man or his wife will surely be put to death."
verse:26:12 Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year one hundred times what he planted. HASHEM blessed him.
portion:Genesis 26:13 - 26:22
verse:26:13 The man grew great, and grew more and more until he became very great. 
verse:26:14 He had possessions of flocks, possessions of herds, and a great household. The Philistines envied him. 
verse:26:15 Now all the wells which his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped, and filled with earth. 
verse:26:16 Abimelech said to Isaac, "Go from us, for you are much mightier than we."
verse:26:17 Isaac departed from there, encamped in the valley of Gerar, and lived there.
verse:26:18 Isaac dug again the wells of water, which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father. For the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham. He called their names after the names by which his father had called them. 
verse:26:19 Isaac's servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water. 
verse:26:20 The herdsmen of Gerar argued with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, "The water is ours." He called the name of the well Esek, because they contended with him. 
verse:26:21 They dug another well, and they argued over that, also. He called its name Sitnah. 
verse:26:22 He left that place, and dug another well. They didn't argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, "For now HASHEM has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land."
portion:Genesis 26:23 - 26:29
verse:26:23 He went up from there to Beersheba. 
verse:26:24 HASHEM appeared to him the same night, and said, "I am the God of Abraham your father. Don't be afraid, for I am with you, and will bless you, and multiply your seed for my servant Abraham's sake."
verse:26:25 He built an altar there, and called on the name of HASHEM, and pitched his tent there. There Isaac's servants dug a well.
verse:26:26 Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his army. 
verse:26:27 Isaac said to them, "Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?"
verse:26:28 They said, "We saw plainly that HASHEM was with you. We said, 'Let there now be an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you, 
verse:26:29 that you will do us no harm, as we have not touched you, and as we have done to you nothing but good, and have sent you away in peace.' You are now the blessed of HASHEM."
portion:Genesis 26:30 - 27:27
verse:26:30 He made them a feast, and they ate and drank. 
verse:26:31 They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace. 
verse:26:32 It happened the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had dug, and said to him, "We have found water." 
verse:26:33 He called it Shibah. Therefore the name of the city is Beersheba to this day.
verse:26:34 When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite. 
verse:26:35 They grieved Isaac's and Rebekah's spirits.
verse:27:1 It happened, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, "My son?"
He said to him, "Here I am."
verse:27:2 He said, "See now, I am old. I don't know the day of my death. 
verse:27:3 Now therefore, please take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison. 
verse:27:4 Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die."
verse:27:5 Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it. 
verse:27:6 Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, "Behold, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying, 
verse:27:7 'Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before HASHEM before my death.' 
verse:27:8 Now therefore, my son, obey my voice according to that which I command you. 
verse:27:9 Go now to the flock, and get me from there two good young goats. I will make them savory food for your father, such as he loves. 
verse:27:10 You shall bring it to your father, that he may eat, so that he may bless you before his death."
verse:27:11 Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, "Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man. 
verse:27:12 What if my father touches me? I will seem to him as a deceiver, and I would bring a curse on myself, and not a blessing."
