verse:29:16 You shall kill the ram, and you shall take its blood, and sprinkle it around on the altar. 
verse:29:17 You shall cut the ram into its pieces, and wash its innards, and its legs, and put them with its pieces, and with its head. 
verse:29:18 You shall burn the whole ram on the altar: it is a burnt offering to HASHEM; it is a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
portion:Exodus 29:19 - 29:37
verse:29:19 "You shall take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram. 
verse:29:20 Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood, and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood around on the altar. 
verse:29:21 You shall take of the blood that is on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron, and on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be made holy, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him. 
verse:29:22 Also you shall take some of the ram's fat, the fat tail, the fat that covers the innards, the cover of the liver, the two kidneys, the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration), 
verse:29:23 and one loaf of bread, one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before HASHEM. 
verse:29:24 You shall put all of this in Aaron's hands, and in his sons' hands, and shall wave them for a wave offering before HASHEM. 
verse:29:25 You shall take them from their hands, and burn them on the altar on the burnt offering, for a pleasant aroma before HASHEM: it is an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
verse:29:26 "You shall take the breast of Aaron's ram of consecration, and wave it for a wave offering before HASHEM: and it shall be your portion. 
verse:29:27 You shall sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the thigh of the wave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons: 
verse:29:28 and it shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the children of Israel; for it is a wave offering: and it shall be a wave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, even their wave offering to HASHEM.
verse:29:29 "The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them, and to be consecrated in them. 
verse:29:30 Seven days shall the son who is priest in his place put them on, when he comes into the Tent of Meeting to minister in the holy place.
verse:29:31 "You shall take the ram of consecration, and boil its flesh in a holy place. 
verse:29:32 Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:29:33 They shall eat those things with which atonement was made, to consecrate and sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat of it, because they are holy. 
verse:29:34 If anything of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, remains to the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verse:29:35 "You shall do so to Aaron, and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. You shall consecrate them seven days. 
verse:29:36 Every day you shall offer the bull of sin offering for atonement: and you shall cleanse the altar, when you make atonement for it; and you shall anoint it, to sanctify it. 
verse:29:37 Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar, and sanctify it: and the altar shall be most holy; whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
portion:Exodus 29:38 - 29:46
verse:29:38 "Now this is that which you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old day by day continually. 
verse:29:39 The one lamb you shall offer in the morning; and the other lamb you shall offer at evening: 
verse:29:40 and with the one lamb a tenth part of an efah of fine flour mixed with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil, and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink offering. 
verse:29:41 The other lamb you shall offer at evening, and shall do to it according to the meal offering of the morning, and according to its drink offering, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to HASHEM. 
verse:29:42 It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the Tent of Meeting before HASHEM, where I will meet with you, to speak there to you. 
verse:29:43 There I will meet with the children of Israel; and the place shall be sanctified by my glory. 
verse:29:44 I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar: Aaron also and his sons I will sanctify, to minister to me in the priest's office. 
verse:29:45 I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God. 
verse:29:46 They shall know that I am HASHEM their God, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am HASHEM their God.
portion:Exodus 30:1 - 30:10
verse:30:1 "You shall make an altar to burn incense on. You shall make it of acacia wood. 
verse:30:2 Its length shall be a cubit, and its breadth a cubit. It shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits. Its horns shall be of one piece with it. 
verse:30:3 You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding around it. 
verse:30:4 You shall make two golden rings for it under its molding; on its two ribs, on its two sides you shall make them; and they shall be for places for poles with which to bear it. 
verse:30:5 You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold. 
verse:30:6 You shall put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with you. 
verse:30:7 Aaron shall burn incense of sweet spices on it every morning. When he tends the lamps, he shall burn it. 
verse:30:8 When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before HASHEM throughout your generations. 
verse:30:9 You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it. 
verse:30:10 Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once in the year; with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to HASHEM."
portion:Exodus 30:8 - 30:10
verse:30:8 When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before HASHEM throughout your generations. 
verse:30:9 You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it. 
verse:30:10 Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once in the year; with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to HASHEM."
portion:Exodus 30:11 - 31:17
verse:30:11 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:30:12 "When you take a census of the children of Israel, according to those who are numbered among them, then each man shall give a ransom for his soul to HASHEM, when you number them; that there be no plague among them when you number them. 
verse:30:13 They shall give this, everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; (the shekel is twenty gerahs;) half a shekel for an offering to HASHEM. 
verse:30:14 Everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering to HASHEM. 
verse:30:15 The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of HASHEM, to make atonement for your souls. 
verse:30:16 You shall take the atonement money from the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the Tent of Meeting; that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before HASHEM, to make atonement for your souls."
verse:30:17 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:30:18 "You shall also make a basin of brass, and its base of brass, in which to wash. You shall put it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it. 
verse:30:19 Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in it. 
verse:30:20 When they go into the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to HASHEM. 
verse:30:21 So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die: and it shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his descendants throughout their generations."
verse:30:22 Moreover HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:30:23 "Also take fine spices: of liquid myrrh, five hundred shekels; and of fragrant cinnamon half as much, even two hundred and fifty; and of fragrant cane, two hundred and fifty; 
verse:30:24 and of cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the sanctuary; and a hin of olive oil. 
verse:30:25 You shall make it a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer: it shall be a holy anointing oil. 
verse:30:26 You shall use it to anoint the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the testimony, 
verse:30:27 the table and all its articles, the menorah and its accessories, the altar of incense, 
verse:30:28 the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its base. 
verse:30:29 You shall sanctify them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy. 
verse:30:30 You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest's office. 
verse:30:31 You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations. 
verse:30:32 It shall not be poured on man's flesh, neither shall you make any like it, according to its composition: it is holy. It shall be holy to you. 
verse:30:33 Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.'"
verse:30:34 HASHEM said to Moses, "Take to yourself sweet spices, gum resin, and onycha, and galbanum; sweet spices with pure frankincense: there shall be an equal weight of each; 
verse:30:35 and you shall make incense of it, a perfume after the art of the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy: 
verse:30:36 and you shall beat some of it very small, and put some of it before the testimony in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be to you most holy. 
verse:30:37 The incense which you shall make, according to its composition you shall not make for yourselves: it shall be to you holy for HASHEM. 
verse:30:38 Whoever shall make any like that, to smell of it, he shall be cut off from his people."
verse:31:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:31:2 "Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah: 
verse:31:3 and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all kinds of workmanship, 
verse:31:4 to devise skillful works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, 
verse:31:5 and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of workmanship. 
verse:31:6 I, behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the heart of all who are wise-hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded you: 
verse:31:7 the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the testimony, the mercy seat that is on it, all the furniture of the Tent, 
verse:31:8 the table and its vessels, the pure menorah with all its vessels, the altar of incense, 
verse:31:9 the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels, the basin and its base, 
verse:31:10 the finely worked garments--the holy garments for Aaron the priest--the garments of his sons to minister in the priest's office, 
verse:31:11 the anointing oil, and the incense of sweet spices for the holy place: according to all that I have commanded you they shall do."
verse:31:12 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:31:13 "Speak also to the children of Israel, saying, 'Most certainly you shall keep my Sabbaths: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that you may know that I am HASHEM who sanctifies you. 
verse:31:14 You shall keep the Sabbath therefore; for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people. 
verse:31:15 Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to HASHEM. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall surely be put to death. 
verse:31:16 Therefore the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant. 
verse:31:17 It is a sign between me and the children of Israel forever; for in six days HASHEM made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.'"
portion:Exodus 31:18 - 33:11
verse:31:18 He gave to Moses, when he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets, written with God's finger.
verse:32:1 When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron, and said to him, "Come, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has become of him."
verse:32:2 Aaron said to them, "Take off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them to me."
verse:32:3 All the people took off the golden rings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron. 
verse:32:4 He received what they handed him, and fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it a molten calf; and they said, "These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt."
verse:32:5 When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made a proclamation, and said, "Tomorrow shall be a feast to HASHEM."
verse:32:6 They rose up early on the next day, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
verse:32:7 HASHEM spoke to Moses, "Go, get down; for your people, who you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves! 
verse:32:8 They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made themselves a molten calf, and have worshiped it, and have sacrificed to it, and said, 'These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.'"
verse:32:9 HASHEM said to Moses, "I have seen these people, and behold, they are a stiff-necked people. 
verse:32:10 Now therefore leave me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them, and that I may consume them; and I will make of you a great nation."
verse:32:11 Moses begged HASHEM his God, and said, "HASHEM, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, that you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand? 
verse:32:12 Why should the Egyptians speak, saying, 'He brought them forth for evil, to kill them in the mountains, and to consume them from the surface of the earth?' Turn from your fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against your people. 
verse:32:13 Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self, and said to them, 'I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and all this land that I have spoken of I will give to your seed, and they shall inherit it forever.'"
verse:32:14 HASHEM repented of the evil which he said he would do to his people.
verse:32:15 Moses turned, and went down from the mountain, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand; tablets that were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other they were written. 
verse:32:16 The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tables.
verse:32:17 When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, "There is the noise of war in the camp."
verse:32:18 He said, "It isn't the voice of those who shout for victory, neither is it the voice of those who cry for being overcome; but the noise of those who sing that I hear." 
verse:32:19 It happened, as soon as he came near to the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing: and Moses' anger grew hot, and he threw the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mountain. 
verse:32:20 He took the calf which they had made, and burnt it with fire, ground it to powder, and scattered it on the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.
verse:32:21 Moses said to Aaron, "What did these people do to you, that you have brought a great sin on them?"
verse:32:22 Aaron said, "Don't let the anger of my lord grow hot. You know the people, that they are set on evil. 
verse:32:23 For they said to me, 'Make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has become of him.' 
verse:32:24 I said to them, 'Whoever has any gold, let them take it off:' so they gave it to me; and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf."
verse:32:25 When Moses saw that the people had broken loose, (for Aaron had let them loose for a derision among their enemies), 
verse:32:26 then Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, "Whoever is on HASHEM's side, come to me!"
All the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him. 
verse:32:27 He said to them, "Thus says HASHEM, the God of Israel, 'Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and every man kill his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.'" 
verse:32:28 The sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men. 
verse:32:29 Moses said, "Consecrate yourselves today to HASHEM, yes, every man against his son, and against his brother; that he may bestow on you a blessing this day."
verse:32:30 It happened on the next day, that Moses said to the people, "You have sinned a great sin. Now I will go up to HASHEM. Perhaps I shall make atonement for your sin."
verse:32:31 Moses returned to HASHEM, and said, "Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made themselves gods of gold. 
verse:32:32 Yet now, if you will, forgive their sin--and if not, please blot me out of your book which you have written."
verse:32:33 HASHEM said to Moses, "Whoever has sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book. 
verse:32:34 Now go, lead the people to the place of which I have spoken to you. Behold, my angel shall go before you. Nevertheless in the day when I punish, I will punish them for their sin." 
verse:32:35 HASHEM struck the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.
verse:33:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, "Depart, go up from here, you and the people that you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, 'I will give it to your seed.' 
verse:33:2 I will send an angel before you; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite: 
verse:33:3 to a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of you, for you are a stiff-necked people, lest I consume you in the way."
verse:33:4 When the people heard this evil news, they mourned: and no one put on his jewelry.
verse:33:5 HASHEM said to Moses, "Tell the children of Israel, 'You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go up into your midst for one moment, I would consume you. Therefore now take off your jewelry from you, that I may know what to do to you.'"
verse:33:6 The children of Israel stripped themselves of their jewelry from Mount Horeb onward.
verse:33:7 Now Moses used to take the tent and to pitch it outside the camp, far away from the camp, and he called it "The Tent of Meeting." It happened that everyone who sought HASHEM went out to the Tent of Meeting, which was outside the camp. 
verse:33:8 It happened that when Moses went out to the Tent, that all the people rose up, and stood, everyone at their tent door, and watched Moses, until he had gone into the Tent. 
verse:33:9 It happened, when Moses entered into the Tent, that the pillar of cloud descended, stood at the door of the Tent, and spoke with Moses. 
verse:33:10 All the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the Tent, and all the people rose up and worshiped, everyone at their tent door. 
verse:33:11 HASHEM spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. He turned again into the camp, but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, didn't depart out of the Tent.
portion:Exodus 33:12 - 33:16
verse:33:12 Moses said to HASHEM, "Behold, you tell me, 'Bring up this people:' and you haven't let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, 'I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my sight.' 
verse:33:13 Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight: and consider that this nation is your people."
verse:33:14 He said, "My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest."
verse:33:15 He said to him, "If your presence doesn't go with me, don't carry us up from here. 
verse:33:16 For how would people know that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people? Isn't it in that you go with us, so that we are separated, I and your people, from all the people who are on the surface of the earth?"
portion:Exodus 33:17 - 33:23
verse:33:17 HASHEM said to Moses, "I will do this thing also that you have spoken; for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name."
verse:33:18 He said, "Please show me your glory."
verse:33:19 He said, "I will make all my goodness pass before you, and will proclaim the name of HASHEM before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy." 
verse:33:20 He said, "You cannot see my face, for man may not see me and live." 
verse:33:21 HASHEM also said, "Behold, there is a place by me, and you shall stand on the rock. 
verse:33:22 It will happen, while my glory passes by, that I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and will cover you with my hand until I have passed by; 
verse:33:23 then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back; but my face shall not be seen."
portion:Exodus 34:1 - 34:9
verse:34:1 HASHEM said to Moses, "Chisel two stone tablets like the first: and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke. 
verse:34:2 Be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain. 
verse:34:3 No one shall come up with you; neither let anyone be seen throughout all the mountain; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mountain."
verse:34:4 He chiseled two tablets of stone like the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up to Mount Sinai, as HASHEM had commanded him, and took in his hand two stone tablets. 
verse:34:5 HASHEM descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of HASHEM. 
verse:34:6 HASHEM passed by before him, and proclaimed, "HASHEM! HASHEM, a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness and truth, 
verse:34:7 keeping loving kindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and disobedience and sin; and that will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the children's children, on the third and on the fourth generation."
verse:34:8 Moses hurried and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshiped. 
verse:34:9 He said, "If now I have found favor in your sight, my Lord, please let my Lord go in the midst of us; although this is a stiff-necked people; pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance."
portion:Exodus 34:10 - 34:26
verse:34:10 He said, "Behold, I make a covenant: before all your people I will do marvels, such as have not been worked in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among which you are shall see the work of HASHEM; for it is an awesome thing that I do with you. 
verse:34:11 Observe that which I command you this day. Behold, I drive out before you the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite. 
verse:34:12 Be careful, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it be for a snare in the midst of you: 
verse:34:13 but you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and you shall cut down their Asherim; 
verse:34:14 for you shall worship no other god: for HASHEM, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
verse:34:15 "Don't make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, lest they play the prostitute after their gods, and sacrifice to their gods, and one call you and you eat of his sacrifice; 
verse:34:16 and you take of their daughters to your sons, and their daughters play the prostitute after their gods, and make your sons play the prostitute after their gods.
verse:34:17 "You shall make no cast idols for yourselves.
verse:34:18 "You shall keep the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib; for in the month Abib you came out from Egypt.
verse:34:19 "All that opens the womb is mine; and all your livestock that is male, the firstborn of cow and sheep. 
verse:34:20 The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb: and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. No one shall appear before me empty.
verse:34:21 "Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest: in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.
verse:34:22 "You shall observe the feast of weeks with the first fruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of harvest at the year's end. 
verse:34:23 Three times in the year all your males shall appear before HASHEM GOD, the God of Israel. 
verse:34:24 For I will drive out nations before you and enlarge your borders; neither shall any man desire your land when you go up to appear before HASHEM, your God, three times in the year.
verse:34:25 "You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the Passover be left to the morning.
verse:34:26 "You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of HASHEM your God.
"You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk."
portion:Exodus 34:27 - 34:35
verse:34:27 HASHEM said to Moses, "Write you these words: for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel."
verse:34:28 He was there with HASHEM forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread, nor drank water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
verse:34:29 It happened, when Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the testimony in Moses' hand, when he came down from the mountain, that Moses didn't know that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him. 
verse:34:30 When Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come near him. 
verse:34:31 Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him; and Moses spoke to them. 
verse:34:32 Afterward all the children of Israel came near, and he gave them all of the commandments that HASHEM had spoken with him on Mount Sinai. 
verse:34:33 When Moses was done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face. 
verse:34:34 But when Moses went in before HASHEM to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded. 
verse:34:35 The children of Israel saw Moses' face, that the skin of Moses' face shone: and Moses put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
portion:Exodus 34:33 - 34:35
verse:34:33 When Moses was done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face. 
verse:34:34 But when Moses went in before HASHEM to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded. 
verse:34:35 The children of Israel saw Moses' face, that the skin of Moses' face shone: and Moses put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
portion:Exodus 35:1 - 35:20
verse:35:1 Moses assembled all the congregation of the children of Israel, and said to them, "These are the words which HASHEM has commanded, that you should do them. 
verse:35:2 'Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of solemn rest to HASHEM: whoever does any work in it shall be put to death. 
verse:35:3 You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations on the Sabbath day.'"
verse:35:4 Moses spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, "This is the thing which HASHEM commanded, saying, 
verse:35:5 'Take from among you an offering to HASHEM. Whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, HASHEM's offering: gold, silver, brass, 
verse:35:6 blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, 
verse:35:7 rams' skins dyed red, sea cow hides, acacia wood, 
verse:35:8 oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense, 
verse:35:9 onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.
verse:35:10 "'Let every wise-hearted man among you come, and make all that HASHEM has commanded: 
verse:35:11 the tabernacle, its outer covering, its roof, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets; 
verse:35:12 the ark, and its poles, the mercy seat, the veil of the screen; 
verse:35:13 the table with its poles and all its vessels, and the show bread; 
verse:35:14 the menorah also for the light, with its vessels, its lamps, and the oil for the light; 
verse:35:15 and the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle; 
verse:35:16 the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base; 
verse:35:17 the hangings of the court, its pillars, their sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court; 
verse:35:18 the pins of the tabernacle, the pins of the court, and their cords; 
verse:35:19 the finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.'"
verse:35:20 All the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
portion:Exodus 35:21 - 35:29
verse:35:21 They came, everyone whose heart stirred him up, and everyone whom his spirit made willing, and brought HASHEM's offering, for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all of its service, and for the holy garments. 
verse:35:22 They came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, and brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, and armlets, all jewels of gold; even every man who offered an offering of gold to HASHEM. 
verse:35:23 Everyone, with whom was found blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, and sea cow hides, brought them. 
verse:35:24 Everyone who offered an offering of silver and brass brought HASHEM's offering; and everyone, with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it. 
verse:35:25 All the women who were wise-hearted spun with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen. 
verse:35:26 All the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats' hair. 
verse:35:27 The rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastplate; 
verse:35:28 and the spice, and the oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense. 
verse:35:29 The children of Israel brought a freewill offering to HASHEM; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which HASHEM had commanded to be made by Moses.
portion:Exodus 35:30 - 36:7
verse:35:30 Moses said to the children of Israel, "Behold, HASHEM has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah. 
verse:35:31 He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all kinds of workmanship; 
verse:35:32 and to make skillful works, to work in gold, in silver, in brass, 
verse:35:33 in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of skillful workmanship. 
verse:35:34 He has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. 
verse:35:35 He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all kinds of workmanship, of the engraver, of the skillful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship, and of those who make skillful works.
verse:36:1 "Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every wise-hearted man, in whom HASHEM has put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that HASHEM has commanded."
verse:36:2 Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart HASHEM had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it: 
verse:36:3 and they received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, with which to make it. They brought yet to him freewill offerings every morning. 
verse:36:4 All the wise men, who performed all the work of the sanctuary, each came from his work which they did. 
verse:36:5 They spoke to Moses, saying, "The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which HASHEM commanded to make."
verse:36:6 Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, "Let neither man nor woman make anything else for the offering for the sanctuary." So the people were restrained from bringing. 
verse:36:7 For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
portion:Exodus 36:8 - 36:19
verse:36:8 All the wise-hearted men among those who did the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet, with cherubim, the work of the skillful workman, they made them. 
verse:36:9 The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure. 
verse:36:10 He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled one to another. 
verse:36:11 He made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain from the edge in the coupling. Likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling. 
verse:36:12 He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling. The loops were opposite one to another. 
verse:36:13 He made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was a unit.
verse:36:14 He made curtains of goats' hair for a covering over the tabernacle. He made them eleven curtains. 
verse:36:15 The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure. 
verse:36:16 He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves. 
verse:36:17 He made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling. 
verse:36:18 He made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be a unit. 
verse:36:19 He made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.
portion:Exodus 36:20 - 37:16
verse:36:20 He made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up. 
verse:36:21 Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board. 
verse:36:22 Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. He made all the boards of the tabernacle this way. 
verse:36:23 He made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward. 
verse:36:24 He made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons. 
verse:36:25 For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards, 
verse:36:26 and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board. 
verse:36:27 For the far part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards. 
verse:36:28 He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part. 
verse:36:29 They were double beneath, and in the same way they were all the way to its top to one ring. He did this to both of them in the two corners. 
verse:36:30 There were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.
verse:36:31 He made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle, 
verse:36:32 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward. 
verse:36:33 He made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other. 
verse:36:34 He overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verse:36:35 He made the veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim. He made it the work of a skillful workman. 
verse:36:36 He made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold. He cast four sockets of silver for them. 
verse:36:37 He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer; 
verse:36:38 and the five pillars of it with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold, and their five sockets were of brass.
verse:37:1 Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height. 
verse:37:2 He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold for it around it. 
verse:37:3 He cast four rings of gold for it, in its four feet; even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its other side. 
verse:37:4 He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold. 
verse:37:5 He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark. 
verse:37:6 He made a mercy seat of pure gold. Its length was two and a half cubits, and a cubit and a half its breadth. 
verse:37:7 He made two cherubim of gold. He made them of beaten work, at the two ends of the mercy seat; 
verse:37:8 one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end. He made the cherubim of one piece with the mercy seat at its two ends. 
verse:37:9 The cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.
verse:37:10 He made the table of acacia wood. Its length was two cubits, and its breadth was a cubit, and its height was a cubit and a half. 
verse:37:11 He overlaid it with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it. 
verse:37:12 He made a border of a handbreadth around it, and made a golden molding on its border around it. 
verse:37:13 He cast four rings of gold for it, and put the rings in the four corners that were on its four feet. 
verse:37:14 The rings were close by the border, the places for the poles to carry the table. 
verse:37:15 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table. 
verse:37:16 He made the vessels which were on the table, its dishes, its spoons, its bowls, and its pitchers with which to pour out, of pure gold.
portion:Exodus 37:17 - 37:29
verse:37:17 He made the menorah of pure gold. He made the menorah of beaten work. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were of one piece with it. 
verse:37:18 There were six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the menorah out of its one side, and three branches of the menorah out of its other side: 
verse:37:19 three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the menorah. 
verse:37:20 In the menorah were four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers; 
verse:37:21 and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it. 
verse:37:22 Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold. 
verse:37:23 He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold. 
verse:37:24 He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
verse:37:25 He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. It was square: its length was a cubit, and its breadth a cubit. Its height was two cubits. Its horns were of one piece with it. 
verse:37:26 He overlaid it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns. He made a gold molding around it. 
verse:37:27 He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it. 
verse:37:28 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold. 
verse:37:29 He made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
portion:Exodus 38:1 - 38:20
verse:38:1 He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its breadth was five cubits, and its height was three cubits. 
verse:38:2 He made its horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with brass. 
verse:38:3 He made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans. He made all its vessels of brass. 
verse:38:4 He made for the altar a grating of a network of brass, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up. 
verse:38:5 He cast four rings for the four ends of brass grating, to be places for the poles. 
verse:38:6 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with brass. 
verse:38:7 He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.
verse:38:8 He made the basin of brass, and its base of brass, out of the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verse:38:9 He made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits; 
verse:38:10 their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver. 
verse:38:11 For the north side one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:12 For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:13 For the east side eastward fifty cubits. 
verse:38:14 The hangings for the one side were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three; 
verse:38:15 and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three. 
verse:38:16 All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen. 
verse:38:17 The sockets for the pillars were of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals, of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver. 
verse:38:18 The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court. 
verse:38:19 Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:20 All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of brass.
portion:Exodus 38:18 - 38:20
verse:38:18 The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court. 
verse:38:19 Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:20 All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of brass.
portion:Exodus 38:21 - 39:1
verse:38:21 This is the amount of material used for the tabernacle, even the Tabernacle of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest. 
verse:38:22 Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:38:23 With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.
verse:38:24 All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents, and seven hundred thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary. 
verse:38:25 The silver of those who were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents, and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary: 
verse:38:26 a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men. 
verse:38:27 The one hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; one hundred sockets for the one hundred talents, a talent for a socket. 
verse:38:28 Of the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them. 
verse:38:29 The brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand four hundred shekels. 
verse:38:30 With this he made the sockets to the door of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, all the vessels of the altar, 
verse:38:31 the sockets around the court, the sockets of the gate of the court, all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins around the court.
verse:39:1 Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as HASHEM commanded Moses.
portion:Exodus 39:2 - 39:21
verse:39:2 He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. 
verse:39:3 They beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, in the purple, in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, the work of the skillful workman. 
verse:39:4 They made shoulder straps for it, joined together. At the two ends it was joined together. 
verse:39:5 The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:6 They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel. 
verse:39:7 He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:8 He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. 
verse:39:9 It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its breadth a span, being double. 
verse:39:10 They set in it four rows of stones. A row of ruby, topaz, and beryl was the first row; 
verse:39:11 and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald; 
verse:39:12 and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst; 
verse:39:13 and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings. 
verse:39:14 The stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, for the twelve tribes. 
verse:39:15 They made on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold. 
verse:39:16 They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate. 
verse:39:17 They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate. 
verse:39:18 The other two ends of the two braided chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, in its front. 
verse:39:19 They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which was toward the side of the ephod inward. 
verse:39:20 They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its front, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod. 
verse:39:21 They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
portion:Exodus 39:22 - 39:32
verse:39:22 He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue. 
verse:39:23 The opening of the robe in its midst was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around its opening, that it should not be torn. 
verse:39:24 They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen. 
verse:39:25 They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates; 
verse:39:26 a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:27 They made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons, 
verse:39:28 and the turban of fine linen, and the linen headbands of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen, 
verse:39:29 and the sash of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:30 They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it a writing, like the engravings of a signet: "HOLY TO THE HASHEM." 
verse:39:31 They tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on the turban above, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:32 Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that HASHEM commanded Moses; so they did.
portion:Exodus 39:33 - 39:43
verse:39:33 They brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent, with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, 
verse:39:34 the covering of rams' skins dyed red, the covering of sea cow hides, the veil of the screen, 
verse:39:35 the ark of the testimony with its poles, the mercy seat, 
verse:39:36 the table, all its vessels, the show bread, 
verse:39:37 the pure menorah, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light, 
verse:39:38 the golden altar, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door of the Tent, 
verse:39:39 the bronze altar, its grating of brass, its poles, all of its vessels, the basin and its base, 
verse:39:40 the hangings of the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pins, all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting, 
verse:39:41 the finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office. 
verse:39:42 According to all that HASHEM commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work. 
verse:39:43 Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as HASHEM had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
portion:Exodus 40:1 - 40:16
verse:40:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:40:2 "On the first day of the first month you shall raise up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:40:3 You shall put the ark of the testimony in it, and you shall screen the ark with the veil. 
verse:40:4 You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the menorah, and light its lamps. 
verse:40:5 You shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verse:40:6 "You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:40:7 You shall set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and shall put water therein. 
verse:40:8 You shall set up the court around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
verse:40:9 "You shall take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is in it, and shall make it holy, and all its furniture: and it will be holy. 
verse:40:10 You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering, with all its vessels, and sanctify the altar: and the altar will be most holy. 
verse:40:11 You shall anoint the basin and its base, and sanctify it.
verse:40:12 "You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall wash them with water. 
verse:40:13 You shall put on Aaron the holy garments; and you shall anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest's office. 
verse:40:14 You shall bring his sons, and put coats on them. 
verse:40:15 You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest's office. Their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations." 
verse:40:16 Moses did so. According to all that HASHEM commanded him, so he did.
portion:Exodus 40:17 - 40:27
verse:40:17 It happened in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was raised up. 
verse:40:18 Moses raised up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and raised up its pillars. 
verse:40:19 He spread the covering over the tent, and put the roof of the tabernacle above on it, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:20 He took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the poles on the ark, and put the mercy seat above on the ark. 
verse:40:21 He brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:22 He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the side of the tabernacle northward, outside of the veil. 
verse:40:23 He set the bread in order on it before HASHEM, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:24 He put the menorah in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward. 
verse:40:25 He lit the lamps before HASHEM, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:26 He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting before the veil; 
verse:40:27 and he burnt incense of sweet spices on it, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
portion:Exodus 40:28 - 40:38
verse:40:28 He put up the screen of the door to the tabernacle. 
verse:40:29 He set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the meal offering, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:30 He set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash. 
verse:40:31 Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and their feet there. 
verse:40:32 When they went into the Tent of Meeting, and when they came near to the altar, they washed, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:33 He raised up the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verse:40:34 Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of HASHEM filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:35 Moses wasn't able to enter into the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and HASHEM's glory filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:36 When the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys; 
verse:40:37 but if the cloud wasn't taken up, then they didn't travel until the day that it was taken up. 
verse:40:38 For the cloud of HASHEM was on the tabernacle by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
portion:Exodus 40:34 - 40:38
verse:40:34 Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of HASHEM filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:35 Moses wasn't able to enter into the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and HASHEM's glory filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:36 When the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys; 
verse:40:37 but if the cloud wasn't taken up, then they didn't travel until the day that it was taken up. 
verse:40:38 For the cloud of HASHEM was on the tabernacle by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
portion:Leviticus 1:1 - 1:13
verse:1:1 HASHEM called to Moses, and spoke to him out of the Tent of Meeting, saying, 
verse:1:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When anyone of you offers an offering to HASHEM, you shall offer your offering of the livestock, from the herd and from the flock.
verse:1:3 "'If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without blemish. He shall offer it at the door of the Tent of Meeting, that he may be accepted before HASHEM. 
verse:1:4 He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him. 
verse:1:5 He shall kill the bull before HASHEM. Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood and sprinkle the blood around on the altar that is at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:1:6 He shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into pieces. 
verse:1:7 The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar, and lay wood in order on the fire; 
verse:1:8 and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall lay the pieces, the head, and the fat in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar; 
verse:1:9 but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM.
verse:1:10 "'If his offering is from the flock, from the sheep, or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall offer a male without blemish. 
verse:1:11 He shall kill it on the north side of the altar before HASHEM. Aaron's sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar. 
verse:1:12 He shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat. The priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar, 
verse:1:13 but the innards and the legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall offer the whole, and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM.
portion:Leviticus 1:14 - 2:6
verse:1:14 "'If his offering to HASHEM is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall offer his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons. 
verse:1:15 The priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head, and burn it on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out on the side of the altar; 
verse:1:16 and he shall take away its crop with its filth, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes. 
verse:1:17 He shall tear it by its wings, but shall not divide it apart. The priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM.
verse:2:1 "'When anyone offers an offering of a meal offering to HASHEM, his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil on it, and put frankincense on it. 
verse:2:2 He shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn its memorial on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:2:3 That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a most holy thing of the offerings of HASHEM made by fire.
verse:2:4 "'When you offer an offering of a meal offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil. 
verse:2:5 If your offering is a meal offering of the griddle, it shall be of unleavened fine flour, mixed with oil. 
verse:2:6 You shall cut it in pieces, and pour oil on it. It is a meal offering.
portion:Leviticus 2:7 - 2:16
verse:2:7 If your offering is a meal offering of the pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil. 
verse:2:8 You shall bring the meal offering that is made of these things to HASHEM: and it shall be presented to the priest, and he shall bring it to the altar. 
verse:2:9 The priest shall take from the meal offering its memorial, and shall burn it on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:2:10 That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a thing most holy of the offerings of HASHEM made by fire.
verse:2:11 "'No meal offering, which you shall offer to HASHEM, shall be made with yeast; for you shall burn no yeast, nor any honey, as an offering made by fire to HASHEM. 
verse:2:12 As an offering of firstfruits you shall offer them to HASHEM: but they shall not ascend for a pleasant aroma on the altar. 
verse:2:13 Every offering of your meal offering you shall season with salt; neither shall you allow the salt of the covenant of your God to be lacking from your meal offering. With all your offerings you shall offer salt.
verse:2:14 "'If you offer a meal offering of first fruits to HASHEM, you shall offer for the meal offering of your first fruits grain in the ear parched with fire, bruised grain of the fresh ear. 
verse:2:15 You shall put oil on it, and lay frankincense on it: it is a meal offering. 
verse:2:16 The priest shall burn as its memorial, part of its bruised grain, and part of its oil, along with all its frankincense: it is an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
portion:Leviticus 3:1 - 3:17
verse:3:1 "'If his offering is a sacrifice of peace offerings; if he offers it from the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before HASHEM. 
verse:3:2 He shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron's sons, the priests shall sprinkle the blood around on the altar. 
verse:3:3 He shall offer of the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to HASHEM; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards, 
verse:3:4 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away. 
verse:3:5 Aaron's sons shall burn it on the altar on the burnt offering, which is on the wood that is on the fire: it is an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to HASHEM.
verse:3:6 "'If his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings to HASHEM is from the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish. 
verse:3:7 If he offers a lamb for his offering, then he shall offer it before HASHEM; 
verse:3:8 and he shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it before the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron's sons shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar. 
verse:3:9 He shall offer from the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to HASHEM; its fat, the entire tail fat, he shall take away close to the backbone; and the fat that covers the inwards, and all the fat that is on the inwards, 
verse:3:10 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away. 
verse:3:11 The priest shall burn it on the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire to HASHEM.
verse:3:12 "'If his offering is a goat, then he shall offer it before HASHEM: 
verse:3:13 and he shall lay his hand on its head, and kill it before the Tent of Meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar. 
verse:3:14 He shall offer from it as his offering, an offering made by fire to HASHEM; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards, 
verse:3:15 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away. 
verse:3:16 The priest shall burn them on the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma; all the fat is HASHEM's.
verse:3:17 "'It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings, that you shall eat neither fat nor blood.'"
portion:Leviticus 4:1 - 4:26
verse:4:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:4:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'If anyone sins unintentionally, in any of the things which HASHEM has commanded not to be done, and does any one of them: 
verse:4:3 if the anointed priest sins so as to bring guilt on the people, then let him offer for his sin, which he has sinned, a young bull without blemish to HASHEM for a sin offering. 
verse:4:4 He shall bring the bull to the door of the Tent of Meeting before HASHEM; and he shall lay his hand on the head of the bull, and kill the bull before HASHEM. 
verse:4:5 The anointed priest shall take some of the blood of the bull, and bring it to the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:4:6 The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before HASHEM, before the veil of the sanctuary. 
verse:4:7 The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of sweet incense before HASHEM, which is in the Tent of Meeting; and he shall pour out all of rest of the blood of the bull at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:4:8 He shall take all the fat of the bull of the sin offering off of it; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards, 
verse:4:9 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away, 
verse:4:10 as it is taken off of the bull of the sacrifice of peace offerings. The priest shall burn them on the altar of burnt offering. 
verse:4:11 The bull's skin, all its flesh, with its head, and with its legs, its innards, and its dung, 
verse:4:12 even the whole bull shall he carry forth outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn it on wood with fire. Where the ashes are poured out it shall be burned.
verse:4:13 "'If the whole congregation of Israel sins, and the thing is hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done any of the things which HASHEM has commanded not to be done, and are guilty; 
verse:4:14 when the sin in which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:4:15 The elders of the congregation shall lay their hands on the head of the bull before HASHEM; and the bull shall be killed before HASHEM. 
verse:4:16 The anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bull to the Tent of Meeting: 
verse:4:17 and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before HASHEM, before the veil. 
verse:4:18 He shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar which is before HASHEM, that is in the Tent of Meeting; and the rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:4:19 All its fat he shall take from it, and burn it on the altar. 
verse:4:20 Thus shall he do with the bull; as he did with the bull of the sin offering, so shall he do with this; and the priest shall make atonement for them, and they shall be forgiven. 
verse:4:21 He shall carry forth the bull outside the camp, and burn it as he burned the first bull. It is the sin offering for the assembly.
verse:4:22 "'When a ruler sins, and unwittingly does any one of all the things which HASHEM his God has commanded not to be done, and is guilty; 
verse:4:23 if his sin, in which he has sinned, is made known to him, he shall bring as his offering a goat, a male without blemish. 
verse:4:24 He shall lay his hand on the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before HASHEM. It is a sin offering. 
verse:4:25 The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering. He shall pour out the rest of its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering. 
verse:4:26 All its fat he shall burn on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin, and he will be forgiven.
portion:Leviticus 4:27 - 5:10
verse:4:27 "'If anyone of the common people sins unwittingly, in doing any of the things which HASHEM has commanded not to be done, and is guilty; 
verse:4:28 if his sin, which he has sinned, is made known to him, then he shall bring for his offering a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has sinned. 
verse:4:29 He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill the sin offering in the place of burnt offering. 
verse:4:30 The priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar. 
verse:4:31 All its fat he shall take away, like the fat is taken away from off of the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn it on the altar for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM; and the priest shall make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.
verse:4:32 "'If he brings a lamb as his offering for a sin offering, he shall bring a female without blemish. 
verse:4:33 He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering. 
verse:4:34 The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar. 
verse:4:35 All its fat he shall take away, like the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn them on the altar, on the offerings of HASHEM made by fire; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned, and he will be forgiven.
verse:5:1 "'If anyone sins, in that he hears the voice of adjuration, he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he doesn't report it, then he shall bear his iniquity.
verse:5:2 "'Or if anyone touches any unclean thing, whether it is the carcass of an unclean animal, or the carcass of unclean livestock, or the carcass of unclean creeping things, and it is hidden from him, and he is unclean, then he shall be guilty.
verse:5:3 "'Or if he touches the uncleanness of man, whatever his uncleanness is with which he is unclean, and it is hidden from him; when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty.
verse:5:4 "'Or if anyone swears rashly with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatever it is that a man might utter rashly with an oath, and it is hidden from him; when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty of one of these. 
verse:5:5 It shall be, when he is guilty of one of these, he shall confess that in which he has sinned: 
verse:5:6 and he shall bring his trespass offering to HASHEM for his sin which he has sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin.
verse:5:7 "'If he can't afford a lamb, then he shall bring his trespass offering for that in which he has sinned, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, to HASHEM; one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering. 
verse:5:8 He shall bring them to the priest, who shall first offer the one which is for the sin offering, and wring off its head from its neck, but shall not sever it completely. 
verse:5:9 He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering. 
verse:5:10 He shall offer the second for a burnt offering, according to the ordinance; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin which he has sinned, and he shall be forgiven.
portion:Leviticus 5:11 - 5:26
verse:5:11 "'But if he can't afford two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he shall bring his offering for that in which he has sinned, the tenth part of an efah of fine flour for a sin offering. He shall put no oil on it, neither shall he put any frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering. 
verse:5:12 He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it as the memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, on the offerings of HASHEM made by fire. It is a sin offering. 
verse:5:13 The priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned in any of these things, and he will be forgiven; and the rest shall be the priest's, as the meal offering.'"
verse:5:14 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:5:15 "If anyone commits a trespass, and sins unwittingly, in the holy things of HASHEM; then he shall bring his trespass offering to HASHEM, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering. 
verse:5:16 He shall make restitution for that which he has done wrong in the holy thing, and shall add a fifth part to it, and give it to the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and he will be forgiven.
verse:5:17 "If anyone sins, and does any of the things which HASHEM has commanded not to be done; though he didn't know it, yet he is guilty, and shall bear his iniquity. 
verse:5:18 He shall bring a ram without blemish from of the flock, according to your estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning the thing in which he sinned and didn't know it, and he will be forgiven. 
verse:5:19 It is a trespass offering. He is certainly guilty before HASHEM."
verse:5:20 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:5:21 "If anyone sins, and commits a trespass against HASHEM, and deals falsely with his neighbor in a matter of deposit, or of bargain, or of robbery, or has oppressed his neighbor, 
verse:5:22 or has found that which was lost, and dealt falsely therein, and swearing to a lie; in any of all these things that a man does, sinning therein; 
verse:5:23 then it shall be, if he has sinned, and is guilty, he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing which he has gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was committed to him, or the lost thing which he found, 
verse:5:24 or any thing about which he has sworn falsely; he shall restore it even in full, and shall add a fifth part more to it. To him to whom it belongs he shall give it, in the day of his being found guilty. 
verse:5:25 He shall bring his trespass offering to HASHEM, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest. 
verse:5:26 The priest shall make atonement for him before HASHEM, and he will be forgiven concerning whatever he does to become guilty."
portion:Leviticus 5:24 - 5:26
verse:5:24 or any thing about which he has sworn falsely; he shall restore it even in full, and shall add a fifth part more to it. To him to whom it belongs he shall give it, in the day of his being found guilty. 
verse:5:25 He shall bring his trespass offering to HASHEM, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest. 
verse:5:26 The priest shall make atonement for him before HASHEM, and he will be forgiven concerning whatever he does to become guilty."
portion:Leviticus 6:1 - 6:11
verse:6:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:6:2 "Command Aaron and his sons, saying, 'This is the law of the burnt offering: the burnt offering shall be on the hearth on the altar all night until the morning; and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it. 
verse:6:3 The priest shall put on his linen garment, and he shall put on his linen breeches upon his body; and he shall remove the ashes from where the fire has consumed the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar. 
verse:6:4 He shall take off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place. 
verse:6:5 The fire on the altar shall be kept burning on it, it shall not go out; and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning: and he shall lay the burnt offering in order upon it, and shall burn on it the fat of the peace offerings. 
verse:6:6 Fire shall be kept burning on the altar continually; it shall not go out.
verse:6:7 "'This is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before HASHEM, before the altar. 
verse:6:8 He shall take from there his handful of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense which is on the meal offering, and shall burn it on the altar for a pleasant aroma, as its memorial, to HASHEM. 
verse:6:9 That which is left of it Aaron and his sons shall eat. It shall be eaten without yeast in a holy place. They shall eat it in the court of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:6:10 It shall not be baked with yeast. I have given it as their portion of my offerings made by fire. It is most holy, as the sin offering, and as the trespass offering. 
verse:6:11 Every male among the children of Aaron shall eat of it, as their portion forever throughout your generations, from the offerings of HASHEM made by fire. Whoever touches them shall be holy.'"
portion:Leviticus 6:12 - 7:10
verse:6:12 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying,
