verse:2:23 and the Avvim, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and lived in their place.)
verse:2:24 "Rise up, take your journey, and pass over the valley of the Arnon: behold, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land; begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle. 
verse:2:25 This day will I begin to put the dread of you and the fear of you on the peoples who are under the whole sky, who shall hear the report of you, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of you."
verse:2:26 I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying, 
verse:2:27 "Let me pass through your land: I will go along by the highway, I will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left. 
verse:2:28 You shall sell me food for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only let me pass through on my feet, 
verse:2:29 as the children of Esau who dwell in Seir, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar, did to me; until I shall pass over the Jordan into the land which HASHEM our God gives us." 
verse:2:30 But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him; for HASHEM your God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into your hand, as at this day.
portion:Deuteronomy 2:31 - 3:14
verse:2:31 HASHEM said to me, "Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before you: begin to possess, that you may inherit his land." 
verse:2:32 Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Jahaz. 
verse:2:33 HASHEM our God delivered him up before us; and we struck him, and his sons, and all his people. 
verse:2:34 We took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones; we left none remaining: 
verse:2:35 only the livestock we took for a prey to ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we had taken. 
verse:2:36 From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the valley, even to Gilead, there was not a city too high for us; HASHEM our God delivered up all before us: 
verse:2:37 only to the land of the children of Ammon you didn't come near; all the side of the river Jabbok, and the cities of the hill country, and wherever HASHEM our God forbade us.
verse:3:1 Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei. 
verse:3:2 HASHEM said to me, "Don't fear him; for I have delivered him, and all his people, and his land, into your hand; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon."
verse:3:3 So HASHEM our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we struck him until none was left to him remaining. 
verse:3:4 We took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we didn't take from them; sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan. 
verse:3:5 All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars; besides the unwalled towns a great many. 
verse:3:6 We utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones. 
verse:3:7 But all the livestock, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves. 
verse:3:8 We took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon. 
verse:3:9 (The Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir.) 
verse:3:10 We took all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, to Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan. 
verse:3:11 (For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Rephaim; behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; isn't it in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? nine cubits was its length, and four cubits its breadth, after the cubit of a man.) 
verse:3:12 This land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead, and its cities, gave I to the Reubenites and to the Gadites: 
verse:3:13 and the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, gave I to the half-tribe of Manasseh; all the region of Argob, even all Bashan. (The same is called the land of Rephaim. 
verse:3:14 Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and called them, even Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth Jair, to this day.)
portion:Deuteronomy 3:15 - 3:22
verse:3:15 I gave Gilead to Machir. 
verse:3:16 To the Reubenites and to the Gadites I gave from Gilead even to the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the valley, and its border, even to the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon; 
verse:3:17 the Arabah also, and the Jordan and its border, from Chinnereth even to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.
verse:3:18 I commanded you at that time, saying, "HASHEM your God has given you this land to possess it: you shall pass over armed before your brothers the children of Israel, all the men of valor. 
verse:3:19 But your wives, and your little ones, and your livestock, (I know that you have much livestock), shall live in your cities which I have given you, 
verse:3:20 until HASHEM gives rest to your brothers, as to you, and they also possess the land which HASHEM your God gives them beyond the Jordan: then you shall return every man to his possession, which I have given you."
verse:3:21 I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, "Your eyes have seen all that HASHEM your God has done to these two kings: so shall HASHEM do to all the kingdoms where you go over. 
verse:3:22 You shall not fear them; for HASHEM your God, he it is who fights for you."
portion:Deuteronomy 3:20 - 3:22
verse:3:20 until HASHEM gives rest to your brothers, as to you, and they also possess the land which HASHEM your God gives them beyond the Jordan: then you shall return every man to his possession, which I have given you."
verse:3:21 I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, "Your eyes have seen all that HASHEM your God has done to these two kings: so shall HASHEM do to all the kingdoms where you go over. 
verse:3:22 You shall not fear them; for HASHEM your God, he it is who fights for you."
portion:Deuteronomy 3:23 - 4:4
verse:3:23 I begged HASHEM at that time, saying, 
verse:3:24 "My Lord HASHEM, you have begun to show your servant your greatness, and your strong hand: for what god is there in heaven or in earth, that can do according to your works, and according to your mighty acts? 
verse:3:25 Please let me go over and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon."
verse:3:26 But HASHEM was angry with me for your sakes, and didn't listen to me; and HASHEM said to me, "Let it suffice you; speak no more to me of this matter. 
verse:3:27 Go up to the top of Pisgah, and lift up your eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and see with your eyes: for you shall not go over this Jordan. 
verse:3:28 But commission Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him; for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which you shall see." 
verse:3:29 So we stayed in the valley over against Beth Peor.
verse:4:1 Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances, which I teach you, to do them; that you may live, and go in and possess the land which HASHEM, the God of your fathers, gives you. 
verse:4:2 You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you diminish from it, that you may keep the commandments of HASHEM your God which I command you. 
verse:4:3 Your eyes have seen what HASHEM did because of Baal Peor; for all the men who followed Baal Peor, HASHEM your God has destroyed them from the midst of you. 
verse:4:4 But you who were faithful to HASHEM your God are all alive this day.
portion:Deuteronomy 4:5 - 4:40
verse:4:5 Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as HASHEM my God commanded me, that you should do so in the midst of the land where you go in to possess it. 
verse:4:6 Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who shall hear all these statutes, and say, "Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people." 
verse:4:7 For what great nation is there, that has a god so near to them, as HASHEM our God is whenever we call on him? 
verse:4:8 What great nation is there, that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?
verse:4:9 Only take heed to yourself, and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things which your eyes saw, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life; but make them known to your children and your children's children; 
verse:4:10 the day that you stood before HASHEM your God in Horeb, when HASHEM said to me, "Assemble me the people, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children." 
verse:4:11 You came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire to the heart of the sky, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness. 
verse:4:12 HASHEM spoke to you out of the midst of the fire: you heard the voice of words, but you saw no form; you only heard a voice. 
verse:4:13 He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments; and he wrote them on two tables of stone. 
verse:4:14 HASHEM commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it. 
verse:4:15 Take therefore good heed to yourselves; for you saw no kind of form on the day that HASHEM spoke to you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire. 
verse:4:16 Lest you corrupt yourselves, and make yourself an engraved image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female, 
verse:4:17 the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky, 
verse:4:18 the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth; 
verse:4:19 and lest you lift up your eyes to the sky, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the army of the sky, you are drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which HASHEM your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole sky. 
verse:4:20 But HASHEM has taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as at this day. 
verse:4:21 Furthermore HASHEM was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in to that good land, which HASHEM your God gives you for an inheritance: 
verse:4:22 but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but you shall go over, and possess that good land. 
verse:4:23 Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of HASHEM your God, which he made with you, and make you an engraved image in the form of anything which HASHEM your God has forbidden you. 
verse:4:24 For HASHEM your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God. 
verse:4:25 When you shall father children, and children's children, and you shall have been long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make an engraved image in the form of anything, and shall do that which is evil in the sight of HASHEM your God, to provoke him to anger; 
verse:4:26 I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that you shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto you go over the Jordan to possess it; you shall not prolong your days on it, but shall utterly be destroyed. 
verse:4:27 HASHEM will scatter you among the peoples, and you shall be left few in number among the nations, where HASHEM shall lead you away. 
verse:4:28 There you shall serve gods, the work of men's hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell. 
verse:4:29 But from there you shall seek HASHEM your God, and you shall find him, when you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul. 
verse:4:30 When you are in oppression, and all these things have come on you, in the latter days you shall return to HASHEM your God, and listen to his voice: 
verse:4:31 for HASHEM your God is a merciful God; he will not fail you, neither destroy you, nor forget the covenant of your fathers which he swore to them. 
verse:4:32 For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and from the one end of the sky to the other, whether there has been anything as this great thing is, or has been heard like it? 
verse:4:33 Did a people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and live? 
verse:4:34 Or has God tried to go and take a nation for himself from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that HASHEM your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes? 
verse:4:35 It was shown to you so that you might know that HASHEM is God. There is no one else besides him. 
verse:4:36 Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you: and on earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire. 
verse:4:37 Because he loved your fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought you out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt; 
verse:4:38 to drive out nations from before you greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as at this day. 
verse:4:39 Know therefore this day, and lay it to your heart, that HASHEM he is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is none else. 
verse:4:40 You shall keep his statutes, and his commandments, which I command you this day, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land, which HASHEM your God gives you, forever.
portion:Deuteronomy 4:41 - 4:49
verse:4:41 Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise; 
verse:4:42 that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unawares, and didn't hate him in time past; and that fleeing to one of these cities he might live: 
verse:4:43 Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites. 
verse:4:44 This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel: 
verse:4:45 these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Moses spoke to the children of Israel, when they came forth out of Egypt, 
verse:4:46 beyond the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck, when they came forth out of Egypt. 
verse:4:47 They took his land in possession, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise; 
verse:4:48 from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even to Mount Sion (the same is Hermon), 
verse:4:49 and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
portion:Deuteronomy 5:1 - 5:18
verse:5:1 Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, Hear, Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears this day, that you may learn them, and observe to do them. 
verse:5:2 HASHEM our God made a covenant with us in Horeb. 
verse:5:3 HASHEM didn't make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day. 
verse:5:4 HASHEM spoke with you face to face on the mountain out of the midst of the fire, 
verse:5:5 (I stood between HASHEM and you at that time, to show you the word of HASHEM: for you were afraid because of the fire, and didn't go up onto the mountain;) saying, 
verse:5:6 "I am HASHEM your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verse:5:7 "You shall have no other gods before me.
verse:5:8 "You shall not make an engraved image for yourself, any likeness of what is in heaven above, or what is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth: 
verse:5:9 you shall not bow down yourself to them, nor serve them; for I, HASHEM, your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the third and on the fourth generation of those who hate me; 
verse:5:10 and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
verse:5:11 "You shall not take the name of HASHEM your God in vain: for HASHEM will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.
verse:5:12 "Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as HASHEM your God commanded you. 
verse:5:13 You shall labor six days, and do all your work; 
verse:5:14 but the seventh day is a Sabbath to HASHEM your God, in which you shall not do any work, you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates; that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you. 
verse:5:15 You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and HASHEM your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore HASHEM your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
verse:5:16 "Honor your father and your mother, as HASHEM your God commanded you; that your days may be long, and that it may go well with you, in the land which HASHEM your God gives you.
verse:5:17 "You shall not murder. Neither shall you commit adultery. Neither shall you steal. Neither shall you give false testimony against your neighbor.
verse:5:18 "Neither shall you covet your neighbor's wife; neither shall you desire your neighbor's house, his field, or his male servant, or his female servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor's."
portion:Deuteronomy 5:19 - 6:3
verse:5:19 These words HASHEM spoke to all your assembly on the mountain out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. He wrote them on two tables of stone, and gave them to me. 
verse:5:20 It happened, when you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that you came near to me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders; 
verse:5:21 and you said, "Behold, HASHEM our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that God does speak with man, and he lives. 
verse:5:22 Now therefore why should we die? For this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of HASHEM our God any more, then we shall die. 
verse:5:23 For who is there of all flesh, that has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived? 
verse:5:24 Go near, and hear all that HASHEM our God shall say: and tell us all that HASHEM our God shall tell you; and we will hear it, and do it."
verse:5:25 HASHEM heard the voice of your words, when you spoke to me; and HASHEM said to me, "I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken to you: they have well said all that they have spoken. 
verse:5:26 Oh that there were such a heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them, and with their children forever!
verse:5:27 "Go tell them, Return to your tents. 
verse:5:28 But as for you, stand here by me, and I will tell you all the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which you shall teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it."
verse:5:29 You shall observe to do therefore as HASHEM your God has commanded you: you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left. 
verse:5:30 You shall walk in all the way which HASHEM your God has commanded you, that you may live, and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.
verse:6:1 Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which HASHEM your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it; 
verse:6:2 that you might fear HASHEM your God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command you, you, and your son, and your son's son, all the days of your life; and that your days may be prolonged. 
verse:6:3 Hear therefore, Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with you, and that you may increase mightily, as HASHEM, the God of your fathers, has promised to you, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
portion:Deuteronomy 6:4 - 6:25
verse:6:4 Hear, Israel: HASHEM is our God; HASHEM is one: 
verse:6:5 and you shall love HASHEM your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your might. 
verse:6:6 These words, which I command you this day, shall be on your heart; 
verse:6:7 and you shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up. 
verse:6:8 You shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for symbols between your eyes. 
verse:6:9 You shall write them on the door posts of your house, and on your gates. 
verse:6:10 It shall be, when HASHEM your God shall bring you into the land which he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give you, great and goodly cities, which you didn't build, 
verse:6:11 and houses full of all good things, which you didn't fill, and cisterns dug out, which you didn't dig, vineyards and olive trees, which you didn't plant, and you shall eat and be full; 
verse:6:12 then beware lest you forget HASHEM, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage. 
verse:6:13 You shall fear HASHEM your God; and you shall serve him, and shall swear by his name. 
verse:6:14 You shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples who are around you; 
verse:6:15 for HASHEM your God in the midst of you is a jealous God; lest the anger of HASHEM your God be kindled against you, and he destroy you from off the face of the earth. 
verse:6:16 You shall not tempt HASHEM your God, as you tempted him in Massah. 
verse:6:17 You shall diligently keep the commandments of HASHEM your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he has commanded you. 
verse:6:18 You shall do that which is right and good in the sight of HASHEM; that it may be well with you, and that you may go in and possess the good land which HASHEM swore to your fathers, 
verse:6:19 to thrust out all your enemies from before you, as HASHEM has spoken.
verse:6:20 When your son asks you in time to come, saying, "What do the testimonies, the statutes, and the ordinances, which HASHEM our God has commanded you mean?" 
verse:6:21 then you shall tell your son, "We were Pharaoh's bondservants in Egypt: and HASHEM brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand; 
verse:6:22 and HASHEM showed great and awesome signs and wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his house, before our eyes; 
verse:6:23 and he brought us out from there, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he swore to our fathers. 
verse:6:24 HASHEM commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear HASHEM our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as at this day. 
verse:6:25 It shall be righteousness to us, if we observe to do all this commandment before HASHEM our God, as he has commanded us."
portion:Deuteronomy 7:1 - 7:11
verse:7:1 When HASHEM your God shall bring you into the land where you go to possess it, and shall cast out many nations before you, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than you; 
verse:7:2 and when HASHEM your God shall deliver them up before you, and you shall strike them; then you shall utterly destroy them: you shall make no covenant with them, nor show mercy to them; 
verse:7:3 neither shall you make marriages with them; your daughter you shall not give to his son, nor shall you take his daughter for your son. 
verse:7:4 For he will turn away your son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so the anger of HASHEM would be kindled against you, and he would destroy you quickly. 
verse:7:5 But you shall deal with them like this: you shall break down their altars, and dash their pillars in pieces, and cut down their Asherim, and burn their engraved images with fire. 
verse:7:6 For you are a holy people to HASHEM your God: HASHEM your God has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth. 
verse:7:7 HASHEM didn't set his love on you, nor choose you, because you were more in number than any people; for you were the fewest of all peoples: 
verse:7:8 but because HASHEM loves you, and because he would keep the oath which he swore to your fathers, has HASHEM brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt. 
verse:7:9 Know therefore that HASHEM your God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with them who love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations, 
verse:7:10 and repays those who hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him who hates him, he will repay him to his face. 
verse:7:11 You shall therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command you this day, to do them.
portion:Deuteronomy 7:9 - 7:11
verse:7:9 Know therefore that HASHEM your God, he is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness with them who love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations, 
verse:7:10 and repays those who hate him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him who hates him, he will repay him to his face. 
verse:7:11 You shall therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command you this day, to do them.
portion:Deuteronomy 7:12 - 8:10
verse:7:12 It shall happen, because you listen to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that HASHEM your God will keep with you the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to your fathers: 
verse:7:13 and he will love you, and bless you, and multiply you; he will also bless the fruit of your body and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your new wine and your oil, the increase of your livestock and the young of your flock, in the land which he swore to your fathers to give you. 
verse:7:14 You shall be blessed above all peoples: there shall not be male or female barren among you, or among your livestock. 
verse:7:15 HASHEM will take away from you all sickness; and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you know, he will put on you, but will lay them on all those who hate you. 
verse:7:16 You shall consume all the peoples whom HASHEM your God shall deliver to you; your eye shall not pity them: neither shall you serve their gods; for that will be a snare to you. 
verse:7:17 If you shall say in your heart, "These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?" 
verse:7:18 you shall not be afraid of them: you shall well remember what HASHEM your God did to Pharaoh, and to all Egypt; 
verse:7:19 the great trials which your eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, by which HASHEM your God brought you out: so shall HASHEM your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid. 
verse:7:20 Moreover HASHEM your God will send the hornet among them, until those who are left, and hide themselves, perish from before you. 
verse:7:21 You shall not be scared of them; for HASHEM your God is in the midst of you, a great and awesome God. 
verse:7:22 HASHEM your God will cast out those nations before you by little and little: you may not consume them at once, lest the animals of the field increase on you. 
verse:7:23 But HASHEM your God will deliver them up before you, and will confuse them with a great confusion, until they be destroyed. 
verse:7:24 He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall make their name to perish from under the sky: no man shall be able to stand before you, until you have destroyed them. 
verse:7:25 You shall burn the engraved images of their gods with fire. You shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it for yourself, lest you be snared in it; for it is an abomination to HASHEM your God. 
verse:7:26 You shall not bring an abomination into your house, and become a devoted thing like it. You shall utterly detest it, and you shall utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.
verse:8:1 You shall observe to do all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which HASHEM swore to your fathers. 
verse:8:2 You shall remember all the way which HASHEM your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, to prove you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments, or not. 
verse:8:3 He humbled you, and allowed you to be hungry, and fed you with manna, which you didn't know, neither did your fathers know; that he might make you know that man does not live by bread only, but man lives by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of HASHEM. 
verse:8:4 Your clothing didn't grow old on you, neither did your foot swell, these forty years. 
verse:8:5 You shall consider in your heart that as a man chastens his son, so HASHEM your God chastens you. 
verse:8:6 You shall keep the commandments of HASHEM your God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him. 
verse:8:7 For HASHEM your God brings you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of springs, and underground water flowing into valleys and hills; 
verse:8:8 a land of wheat and barley, and vines and fig trees and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey; 
verse:8:9 a land in which you shall eat bread without scarceness, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper. 
verse:8:10 You shall eat and be full, and you shall bless HASHEM your God for the good land which he has given you.
portion:Deuteronomy 8:11 - 9:3
verse:8:11 Beware lest you forget HASHEM your God, in not keeping his commandments, and his ordinances, and his statutes, which I command you this day: 
verse:8:12 lest, when you have eaten and are full, and have built goodly houses, and lived therein; 
verse:8:13 and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold is multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied; 
verse:8:14 then your heart be lifted up, and you forget HASHEM your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage; 
verse:8:15 who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with fiery serpents and scorpions, and thirsty ground where there was no water; who brought you forth water out of the rock of flint; 
verse:8:16 who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers didn't know; that he might humble you, and that he might prove you, to do you good at your latter end: 
verse:8:17 and lest you say in your heart, "My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth." 
verse:8:18 But you shall remember HASHEM your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth; that he may establish his covenant which he swore to your fathers, as at this day.
verse:8:19 It shall be, if you shall forget HASHEM your God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify against you this day that you shall surely perish. 
verse:8:20 As the nations that HASHEM makes to perish before you, so you shall perish; because you wouldn't listen to the voice of HASHEM your God.
verse:9:1 Hear, Israel: you are to pass over the Jordan this day, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky, 
verse:9:2 a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard say, "Who can stand before the sons of Anak?" 
verse:9:3 Know therefore this day, that HASHEM your God is he who goes over before you as a devouring fire; he will destroy them, and he will bring them down before you: so you shall drive them out, and make them to perish quickly, as HASHEM has spoken to you.
portion:Deuteronomy 9:4 - 9:29
verse:9:4 Don't say in your heart, after HASHEM your God has thrust them out from before you, saying, "For my righteousness HASHEM has brought me in to possess this land;" because HASHEM drives them out before you because of the wickedness of these nations. 
verse:9:5 Not for your righteousness, or for the uprightness of your heart, do you go in to possess their land; but for the wickedness of these nations HASHEM your God does drive them out from before you, and that he may establish the word which HASHEM swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob. 
verse:9:6 Know therefore, that HASHEM your God doesn't give you this good land to possess it for your righteousness; for you are a stiff-necked people. 
verse:9:7 Remember, don't forget, how you provoked HASHEM your God to wrath in the wilderness: from the day that you went forth out of the land of Egypt, until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against HASHEM. 
verse:9:8 Also in Horeb you provoked HASHEM to wrath, and HASHEM was angry with you to destroy you. 
verse:9:9 When I was gone up onto the mountain to receive the tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant which HASHEM made with you, then I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water. 
verse:9:10 HASHEM delivered to me the two tables of stone written with the finger of God; and on them were all the words which HASHEM spoke with you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.
verse:9:11 It came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that HASHEM gave me the two tables of stone, even the tables of the covenant. 
verse:9:12 HASHEM said to me, "Arise, get down quickly from here; for your people whom you have brought out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they have quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image."
verse:9:13 Furthermore HASHEM spoke to me, saying, "I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people: 
verse:9:14 let me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under the sky; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they."
verse:9:15 So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands. 
verse:9:16 I looked, and behold, you had sinned against HASHEM your God; you had made yourselves a molten calf: you had turned aside quickly out of the way which HASHEM had commanded you. 
verse:9:17 I took hold of the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and broke them before your eyes. 
verse:9:18 I fell down before HASHEM, as at the first, forty days and forty nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water; because of all your sin which you sinned, in doing that which was evil in the sight of HASHEM, to provoke him to anger. 
verse:9:19 For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, with which HASHEM was angry against you to destroy you. But HASHEM listened to me that time also. 
verse:9:20 HASHEM was very angry with Aaron to destroy him: and I prayed for Aaron also at the same time. 
verse:9:21 I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust: and I cast its dust into the brook that descended out of the mountain. 
verse:9:22 At Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth Hattaavah, you provoked HASHEM to wrath. 
verse:9:23 When HASHEM sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, "Go up and possess the land which I have given you;" then you rebelled against the commandment of HASHEM your God, and you didn't believe him, nor listen to his voice. 
verse:9:24 You have been rebellious against HASHEM from the day that I knew you. 
verse:9:25 So I fell down before HASHEM the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because HASHEM had said he would destroy you. 
verse:9:26 I prayed to HASHEM, and said, "HASHEM GOD, don't destroy your people and your inheritance, that you have redeemed through your greatness, that you have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand. 
verse:9:27 Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; don't look to the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin, 
verse:9:28 lest the land you brought us out from say, 'Because HASHEM was not able to bring them into the land which he promised to them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.' 
verse:9:29 Yet they are your people and your inheritance, which you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm."
portion:Deuteronomy 10:1 - 10:11
verse:10:1 At that time HASHEM said to me, "Cut two tables of stone like the first, and come up to me onto the mountain, and make an ark of wood. 
verse:10:2 I will write on the tables the words that were on the first tables which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark." 
verse:10:3 So I made an ark of acacia wood, and cut two tables of stone like the first, and went up onto the mountain, having the two tables in my hand. 
verse:10:4 He wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which HASHEM spoke to you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and HASHEM gave them to me. 
verse:10:5 I turned and came down from the mountain, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they are as HASHEM commanded me. 
verse:10:6 (The children of Israel traveled from Beeroth Bene Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest's office in his place. 
verse:10:7 From there they traveled to Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of brooks of water. 
verse:10:8 At that time HASHEM set apart the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, to stand before HASHEM to minister to him, and to bless in his name, to this day. 
verse:10:9 Therefore Levi has no portion nor inheritance with his brothers; HASHEM is his inheritance, according as HASHEM your God spoke to him.) 
verse:10:10 I stayed on the mountain, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights: and HASHEM listened to me that time also; HASHEM would not destroy you. 
verse:10:11 HASHEM said to me, "Arise, take your journey before the people; and they shall go in and possess the land, which I swore to their fathers to give to them."
portion:Deuteronomy 10:12 - 11:9
verse:10:12 Now, Israel, what does HASHEM your God require of you, but to fear HASHEM your God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve HASHEM your God with all your heart and with all your soul, 
verse:10:13 to keep the commandments of HASHEM, and his statutes, which I command you this day for your good? 
verse:10:14 Behold, to HASHEM your God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is therein. 
verse:10:15 Only HASHEM had a delight in your fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all peoples, as at this day. 
verse:10:16 Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiff-necked. 
verse:10:17 For HASHEM your God, he is God of gods, and Lord of lords, the great God, the mighty, and the awesome, who doesn't respect persons, nor takes reward. 
verse:10:18 He does execute justice for the fatherless and widow, and loves the foreigner, in giving him food and clothing. 
verse:10:19 Therefore love the foreigner; for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt. 
verse:10:20 You shall fear HASHEM your God; you shall serve him; and you shall cling to him, and you shall swear by his name. 
verse:10:21 He is your praise, and he is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome things, which your eyes have seen. 
verse:10:22 Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons; and now HASHEM your God has made you as the stars of the sky for multitude.
verse:11:1 Therefore you shall love HASHEM your God, and keep his instructions, and his statutes, and his ordinances, and his commandments, always. 
verse:11:2 Know this day: for I don't speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of HASHEM your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his outstretched arm, 
verse:11:3 and his signs, and his works, which he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and to all his land; 
verse:11:4 and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Sea of Suf to overflow them as they pursued after you, and how HASHEM has destroyed them to this day; 
verse:11:5 and what he did to you in the wilderness, until you came to this place; 
verse:11:6 and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben; how the earth opened its mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel: 
verse:11:7 but your eyes have seen all the great work of HASHEM which he did. 
verse:11:8 Therefore you shall keep all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land, where you go over to possess it; 
verse:11:9 and that you may prolong your days in the land, which HASHEM swore to your fathers to give to them and to their seed, a land flowing with milk and honey. 
portion:Deuteronomy 11:10 - 11:21
verse:11:10 For the land, where you go in to possess it, isn't as the land of Egypt, that you came out from, where you sowed your seed, and watered it with your foot, as a garden of herbs; 
verse:11:11 but the land, where you go over to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys which drinks water of the rain of the sky, 
verse:11:12 a land which HASHEM your God cares for: the eyes of HASHEM your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year. 
verse:11:13 It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to my commandments which I command you this day, to love HASHEM your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul, 
verse:11:14 that I will give the rain of your land in its season, the former rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain, and your new wine, and your oil. 
verse:11:15 I will give grass in your fields for your livestock, and you shall eat and be full. 
verse:11:16 Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them; 
verse:11:17 and the anger of HASHEM be kindled against you, and he shut up the sky, so that there shall be no rain, and the land shall not yield its fruit; and you perish quickly from off the good land which HASHEM gives you. 
verse:11:18 Therefore you shall lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul; and you shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for symbols between your eyes. 
verse:11:19 You shall teach them your children, talking of them, when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up. 
verse:11:20 You shall write them on the door posts of your house, and on your gates; 
verse:11:21 that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which HASHEM swore to your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.
portion:Deuteronomy 11:22 - 11:25
verse:11:22 For if you shall diligently keep all this commandment which I command you, to do it, to love HASHEM your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cling to him; 
verse:11:23 then will HASHEM drive out all these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourselves. 
verse:11:24 Every place whereon the sole of your foot shall tread shall be yours: from the wilderness, and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even to the hinder sea shall be your border. 
verse:11:25 No man shall be able to stand before you: HASHEM your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land that you shall tread on, as he has spoken to you.
portion:Deuteronomy 11:26 - 12:10
verse:11:26 Behold, I set before you this day a blessing and a curse: 
verse:11:27 the blessing, if you shall listen to the commandments of HASHEM your God, which I command you this day; 
verse:11:28 and the curse, if you shall not listen to the commandments of HASHEM your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you this day, to go after other gods, which you have not known. 
verse:11:29 It shall happen, when HASHEM your God shall bring you into the land where you go to possess it, that you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim, and the curse on Mount Ebal. 
verse:11:30 Aren't they beyond the Jordan, behind the way of the going down of the sun, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah, over against Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh? 
verse:11:31 For you are to pass over the Jordan to go in to possess the land which HASHEM your God gives you, and you shall possess it, and dwell therein. 
verse:11:32 You shall observe to do all the statutes and the ordinances which I set before you this day.
verse:12:1 These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which HASHEM, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess it, all the days that you live on the earth. 
verse:12:2 You shall surely destroy all the places in which the nations that you shall dispossess served their gods, on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every green tree: 
verse:12:3 and you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and burn their Asherim with fire; and you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods; and you shall destroy their name out of that place. 
verse:12:4 You shall not do so to HASHEM your God. 
verse:12:5 But to the place which HASHEM your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, even to his habitation you shall seek, and there you shall come; 
verse:12:6 and there you shall bring your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and the wave offering of your hand, and your vows, and your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock: 
verse:12:7 and there you shall eat before HASHEM your God, and you shall rejoice in all that you put your hand to, you and your households, in which HASHEM your God has blessed you. 
verse:12:8 You shall not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatever is right in his own eyes; 
verse:12:9 for you haven't yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which HASHEM your God gives you. 
verse:12:10 But when you go over the Jordan, and dwell in the land which HASHEM your God causes you to inherit, and he gives you rest from all your enemies around you, so that you dwell in safety;
portion:Deuteronomy 12:11 - 12:28
verse:12:11 then it shall happen that to the place which HASHEM your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, there you shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, and the wave offering of your hand, and all your choice vows which you vow to HASHEM. 
verse:12:12 You shall rejoice before HASHEM your God, you, and your sons, and your daughters, and your male servants, and your female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you. 
verse:12:13 Take heed to yourself that you don't offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see; 
verse:12:14 but in the place which HASHEM shall choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I command you. 
verse:12:15 Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat flesh within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to the blessing of HASHEM your God which he has given you: the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle, and as of the hart. 
verse:12:16 Only you shall not eat the blood; you shall pour it out on the earth as water. 
verse:12:17 You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your new wine, or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, nor any of your vows which you vow, nor your freewill offerings, nor the wave offering of your hand; 
verse:12:18 but you shall eat them before HASHEM your God in the place which HASHEM your God shall choose, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates: and you shall rejoice before HASHEM your God in all that you put your hand to. 
verse:12:19 Take heed to yourself that you don't forsake the Levite as long as you live in your land.
verse:12:20 When HASHEM your God shall enlarge your border, as he has promised you, and you shall say, "I want to eat meat," because your soul desires to eat meat; you may eat meat, after all the desire of your soul. 
verse:12:21 If the place which HASHEM your God shall choose, to put his name there, is too far from you, then you shall kill of your herd and of your flock, which HASHEM has given you, as I have commanded you; and you may eat within your gates, after all the desire of your soul. 
verse:12:22 Even as the gazelle and as the hart is eaten, so you shall eat of it: the unclean and the clean may eat of it alike. 
verse:12:23 Only be sure that you don't eat the blood: for the blood is the life; and you shall not eat the life with the flesh. 
verse:12:24 You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the earth as water. 
verse:12:25 You shall not eat it; that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, when you shall do that which is right in the eyes of HASHEM. 
verse:12:26 Only your holy things which you have, and your vows, you shall take, and go to the place which HASHEM shall choose: 
verse:12:27 and you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, on the altar of HASHEM your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of HASHEM your God; and you shall eat the flesh. 
verse:12:28 Observe and hear all these words which I command you, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and right in the eyes of HASHEM your God.
portion:Deuteronomy 12:29 - 13:19
verse:12:29 When HASHEM your God shall cut off the nations from before you, where you go in to dispossess them, and you dispossess them, and dwell in their land; 
verse:12:30 take heed to yourself that you not be ensnared to follow them, after that they are destroyed from before you; and that you not inquire after their gods, saying, "How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise." 
verse:12:31 You shall not do so to HASHEM your God: for every abomination to HASHEM, which he hates, have they done to their gods; for even their sons and their daughters do they burn in the fire to their gods. 
verse:13:1 Whatever thing I command you, that you shall observe to do: you shall not add thereto, nor diminish from it.
verse:13:2 If there arise in the midst of you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and he give you a sign or a wonder, 
verse:13:3 and the sign or the wonder come to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, "Let us go after other gods" (which you have not known) "and let us serve them;" 
verse:13:4 you shall not listen to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams: for HASHEM your God proves you, to know whether you love HASHEM your God with all your heart and with all your soul. 
verse:13:5 You shall walk after HASHEM your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and you shall serve him, and cling to him. 
verse:13:6 That prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against HASHEM your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to draw you aside out of the way which HASHEM your God commanded you to walk in. So you shall put away the evil from the midst of you.
verse:13:7 If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend, who is as your own soul, entice you secretly, saying, "Let us go and serve other gods," which you have not known, you, nor your fathers; 
verse:13:8 of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near to you, or far off from you, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth; 
verse:13:9 you shall not consent to him, nor listen to him; neither shall your eye pity him, neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him: 
verse:13:10 but you shall surely kill him; your hand shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people. 
verse:13:11 You shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw you away from HASHEM your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage. 
verse:13:12 All Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall not do any more such wickedness as this is in the midst of you.
verse:13:13 If you shall hear tell concerning one of your cities, which HASHEM your God gives you to dwell there, saying, 
verse:13:14 Certain base fellows are gone out from the midst of you, and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, "Let us go and serve other gods," which you have not known; 
verse:13:15 then you shall inquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in the midst of you, 
verse:13:16 you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword. 
verse:13:17 You shall gather all its spoil into the midst of its street, and shall burn with fire the city, and all its spoil every whit, to HASHEM your God: and it shall be a heap forever; it shall not be built again. 
verse:13:18 Nothing of the devoted thing shall cling to your hand; that HASHEM may turn from the fierceness of his anger, and show you mercy, and have compassion on you, and multiply you, as he has sworn to your fathers; 
verse:13:19 when you shall listen to the voice of HASHEM your God, to keep all his commandments which I command you this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of HASHEM your God.
portion:Deuteronomy 14:1 - 14:21
verse:14:1 You are the children of HASHEM your God: you shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead. 
verse:14:2 For you are a holy people to HASHEM your God, and HASHEM has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth. 
verse:14:3 You shall not eat any abominable thing. 
verse:14:4 These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat, 
verse:14:5 the hart, and the gazelle, and the roebuck, and the wild goat, and the ibex, and the antelope, and the chamois. 
verse:14:6 Every animal that parts the hoof, and has the hoof cloven in two and chews the cud, among the animals, that may you eat. 
verse:14:7 Nevertheless these you shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of those who have the hoof cloven: the camel, and the hare, and the rabbit; because they chew the cud but don't part the hoof, they are unclean to you. 
verse:14:8 The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn't chew the cud, is unclean to you: of their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch. 
verse:14:9 These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales may you eat; 
verse:14:10 and whatever doesn't have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean to you. 
verse:14:11 Of all clean birds you may eat. 
verse:14:12 But these are they of which you shall not eat: the eagle, and the vulture, and the osprey, 
verse:14:13 and the red kite, and the falcon, and the kite after its kind, 
verse:14:14 and every raven after its kind, 
verse:14:15 and the ostrich, and the owl, and the seagull, and the hawk after its kind, 
verse:14:16 the little owl, and the great owl, and the horned owl, 
verse:14:17 and the pelican, and the vulture, and the cormorant, 
verse:14:18 and the stork, and the heron after its kind, and the hoopoe, and the bat. 
verse:14:19 All winged creeping things are unclean to you: they shall not be eaten. 
verse:14:20 Of all clean birds you may eat. 
verse:14:21 You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself: you may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner: for you are a holy people to HASHEM your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
portion:Deuteronomy 14:22 - 14:29
verse:14:22 You shall surely tithe all the increase of your seed, that which comes forth from the field year by year. 
verse:14:23 You shall eat before HASHEM your God, in the place which he shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, the tithe of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock; that you may learn to fear HASHEM your God always. 
verse:14:24 If the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry it, because the place is too far from you, which HASHEM your God shall choose, to set his name there, when HASHEM your God shall bless you; 
verse:14:25 then you shall turn it into money, and bind up the money in your hand, and shall go to the place which HASHEM your God shall choose: 
verse:14:26 and you shall bestow the money for whatever your soul desires, for cattle, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever your soul asks of you; and you shall eat there before HASHEM your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household. 
verse:14:27 The Levite who is within your gates, you shall not forsake him; for he has no portion nor inheritance with you. 
verse:14:28 At the end of every three years you shall bring forth all the tithe of your increase in the same year, and shall lay it up within your gates: 
verse:14:29 and the Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, and the foreigner living among you, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that HASHEM your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
portion:Deuteronomy 15:1 - 15:18
verse:15:1 At the end of every seven years you shall make a release. 
verse:15:2 This is the way of the release: every creditor shall release that which he has lent to his neighbor; he shall not exact it of his neighbor and his brother; because HASHEM's release has been proclaimed. 
verse:15:3 Of a foreigner you may exact it: but whatever of your is with your brother your hand shall release. 
verse:15:4 However there shall be no poor with you; (for HASHEM will surely bless you in the land which HASHEM your God gives you for an inheritance to possess it;) 
verse:15:5 if only you diligently listen to the voice of HASHEM your God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command you this day. 
verse:15:6 For HASHEM your God will bless you, as he promised you: and you shall lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow; and you shall rule over many nations, but they shall not rule over you. 
verse:15:7 If a poor man, one of your brothers, is with you within any of your gates in your land which HASHEM your God gives you, you shall not harden your heart, nor shut your hand from your poor brother; 
verse:15:8 but you shall surely open your hand to him, and shall surely lend him sufficient for his need, which he lacks. 
verse:15:9 Beware that there not be a base thought in your heart, saying, "The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand;" and your eye be evil against your poor brother, and you give him nothing; and he cry to HASHEM against you, and it be sin to you. 
verse:15:10 You shall surely give him, and your heart shall not be grieved when you give to him; because that for this thing HASHEM your God will bless you in all your work, and in all that you put your hand to. 
verse:15:11 For the poor will never cease out of the land: therefore I command you, saying, You shall surely open your hand to your brother, to your needy, and to your poor, in your land. 
verse:15:12 If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you, and serves you six years; then in the seventh year you shall let him go free from you. 
verse:15:13 When you let him go free from you, you shall not let him go empty: 
verse:15:14 you shall furnish him liberally out of your flock, and out of your threshing floor, and out of your winepress; as HASHEM your God has blessed you, you shall give to him. 
verse:15:15 You shall remember that you were a bondservant in the land of Egypt, and HASHEM your God redeemed you: therefore I command you this thing today. 
verse:15:16 It shall be, if he tells you, "I will not go out from you;" because he loves you and your house, because he is well with you; 
verse:15:17 then you shall take an awl, and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. Also to your female servant you shall do likewise. 
verse:15:18 It shall not seem hard to you, when you let him go free from you; for to the double of the hire of a hireling has he served you six years: and HASHEM your God will bless you in all that you do.
portion:Deuteronomy 15:19 - 16:17
verse:15:19 All the firstborn males that are born of your herd and of your flock you shall sanctify to HASHEM your God: you shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock. 
verse:15:20 You shall eat it before HASHEM your God year by year in the place which HASHEM shall choose, you and your household. 
verse:15:21 If it has any blemish, is lame or blind, or has any defect whatever, you shall not sacrifice it to HASHEM your God. 
verse:15:22 You shall eat it within your gates: the unclean and the clean shall eat it alike, as the gazelle, and as the hart. 
verse:15:23 Only you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground as water.
verse:16:1 Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to HASHEM your God; for in the month of Abib HASHEM your God brought you forth out of Egypt by night. 
verse:16:2 You shall sacrifice the Passover to HASHEM your God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which HASHEM shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there. 
verse:16:3 You shall eat no leavened bread with it. You shall eat unleavened bread with it seven days, even the bread of affliction; for you came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that you may remember the day when you came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life. 
verse:16:4 No yeast shall be seen with you in all your borders seven days; neither shall any of the flesh, which you sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning. 
verse:16:5 You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates, which HASHEM your God gives you; 
verse:16:6 but at the place which HASHEM your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell in, there you shall sacrifice the Passover at evening, at the going down of the sun, at the season that you came forth out of Egypt. 
verse:16:7 You shall roast and eat it in the place which HASHEM your God shall choose: and you shall turn in the morning, and go to your tents. 
verse:16:8 Six days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to HASHEM your God; you shall do no work. 
verse:16:9 You shall count for yourselves seven weeks: from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain you shall begin to number seven weeks. 
verse:16:10 You shall keep the feast of weeks to HASHEM your God with a tribute of a freewill offering of your hand, which you shall give, according as HASHEM your God blesses you: 
verse:16:11 and you shall rejoice before HASHEM your God, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are in the midst of you, in the place which HASHEM your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there. 
verse:16:12 You shall remember that you were a bondservant in Egypt: and you shall observe and do these statutes. 
verse:16:13 You shall keep the feast of booths seven days, after that you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress: 
verse:16:14 and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates. 
verse:16:15 You shall keep a feast to HASHEM your God seven days in the place which HASHEM shall choose; because HASHEM your God will bless you in all your increase, and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be altogether joyful. 
verse:16:16 Three times in a year shall all your males appear before HASHEM your God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of booths; and they shall not appear before HASHEM empty: 
verse:16:17 every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of HASHEM your God which he has given you.
portion:Deuteronomy 16:13 - 16:17
verse:16:13 You shall keep the feast of booths seven days, after that you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress: 
verse:16:14 and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates. 
verse:16:15 You shall keep a feast to HASHEM your God seven days in the place which HASHEM shall choose; because HASHEM your God will bless you in all your increase, and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be altogether joyful. 
verse:16:16 Three times in a year shall all your males appear before HASHEM your God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of booths; and they shall not appear before HASHEM empty: 
verse:16:17 every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of HASHEM your God which he has given you. 
portion:Deuteronomy 16:18 - 17:13
verse:16:18 You shall make judges and officers in all your gates, which HASHEM your God gives you, according to your tribes; and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment. 
verse:16:19 You shall not wrest justice: you shall not respect persons; neither shall you take a bribe; for a bribe does blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous. 
verse:16:20 You shall follow that which is altogether just, that you may live, and inherit the land which HASHEM your God gives you. 
verse:16:21 You shall not plant for yourselves an Asherah of any kind of tree beside the altar of HASHEM your God, which you shall make for yourselves. 
verse:16:22 Neither shall you set yourself up a pillar; which HASHEM your God hates.
verse:17:1 You shall not sacrifice to HASHEM your God an ox, or a sheep, in which is a blemish, or anything evil; for that is an abomination to HASHEM your God. 
verse:17:2 If there is found in the midst of you, within any of your gates which HASHEM your God gives you, man or woman, who does that which is evil in the sight of HASHEM your God, in transgressing his covenant, 
verse:17:3 and has gone and served other gods, and worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the army of the sky, which I have not commanded; 
verse:17:4 and it be told you, and you have heard of it, then you shall inquire diligently; and behold, if it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in Israel, 
verse:17:5 then you shall bring forth that man or that woman, who has done this evil thing, to your gates, even the man or the woman; and you shall stone them to death with stones. 
verse:17:6 At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he who is to die be put to death; at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death. 
verse:17:7 The hand of the witnesses shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people. So you shall put away the evil from the midst of you. 
verse:17:8 If there arises a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within your gates; then you shall arise, and go up to the place which HASHEM your God shall choose; 
verse:17:9 and you shall come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge who shall be in those days: and you shall inquire; and they shall show you the sentence of judgment. 
verse:17:10 You shall do according to the tenor of the sentence which they shall show you from that place which HASHEM shall choose; and you shall observe to do according to all that they shall teach you: 
verse:17:11 according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left. 
verse:17:12 The man who does presumptuously, in not listening to the priest who stands to minister there before HASHEM your God, or to the judge, even that man shall die: and you shall put away the evil from Israel. 
verse:17:13 All the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
portion:Deuteronomy 17:14 - 17:20
verse:17:14 When you have come to the land which HASHEM your God gives you, and shall possess it, and shall dwell therein, and shall say, "I will set a king over me, like all the nations that are around me;" 
verse:17:15 you shall surely set him king over yourselves, whom HASHEM your God shall choose: one from among your brothers you shall set king over you; you may not put a foreigner over you, who is not your brother. 
verse:17:16 Only he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he may multiply horses; because HASHEM has said to you, "You shall not go back that way again." 
verse:17:17 Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart not turn away: neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
verse:17:18 It shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book, out of that which is before the priests the Levites: 
verse:17:19 and it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life; that he may learn to fear HASHEM his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them; 
verse:17:20 that his heart not be lifted up above his brothers, and that he not turn aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children, in the midst of Israel.
portion:Deuteronomy 18:1 - 18:5
verse:18:1 The priests the Levites, all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of HASHEM made by fire, and his inheritance. 
verse:18:2 They shall have no inheritance among their brothers: HASHEM is their inheritance, as he has spoken to them. 
verse:18:3 This shall be the priests' due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give to the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw. 
verse:18:4 The first fruits of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep, you shall give him. 
verse:18:5 For HASHEM your God has chosen him out of all your tribes, to stand to minister in the name of HASHEM, him and his sons for ever.
portion:Deuteronomy 18:6 - 18:13
verse:18:6 If a Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel, where he lives as a foreigner, and comes with all the desire of his soul to the place which HASHEM shall choose; 
verse:18:7 then he shall minister in the name of HASHEM his God, as all his brothers the Levites do, who stand there before HASHEM. 
verse:18:8 They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which comes of the sale of his patrimony. 
verse:18:9 When you have come into the land which HASHEM your God gives you, you shall not learn to do after the abominations of those nations. 
verse:18:10 There shall not be found with you anyone who makes his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, one who uses divination, one who practices sorcery, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer, 
verse:18:11 or a charmer, or a consulter with a familiar spirit, or a wizard, or a necromancer. 
verse:18:12 For whoever does these things is an abomination to HASHEM: and because of these abominations HASHEM your God does drive them out from before you. 
verse:18:13 You shall be perfect with HASHEM your God.
portion:Deuteronomy 18:14 - 19:13
verse:18:14 For these nations, that you shall dispossess, listen to those who practice sorcery, and to diviners; but as for you, HASHEM your God has not allowed you so to do. 
verse:18:15 HASHEM your God will raise up to you a prophet from the midst of you, of your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him. 
verse:18:16 This is according to all that you desired of HASHEM your God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, "Let me not hear again the voice of HASHEM my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I not die."
verse:18:17 HASHEM said to me, "They have well said that which they have spoken. 
verse:18:18 I will raise them up a prophet from among their brothers, like you; and I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him. 
verse:18:19 It shall happen, that whoever will not listen to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him. 
verse:18:20 But the prophet, who shall speak a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who shall speak in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die."
verse:18:21 If you say in your heart, "How shall we know the word which HASHEM has not spoken?" 
verse:18:22 when a prophet speaks in the name of HASHEM, if the thing doesn't follow, nor happen, that is the thing which HASHEM has not spoken: the prophet has spoken it presumptuously, you shall not be afraid of him.
verse:19:1 When HASHEM your God shall cut off the nations, whose land HASHEM your God gives you, and you succeed them, and dwell in their cities, and in their houses; 
verse:19:2 you shall set apart three cities for you in the midst of your land, which HASHEM your God gives you to possess it. 
verse:19:3 You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which HASHEM your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there. 
verse:19:4 This is the case of the manslayer, that shall flee there and live: whoever kills his neighbor unawares, and didn't hate him in time past; 
verse:19:5 as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to chop wood, and his hand fetches a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle, and lights on his neighbor, so that he dies; he shall flee to one of these cities and live: 
verse:19:6 lest the avenger of blood pursue the manslayer, while his heart is hot, and overtake him, because the way is long, and strike him mortally; whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he didn't hate him in time past. 
verse:19:7 Therefore I command you, saying, You shall set apart three cities for yourselves. 
verse:19:8 If HASHEM your God enlarges your border, as he has sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land which he promised to give to your fathers; 
verse:19:9 if you keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you this day, to love HASHEM your God, and to walk ever in his ways; then you shall add three cities more for yourselves, besides these three: 
verse:19:10 that innocent blood not be shed in the midst of your land, which HASHEM your God gives you for an inheritance, and so blood be on you. 
verse:19:11 But if any man hates his neighbor, and lies in wait for him, and rises up against him, and strikes him mortally so that he dies, and he flees into one of these cities; 
verse:19:12 then the elders of his city shall send and bring him there, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die. 
verse:19:13 Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall put away the innocent blood from Israel, that it may go well with you.
portion:Deuteronomy 19:14 - 20:9
verse:19:14 You shall not remove your neighbor's landmark, which they of old time have set, in your inheritance which you shall inherit, in the land that HASHEM your God gives you to possess it. 
verse:19:15 One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sins: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall a matter be established. 
verse:19:16 If an unrighteous witness rise up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing, 
verse:19:17 then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before HASHEM, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days; 
verse:19:18 and the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and, behold, if the witness is a false witness, and has testified falsely against his brother; 
verse:19:19 then you shall do to him as he had thought to do to his brother: so you shall put away the evil from the midst of you. 
verse:19:20 Those who remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil in the midst of you. 
verse:19:21 Your eyes shall not pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verse:20:1 When you go forth to battle against your enemies, and see horses, chariots, and a people more than you, you shall not be afraid of them; for HASHEM your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. 
verse:20:2 It shall be, when you draw near to the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people, 
verse:20:3 and shall tell them, "Hear, Israel, you draw near this day to battle against your enemies: don't let your heart faint; don't be afraid, nor tremble, neither be scared of them; 
verse:20:4 for HASHEM your God is he who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you."
verse:20:5 The officers shall speak to the people, saying, "What man is there who has built a new house, and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.
