verse:16:2 and HASHEM said to Moses, "Tell Aaron your brother, not to come at all times into the Most Holy Place within the veil, before the mercy seat which is on the ark; lest he die: for I will appear in the cloud on the mercy seat.
verse:16:3 "Herewith shall Aaron come into the sanctuary: with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering. 
verse:16:4 He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches on his body, and shall put on the linen sash, and he shall be clothed with the linen turban. They are the holy garments. He shall bathe his body in water, and put them on. 
verse:16:5 He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
verse:16:6 "Aaron shall offer the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house. 
verse:16:7 He shall take the two goats, and set them before HASHEM at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:16:8 Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats; one lot for HASHEM, and the other lot for the scapegoat. 
verse:16:9 Aaron shall present the goat on which the lot fell for HASHEM, and offer him for a sin offering. 
verse:16:10 But the goat, on which the lot fell for the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before HASHEM, to make atonement for him, to send him away for the scapegoat into the wilderness.
verse:16:11 "Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering which is for himself. 
verse:16:12 He shall take a censer full of coals of fire from off the altar before HASHEM, and two handfuls of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil: 
verse:16:13 and he shall put the incense on the fire before HASHEM, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the testimony, so that he will not die. 
verse:16:14 He shall take some of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the east; and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
verse:16:15 "Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with his blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it on the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat: 
verse:16:16 and he shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, even all their sins; and so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, that dwells with them in the midst of their uncleanness. 
verse:16:17 No one shall be in the Tent of Meeting when he enters to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out, and has made atonement for himself and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
verse:16:18 "He shall go out to the altar that is before HASHEM and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the bull's blood, and some of the goat's blood, and put it around on the horns of the altar. 
verse:16:19 He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and make it holy from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
verse:16:20 "When he has made an end of atoning for the Holy Place, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, he shall present the live goat. 
verse:16:21 Aaron shall lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, even all their sins; and he shall put them on the head of the goat, and shall send him away into the wilderness by the hand of a man who is in readiness. 
verse:16:22 The goat shall carry all their iniquities on himself to a solitary land, and he shall let the goat go in the wilderness.
verse:16:23 "Aaron shall come into the Tent of Meeting, and shall take off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the Holy Place, and shall leave them there. 
verse:16:24 Then he shall bathe himself in water in a holy place, and put on his garments, and come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, and make atonement for himself and for the people. 
verse:16:25 The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
verse:16:26 "He who lets the goat go for the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp. 
verse:16:27 The bull for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried forth outside the camp; and they shall burn their skins, their flesh, and their dung with fire. 
verse:16:28 He who burns them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
verse:16:29 "It shall be a statute to you forever: in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall afflict your souls, and shall do no kind of work, the native-born, or the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you: 
verse:16:30 for on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins you shall be clean before HASHEM. 
verse:16:31 It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict your souls; it is a statute forever. 
verse:16:32 The priest, who is anointed and who is consecrated to be priest in his father's place, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen garments, even the holy garments. 
verse:16:33 Then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary; and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.
verse:16:34 "This shall be an everlasting statute for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel once in the year because of all their sins."
It was done as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:17:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:17:2 "Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: 'This is the thing which HASHEM has commanded, 
verse:17:3 Whatever man there is of the house of Israel, who kills a bull, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or who kills it outside the camp, 
verse:17:4 and hasn't brought it to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to offer it as an offering to HASHEM before the tabernacle of HASHEM: blood shall be imputed to that man. He has shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people. 
verse:17:5 This is to the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they sacrifice in the open field, that they may bring them to HASHEM, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to the priest, and sacrifice them for sacrifices of peace offerings to HASHEM. 
verse:17:6 The priest shall sprinkle the blood on the altar of HASHEM at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and burn the fat for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM. 
verse:17:7 They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.'
verse:17:8 "You shall say to them, 'Any man there is of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice, 
verse:17:9 and doesn't bring it to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to sacrifice it to HASHEM; that man shall be cut off from his people.
verse:17:10 "'Any man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who eats any kind of blood, I will set my face against that soul who eats blood, and will cut him off from among his people. 
verse:17:11 For the life of the flesh is in the blood; and I have given it to you on the altar to make atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life. 
verse:17:12 Therefore I have said to the children of Israel, "No person among you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger who lives as a foreigner among you eat blood."
verse:17:13 "'Whatever man there is of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who takes in hunting any animal or bird that may be eaten; he shall pour out its blood, and cover it with dust. 
verse:17:14 For as to the life of all flesh, its blood is with its life: therefore I said to the children of Israel, "You shall not eat the blood of any kind of flesh; for the life of all flesh is its blood. Whoever eats it shall be cut off."
verse:17:15 "'Every person that eats what dies of itself, or that which is torn by animals, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening: then he shall be clean. 
verse:17:16 But if he doesn't wash them, or bathe his flesh, then he shall bear his iniquity.'"
verse:18:1 HASHEM said to Moses, 
verse:18:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, 'I am HASHEM your God. 
verse:18:3 You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you lived: and you shall not do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you; neither shall you walk in their statutes. 
verse:18:4 You shall do my ordinances, and you shall keep my statutes, and walk in them: I am HASHEM your God. 
verse:18:5 You shall therefore keep my statutes and my ordinances; which if a man does, he shall live in them: I am HASHEM.
verse:18:6 "'None of you shall approach anyone who are his close relatives, to uncover their nakedness: I am HASHEM.
verse:18:7 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father, nor the nakedness of your mother: she is your mother. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
verse:18:8 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's wife: it is your father's nakedness.
verse:18:9 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home, or born abroad.
verse:18:10 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son's daughter, or of your daughter's daughter, even their nakedness: for theirs is your own nakedness.
verse:18:11 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's wife's daughter, conceived by your father, since she is your sister.
verse:18:12 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister: she is your father's near kinswoman.
verse:18:13 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother's sister: for she is your mother's near kinswoman.
verse:18:14 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's brother, you shall not approach his wife: she is your aunt.
verse:18:15 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son's wife. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
verse:18:16 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother's wife: it is your brother's nakedness.
verse:18:17 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter. You shall not take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedness; they are near kinswomen: it is wickedness.
verse:18:18 "'You shall not take a wife to her sister, to be a rival, to uncover her nakedness, while her sister is yet alive.
verse:18:19 "'You shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is impure by her uncleanness.
verse:18:20 "'You shall not lie carnally with your neighbor's wife, and defile yourself with her.
verse:18:21 "'You shall not give any of your children to sacrifice to Molech; neither shall you profane the name of your God: I am HASHEM.
verse:18:22 "'You shall not lie with a man, as with a woman. That is detestable.
verse:18:23 "'You shall not lie with any animal to defile yourself with it; neither shall any woman give herself to an animal, to lie down with it: it is a perversion.
verse:18:24 "'Don't defile yourselves in any of these things: for in all these the nations which I am casting out before you were defiled. 
verse:18:25 The land was defiled: therefore I punished its iniquity, and the land vomited out her inhabitants. 
verse:18:26 You therefore shall keep my statutes and my ordinances, and shall not do any of these abominations; neither the native-born, nor the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you; 
verse:18:27 (for all these abominations have the men of the land done, that were before you, and the land became defiled); 
verse:18:28 that the land not vomit you out also, when you defile it, as it vomited out the nation that was before you.
verse:18:29 "'For whoever shall do any of these abominations, even the souls that do them shall be cut off from among their people. 
verse:18:30 Therefore you shall keep my requirements, that you do not practice any of these abominable customs, which were practiced before you, and that you do not defile yourselves with them: I am HASHEM your God.'"
verse:19:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:19:2 "Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and tell them, 'You shall be holy; for I HASHEM your God am holy.
verse:19:3 "'Each one of you shall respect his mother and his father. You shall keep my Sabbaths. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:4 "'Don't turn to idols, nor make molten gods for yourselves. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:5 "'When you offer a sacrifice of peace offerings to HASHEM, you shall offer it so that you may be accepted. 
verse:19:6 It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day: and if anything remains until the third day, it shall be burned with fire. 
verse:19:7 If it is eaten at all on the third day, it is an abomination. It will not be accepted; 
verse:19:8 but everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the holy thing of HASHEM, and that soul shall be cut off from his people.
verse:19:9 "'When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, neither shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest. 
verse:19:10 You shall not glean your vineyard, neither shall you gather the fallen grapes of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and for the foreigner. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:11 "'You shall not steal.
"'You shall not lie.
"'You shall not deceive one another.
verse:19:12 "'You shall not swear by my name falsely, and profane the name of your God. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:13 "'You shall not oppress your neighbor, nor rob him.
"'The wages of a hired servant shall not remain with you all night until the morning.
verse:19:14 "'You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind; but you shall fear your God. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:15 "'You shall do no injustice in judgment: you shall not be partial to the poor, nor show favoritism to the great; but you shall judge your neighbor in righteousness.
verse:19:16 "'You shall not go up and down as a slanderer among your people.
"'You shall not endanger the life of your neighbor. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:17 "'You shall not hate your brother in your heart. You shall surely rebuke your neighbor, and not bear sin because of him.
verse:19:18 "'You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people; but you shall love your neighbor as yourself. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:19 "'You shall keep my statutes.
"'You shall not crossbreed different kinds of animals.
"'you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed;
"'neither shall there come upon on you a garment made of two kinds of material.
verse:19:20 "'If a man lies carnally with a woman who is a slave girl, pledged to be married to another man, and not ransomed, or given her freedom; they shall be punished. They shall not be put to death, because she was not free. 
verse:19:21 He shall bring his trespass offering to HASHEM, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, even a ram for a trespass offering. 
verse:19:22 The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before HASHEM for his sin which he has committed: and the sin which he has committed shall be forgiven him.
verse:19:23 "'When you come into the land, and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall count their fruit as forbidden. Three years shall they be forbidden to you. It shall not be eaten. 
verse:19:24 But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, for giving praise to HASHEM. 
verse:19:25 In the fifth year you shall eat its fruit, that it may yield its increase to you. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:26 "'You shall not eat any meat with the blood still in it; neither shall you use enchantments, nor practice sorcery.
verse:19:27 "'You shall not cut the hair on the sides of your heads, neither shall you clip off the edge of your beard.
verse:19:28 "'You shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor tattoo any marks on you. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:29 "'Don't profane your daughter, to make her a prostitute; lest the land fall to prostitution, and the land become full of wickedness.
verse:19:30 "'You shall keep my Sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary; I am HASHEM.
verse:19:31 "'Don't turn to those who are mediums, nor to the wizards. Don't seek them out, to be defiled by them. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:32 "'You shall rise up before the gray head, and honor the face of an old man, and you shall fear your God. I am HASHEM.
verse:19:33 "'If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you in your land, you shall not do him wrong. 
verse:19:34 The stranger who lives as a foreigner with you shall be to you as the native-born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you lived as foreigners in the land of Egypt. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:19:35 "'You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in measures of length, of weight, or of quantity. 
verse:19:36 You shall have just balances, just weights, a just efah, and a just hin. I am HASHEM your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
verse:19:37 "'You shall observe all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them. I am HASHEM.'"
verse:20:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:20:2 "Moreover, you shall tell the children of Israel, 'Anyone of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners in Israel, who gives any of his seed to Molech; he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones. 
verse:20:3 I also will set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people because he has given of his seed to Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name. 
verse:20:4 If the people of the land all hide their eyes from that person, when he gives of his seed to Molech, and don't put him to death; 
verse:20:5 then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all who play the prostitute after him, to play the prostitute with Molech, from among their people.
verse:20:6 "'The person that turns to those who are mediums, and to the wizards, to play the prostitute after them, I will even set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people.
verse:20:7 "'Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be holy; for I am HASHEM your God. 
verse:20:8 You shall keep my statutes, and do them. I am HASHEM who sanctifies you.
verse:20:9 "'For everyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death: he has cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.
verse:20:10 "'The man who commits adultery with another man's wife, even he who commits adultery with his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
verse:20:11 "'The man who lies with his father's wife has uncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
verse:20:12 "'If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have committed a perversion; their blood shall be upon them.
verse:20:13 "'If a man lies with a male, as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
verse:20:14 "'If a man takes a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burned with fire, both he and they; that there may be no wickedness among you.
verse:20:15 "'If a man lies with an animal, he shall surely be put to death; and you shall kill the animal.
verse:20:16 "'If a woman approaches any animal, and lies down with it, you shall kill the woman, and the animal: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
verse:20:17 "'If a man takes his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness; it is a shameful thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people: he has uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.
verse:20:18 "'If a man lies with a woman having her monthly period, and uncovers her nakedness; he has made naked her fountain, and she has uncovered the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
verse:20:19 "'You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother's sister, nor of your father's sister; for he has made naked his close relative: they shall bear their iniquity. 
verse:20:20 If a man lies with his uncle's wife, he has uncovered his uncle's nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
verse:20:21 "'If a man takes his brother's wife, it is an impurity: he has uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.
verse:20:22 "'You shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them; that the land, where I am bringing you to dwell, may not vomit you out. 
verse:20:23 You shall not walk in the customs of the nation, which I am casting out before you: for they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them. 
verse:20:24 But I have said to you, "You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess it, a land flowing with milk and honey." I am HASHEM your God, who has separated you from the peoples.
verse:20:25 "'You shall therefore make a distinction between the clean animal and the unclean, and between the unclean fowl and the clean: and you shall not make yourselves abominable by animal, or by bird, or by anything with which the ground teems, which I have separated from you as unclean for you. 
verse:20:26 You shall be holy to me: for I, HASHEM, am holy, and have set you apart from the peoples, that you should be mine.
verse:20:27 "'A man or a woman that is a medium, or is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones; their blood shall be upon them.'"
portion:Leviticus 25:1 - 25:18
verse:25:1 HASHEM said to Moses in Mount Sinai, 
verse:25:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a Sabbath to HASHEM. 
verse:25:3 Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and gather in its fruits; 
verse:25:4 but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to HASHEM. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard. 
verse:25:5 What grows of itself in your harvest you shall not reap, and the grapes of your undressed vine you shall not gather. It shall be a year of solemn rest for the land. 
verse:25:6 The Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you; for yourself, for your servant, for your maid, for your hired servant, and for your stranger, who lives as a foreigner with you. 
verse:25:7 For your livestock also, and for the animals that are in your land, shall all its increase be for food.
verse:25:8 "'You shall count off seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years; and there shall be to you the days of seven Sabbaths of years, even forty-nine years. 
verse:25:9 Then you shall sound the loud shofar on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the shofar throughout all your land. 
verse:25:10 You shall make the fiftieth year holy, and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee to you; and each of you shall return to his own property, and each of you shall return to his family. 
verse:25:11 That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee to you. In it you shall not sow, neither reap that which grows of itself, nor gather from the undressed vines. 
verse:25:12 For it is a jubilee; it shall be holy to you. You shall eat of its increase out of the field.
verse:25:13 "'In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.
verse:25:14 "'If you sell anything to your neighbor, or buy from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another. 
verse:25:15 According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor. According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you. 
verse:25:16 According to the length of the years you shall increase its price, and according to the shortness of the years you shall diminish its price; for he is selling the number of the crops to you. 
verse:25:17 You shall not wrong one another; but you shall fear your God: for I am HASHEM your God.
verse:25:18 "'Therefore you shall do my statutes, and keep my ordinances and do them; and you shall dwell in the land in safety.
portion:Leviticus 25:19 - 25:28
verse:25:19 The land shall yield its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety. 
verse:25:20 If you said, "What shall we eat the seventh year? Behold, we shall not sow, nor gather in our increase;" 
verse:25:21 then I will command my blessing on you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for the three years. 
verse:25:22 You shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the fruits, the old store; until the ninth year, until its fruits come in, you shall eat the old store.
verse:25:23 "'The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is mine; for you are strangers and live as foreigners with me. 
verse:25:24 In all the land of your possession you shall grant a redemption for the land.
verse:25:25 "'If your brother becomes poor, and sells some of his possessions, then his kinsman who is next to him shall come, and redeem that which his brother has sold. 
verse:25:26 If a man has no one to redeem it, and he becomes prosperous and finds sufficient means to redeem it; 
verse:25:27 then let him reckon the years since its sale, and restore the surplus to the man to whom he sold it; and he shall return to his property. 
verse:25:28 But if he isn't able to get it back for himself, then what he has sold shall remain in the hand of him who has bought it until the Year of Jubilee: and in the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his property.
portion:Leviticus 25:39 - 26:9
verse:25:39 "'If your brother has grown poor among you, and sells himself to you; you shall not make him to serve as a slave. 
verse:25:40 As a hired servant, and as a temporary resident, he shall be with you; he shall serve with you until the Year of Jubilee: 
verse:25:41 then he shall go out from you, he and his children with him, and shall return to his own family, and to the possession of his fathers. 
verse:25:42 For they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. They shall not be sold as slaves. 
verse:25:43 You shall not rule over him with harshness, but shall fear your God.
verse:25:44 "'As for your male and your female slaves, whom you may have; of the nations that are around you, from them you may buy male and female slaves. 
verse:25:45 Moreover of the children of the aliens who live among you, of them you may buy, and of their families who are with you, which they have conceived in your land; and they will be your property. 
verse:25:46 You may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession; of them may you take your slaves forever: but over your brothers the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
verse:25:47 "'If an alien or temporary resident with you becomes rich, and your brother beside him has grown poor, and sells himself to the stranger or foreigner living among you, or to a member of the stranger's family; 
verse:25:48 after he is sold he may be redeemed. One of his brothers may redeem him; 
verse:25:49 or his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redeem him, or any who is a close relative to him of his family may redeem him; or if he has grown rich, he may redeem himself. 
verse:25:50 He shall reckon with him who bought him from the year that he sold himself to him to the Year of Jubilee: and the price of his sale shall be according to the number of years; according to the time of a hired servant shall he be with him. 
verse:25:51 If there are yet many years, according to them he shall give back the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for. 
verse:25:52 If there remain but a few years to the year of jubilee, then he shall reckon with him; according to his years of service he shall give back the price of his redemption. 
verse:25:53 As a servant hired year by year shall he be with him: he shall not rule with harshness over him in your sight. 
verse:25:54 If he isn't redeemed by these means, then he shall be released in the Year of Jubilee, he, and his children with him. 
verse:25:55 For to me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:26:1 "'You shall make for yourselves no idols, neither shall you raise up an engraved image or a pillar, neither shall you place any figured stone in your land, to bow down to it: for I am HASHEM your God.
verse:26:2 "'You shall keep my Sabbaths, and have reverence for my sanctuary. I am HASHEM.
verse:26:3 "'If you walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them; 
verse:26:4 then I will give you your rains in their season, and the land shall yield its increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit. 
verse:26:5 Your threshing shall reach to the vintage, and the vintage shall reach to the sowing time; and you shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
verse:26:6 "'I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and no one will make you afraid; and I will remove evil animals out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land. 
verse:26:7 You shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword. 
verse:26:8 Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
verse:26:9 "'I will have respect for you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and will establish my covenant with you.
portion:Leviticus 27:16 - 27:34
verse:27:16 "'If a man dedicates to HASHEM part of the field of his possession, then your valuation shall be according to the seed for it: the sowing of a omer of barley shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver. 
verse:27:17 If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand. 
verse:27:18 But if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain to the Year of Jubilee; and an abatement shall be made from your valuation. 
verse:27:19 If he who dedicated the field will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall remain his. 
verse:27:20 If he will not redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more; 
verse:27:21 but the field, when it goes out in the Jubilee, shall be holy to HASHEM, as a field devoted; it shall be owned by the priests.
verse:27:22 "'If he dedicates to HASHEM a field which he has bought, which is not of the field of his possession, 
verse:27:23 then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of your valuation up to the Year of Jubilee; and he shall give your valuation on that day, as a holy thing to HASHEM. 
verse:27:24 In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to him from whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land belongs. 
verse:27:25 All your valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs to the shekel.
verse:27:26 "'Only the firstborn among animals, which is made a firstborn to HASHEM, no man may dedicate it; whether an ox or sheep, it is HASHEM's. 
verse:27:27 If it is an unclean animal, then he shall buy it back according to your valuation, and shall add to it the fifth part of it: or if it isn't redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your valuation.
verse:27:28 "'Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote to HASHEM of all that he has, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to HASHEM.
verse:27:29 "'No one devoted, who shall be devoted from among men, shall be ransomed; he shall surely be put to death.
verse:27:30 "'All the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the trees, is HASHEM's. It is holy to HASHEM. 
verse:27:31 If a man redeems anything of his tithe, he shall add a fifth part to it. 
verse:27:32 All the tithe of the herds or the flocks, whatever passes under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to HASHEM. 
verse:27:33 He shall not search whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he changes it at all, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy. It shall not be redeemed.'"
verse:27:34 These are the commandments which HASHEM commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai. 
portion:Leviticus 25:1 - 27:34
verse:25:1 HASHEM said to Moses in Mount Sinai, 
verse:25:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a Sabbath to HASHEM. 
verse:25:3 Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and gather in its fruits; 
verse:25:4 but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to HASHEM. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard. 
verse:25:5 What grows of itself in your harvest you shall not reap, and the grapes of your undressed vine you shall not gather. It shall be a year of solemn rest for the land. 
verse:25:6 The Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you; for yourself, for your servant, for your maid, for your hired servant, and for your stranger, who lives as a foreigner with you. 
verse:25:7 For your livestock also, and for the animals that are in your land, shall all its increase be for food.
verse:25:8 "'You shall count off seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years; and there shall be to you the days of seven Sabbaths of years, even forty-nine years. 
verse:25:9 Then you shall sound the loud shofar on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the shofar throughout all your land. 
verse:25:10 You shall make the fiftieth year holy, and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee to you; and each of you shall return to his own property, and each of you shall return to his family. 
verse:25:11 That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee to you. In it you shall not sow, neither reap that which grows of itself, nor gather from the undressed vines. 
verse:25:12 For it is a jubilee; it shall be holy to you. You shall eat of its increase out of the field.
verse:25:13 "'In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.
verse:25:14 "'If you sell anything to your neighbor, or buy from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another. 
verse:25:15 According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor. According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you. 
verse:25:16 According to the length of the years you shall increase its price, and according to the shortness of the years you shall diminish its price; for he is selling the number of the crops to you. 
verse:25:17 You shall not wrong one another; but you shall fear your God: for I am HASHEM your God.
verse:25:18 "'Therefore you shall do my statutes, and keep my ordinances and do them; and you shall dwell in the land in safety. 
verse:25:19 The land shall yield its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety. 
verse:25:20 If you said, "What shall we eat the seventh year? Behold, we shall not sow, nor gather in our increase;" 
verse:25:21 then I will command my blessing on you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for the three years. 
verse:25:22 You shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the fruits, the old store; until the ninth year, until its fruits come in, you shall eat the old store.
verse:25:23 "'The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is mine; for you are strangers and live as foreigners with me. 
verse:25:24 In all the land of your possession you shall grant a redemption for the land.
verse:25:25 "'If your brother becomes poor, and sells some of his possessions, then his kinsman who is next to him shall come, and redeem that which his brother has sold. 
verse:25:26 If a man has no one to redeem it, and he becomes prosperous and finds sufficient means to redeem it; 
verse:25:27 then let him reckon the years since its sale, and restore the surplus to the man to whom he sold it; and he shall return to his property. 
verse:25:28 But if he isn't able to get it back for himself, then what he has sold shall remain in the hand of him who has bought it until the Year of Jubilee: and in the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his property.
verse:25:29 "'If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it has been sold. For a full year he shall have the right of redemption. 
verse:25:30 If it isn't redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be made sure in perpetuity to him who bought it, throughout his generations. It shall not be released in the Jubilee. 
verse:25:31 But the houses of the villages which have no wall around them shall be reckoned with the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.
verse:25:32 "'Nevertheless the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time. 
verse:25:33 The Levites may redeem the house that was sold, and the city of his possession, and it shall be released in the Jubilee; for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel. 
verse:25:34 But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it is their perpetual possession.
verse:25:35 "'If your brother has become poor, and his hand can't support him among you; then you shall uphold him. He shall live with you like an alien and a temporary resident. 
verse:25:36 Take no interest from him or profit, but fear your God; that your brother may live among you. 
verse:25:37 You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor give him your food for profit. 
verse:25:38 I am HASHEM your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, and to be your God.
verse:25:39 "'If your brother has grown poor among you, and sells himself to you; you shall not make him to serve as a slave. 
verse:25:40 As a hired servant, and as a temporary resident, he shall be with you; he shall serve with you until the Year of Jubilee: 
verse:25:41 then he shall go out from you, he and his children with him, and shall return to his own family, and to the possession of his fathers. 
verse:25:42 For they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. They shall not be sold as slaves. 
verse:25:43 You shall not rule over him with harshness, but shall fear your God.
verse:25:44 "'As for your male and your female slaves, whom you may have; of the nations that are around you, from them you may buy male and female slaves. 
verse:25:45 Moreover of the children of the aliens who live among you, of them you may buy, and of their families who are with you, which they have conceived in your land; and they will be your property. 
verse:25:46 You may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession; of them may you take your slaves forever: but over your brothers the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
verse:25:47 "'If an alien or temporary resident with you becomes rich, and your brother beside him has grown poor, and sells himself to the stranger or foreigner living among you, or to a member of the stranger's family; 
verse:25:48 after he is sold he may be redeemed. One of his brothers may redeem him; 
verse:25:49 or his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redeem him, or any who is a close relative to him of his family may redeem him; or if he has grown rich, he may redeem himself. 
verse:25:50 He shall reckon with him who bought him from the year that he sold himself to him to the Year of Jubilee: and the price of his sale shall be according to the number of years; according to the time of a hired servant shall he be with him. 
verse:25:51 If there are yet many years, according to them he shall give back the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for. 
verse:25:52 If there remain but a few years to the year of jubilee, then he shall reckon with him; according to his years of service he shall give back the price of his redemption. 
verse:25:53 As a servant hired year by year shall he be with him: he shall not rule with harshness over him in your sight. 
verse:25:54 If he isn't redeemed by these means, then he shall be released in the Year of Jubilee, he, and his children with him. 
verse:25:55 For to me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am HASHEM your God.
verse:26:1 "'You shall make for yourselves no idols, neither shall you raise up an engraved image or a pillar, neither shall you place any figured stone in your land, to bow down to it: for I am HASHEM your God.
verse:26:2 "'You shall keep my Sabbaths, and have reverence for my sanctuary. I am HASHEM.
verse:26:3 "'If you walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them; 
verse:26:4 then I will give you your rains in their season, and the land shall yield its increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit. 
verse:26:5 Your threshing shall reach to the vintage, and the vintage shall reach to the sowing time; and you shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
verse:26:6 "'I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and no one will make you afraid; and I will remove evil animals out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land. 
verse:26:7 You shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword. 
verse:26:8 Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
verse:26:9 "'I will have respect for you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and will establish my covenant with you. 
verse:26:10 You shall eat old store long kept, and you shall move out the old because of the new. 
verse:26:11 I will set my tent among you: and my soul won't abhor you. 
verse:26:12 I will walk among you, and will be your God, and you will be my people. 
verse:26:13 I am HASHEM your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their slaves; and I have broken the bars of your yoke, and made you go upright.
verse:26:14 "'But if you will not listen to me, and will not do all these commandments; 
verse:26:15 and if you shall reject my statutes, and if your soul abhors my ordinances, so that you will not do all my commandments, but break my covenant; 
verse:26:16 I also will do this to you: I will appoint terror over you, even consumption and fever, that shall consume the eyes, and make the soul to pine away; and you will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will eat it. 
verse:26:17 I will set my face against you, and you will be struck before your enemies. Those who hate you will rule over you; and you will flee when no one pursues you.
verse:26:18 "'If you in spite of these things will not listen to me, then I will chastise you seven times more for your sins. 
verse:26:19 I will break the pride of your power, and I will make your sky like iron, and your soil like brass; 
verse:26:20 and your strength will be spent in vain; for your land won't yield its increase, neither will the trees of the land yield their fruit.
verse:26:21 "'If you walk contrary to me, and won't listen to me, then I will bring seven times more plagues on you according to your sins. 
verse:26:22 I will send the wild animals among you, which will rob you of your children, destroy your livestock, and make you few in number; and your roads will become desolate.
verse:26:23 "'If by these things you won't be reformed to me, but will walk contrary to me; 
verse:26:24 then I will also walk contrary to you; and I will strike you, even I, seven times for your sins. 
verse:26:25 I will bring a sword upon you, that will execute the vengeance of the covenant; and you will be gathered together within your cities: and I will send the pestilence among you; and you will be delivered into the hand of the enemy. 
verse:26:26 When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver your bread again by weight: and you shall eat, and not be satisfied.
verse:26:27 "'If you in spite of this won't listen to me, but walk contrary to me; 
verse:26:28 then I will walk contrary to you in wrath; and I also will chastise you seven times for your sins. 
verse:26:29 You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters. 
verse:26:30 I will destroy your high places, and cut down your incense altars, and cast your dead bodies upon the bodies of your idols; and my soul will abhor you. 
verse:26:31 I will lay your cities waste, and will bring your sanctuaries to desolation, and I will not take delight in the sweet fragrance of your offerings. 
verse:26:32 I will bring the land into desolation; and your enemies that dwell therein will be astonished at it. 
verse:26:33 I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw out the sword after you: and your land will be a desolation, and your cities shall be a waste. 
verse:26:34 Then the land will enjoy its sabbaths as long as it lies desolate and you are in your enemies' land. Even then the land will rest and enjoy its sabbaths. 
verse:26:35 As long as it lies desolate it shall have rest, even the rest which it didn't have in your sabbaths, when you lived on it.
verse:26:36 "'As for those of you who are left, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies: and the sound of a driven leaf will put them to flight; and they shall flee, as one flees from the sword; and they will fall when no one pursues. 
verse:26:37 They will stumble over one another, as it were before the sword, when no one pursues: and you will have no power to stand before your enemies. 
verse:26:38 You will perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies will eat you up. 
verse:26:39 Those of you who are left will pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.
verse:26:40 "'If they confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, in their trespass which they trespassed against me, and also that, because they walked contrary to me, 
verse:26:41 I also walked contrary to them, and brought them into the land of their enemies: if then their uncircumcised heart is humbled, and they then accept the punishment of their iniquity; 
verse:26:42 then I will remember my covenant with Jacob; and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham; and I will remember the land. 
verse:26:43 The land also will be left by them, and will enjoy its sabbaths while it lies desolate without them: and they will accept the punishment of their iniquity; because, even because they rejected my ordinances, and their soul abhorred my statutes. 
verse:26:44 Yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break my covenant with them; for I am HASHEM their God; 
verse:26:45 but I will for their sake remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations, that I might be their God. I am HASHEM.'"
verse:26:46 These are the statutes, ordinances and laws, which HASHEM made between him and the children of Israel in Mount Sinai by Moses.
verse:27:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:27:2 "Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, 'When a man makes a vow, the persons shall be for HASHEM by your valuation. 
verse:27:3 Your valuation shall be of a male from twenty years old even to sixty years old, even your valuation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary. 
verse:27:4 If it is a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels. 
verse:27:5 If the person is from five years old even to twenty years old, then your valuation shall be for a male twenty shekels, and for a female ten shekels. 
verse:27:6 If the person is from a month old even to five years old, then your valuation shall be for a male five shekels of silver, and for a female your valuation shall be three shekels of silver. 
verse:27:7 If the person is from sixty years old and upward; if it is a male, then your valuation shall be fifteen shekels, and for a female ten shekels. 
verse:27:8 But if he is poorer than your valuation, then he shall be set before the priest, and the priest shall value him; according to the ability of him who vowed shall the priest value him.
verse:27:9 "'If it is an animal, of which men offer an offering to HASHEM, all that any man gives of such to HASHEM becomes holy. 
verse:27:10 He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change animal for animal, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy. 
verse:27:11 If it is any unclean animal, of which they do not offer as an offering to HASHEM, then he shall set the animal before the priest; 
verse:27:12 and the priest shall value it, whether it is good or bad. As you the priest values it, so shall it be. 
verse:27:13 But if he will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of it to its valuation.
verse:27:14 "'When a man dedicates his house to be holy to HASHEM, then the priest shall evaluate it, whether it is good or bad: as the priest shall evaluate it, so shall it stand. 
verse:27:15 If he who dedicates it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall be his.
verse:27:16 "'If a man dedicates to HASHEM part of the field of his possession, then your valuation shall be according to the seed for it: the sowing of a omer of barley shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver. 
verse:27:17 If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand. 
verse:27:18 But if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain to the Year of Jubilee; and an abatement shall be made from your valuation. 
verse:27:19 If he who dedicated the field will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall remain his. 
verse:27:20 If he will not redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more; 
verse:27:21 but the field, when it goes out in the Jubilee, shall be holy to HASHEM, as a field devoted; it shall be owned by the priests.
verse:27:22 "'If he dedicates to HASHEM a field which he has bought, which is not of the field of his possession, 
verse:27:23 then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of your valuation up to the Year of Jubilee; and he shall give your valuation on that day, as a holy thing to HASHEM. 
verse:27:24 In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to him from whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land belongs. 
verse:27:25 All your valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs to the shekel.
verse:27:26 "'Only the firstborn among animals, which is made a firstborn to HASHEM, no man may dedicate it; whether an ox or sheep, it is HASHEM's. 
verse:27:27 If it is an unclean animal, then he shall buy it back according to your valuation, and shall add to it the fifth part of it: or if it isn't redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your valuation.
verse:27:28 "'Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote to HASHEM of all that he has, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to HASHEM.
verse:27:29 "'No one devoted, who shall be devoted from among men, shall be ransomed; he shall surely be put to death.
verse:27:30 "'All the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the trees, is HASHEM's. It is holy to HASHEM. 
verse:27:31 If a man redeems anything of his tithe, he shall add a fifth part to it. 
verse:27:32 All the tithe of the herds or the flocks, whatever passes under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to HASHEM. 
verse:27:33 He shall not search whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he changes it at all, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy. It shall not be redeemed.'"
verse:27:34 These are the commandments which HASHEM commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai. 
portion:Numbers 19:1 - 20:6
verse:19:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, 
verse:19:2 "This is the statute of the law which HASHEM has commanded: Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring you a red heifer without spot, in which is no blemish, and which was never yoked. 
verse:19:3 You shall give her to Eleazar the priest, and he shall bring her forth outside of the camp, and one shall kill her before his face: 
verse:19:4 and Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle her blood toward the front of the Tent of Meeting seven times. 
verse:19:5 One shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn: 
verse:19:6 and the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer. 
verse:19:7 Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the evening. 
verse:19:8 He who burns her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the evening.
verse:19:9 "A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up outside of the camp in a clean place; and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water for impurity: it is a sin offering. 
verse:19:10 He who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening: and it shall be to the children of Israel, and to the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them, for a statute forever.
verse:19:11 "He who touches the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days: 
verse:19:12 the same shall purify himself with water on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he doesn't purify himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean. 
verse:19:13 Whoever touches a dead person, the body of a man who has died, and doesn't purify himself, defiles the tabernacle of HASHEM; and that soul shall be cut off from Israel: because the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet on him.
verse:19:14 "This is the law when a man dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent, and everyone who is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days. 
verse:19:15 Every open vessel, which has no covering bound on it, is unclean.
verse:19:16 "Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain with a sword, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verse:19:17 "For the unclean they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the sin offering; and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel: 
verse:19:18 and a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent, and on all the vessels, and on the persons who were there, and on him who touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave: 
verse:19:19 and the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify him; and he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at evening. 
verse:19:20 But the man who shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of HASHEM: the water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean. 
verse:19:21 It shall be a perpetual statute to them: and he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.
verse:19:22 "Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the soul that touches it shall be unclean until evening."
verse:20:1 The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month: and the people stayed in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there. 
verse:20:2 There was no water for the congregation: and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron. 
verse:20:3 The people strove with Moses, and spoke, saying, "We wish that we had died when our brothers died before HASHEM! 
verse:20:4 Why have you brought the assembly of HASHEM into this wilderness, that we should die there, we and our animals? 
verse:20:5 Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink."
verse:20:6 Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces: and the glory of HASHEM appeared to them.
portion:Numbers 20:7 - 20:21
verse:20:7 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:20:8 "Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it give forth its water; and you shall bring forth to them water out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink."
verse:20:9 Moses took the rod from before HASHEM, as he commanded him. 
verse:20:10 Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said to them, "Hear now, you rebels; shall we bring you water out of this rock for you?" 
verse:20:11 Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice: and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their livestock.
verse:20:12 HASHEM said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you didn't believe in me, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them."
verse:20:13 These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with HASHEM, and he was sanctified in them. 
verse:20:14 Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying:
"Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the travail that has happened to us: 
verse:20:15 how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and our fathers: 
verse:20:16 and when we cried to HASHEM, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt: and behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of your border.
verse:20:17 "Please let us pass through your land: we will not pass through field or through vineyard, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go along the king's highway; we will not turn aside to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed your border."
verse:20:18 Edom said to him, "You shall not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against you."
verse:20:19 The children of Israel said to him, "We will go up by the highway; and if we drink of your water, I and my livestock, then will I give its price: let me only, without doing anything else, pass through on my feet."
verse:20:20 He said, "You shall not pass through." Edom came out against him with many people, and with a strong hand. 
verse:20:21 Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border, so Israel turned away from him.
portion:Numbers 20:22 - 21:20
verse:20:22 They traveled from Kadesh: and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor. 
verse:20:23 HASHEM spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying, 
verse:20:24 "Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah. 
verse:20:25 Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor; 
verse:20:26 and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be taken, and shall die there."
verse:20:27 Moses did as HASHEM commanded: and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation. 
verse:20:28 Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there on the top of the mountain: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain. 
verse:20:29 When all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verse:21:1 The Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the South, heard tell that Israel came by the way of Atharim; and he fought against Israel, and took some of them captive. 
verse:21:2 Israel vowed a vow to HASHEM, and said, "If you will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities." 
verse:21:3 HASHEM listened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and the name of the place was called Hormah.
verse:21:4 They traveled from Mount Hor by the way to the Sea of Suf, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way. 
verse:21:5 The people spoke against God, and against Moses, "Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread, and there is no water; and our soul loathes this light bread."
verse:21:6 HASHEM sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and many people of Israel died. 
verse:21:7 The people came to Moses, and said, "We have sinned, because we have spoken against HASHEM, and against you. Pray to HASHEM, that he take away the serpents from us." Moses prayed for the people.
verse:21:8 HASHEM said to Moses, "Make a fiery serpent, and set it on a standard: and it shall happen, that everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live." 
verse:21:9 Moses made a serpent of brass, and set it on the standard: and it happened, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked to the serpent of brass, he lived. 
verse:21:10 The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in Oboth. 
verse:21:11 They traveled from Oboth, and encamped at Iyeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrise. 
verse:21:12 From there they traveled, and encamped in the valley of Zered. 
verse:21:13 From there they traveled, and encamped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness, that comes out of the border of the Amorites: for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites. 
verse:21:14 Therefore it is said in the book of the Wars of HASHEM, "Vaheb in Suphah, the valleys of the Arnon, 
verse:21:15 the slope of the valleys that incline toward the dwelling of Ar, leans on the border of Moab."
verse:21:16 From there they traveled to Beer: that is the well of which HASHEM said to Moses, "Gather the people together, and I will give them water."
verse:21:17 Then sang Israel this song: "Spring up, well; sing to it: 
verse:21:18 the well, which the princes dug, which the nobles of the people dug, with the scepter, and with their poles." 
From the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah; 
verse:21:19 and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth; 
verse:21:20 and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the field of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks down on the desert.
portion:Numbers 21:21 - 22:1221:21} Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying, 
verse:21:22 "Let me pass through your land: we will not turn aside into field, or into vineyard; we will not drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king's highway, until we have passed your border."
verse:21:23 Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and came to Jahaz; and he fought against Israel. 
verse:21:24 Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, even to the children of Ammon; for the border of the children of Ammon was strong. 
verse:21:25 Israel took all these cities: and Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its towns. 
verse:21:26 For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even to the Arnon. 
verse:21:27 Therefore those who speak in proverbs say, "Come to Heshbon. Let the city of Sihon be built and established; 
verse:21:28 for a fire has gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon. It has devoured Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of the Arnon. 
verse:21:29 Woe to you, Moab! You are undone, people of Chemosh! He has given his sons as fugitives, and his daughters into captivity, to Sihon king of the Amorites. 
verse:21:30 We have shot at them. Heshbon has perished even to Dibon. We have laid waste even to Nophah, Which reaches to Medeba."
verse:21:31 Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites. 
verse:21:32 Moses sent to spy out Jazer; and they took its towns, and drove out the Amorites who were there. 
verse:21:33 They turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verse:21:34 HASHEM said to Moses, "Don't fear him: for I have delivered him into your hand, and all his people, and his land; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon."
verse:21:35 So they struck him, and his sons and all his people, until there was none left him remaining: and they possessed his land.
verse:22:1 The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho. 
verse:22:2 Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites. 
verse:22:3 Moab was very afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel. 
verse:22:4 Moab said to the elders of Midian, "Now this multitude will lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field."
Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time. 
verse:22:5 He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, "Behold, there is a people who came out from Egypt. Behold, they cover the surface of the earth, and they are staying opposite me. 
verse:22:6 Please come now therefore curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me: perhaps I shall prevail, that we may strike them, and that I may drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed."
verse:22:7 The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand; and they came to Balaam, and spoke to him the words of Balak. 
verse:22:8 He said to them, "Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as HASHEM shall speak to me." The princes of Moab stayed with Balaam. 
verse:22:9 God came to Balaam, and said, "Who are these men with you?" 
verse:22:10 Balaam said to God, "Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has said to me, 
verse:22:11 'Behold, the people that has come out of Egypt, it covers the surface of the earth: now, come curse me them; perhaps I shall be able to fight against them, and shall drive them out.'"
verse:22:12 God said to Balaam, "You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people; for they are blessed."
portion:Numbers 22:13 - 22:38
verse:22:13 Balaam rose up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, "Go to your land; for HASHEM refuses to permit me to go with you."
verse:22:14 The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak, and said, "Balaam refuses to come with us."
verse:22:15 Balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honorable than they. 
verse:22:16 They came to Balaam, and said to him, "Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, 'Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me: 
verse:22:17 for I will promote you to very great honor, and whatever you say to me I will do. Please come therefore, and curse this people for me.'"
verse:22:18 Balaam answered the servants of Balak, "If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can't go beyond the word of HASHEM my God, to do less or more. 
verse:22:19 Now therefore, please wait also here this night, that I may know what HASHEM will speak to me more."
verse:22:20 God came to Balaam at night, and said to him, "If the men have come to call you, rise up, go with them; but only the word which I speak to you, that you shall do."
verse:22:21 Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab. 
verse:22:22 God's anger was kindled because he went; and the angel of HASHEM placed himself in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him. 
verse:22:23 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and the donkey turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the way. 
verse:22:24 Then the angel of HASHEM stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side. 
verse:22:25 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM, and she thrust herself to the wall, and crushed Balaam's foot against the wall: and he struck her again.
verse:22:26 The angel of HASHEM went further, and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left. 
verse:22:27 The donkey saw the angel of HASHEM, and she lay down under Balaam: and Balaam's anger was kindled, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verse:22:28 HASHEM opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, "What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?"
verse:22:29 Balaam said to the donkey, "Because you have mocked me, I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now I would have killed you."
verse:22:30 The donkey said to Balaam, "Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long to this day? Was I ever in the habit of doing so to you?"
He said, "No."
verse:22:31 Then HASHEM opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of HASHEM standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed his head, and fell on his face. 
verse:22:32 The angel of HASHEM said to him, "Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come forth as an adversary, because your way is perverse before me: 
verse:22:33 and the donkey saw me, and turned aside before me these three times. Unless she had turned aside from me, surely now I would have killed you, and saved her alive."
verse:22:34 Balaam said to the angel of HASHEM, "I have sinned; for I didn't know that you stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases you, I will go back again."
verse:22:35 The angel of HASHEM said to Balaam, "Go with the men; but only the word that I shall speak to you, that you shall speak."
So Balaam went with the princes of Balak. 
verse:22:36 When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him to the City of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, which is in the utmost part of the border. 
verse:22:37 Balak said to Balaam, "Didn't I earnestly send to you to call you? Why didn't you come to me? Am I not able indeed to promote you to honor?"
verse:22:38 Balaam said to Balak, "Behold, I have come to you: have I now any power at all to speak anything? The word that God puts in my mouth, that shall I speak."
portion:Numbers 22:39 - 23:26
verse:22:39 Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth. 
verse:22:40 Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him. 
verse:22:41 It happened in the morning, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal; and he saw from there the utmost part of the people.
verse:23:1 Balaam said to Balak, "Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bulls and seven rams."
verse:23:2 Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram. 
verse:23:3 Balaam said to Balak, "Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go: perhaps HASHEM will come to meet me; and whatever he shows me I will tell you."
He went to a bare height. 
verse:23:4 God met Balaam: and he said to him, "I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on every altar."
verse:23:5 HASHEM put a word in Balaam's mouth, and said, "Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak."
verse:23:6 He returned to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab. 
verse:23:7 He took up his parable, and said, "From Aram has Balak brought me, the king of Moab from the mountains of the East. Come, curse Jacob for me. Come, defy Israel. 
verse:23:8 How shall I curse whom God has not cursed? How shall I defy whom HASHEM has not defied? 
verse:23:9 For from the top of the rocks I see him. From the hills I see him. Behold, it is a people that dwells alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations. 
verse:23:10 Who can count the dust of Jacob, or number the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous! Let my last end be like his!"
verse:23:11 Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed them altogether."
verse:23:12 He answered and said, "Must I not take heed to speak that which HASHEM puts in my mouth?"
verse:23:13 Balak said to him, "Please come with me to another place, where you may see them; you shall see but the utmost part of them, and shall not see them all: and curse me them from there."
verse:23:14 He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar. 
verse:23:15 He said to Balak, "Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet over there."
verse:23:16 HASHEM met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, "Return to Balak, and say this."
verse:23:17 He came to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. Balak said to him, "What has HASHEM spoken?"
verse:23:18 He took up his parable, and said, "Rise up, Balak, and hear! Listen to me, you son of Zippor. 
verse:23:19 God is not a man, that he should lie, nor the son of man, that he should repent. Has he said, and will he not do it? Or has he spoken, and will he not make it good? 
verse:23:20 Behold, I have received a command to bless. He has blessed, and I can't reverse it. 
verse:23:21 He has not seen iniquity in Jacob. Neither has he seen perverseness in Israel. HASHEM his God is with him. The shout of a king is among them. 
verse:23:22 God brings them out of Egypt. He has as it were the strength of the wild ox. 
verse:23:23 Surely there is no enchantment with Jacob; Neither is there any divination with Israel. Now it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What has God done! 
verse:23:24 Behold, the people rises up as a lioness, As a lion he lifts himself up. He shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drinks the blood of the slain."
verse:23:25 Balak said to Balaam, "Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all."
verse:23:26 But Balaam answered Balak, "Didn't I tell you, saying, 'All that HASHEM speaks, that I must do?'"
portion:Numbers 23:27 - 25:9
verse:23:27 Balak said to Balaam, "Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse me them from there."
verse:23:28 Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that looks down on the desert. 
verse:23:29 Balaam said to Balak, "Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bulls and seven rams."
verse:23:30 Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verse:24:1 When Balaam saw that it pleased HASHEM to bless Israel, he didn't go, as at the other times, to meet with enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness. 
verse:24:2 Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came on him. 
verse:24:3 He took up his parable, and said, "Balaam the son of Beor says, the man whose eye was closed says; 
verse:24:4 he says, who hears the words of God, who sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down, and having his eyes open: 
verse:24:5 How goodly are your tents, Jacob, and your tents, Israel! 
verse:24:6 As valleys they are spread forth, as gardens by the riverside, as aloes which HASHEM has planted, as cedar trees beside the waters. 
verse:24:7 Water shall flow from his buckets. His seed shall be in many waters. His king shall be higher than Agag. His kingdom shall be exalted. 
verse:24:8 God brings him out of Egypt. He has as it were the strength of the wild ox. He shall eat up the nations his adversaries, shall break their bones in pieces, and pierce them with his arrows. 
verse:24:9 He couched, he lay down as a lion, as a lioness; who shall rouse him up? Everyone who blesses you is blessed. Everyone who curses you is cursed."
verse:24:10 Balak's anger was kindled against Balaam, and he struck his hands together; and Balak said to Balaam, "I called you to curse my enemies, and, behold, you have altogether blessed them these three times. 
verse:24:11 Therefore now flee you to your place! I thought to promote you to great honor; but, behold, HASHEM has kept you back from honor."
verse:24:12 Balaam said to Balak, "Didn't I also tell your messengers who you sent to me, saying, 
verse:24:13 'If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can't go beyond the word of HASHEM, to do either good or bad of my own mind. I will say what HASHEM says'? 
verse:24:14 Now, behold, I go to my people: come, I will inform you what this people shall do to your people in the latter days."
verse:24:15 He took up his parable, and said, "Balaam the son of Beor says, the man whose eye was closed says; 
verse:24:16 he says, who hears the words of God, knows the knowledge of the Most High, and who sees the vision of the Almighty, Falling down, and having his eyes open: 
verse:24:17 I see him, but not now. I see him, but not near. A star will come out of Jacob. A scepter will rise out of Israel, and shall strike through the corners of Moab, and break down all the sons of Sheth.
