verse:34:10 "'You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham; 
verse:34:11 and the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall go down, and shall reach to the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward; 
verse:34:12 and the border shall go down to the Jordan, and the goings out of it shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders around it.'"
verse:34:13 Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, "This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which HASHEM has commanded to give to the nine tribes, and to the half-tribe; 
verse:34:14 for the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their fathers' houses, and the tribe of the children of Gad according to their fathers' houses, have received, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received, their inheritance: 
verse:34:15 the two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise."
verse:34:16 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:34:17 "These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun. 
verse:34:18 You shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land for inheritance. 
verse:34:19 These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh. 
verse:34:20 Of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud. 
verse:34:21 Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon. 
verse:34:22 Of the tribe of the children of Dan a prince, Bukki the son of Jogli. 
verse:34:23 Of the children of Joseph: of the tribe of the children of Manasseh a prince, Hanniel the son of Ephod. 
verse:34:24 Of the tribe of the children of Ephraim a prince, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan. 
verse:34:25 Of the tribe of the children of Zebulun a prince, Elizaphan the son of Parnach. 
verse:34:26 Of the tribe of the children of Issachar a prince, Paltiel the son of Azzan. 
verse:34:27 Of the tribe of the children of Asher a prince, Ahihud the son of Shelomi. 
verse:34:28 Of the tribe of the children of Naphtali a prince, Pedahel the son of Ammihud." 
verse:34:29 These are they whom HASHEM commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
verse:35:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying, 
verse:35:2 "Command the children of Israel that they give to the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and you shall give suburbs for the cities around them to the Levites. 
verse:35:3 The cities shall they have to dwell in; and their suburbs shall be for their livestock, and for their substance, and for all their animals.
verse:35:4 "The suburbs of the cities, which you shall give to the Levites, shall be from the wall of the city and outward one thousand cubits around it. 
verse:35:5 You shall measure outside of the city for the east side two thousand cubits, and for the south side two thousand cubits, and for the west side two thousand cubits, and for the north side two thousand cubits, the city being in the midst. This shall be to them the suburbs of the cities.
verse:35:6 "The cities which you shall give to the Levites, they shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the manslayer to flee to: and besides them you shall give forty-two cities. 
verse:35:7 All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities together with their suburbs. 
verse:35:8 Concerning the cities which you shall give of the possession of the children of Israel, from the many you shall take many; and from the few you shall take few: everyone according to his inheritance which he inherits shall give of his cities to the Levites." 
verse:35:9 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:35:10 "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, 'When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan, 
verse:35:11 then you shall appoint you cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the manslayer who kills any person unwittingly may flee there. 
verse:35:12 The cities shall be to you for refuge from the avenger, that the manslayer not die, until he stands before the congregation for judgment. 
verse:35:13 The cities which you shall give shall be for you six cities of refuge. 
verse:35:14 You shall give three cities beyond the Jordan, and you shall give three cities in the land of Canaan; they shall be cities of refuge. 
verse:35:15 For the children of Israel, and for the stranger and for the foreigner living among them, shall these six cities be for refuge; that everyone who kills any person unwittingly may flee there.
verse:35:16 "'But if he struck him with an instrument of iron, so that he died, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death. 
verse:35:17 If he struck him with a stone in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death. 
verse:35:18 Or if he struck him with a weapon of wood in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death. 
verse:35:19 The avenger of blood shall himself put the murderer to death: when he meets him, he shall put him to death. 
verse:35:20 If he thrust him of hatred, or hurled at him, lying in wait, so that he died, 
verse:35:21 or in enmity struck him with his hand, so that he died; he who struck him shall surely be put to death; he is a murderer: the avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death, when he meets him.
verse:35:22 "'But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or hurled on him anything without lying in wait, 
verse:35:23 or with any stone, by which a man may die, not seeing him, and cast it on him, so that he died, and he was not his enemy, neither sought his harm; 
verse:35:24 then the congregation shall judge between the striker and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances; 
verse:35:25 and the congregation shall deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge, where he was fled: and he shall dwell therein until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
verse:35:26 "'But if the manslayer shall at any time go beyond the border of his city of refuge, where he flees, 
verse:35:27 and the avenger of blood find him outside of the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kill the manslayer; he shall not be guilty of blood, 
verse:35:28 because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest the manslayer shall return into the land of his possession.
verse:35:29 "'These things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verse:35:30 "'Whoever kills any person, the murderer shall be slain at the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person that he die.
verse:35:31 "'Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death; but he shall surely be put to death.
verse:35:32 "'You shall take no ransom for him who is fled to his city of refuge, that he may come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.
verse:35:33 "'So you shall not pollute the land in which you are: for blood, it pollutes the land; and no expiation can be made for the land for the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him who shed it. 
verse:35:34 You shall not defile the land which you inhabit, in the midst of which I dwell: for I, HASHEM, dwell in the midst of the children of Israel.'"
verse:36:1 The heads of the fathers' households of the family of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spoke before Moses, and before the princes, the heads of the fathers' households of the children of Israel: 
verse:36:2 and they said, "HASHEM commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commanded by HASHEM to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters. 
verse:36:3 If they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong: so will it be taken away from the lot of our inheritance. 
verse:36:4 When the jubilee of the children of Israel shall be, then will their inheritance be added to the inheritance of the tribe whereunto they shall belong: so will their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers."
verse:36:5 Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of HASHEM, saying, "The tribe of the sons of Joseph speaks right. 
verse:36:6 This is the thing which HASHEM does command concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them be married to whom they think best; only into the family of the tribe of their father shall they be married. 
verse:36:7 So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall all keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers. 
verse:36:8 Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may possess every man the inheritance of his fathers. 
verse:36:9 So shall no inheritance remove from one tribe to another tribe; for the tribes of the children of Israel shall each keep his own inheritance."
verse:36:10 The daughters of Zelophehad did as HASHEM commanded Moses: 
verse:36:11 for Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their father's brothers' sons. 
verse:36:12 They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father. 
verse:36:13 These are the commandments and the ordinances which HASHEM commanded by Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho. 
portion:Deuteronomy 29:9 - 29:28
verse:29:9 You stand this day all of you before HASHEM your God; your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the men of Israel, 
verse:29:10 your little ones, your wives, and your foreigner who is in the midst of your camps, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water; 
verse:29:11 that you may enter into the covenant of HASHEM your God, and into his oath, which HASHEM your God makes with you this day; 
verse:29:12 that he may establish you this day to himself for a people, and that he may be to you a God, as he spoke to you, and as he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob. 
verse:29:13 Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath, 
verse:29:14 but with him who stands here with us this day before HASHEM our God, and also with him who is not here with us this day 
verse:29:15 (for you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the midst of the nations through which you passed; 
verse:29:16 and you have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them); 
verse:29:17 lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turns away this day from HASHEM our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that bears gall and wormwood; 
verse:29:18 and it happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, "I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry." 
verse:29:19 HASHEM will not pardon him, but then the anger of HASHEM and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the curse that is written in this book shall lie on him, and HASHEM will blot out his name from under the sky. 
verse:29:20 HASHEM will set him apart to evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that is written in this scroll of the Torah.
verse:29:21 The generation to come, your children who shall rise up after you, and the foreigner who shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses with which HASHEM has made it sick; 
verse:29:22 and that the whole land of it is sulfur, salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor bears, nor any grass grows therein, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which HASHEM overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath: 
verse:29:23 even all the nations shall say, "Why has HASHEM done thus to this land? What does the heat of this great anger mean?"
verse:29:24 Then men shall say, "Because they forsook the covenant of HASHEM, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, 
verse:29:25 and went and served other gods, and worshiped them, gods that they didn't know, and that he had not given to them: 
verse:29:26 therefore the anger of HASHEM was kindled against this land, to bring on it all the curse that is written in this book; 
verse:29:27 and HASHEM rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as at this day."
verse:29:28 The secret things belong to HASHEM our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
portion:Deuteronomy 30:7 - 30:14
verse:30:7 HASHEM your God will put all these curses on your enemies, and on those who hate you, who persecuted you. 
verse:30:8 You shall return and obey the voice of HASHEM, and do all his commandments which I command you this day. 
verse:30:9 HASHEM your God will make you plenteous in all the work of your hand, in the fruit of your body, and in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground, for good: for HASHEM will again rejoice over you for good, as he rejoiced over your fathers; 
verse:30:10 if you shall obey the voice of HASHEM your God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this scroll of the Torah; if you turn to HASHEM your God with all your heart, and with all your soul.
verse:30:11 For this commandment which I command you this day, it is not too hard for you, neither is it far off. 
verse:30:12 It is not in heaven, that you should say, "Who shall go up for us to heaven, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?" 
verse:30:13 Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, "Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?" 
verse:30:14 But the word is very near to you, in your mouth, and in your heart, that you may do it.
portion:Deuteronomy 30:15 - 31:6
verse:30:15 Behold, I have set before you this day life and good, and death and evil; 
verse:30:16 in that I command you this day to love HASHEM your God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes and his ordinances, that you may live and multiply, and that HASHEM your God may bless you in the land where you go in to possess it. 
verse:30:17 But if your heart turns away, and you will not hear, but shall be drawn away, and worship other gods, and serve them; 
verse:30:18 I denounce to you this day, that you shall surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land, where you pass over the Jordan to go in to possess it. 
verse:30:19 I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that I have set before you life and death, the blessing and the curse: therefore choose life, that you may live, you and your seed; 
verse:30:20 to love HASHEM your God, to obey his voice, and to cling to him; for he is your life, and the length of your days; that you may dwell in the land which HASHEM swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.
verse:31:1 Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel. 
verse:31:2 He said to them, "I am one hundred twenty years old this day; I can no more go out and come in: and HASHEM has said to me, 'You shall not go over this Jordan.' 
verse:31:3 HASHEM your God, he will go over before you; he will destroy these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua shall go over before you, as HASHEM has spoken. 
verse:31:4 HASHEM will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land; whom he destroyed. 
verse:31:5 HASHEM will deliver them up before you, and you shall do to them according to all the commandment which I have commanded you. 
verse:31:6 Be strong and courageous, don't be afraid, nor be scared of them: for HASHEM your God, he it is who does go with you; he will not fail you, nor forsake you."
portion:Deuteronomy 31:7 - 31:13
verse:31:7 Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, "Be strong and courageous: for you shall go with this people into the land which HASHEM has sworn to their fathers to give them; and you shall cause them to inherit it. 
verse:31:8 HASHEM, he it is who does go before you; he will be with you, he will not fail you, neither forsake you: don't be afraid, neither be dismayed."
verse:31:9 Moses wrote this law, and delivered it to the priests the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, and to all the elders of Israel. 
verse:31:10 Moses commanded them, saying, "At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the feast of booths, 
verse:31:11 when all Israel has come to appear before HASHEM your God in the place which he shall choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing. 
verse:31:12 Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones, and your foreigner who is within your gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear HASHEM your God, and observe to do all the words of this law; 
verse:31:13 and that their children, who have not known, may hear, and learn to fear HASHEM your God, as long as you live in the land where you go over the Jordan to possess it."
portion:Deuteronomy 31:20 - 31:30
verse:31:20 For when I shall have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, flowing with milk and honey, and they shall have eaten and filled themselves, and grown fat; then will they turn to other gods, and serve them, and despise me, and break my covenant. 
verse:31:21 It shall happen, when many evils and troubles have come on them, that this song shall testify before them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they frame this day, before I have brought them into the land which I swore." 
verse:31:22 So Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.
verse:31:23 He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, "Be strong and courageous; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with you."
verse:31:24 It happened, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished, 
verse:31:25 that Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, saying, 
verse:31:26 "Take this scroll of the Torah, and put it by the side of the ark of the covenant of HASHEM your God, that it may be there for a witness against you. 
verse:31:27 For I know your rebellion, and your stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, you have been rebellious against HASHEM; and how much more after my death? 
verse:31:28 Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to witness against them. 
verse:31:29 For I know that after my death you will utterly corrupt yourselves, and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will happen to you in the latter days; because you will do that which is evil in the sight of HASHEM, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands."
verse:31:30 Moses spoke in the ears of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, until they were finished.
portion:Deuteronomy 29:9 - 31:30
verse:29:9 You stand this day all of you before HASHEM your God; your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the men of Israel, 
verse:29:10 your little ones, your wives, and your foreigner who is in the midst of your camps, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water; 
verse:29:11 that you may enter into the covenant of HASHEM your God, and into his oath, which HASHEM your God makes with you this day; 
verse:29:12 that he may establish you this day to himself for a people, and that he may be to you a God, as he spoke to you, and as he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob. 
verse:29:13 Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath, 
verse:29:14 but with him who stands here with us this day before HASHEM our God, and also with him who is not here with us this day 
verse:29:15 (for you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the midst of the nations through which you passed; 
verse:29:16 and you have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them); 
verse:29:17 lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turns away this day from HASHEM our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that bears gall and wormwood; 
verse:29:18 and it happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, "I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart, to destroy the moist with the dry." 
verse:29:19 HASHEM will not pardon him, but then the anger of HASHEM and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the curse that is written in this book shall lie on him, and HASHEM will blot out his name from under the sky. 
verse:29:20 HASHEM will set him apart to evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that is written in this scroll of the Torah.
verse:29:21 The generation to come, your children who shall rise up after you, and the foreigner who shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses with which HASHEM has made it sick; 
verse:29:22 and that the whole land of it is sulfur, salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor bears, nor any grass grows therein, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which HASHEM overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath: 
verse:29:23 even all the nations shall say, "Why has HASHEM done thus to this land? What does the heat of this great anger mean?"
verse:29:24 Then men shall say, "Because they forsook the covenant of HASHEM, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, 
verse:29:25 and went and served other gods, and worshiped them, gods that they didn't know, and that he had not given to them: 
verse:29:26 therefore the anger of HASHEM was kindled against this land, to bring on it all the curse that is written in this book; 
verse:29:27 and HASHEM rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as at this day."
verse:29:28 The secret things belong to HASHEM our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
verse:30:1 It shall happen, when all these things have come on you, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before you, and you shall call them to mind among all the nations, where HASHEM your God has driven you, 
verse:30:2 and shall return to HASHEM your God, and shall obey his voice according to all that I command you this day, you and your children, with all your heart, and with all your soul; 
verse:30:3 that then HASHEM your God will turn your captivity, and have compassion on you, and will return and gather you from all the peoples, where HASHEM your God has scattered you. 
verse:30:4 If your outcasts are in the uttermost parts of the heavens, from there will HASHEM your God gather you, and from there he will bring you back: 
verse:30:5 and HASHEM your God will bring you into the land which your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and he will do you good, and multiply you above your fathers. 
verse:30:6 HASHEM your God will circumcise your heart, and the heart of your seed, to love HASHEM your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, that you may live. 
verse:30:7 HASHEM your God will put all these curses on your enemies, and on those who hate you, who persecuted you. 
verse:30:8 You shall return and obey the voice of HASHEM, and do all his commandments which I command you this day. 
verse:30:9 HASHEM your God will make you plenteous in all the work of your hand, in the fruit of your body, and in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground, for good: for HASHEM will again rejoice over you for good, as he rejoiced over your fathers; 
verse:30:10 if you shall obey the voice of HASHEM your God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this scroll of the Torah; if you turn to HASHEM your God with all your heart, and with all your soul.
verse:30:11 For this commandment which I command you this day, it is not too hard for you, neither is it far off. 
verse:30:12 It is not in heaven, that you should say, "Who shall go up for us to heaven, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?" 
verse:30:13 Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, "Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?" 
verse:30:14 But the word is very near to you, in your mouth, and in your heart, that you may do it. 
verse:30:15 Behold, I have set before you this day life and good, and death and evil; 
verse:30:16 in that I command you this day to love HASHEM your God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes and his ordinances, that you may live and multiply, and that HASHEM your God may bless you in the land where you go in to possess it. 
verse:30:17 But if your heart turns away, and you will not hear, but shall be drawn away, and worship other gods, and serve them; 
verse:30:18 I denounce to you this day, that you shall surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land, where you pass over the Jordan to go in to possess it. 
verse:30:19 I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that I have set before you life and death, the blessing and the curse: therefore choose life, that you may live, you and your seed; 
verse:30:20 to love HASHEM your God, to obey his voice, and to cling to him; for he is your life, and the length of your days; that you may dwell in the land which HASHEM swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.
verse:31:1 Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel. 
verse:31:2 He said to them, "I am one hundred twenty years old this day; I can no more go out and come in: and HASHEM has said to me, 'You shall not go over this Jordan.' 
verse:31:3 HASHEM your God, he will go over before you; he will destroy these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua shall go over before you, as HASHEM has spoken. 
verse:31:4 HASHEM will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land; whom he destroyed. 
verse:31:5 HASHEM will deliver them up before you, and you shall do to them according to all the commandment which I have commanded you. 
verse:31:6 Be strong and courageous, don't be afraid, nor be scared of them: for HASHEM your God, he it is who does go with you; he will not fail you, nor forsake you."
verse:31:7 Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, "Be strong and courageous: for you shall go with this people into the land which HASHEM has sworn to their fathers to give them; and you shall cause them to inherit it. 
verse:31:8 HASHEM, he it is who does go before you; he will be with you, he will not fail you, neither forsake you: don't be afraid, neither be dismayed."
verse:31:9 Moses wrote this law, and delivered it to the priests the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, and to all the elders of Israel. 
verse:31:10 Moses commanded them, saying, "At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the feast of booths, 
verse:31:11 when all Israel has come to appear before HASHEM your God in the place which he shall choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing. 
verse:31:12 Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones, and your foreigner who is within your gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear HASHEM your God, and observe to do all the words of this law; 
verse:31:13 and that their children, who have not known, may hear, and learn to fear HASHEM your God, as long as you live in the land where you go over the Jordan to possess it."
verse:31:14 HASHEM said to Moses, "Behold, your days approach that you must die: call Joshua, and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may commission him." Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.
verse:31:15 HASHEM appeared in the Tent in a pillar of cloud: and the pillar of cloud stood over the door of the Tent. 
verse:31:16 HASHEM said to Moses, "Behold, you shall sleep with your fathers; and this people will rise up, and play the prostitute after the strange gods of the land, where they go to be among them, and will forsake me, and break my covenant which I have made with them. 
verse:31:17 Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall come on them; so that they will say in that day, 'Haven't these evils come on us because our God is not among us?' 
verse:31:18 I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they shall have worked, in that they are turned to other gods.
verse:31:19 "Now therefore write this song for yourselves, and teach it to the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel. 
verse:31:20 For when I shall have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, flowing with milk and honey, and they shall have eaten and filled themselves, and grown fat; then will they turn to other gods, and serve them, and despise me, and break my covenant. 
verse:31:21 It shall happen, when many evils and troubles have come on them, that this song shall testify before them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they frame this day, before I have brought them into the land which I swore." 
verse:31:22 So Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it the children of Israel.
verse:31:23 He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, "Be strong and courageous; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with you."
verse:31:24 It happened, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished, 
verse:31:25 that Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, saying, 
verse:31:26 "Take this scroll of the Torah, and put it by the side of the ark of the covenant of HASHEM your God, that it may be there for a witness against you. 
verse:31:27 For I know your rebellion, and your stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, you have been rebellious against HASHEM; and how much more after my death? 
verse:31:28 Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to witness against them. 
verse:31:29 For I know that after my death you will utterly corrupt yourselves, and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will happen to you in the latter days; because you will do that which is evil in the sight of HASHEM, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands."
verse:31:30 Moses spoke in the ears of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, until they were finished.
portion:Genesis 21:1 - 21:4
verse:21:1 HASHEM visited Sarah as he had said, and HASHEM did to Sarah as he had spoken. 
verse:21:2 Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him. 
verse:21:3 Abraham called his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac. 
verse:21:4 Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him.
portion:Genesis 21:5 - 21:12
verse:21:5 Abraham was one hundred years old when his son, Isaac, was born to him. 
verse:21:6 Sarah said, "God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears will laugh with me." 
verse:21:7 She said, "Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age."
verse:21:8 The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned. 
verse:21:9 Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking. 
verse:21:10 Therefore she said to Abraham, "Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, Isaac."
verse:21:11 The thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight on account of his son. 
verse:21:12 God said to Abraham, "Don't let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called.
portion:Genesis 21:13 - 21:21
verse:21:13 I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed." 
verse:21:14 Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder; and gave her the child, and sent her away. She departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba. 
verse:21:15 The water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs. 
verse:21:16 She went and sat down opposite him, a good way off, about a bow shot away. For she said, "Don't let me see the death of the child." She sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept. 
verse:21:17 God heard the voice of the boy.
The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, "What ails you, Hagar? Don't be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is. 
verse:21:18 Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation."
verse:21:19 God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went, filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink. 
verse:21:20 God was with the boy, and he grew. He lived in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer. 
verse:21:21 He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.
portion:Genesis 21:22 - 21:27
verse:21:22 It happened at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in all that you do. 
verse:21:23 Now, therefore, swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son. But according to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall do to me, and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner."
verse:21:24 Abraham said, "I will swear." 
verse:21:25 Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away. 
verse:21:26 Abimelech said, "I don't know who has done this thing. You didn't tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today."
verse:21:27 Abraham took sheep and cattle, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant.
portion:Genesis 21:28 - 21:34
verse:21:28 Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves. 
verse:21:29 Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"
verse:21:30 He said, "You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well." 
verse:21:31 Therefore he called that place Beersheba, because they both swore there. 
verse:21:32 So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines. 
verse:21:33 Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and called there on the name of HASHEM, the Everlasting God. 
verse:21:34 Abraham lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines many days.
portion:Numbers 29:1 - 29:6
verse:29:1 "'In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing of shofars to you. 
verse:29:2 You shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish; 
verse:29:3 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenth parts for the bull, two tenth parts for the ram, 
verse:29:4 and one tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs; 
verse:29:5 and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you; 
verse:29:6 besides the burnt offering of the new moon, and the meal offering of it, and the continual burnt offering and the meal offering of it, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
portion:Genesis 21:1 - 21:34; Numbers 29:1 - 29:6
verse:21:1 HASHEM visited Sarah as he had said, and HASHEM did to Sarah as he had spoken. 
verse:21:2 Sarah conceived, and bore Abraham a son in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken to him. 
verse:21:3 Abraham called his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore to him, Isaac. 
verse:21:4 Abraham circumcised his son, Isaac, when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him. 
verse:21:5 Abraham was one hundred years old when his son, Isaac, was born to him. 
verse:21:6 Sarah said, "God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears will laugh with me." 
verse:21:7 She said, "Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age."
verse:21:8 The child grew, and was weaned. Abraham made a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned. 
verse:21:9 Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, whom she had borne to Abraham, mocking. 
verse:21:10 Therefore she said to Abraham, "Cast out this handmaid and her son! For the son of this handmaid will not be heir with my son, Isaac."
verse:21:11 The thing was very grievous in Abraham's sight on account of his son. 
verse:21:12 God said to Abraham, "Don't let it be grievous in your sight because of the boy, and because of your handmaid. In all that Sarah says to you, listen to her voice. For from Isaac will your seed be called. 
verse:21:13 I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed." 
verse:21:14 Abraham rose up early in the morning, and took bread and a bottle of water, and gave it to Hagar, putting it on her shoulder; and gave her the child, and sent her away. She departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba. 
verse:21:15 The water in the bottle was spent, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs. 
verse:21:16 She went and sat down opposite him, a good way off, about a bow shot away. For she said, "Don't let me see the death of the child." She sat over against him, and lifted up her voice, and wept. 
verse:21:17 God heard the voice of the boy.
The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, "What ails you, Hagar? Don't be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is. 
verse:21:18 Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation."
verse:21:19 God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. She went, filled the bottle with water, and gave the boy drink. 
verse:21:20 God was with the boy, and he grew. He lived in the wilderness, and became, as he grew up, an archer. 
verse:21:21 He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.
verse:21:22 It happened at that time, that Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army spoke to Abraham, saying, "God is with you in all that you do. 
verse:21:23 Now, therefore, swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son. But according to the kindness that I have done to you, you shall do to me, and to the land in which you have lived as a foreigner."
verse:21:24 Abraham said, "I will swear." 
verse:21:25 Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away. 
verse:21:26 Abimelech said, "I don't know who has done this thing. You didn't tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today."
verse:21:27 Abraham took sheep and cattle, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant. 
verse:21:28 Abraham set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves. 
verse:21:29 Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"
verse:21:30 He said, "You shall take these seven ewe lambs from my hand, that it may be a witness to me, that I have dug this well." 
verse:21:31 Therefore he called that place Beersheba, because they both swore there. 
verse:21:32 So they made a covenant at Beersheba. Abimelech rose up with Phicol, the captain of his army, and they returned into the land of the Philistines. 
verse:21:33 Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and called there on the name of HASHEM, the Everlasting God. 
verse:21:34 Abraham lived as a foreigner in the land of the Philistines many days.
Numbers 
verse:29:1 "'In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing of shofars to you. 
verse:29:2 You shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish; 
verse:29:3 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenth parts for the bull, two tenth parts for the ram, 
verse:29:4 and one tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs; 
verse:29:5 and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you; 
verse:29:6 besides the burnt offering of the new moon, and the meal offering of it, and the continual burnt offering and the meal offering of it, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
portion:Exodus 35:1 - 40:38
verse:35:1 Moses assembled all the congregation of the children of Israel, and said to them, "These are the words which HASHEM has commanded, that you should do them. 
verse:35:2 'Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of solemn rest to HASHEM: whoever does any work in it shall be put to death. 
verse:35:3 You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations on the Sabbath day.'"
verse:35:4 Moses spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, "This is the thing which HASHEM commanded, saying, 
verse:35:5 'Take from among you an offering to HASHEM. Whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, HASHEM's offering: gold, silver, brass, 
verse:35:6 blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, 
verse:35:7 rams' skins dyed red, sea cow hides, acacia wood, 
verse:35:8 oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense, 
verse:35:9 onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.
verse:35:10 "'Let every wise-hearted man among you come, and make all that HASHEM has commanded: 
verse:35:11 the tabernacle, its outer covering, its roof, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets; 
verse:35:12 the ark, and its poles, the mercy seat, the veil of the screen; 
verse:35:13 the table with its poles and all its vessels, and the show bread; 
verse:35:14 the menorah also for the light, with its vessels, its lamps, and the oil for the light; 
verse:35:15 and the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle; 
verse:35:16 the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base; 
verse:35:17 the hangings of the court, its pillars, their sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court; 
verse:35:18 the pins of the tabernacle, the pins of the court, and their cords; 
verse:35:19 the finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.'"
verse:35:20 All the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses. 
verse:35:21 They came, everyone whose heart stirred him up, and everyone whom his spirit made willing, and brought HASHEM's offering, for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all of its service, and for the holy garments. 
verse:35:22 They came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, and brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, and armlets, all jewels of gold; even every man who offered an offering of gold to HASHEM. 
verse:35:23 Everyone, with whom was found blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, and sea cow hides, brought them. 
verse:35:24 Everyone who offered an offering of silver and brass brought HASHEM's offering; and everyone, with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it. 
verse:35:25 All the women who were wise-hearted spun with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen. 
verse:35:26 All the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats' hair. 
verse:35:27 The rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastplate; 
verse:35:28 and the spice, and the oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense. 
verse:35:29 The children of Israel brought a freewill offering to HASHEM; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which HASHEM had commanded to be made by Moses.
verse:35:30 Moses said to the children of Israel, "Behold, HASHEM has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah. 
verse:35:31 He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all kinds of workmanship; 
verse:35:32 and to make skillful works, to work in gold, in silver, in brass, 
verse:35:33 in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of skillful workmanship. 
verse:35:34 He has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan. 
verse:35:35 He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all kinds of workmanship, of the engraver, of the skillful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship, and of those who make skillful works.
verse:36:1 "Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every wise-hearted man, in whom HASHEM has put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that HASHEM has commanded."
verse:36:2 Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart HASHEM had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it: 
verse:36:3 and they received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, with which to make it. They brought yet to him freewill offerings every morning. 
verse:36:4 All the wise men, who performed all the work of the sanctuary, each came from his work which they did. 
verse:36:5 They spoke to Moses, saying, "The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which HASHEM commanded to make."
verse:36:6 Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, "Let neither man nor woman make anything else for the offering for the sanctuary." So the people were restrained from bringing. 
verse:36:7 For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
verse:36:8 All the wise-hearted men among those who did the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet, with cherubim, the work of the skillful workman, they made them. 
verse:36:9 The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure. 
verse:36:10 He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled one to another. 
verse:36:11 He made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain from the edge in the coupling. Likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling. 
verse:36:12 He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling. The loops were opposite one to another. 
verse:36:13 He made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was a unit.
verse:36:14 He made curtains of goats' hair for a covering over the tabernacle. He made them eleven curtains. 
verse:36:15 The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure. 
verse:36:16 He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves. 
verse:36:17 He made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling. 
verse:36:18 He made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be a unit. 
verse:36:19 He made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.
verse:36:20 He made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up. 
verse:36:21 Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board. 
verse:36:22 Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. He made all the boards of the tabernacle this way. 
verse:36:23 He made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward. 
verse:36:24 He made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons. 
verse:36:25 For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards, 
verse:36:26 and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board. 
verse:36:27 For the far part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards. 
verse:36:28 He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part. 
verse:36:29 They were double beneath, and in the same way they were all the way to its top to one ring. He did this to both of them in the two corners. 
verse:36:30 There were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.
verse:36:31 He made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle, 
verse:36:32 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward. 
verse:36:33 He made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other. 
verse:36:34 He overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
verse:36:35 He made the veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim. He made it the work of a skillful workman. 
verse:36:36 He made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold. He cast four sockets of silver for them. 
verse:36:37 He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer; 
verse:36:38 and the five pillars of it with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold, and their five sockets were of brass.
verse:37:1 Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height. 
verse:37:2 He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold for it around it. 
verse:37:3 He cast four rings of gold for it, in its four feet; even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its other side. 
verse:37:4 He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold. 
verse:37:5 He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark. 
verse:37:6 He made a mercy seat of pure gold. Its length was two and a half cubits, and a cubit and a half its breadth. 
verse:37:7 He made two cherubim of gold. He made them of beaten work, at the two ends of the mercy seat; 
verse:37:8 one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end. He made the cherubim of one piece with the mercy seat at its two ends. 
verse:37:9 The cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.
verse:37:10 He made the table of acacia wood. Its length was two cubits, and its breadth was a cubit, and its height was a cubit and a half. 
verse:37:11 He overlaid it with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it. 
verse:37:12 He made a border of a handbreadth around it, and made a golden molding on its border around it. 
verse:37:13 He cast four rings of gold for it, and put the rings in the four corners that were on its four feet. 
verse:37:14 The rings were close by the border, the places for the poles to carry the table. 
verse:37:15 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table. 
verse:37:16 He made the vessels which were on the table, its dishes, its spoons, its bowls, and its pitchers with which to pour out, of pure gold.
verse:37:17 He made the menorah of pure gold. He made the menorah of beaten work. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were of one piece with it. 
verse:37:18 There were six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the menorah out of its one side, and three branches of the menorah out of its other side: 
verse:37:19 three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the menorah. 
verse:37:20 In the menorah were four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers; 
verse:37:21 and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it. 
verse:37:22 Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold. 
verse:37:23 He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold. 
verse:37:24 He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
verse:37:25 He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. It was square: its length was a cubit, and its breadth a cubit. Its height was two cubits. Its horns were of one piece with it. 
verse:37:26 He overlaid it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns. He made a gold molding around it. 
verse:37:27 He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it. 
verse:37:28 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold. 
verse:37:29 He made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
verse:38:1 He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its breadth was five cubits, and its height was three cubits. 
verse:38:2 He made its horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with brass. 
verse:38:3 He made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans. He made all its vessels of brass. 
verse:38:4 He made for the altar a grating of a network of brass, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up. 
verse:38:5 He cast four rings for the four ends of brass grating, to be places for the poles. 
verse:38:6 He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with brass. 
verse:38:7 He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.
verse:38:8 He made the basin of brass, and its base of brass, out of the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verse:38:9 He made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits; 
verse:38:10 their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver. 
verse:38:11 For the north side one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:12 For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:13 For the east side eastward fifty cubits. 
verse:38:14 The hangings for the one side were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three; 
verse:38:15 and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three. 
verse:38:16 All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen. 
verse:38:17 The sockets for the pillars were of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals, of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver. 
verse:38:18 The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court. 
verse:38:19 Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver. 
verse:38:20 All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of brass.
verse:38:21 This is the amount of material used for the tabernacle, even the Tabernacle of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest. 
verse:38:22 Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:38:23 With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.
verse:38:24 All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents, and seven hundred thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary. 
verse:38:25 The silver of those who were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents, and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary: 
verse:38:26 a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men. 
verse:38:27 The one hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; one hundred sockets for the one hundred talents, a talent for a socket. 
verse:38:28 Of the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them. 
verse:38:29 The brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand four hundred shekels. 
verse:38:30 With this he made the sockets to the door of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, all the vessels of the altar, 
verse:38:31 the sockets around the court, the sockets of the gate of the court, all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins around the court.
verse:39:1 Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:2 He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. 
verse:39:3 They beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, in the purple, in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, the work of the skillful workman. 
verse:39:4 They made shoulder straps for it, joined together. At the two ends it was joined together. 
verse:39:5 The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:6 They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel. 
verse:39:7 He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:8 He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. 
verse:39:9 It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its breadth a span, being double. 
verse:39:10 They set in it four rows of stones. A row of ruby, topaz, and beryl was the first row; 
verse:39:11 and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald; 
verse:39:12 and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst; 
verse:39:13 and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings. 
verse:39:14 The stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, for the twelve tribes. 
verse:39:15 They made on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold. 
verse:39:16 They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate. 
verse:39:17 They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate. 
verse:39:18 The other two ends of the two braided chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, in its front. 
verse:39:19 They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which was toward the side of the ephod inward. 
verse:39:20 They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its front, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod. 
verse:39:21 They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:22 He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue. 
verse:39:23 The opening of the robe in its midst was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around its opening, that it should not be torn. 
verse:39:24 They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen. 
verse:39:25 They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates; 
verse:39:26 a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:27 They made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons, 
verse:39:28 and the turban of fine linen, and the linen headbands of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen, 
verse:39:29 and the sash of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:30 They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it a writing, like the engravings of a signet: "HOLY TO THE HASHEM." 
verse:39:31 They tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on the turban above, as HASHEM commanded Moses.
verse:39:32 Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that HASHEM commanded Moses; so they did. 
verse:39:33 They brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent, with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets, 
verse:39:34 the covering of rams' skins dyed red, the covering of sea cow hides, the veil of the screen, 
verse:39:35 the ark of the testimony with its poles, the mercy seat, 
verse:39:36 the table, all its vessels, the show bread, 
verse:39:37 the pure menorah, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light, 
verse:39:38 the golden altar, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door of the Tent, 
verse:39:39 the bronze altar, its grating of brass, its poles, all of its vessels, the basin and its base, 
verse:39:40 the hangings of the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pins, all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting, 
verse:39:41 the finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office. 
verse:39:42 According to all that HASHEM commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work. 
verse:39:43 Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as HASHEM had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
verse:40:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, saying, 
verse:40:2 "On the first day of the first month you shall raise up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:40:3 You shall put the ark of the testimony in it, and you shall screen the ark with the veil. 
verse:40:4 You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the menorah, and light its lamps. 
verse:40:5 You shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verse:40:6 "You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:40:7 You shall set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and shall put water therein. 
verse:40:8 You shall set up the court around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
verse:40:9 "You shall take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is in it, and shall make it holy, and all its furniture: and it will be holy. 
verse:40:10 You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering, with all its vessels, and sanctify the altar: and the altar will be most holy. 
verse:40:11 You shall anoint the basin and its base, and sanctify it.
verse:40:12 "You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall wash them with water. 
verse:40:13 You shall put on Aaron the holy garments; and you shall anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest's office. 
verse:40:14 You shall bring his sons, and put coats on them. 
verse:40:15 You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest's office. Their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations." 
verse:40:16 Moses did so. According to all that HASHEM commanded him, so he did.
verse:40:17 It happened in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was raised up. 
verse:40:18 Moses raised up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and raised up its pillars. 
verse:40:19 He spread the covering over the tent, and put the roof of the tabernacle above on it, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:20 He took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the poles on the ark, and put the mercy seat above on the ark. 
verse:40:21 He brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:22 He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the side of the tabernacle northward, outside of the veil. 
verse:40:23 He set the bread in order on it before HASHEM, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:24 He put the menorah in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward. 
verse:40:25 He lit the lamps before HASHEM, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:26 He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting before the veil; 
verse:40:27 and he burnt incense of sweet spices on it, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:28 He put up the screen of the door to the tabernacle. 
verse:40:29 He set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the meal offering, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:30 He set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash. 
verse:40:31 Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and their feet there. 
verse:40:32 When they went into the Tent of Meeting, and when they came near to the altar, they washed, as HASHEM commanded Moses. 
verse:40:33 He raised up the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verse:40:34 Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of HASHEM filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:35 Moses wasn't able to enter into the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and HASHEM's glory filled the tabernacle. 
verse:40:36 When the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys; 
verse:40:37 but if the cloud wasn't taken up, then they didn't travel until the day that it was taken up. 
verse:40:38 For the cloud of HASHEM was on the tabernacle by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
portion:Leviticus 16:1 - 16:3
verse:16:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they drew near before HASHEM, and died; 
verse:16:2 and HASHEM said to Moses, "Tell Aaron your brother, not to come at all times into the Most Holy Place within the veil, before the mercy seat which is on the ark; lest he die: for I will appear in the cloud on the mercy seat.
verse:16:3 "Herewith shall Aaron come into the sanctuary: with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.
portion:Leviticus 16:4 - 16:6
verse:16:4 He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches on his body, and shall put on the linen sash, and he shall be clothed with the linen turban. They are the holy garments. He shall bathe his body in water, and put them on. 
verse:16:5 He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
verse:16:6 "Aaron shall offer the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house.
portion:Leviticus 16:7 - 16:11
verse:16:7 He shall take the two goats, and set them before HASHEM at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:16:8 Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats; one lot for HASHEM, and the other lot for the scapegoat. 
verse:16:9 Aaron shall present the goat on which the lot fell for HASHEM, and offer him for a sin offering. 
verse:16:10 But the goat, on which the lot fell for the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before HASHEM, to make atonement for him, to send him away for the scapegoat into the wilderness.
verse:16:11 "Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering which is for himself.
portion:Leviticus 16:12 - 16:17
verse:16:12 He shall take a censer full of coals of fire from off the altar before HASHEM, and two handfuls of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil: 
verse:16:13 and he shall put the incense on the fire before HASHEM, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the testimony, so that he will not die. 
verse:16:14 He shall take some of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the east; and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
verse:16:15 "Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with his blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it on the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat: 
verse:16:16 and he shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, even all their sins; and so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, that dwells with them in the midst of their uncleanness. 
verse:16:17 No one shall be in the Tent of Meeting when he enters to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out, and has made atonement for himself and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
portion:Leviticus 16:25 - 16:30
verse:16:25 The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
verse:16:26 "He who lets the goat go for the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp. 
verse:16:27 The bull for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried forth outside the camp; and they shall burn their skins, their flesh, and their dung with fire. 
verse:16:28 He who burns them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
verse:16:29 "It shall be a statute to you forever: in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall afflict your souls, and shall do no kind of work, the native-born, or the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you: 
verse:16:30 for on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins you shall be clean before HASHEM.
portion:Leviticus 16:31 - 16:34
verse:16:31 It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict your souls; it is a statute forever. 
verse:16:32 The priest, who is anointed and who is consecrated to be priest in his father's place, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen garments, even the holy garments. 
verse:16:33 Then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary; and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.
verse:16:34 "This shall be an everlasting statute for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel once in the year because of all their sins."
It was done as HASHEM commanded Moses.
portion:Numbers 29:7 - 29:11
verse:29:7 Then you shall take the anointing oil, and pour it on his head, and anoint him. 
verse:29:8 You shall bring his sons, and put coats on them. 
verse:29:9 You shall clothe them with belts, Aaron and his sons, and bind headbands on them: and they shall have the priesthood by a perpetual statute: and you shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.
verse:29:10 "You shall bring the bull before the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull. 
verse:29:11 You shall kill the bull before HASHEM, at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
portion:Leviticus 16:1 - 16:34
verse:16:1 HASHEM spoke to Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they drew near before HASHEM, and died; 
verse:16:2 and HASHEM said to Moses, "Tell Aaron your brother, not to come at all times into the Most Holy Place within the veil, before the mercy seat which is on the ark; lest he die: for I will appear in the cloud on the mercy seat.
verse:16:3 "Herewith shall Aaron come into the sanctuary: with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering. 
verse:16:4 He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches on his body, and shall put on the linen sash, and he shall be clothed with the linen turban. They are the holy garments. He shall bathe his body in water, and put them on. 
verse:16:5 He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
verse:16:6 "Aaron shall offer the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house. 
verse:16:7 He shall take the two goats, and set them before HASHEM at the door of the Tent of Meeting. 
verse:16:8 Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats; one lot for HASHEM, and the other lot for the scapegoat. 
verse:16:9 Aaron shall present the goat on which the lot fell for HASHEM, and offer him for a sin offering. 
verse:16:10 But the goat, on which the lot fell for the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before HASHEM, to make atonement for him, to send him away for the scapegoat into the wilderness.
verse:16:11 "Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering which is for himself. 
verse:16:12 He shall take a censer full of coals of fire from off the altar before HASHEM, and two handfuls of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil: 
verse:16:13 and he shall put the incense on the fire before HASHEM, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the testimony, so that he will not die. 
verse:16:14 He shall take some of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the east; and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
verse:16:15 "Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with his blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it on the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat: 
verse:16:16 and he shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, even all their sins; and so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, that dwells with them in the midst of their uncleanness. 
verse:16:17 No one shall be in the Tent of Meeting when he enters to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out, and has made atonement for himself and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
verse:16:18 "He shall go out to the altar that is before HASHEM and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the bull's blood, and some of the goat's blood, and put it around on the horns of the altar.
