verse:19:18 Mount Sinai, all it, smoked, because HASHEM descended on it in fire; and its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly. 
verse:19:19 When the sound of the shofar grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by a voice. 
verse:19:20 HASHEM came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain. HASHEM called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verse:19:21 HASHEM said to Moses, "Go down, warn the people, lest they break through to HASHEM to gaze, and many of them perish. 
verse:19:22 Let the priests also, who come near to HASHEM, sanctify themselves, lest HASHEM break forth on them."
verse:19:23 Moses said to HASHEM, "The people can't come up to Mount Sinai, for you warned us, saying, 'Set bounds around the mountain, and sanctify it.'"
Numbers 
verse:28:26 "'Also in the day of the first fruits, when you offer a new meal offering to HASHEM in your feast of weeks, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no servile work; 
verse:28:27 but you shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to HASHEM: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old; 
verse:28:28 and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenth parts for each bull, two tenth parts for the one ram, 
verse:28:29 a tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs; 
verse:28:30 one male goat, to make atonement for you. 
verse:28:31 Besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, you shall offer them (they shall be to you without blemish), and their drink offerings.
portion:Isaiah 42:5 - 43:10
verse:42:5 Thus says God HASHEM, he who created the heavens and stretched them out, he who spread out the earth and that which comes out of it, he who gives breath to its people and spirit to those who walk in it. 
verse:42:6 "I, HASHEM, have called you in righteousness, and will hold your hand, and will keep you, and make you a covenant for the people, as a light for the nations; 
verse:42:7 to open the blind eyes, to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon, and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.
verse:42:8 "I am HASHEM. That is my name. I will not give my glory to another, nor my praise to engraved images. 
verse:42:9 Behold, the former things have happened, and I declare new things. I tell you about them before they come up."
verse:42:10 Sing to HASHEM a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that is therein, the islands and their inhabitants. 
verse:42:11 Let the wilderness and its cities raise their voices, with the villages that Kedar inhabits. Let the inhabitants of Sela sing. Let them shout from the top of the mountains! 
verse:42:12 Let them give glory to HASHEM, and declare his praise in the islands. 
verse:42:13 HASHEM will go out like a mighty man. He will stir up zeal like a man of war. He will raise a war cry. Yes, he will shout aloud. He will triumph over his enemies.
verse:42:14 "I have been silent a long time. I have been quiet and restrained myself. Now I will cry out like a travailing woman. I will both gasp and pant. 
verse:42:15 I will destroy mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs. I will make the rivers islands, and will dry up the pools. 
verse:42:16 I will bring the blind by a way that they don't know. I will lead them in paths that they don't know. I will make darkness light before them, and crooked places straight. I will do these things, and I will not forsake them.
verse:42:17 "Those who trust in engraved images, who tell molten images, 'You are our gods' will be turned back. They will be utterly disappointed.
verse:42:18 "Hear, you deaf, and look, you blind, that you may see. 
verse:42:19 Who is blind, but my servant? Or who is as deaf as my messenger whom I send? Who is as blind as he who is at peace, and as blind as HASHEM's servant? 
verse:42:20 You see many things, but don't observe. His ears are open, but he doesn't listen. 
verse:42:21 It pleased HASHEM, for his righteousness' sake, to magnify the law, and make it honorable. 
verse:42:22 But this is a robbed and plundered people. All of them are snared in holes, and they are hidden in prisons. They have become a prey, and no one delivers; and a spoil, and no one says, 'Restore them!' 
verse:42:23 Who is there among you who will give ear to this? Who will listen and hear for the time to come? 
verse:42:24 Who gave Jacob as plunder, and Israel to the robbers? Didn't HASHEM, he against whom we have sinned? For they would not walk in his ways, and they disobeyed his law. 
verse:42:25 Therefore he poured the fierceness of his anger on him, and the strength of battle; and it set him on fire all around, but he didn't know; and it burned him, but he didn't take it to heart."
verse:43:1 But now thus says HASHEM who created you, Jacob, and he who formed you, Israel: "Don't be afraid, for I have redeemed you. I have called you by your name. You are mine. 
verse:43:2 When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and through the rivers, they will not overflow you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned, and flame will not scorch you. 
verse:43:3 For I am HASHEM your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I have given Egypt as your ransom, Ethiopia and Seba in your place. 
verse:43:4 Since you have been precious and honored in my sight, and I have loved you; therefore I will give people in your place, and nations instead of your life. 
verse:43:5 Don't be afraid; for I am with you. I will bring your seed from the east, and gather you from the west. 
verse:43:6 I will tell the north, 'Give them up!' and tell the south, 'Don't hold them back! Bring my sons from far, and my daughters from the ends of the earth-- 
verse:43:7 everyone who is called by my name, and whom I have created for my glory, whom I have formed, yes, whom I have made.'"
verse:43:8 Bring out the blind people who have eyes, and the deaf who have ears. 
verse:43:9 Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the peoples be assembled. Who among them can declare this, and show us former things? Let them bring their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear, and say, "That is true."
verse:43:10 "You are my witnesses," says HASHEM, "With my servant whom I have chosen; that you may know and believe me, and understand that I am he. Before me there was no God formed, neither will there be after me.
portion:Isaiah 54:1-55:5
verse:54:1 "Sing, barren, you who didn't bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, you who did not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife," says HASHEM. 
verse:54:2 "Enlarge the place of your tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of your habitations; don't spare: lengthen your cords, and strengthen your stakes. 
verse:54:3 For you shall spread out on the right hand and on the left; and your seed shall possess the nations, and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
verse:54:4 "Don't be afraid; for you shall not be ashamed: neither be confounded; for you shall not be disappointed: for you shall forget the shame of your youth; and the reproach of your widowhood you shall remember no more. 
verse:54:5 For your Maker is your husband; HASHEM of Hosts is his name: and the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer; the God of the whole earth shall he be called. 
verse:54:6 For HASHEM has called you as a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit, even a wife of youth, when she is cast off," says your God.
verse:54:7 "For a small moment have I forsaken you; but with great mercies will I gather you. 
verse:54:8 In overflowing wrath I hid my face from you for a moment; but with everlasting loving kindness will I have mercy on you," says HASHEM your Redeemer.
verse:54:9 "For this is like the waters of Noah to me; for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah shall no more go over the earth, so have I sworn that I will not be angry with you, nor rebuke you. 
verse:54:10 For the mountains may depart, and the hills be removed; but my loving kindness shall not depart from you, neither shall my covenant of peace be removed," says HASHEM who has mercy on you.
verse:54:11 "You afflicted, tossed with storms, and not comforted, behold, I will set your stones in beautiful colors, and lay your foundations with sapphires. 
verse:54:12 I will make your pinnacles of rubies, and your gates of sparkling jewels, and all your walls of precious stones. 
verse:54:13 All your children shall be taught of HASHEM; and great shall be the peace of your children. 
verse:54:14 In righteousness you shall be established: you shall be far from oppression, for you shall not be afraid; and from terror, for it shall not come near you. 
verse:54:15 Behold, they may gather together, but not by me: whoever shall gather together against you shall fall because of you.
verse:54:16 "Behold, I have created the smith who blows the fire of coals, and brings forth a weapon for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy. 
verse:54:17 No weapon that is formed against you will prevail; and you will condemn every tongue that rises against you in judgment. This is the heritage of the servants of HASHEM, and their righteousness which is of me," says HASHEM.
verse:55:1 "Come, everyone who thirsts, to the waters! Come, he who has no money, buy, and eat! Yes, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price. 
verse:55:2 Why do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labor for that which doesn't satisfy? listen diligently to me, and eat you that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness. 
verse:55:3 Turn your ear, and come to me; hear, and your soul shall live: and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David. 
verse:55:4 Behold, I have given him for a witness to the peoples, a leader and commander to the peoples. 
verse:55:5 Behold, you shall call a nation that you don't know; and a nation that didn't know you shall run to you, because of HASHEM your God, and for the Holy One of Israel; for he has glorified you."
portion:Isaiah 40:27 - 41:16
verse:40:27 Why do you say, Jacob, and speak, Israel, "My way is hidden from HASHEM, and the justice due me is disregarded by my God?" 
verse:40:28 Haven't you known? Haven't you heard? The everlasting God, HASHEM, The Creator of the ends of the earth, doesn't faint. He isn't weary. His understanding is unsearchable. 
verse:40:29 He gives power to the weak. He increases the strength of him who has no might. 
verse:40:30 Even the youths faint and get weary, and the young men utterly fall; 
verse:40:31 But those who wait for HASHEM will renew their strength. They will mount up with wings like eagles. They will run, and not be weary. They will walk, and not faint.
verse:41:1 "Keep silent before me, islands, and let the peoples renew their strength. Let them come near, then let them speak. Let's meet together for judgment. 
verse:41:2 Who has raised up one from the east? Who called him to his foot in righteousness? He hands over nations to him, and makes him rule over kings. He gives them like the dust to his sword, like the driven stubble to his bow. 
verse:41:3 He pursues them, and passes by safely, Even by a way that he had not gone with his feet. 
verse:41:4 Who has worked and done it, calling the generations from the beginning? I, HASHEM, the first, and with the last, I am he."
verse:41:5 The islands have seen, and fear. The ends of the earth tremble. They approach, and come. 
verse:41:6 Everyone helps his neighbor. They say to their brothers, "Be strong!" 
verse:41:7 So the carpenter encourages the goldsmith. He who smoothes with the hammer encourages him who strikes the anvil, saying of the soldering, "It is good;" and he fastens it with nails, that it might not totter. 
verse:41:8 "But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend, 
verse:41:9 You whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth, and called from its corners, and said to you, 'You are my servant, I have chosen you and not cast you away;' 
verse:41:10 Don't you be afraid, for I am with you. Don't be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you. Yes, I will help you. Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand of my righteousness. 
verse:41:11 Behold, all those who are incensed against you will be disappointed and confounded. Those who strive with you will be like nothing, and shall perish. 
verse:41:12 You will seek them, and won't find them, even those who contend with you. Those who war against you will be as nothing, as a non-existent thing. 
verse:41:13 For I, HASHEM your God, will hold your right hand, saying to you, 'Don't be afraid. I will help you.' 
verse:41:14 Don't be afraid, you worm Jacob, and you men of Israel. I will help you," says HASHEM, "and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel. 
verse:41:15 Behold, I have made you into a new sharp threshing instrument with teeth. You will thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and will make the hills like chaff. 
verse:41:16 You will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away, and the whirlwind will scatter them. You will rejoice in HASHEM. You will glory in the Holy One of Israel. 
portion:I Kings 1:1 - 1:31
verse:1:1 Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he couldn't keep warm. 
verse:1:2 Therefore his servants said to him, "Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin. Let her stand before the king, and cherish him; and let her lie in your bosom, that my lord the king may keep warm." 
verse:1:3 So they sought for a beautiful young lady throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king. 
verse:1:4 The young lady was very beautiful; and she cherished the king, and ministered to him; but the king didn't know her intimately. 
verse:1:5 Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, "I will be king." Then he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him. 
verse:1:6 His father had not displeased him at any time in saying, "Why have you done so?" and he was also a very handsome man; and he was born after Absalom. 
verse:1:7 He conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him. 
verse:1:8 But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men who belonged to David, were not with Adonijah. 
verse:1:9 Adonijah killed sheep and cattle and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth, which is beside En Rogel; and he called all his brothers, the king's sons, and all the men of Judah, the king's servants: 
verse:1:10 but Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he didn't call. 
verse:1:11 Then Nathan spoke to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, "Haven't you heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith reigns, and David our lord doesn't know it? 
verse:1:12 Now therefore come, please let me give you counsel, that you may save your own life, and the life of your son Solomon. 
verse:1:13 Go in to king David, and tell him, 'Didn't you, my lord, king, swear to your handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne? Why then does Adonijah reign?' 
verse:1:14 Behold, while you yet talk there with the king, I also will come in after you, and confirm your words."
verse:1:15 Bathsheba went in to the king into the room. The king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite was ministering to the king. 
verse:1:16 Bathsheba bowed, and showed respect to the king. The king said, "What would you like?" 
verse:1:17 She said to him, "My lord, you swore by HASHEM your God[ to your handmaid, 'Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne.' 
verse:1:18 Now, behold, Adonijah reigns; and you, my lord the king, don't know it. 
verse:1:19 He has slain cattle and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the army; but he hasn't called Solomon your servant. 
verse:1:20 You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him. 
verse:1:21 Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders."
verse:1:22 Behold, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet came in. 
verse:1:23 They told the king, saying, "Behold, Nathan the prophet!"
When he had come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground. 
verse:1:24 Nathan said, "My lord, king, have you said, 'Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?' 
verse:1:25 For he is gone down this day, and has slain cattle and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the king's sons, and the captains of the army, and Abiathar the priest. Behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and say, 'Long live king Adonijah!' 
verse:1:26 But he hasn't called me, even me your servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon. 
verse:1:27 Is this thing done by my lord the king, and you haven't shown to your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?"
verse:1:28 Then king David answered, "Call to me Bathsheba." She came into the king's presence, and stood before the king. 
verse:1:29 The king swore, and said, "As HASHEM lives, who has redeemed my soul out of all adversity, 
verse:1:30 most certainly as I swore to you by HASHEM, the God of Israel, saying, 'Assuredly Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place;' most certainly so will I do this day."
verse:1:31 Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and showed respect to the king, and said, "Let my lord king David live forever!"
portion:I Kings 2:1 - 2:12
verse:2:1 Now the days of David drew near that he should die; and he commanded Solomon his son, saying, 
verse:2:2 "I am going the way of all the earth. You be strong therefore, and show yourself a man; 
verse:2:3 and keep the instruction of HASHEM your God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, his commandments, his ordinances, and his testimonies, according to that which is written in the Torah of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do, and wherever you turn yourself. 
verse:2:4 That HASHEM may establish his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, 'If your children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail you,' he said, 'a man on the throne of Israel.'
verse:2:5 "Moreover you know also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, even what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner, and to Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war on his sash that was about his waist, and in his shoes that were on his feet. 
verse:2:6 Do therefore according to your wisdom, and don't let his gray head go down to Sheol in peace. 
verse:2:7 But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those who eat at your table; for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom your brother.
verse:2:8 "Behold, there is with you Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim; but he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by HASHEM, saying, 'I will not put you to death with the sword.' 
verse:2:9 Now therefore don't hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man; and you will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood." 
verse:2:10 David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David. 
verse:2:11 The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem. 
verse:2:12 Solomon sat on the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was firmly established. 
portion:I Kings 3:15-4:1
verse:3:15 Solomon awoke; and behold, it was a dream. Then he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of HASHEM, and offered up burnt offerings, offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
verse:3:16 Then two women who were prostitutes came to the king, and stood before him. 
verse:3:17 The one woman said, "Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house. I delivered a child with her in the house. 
verse:3:18 It happened the third day after I delivered, that this woman delivered also. We were together. There was no stranger with us in the house, just us two in the house. 
verse:3:19 This woman's child died in the night, because she lay on it. 
verse:3:20 She arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while your handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom. 
verse:3:21 When I rose in the morning to nurse my child, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, whom I bore."
verse:3:22 The other woman said, "No; but the living is my son, and the dead is your son."
This said, "No; but the dead is your son, and the living is my son." Thus they spoke before the king.
verse:3:23 Then the king said, "The one says, 'This is my son who lives, and your son is the dead;' and the other says, 'No; but your son is the dead one, and my son is the living one.'" 
verse:3:24 The king said, "Get me a sword." They brought a sword before the king. 
verse:3:25 The king said, "Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to he other."
verse:3:26 Then the woman whose the living child was spoke to the king, for her heart yearned over her son, and she said, "Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and in no way kill it!"
But the other said, "It shall be neither mine nor yours. Divide it."
verse:3:27 Then the king answered, "Give her the living child, and in no way kill it. She is its mother."
verse:3:28 All Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.
verse:4:1 King Solomon was king over all Israel. 
portion:I Kings 5:26 - 6:13
verse:5:26 HASHEM gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him; and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a treaty together. 
verse:5:27 King Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men. 
verse:5:28 He sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses; a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home; and Adoniram was over the men subject to forced labor. 
verse:5:29 Solomon had seventy thousand who bore burdens, and eighty thousand who were stone cutters in the mountains; 
verse:5:30 besides Solomon's chief officers who were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, who bore rule over the people who labored in the work. 
verse:5:31 The king commanded, and they cut out great stones, costly stones, to lay the foundation of the house with worked stone. 
verse:5:32 Solomon's builders and Hiram's builders and the Gebalites cut them, and prepared the timber and the stones to build the house.
verse:6:1 It happened in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of HASHEM. 
verse:6:2 The house which king Solomon built for HASHEM, its length was sixty cubits, and its breadth twenty, and its height thirty cubits. 
verse:6:3 The porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was its length, according to the breadth of the house. Ten cubits was its breadth before the house. 
verse:6:4 For the house he made windows of fixed lattice work. 
verse:6:5 Against the wall of the house he built stories all around, against the walls of the house all around, both of the temple and of the oracle; and he made side rooms all around. 
verse:6:6 The nethermost story was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad; for on the outside he made offsets in the wall of the house all around, that the beams should not have hold in the walls of the house. 
verse:6:7 The house, when it was in building, was built of stone prepared at the quarry; and there was neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building. 
verse:6:8 The door for the middle side rooms was in the right side of the house: and they went up by winding stairs into the middle story, and out of the middle into the third. 
verse:6:9 So he built the house, and finished it; and he covered the house with beams and planks of cedar. 
verse:6:10 He built the stories against all the house, each five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.
verse:6:11 The word of HASHEM came to Solomon, saying, 
verse:6:12 "Concerning this house which you are building, if you will walk in my statutes, and execute my ordinances, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I establish my word with you, which I spoke to David your father. 
verse:6:13 I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel."
portion:I Kings 7:40 - 7:50
verse:7:40 Hiram made the basins, and the shovels, and the basins. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he worked for king Solomon in the house of HASHEM: 
verse:7:41 the two pillars, and the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars; and the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars; 
verse:7:42 and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the pillars; 
verse:7:43 and the ten bases, and the ten basins on the bases; 
verse:7:44 and the one sea, and the twelve oxen under the sea; 
verse:7:45 and the pots, and the shovels, and the basins: even all these vessels, which Hiram made for king Solomon, in the house of HASHEM, were of burnished brass. 
verse:7:46 The king cast them in the plain of the Jordan, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarethan. 
verse:7:47 Solomon left all the vessels unweighed, because they were exceeding many: the weight of the brass could not be found out. 
verse:7:48 Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of HASHEM: the golden altar, and the table whereupon the show bread was, of gold; 
verse:7:49 and the menorahs, five on the right side, and five on the left, before the oracle, of pure gold; and the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, of gold; 
verse:7:50 and the cups, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the fire pans, of pure gold; and the hinges, both for the doors of the inner house, the most holy place, and for the doors of the house, of the temple, of gold.
portion:I Kings 7:51 - 8:21
verse:7:51 Thus all the work that king Solomon worked in the house of HASHEM was finished. Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated, the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of HASHEM.
verse:8:1 Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers' households of the children of Israel, to king Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of HASHEM out of the city of David, which is Zion. 
verse:8:2 All the men of Israel assembled themselves to king Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month. 
verse:8:3 All the elders of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark. 
verse:8:4 They brought up the ark of HASHEM, and the Tent of Meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; even these the priests and the Levites brought up. 
verse:8:5 King Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, who were assembled to him, were with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and cattle, that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude. 
verse:8:6 The priests brought in the ark of the covenant of HASHEM to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim. 
verse:8:7 For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and its poles above. 
verse:8:8 The poles were so long that the ends of the poles were seen from the holy place before the oracle; but they were not seen outside: and there they are to this day. 
verse:8:9 There was nothing in the ark except the two tables of stone which Moses put there at Horeb, when HASHEM made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt. 
verse:8:10 It came to pass, when the priests had come out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of HASHEM, 
verse:8:11 so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud; for the glory of HASHEM filled the house of HASHEM. 
verse:8:12 Then Solomon said, "HASHEM has said that he would dwell in the thick darkness. 
verse:8:13 I have surely built you a house of habitation, a place for you to dwell in forever."
verse:8:14 The king turned his face about, and blessed all the assembly of Israel: and all the assembly of Israel stood. 
verse:8:15 He said, "Blessed is HASHEM, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David your father, and has with his hand fulfilled it, saying, 
verse:8:16 'Since the day that I brought my people Israel out of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that my name might be there; but I chose David to be over my people Israel.'
verse:8:17 "Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of HASHEM, the God of Israel. 
verse:8:18 But HASHEM said to David my father, 'Whereas it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart. 
verse:8:19 Nevertheless, you shall not build the house; but your son who shall come forth out of your body, he shall build the house for my name.' 
verse:8:20 HASHEM has established his word that he spoke; for I have risen up in the place of David my father, and I sit on the throne of Israel, as HASHEM promised, and have built the house for the name of HASHEM, the God of Israel. 
verse:8:21 There I have set a place for the ark, in which is the covenant of HASHEM, which he made with our fathers, when he brought them out of the land of Egypt."
portion:I Kings 8:54 - 8:66
verse:8:54 It was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication to HASHEM, he arose from before the altar of HASHEM, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread forth toward heaven. 
verse:8:55 He stood, and blessed all the assembly of Israel with a loud voice, saying, 
verse:8:56 "Blessed be HASHEM, who has given rest to his people Israel, according to all that he promised. There has not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by Moses his servant. 
verse:8:57 May HASHEM our God be with us, as he was with our fathers. Let him not leave us, nor forsake us; 
verse:8:58 that he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his ordinances, which he commanded our fathers. 
verse:8:59 Let these my words, with which I have made supplication before HASHEM, be near to HASHEM our God day and night, that he may maintain the cause of his servant, and the cause of his people Israel, as every day shall require; 
verse:8:60 that all the peoples of the earth may know that HASHEM, he is God. There is none else.
verse:8:61 "Let your heart therefore be perfect with HASHEM our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day."
verse:8:62 The king, and all Israel with him, offered sacrifice before HASHEM. 
verse:8:63 Solomon offered for the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to HASHEM, two and twenty thousand head of cattle, and one hundred twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of HASHEM. 
verse:8:64 The same day the king made the middle of the court holy that was before the house of HASHEM; for there he offered the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar that was before HASHEM was too little to receive the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings. 
verse:8:65 So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt, before HASHEM our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days. 
verse:8:66 On the eighth day he sent the people away; and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that HASHEM had shown to David his servant, and to Israel his people.
portion:I Kings 18:46 - 19:21
verse:18:46 The hand of HASHEM was on Elijah; and he tucked his cloak into his belt and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
verse:19:1 Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword. 
verse:19:2 Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, "So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I don't make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time!"
verse:19:3 When he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there. 
verse:19:4 But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die, and said, "It is enough. Now, O HASHEM, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers."
verse:19:5 He lay down and slept under a juniper tree; and behold, an angel touched him, and said to him, "Arise and eat!"
verse:19:6 He looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drank, and lay down again. 
verse:19:7 The angel of HASHEM came again the second time, and touched him, and said, "Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for you."
verse:19:8 He arose, and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb the Mount of God. 
verse:19:9 He came there to a cave, and lodged there; and behold, the word of HASHEM came to him, and he said to him, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"
verse:19:10 He said, "I have been very jealous for HASHEM, the God of Hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away."
verse:19:11 He said, "Go out, and stand on the mountain before HASHEM."
Behold, HASHEM passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before HASHEM; but HASHEM was not in the wind. After the wind an earthquake; but HASHEM was not in the earthquake. 
verse:19:12 After the earthquake a fire passed; but HASHEM was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice. 
verse:19:13 It was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"
verse:19:14 He said, "I have been very jealous for HASHEM, the God of Hosts; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away."
verse:19:15 HASHEM said to him, "Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. When you arrive, you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria. 
verse:19:16 You shall anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi to be king over Israel; and you shall anoint Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel Meholah to be prophet in your place. 
verse:19:17 It shall happen, that he who escapes from the sword of Hazael, Jehu will kill; and he who escapes from the sword of Jehu, Elisha will kill. 
verse:19:18 Yet will I leave seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth which has not kissed him."
verse:19:19 So he departed there, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing, with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed over to him, and cast his mantle on him. 
verse:19:20 He left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, "Let me please kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you."
He said to him, "Go back again; for what have I done to you?"
verse:19:21 He returned from following him, and took the yoke of oxen, and killed them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave to the people, and they ate. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and served him.
portion:I Kings 18:1 - 18:39
verse:18:1 It happened after many days, that the word of HASHEM came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, "Go, show yourself to Ahab; and I will send rain on the earth."
verse:18:2 Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. The famine was severe in Samaria. 
verse:18:3 Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared HASHEM greatly: 
verse:18:4 for it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of HASHEM, that Obadiah took one hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.) 
verse:18:5 Ahab said to Obadiah, "Go through the land, to all the springs of water, and to all the brooks. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the animals."
verse:18:6 So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself. 
verse:18:7 As Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, "Is it you, my lord Elijah?"
verse:18:8 He answered him, "It is I. Go, tell your lord, 'Behold, Elijah is here!'"
verse:18:9 He said, "Wherein have I sinned, that you would deliver your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me? 
verse:18:10 As HASHEM your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom, where my lord has not sent to seek you. When they said, 'He is not here,' he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they didn't find you. 
verse:18:11 Now you say, 'Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here."' 
verse:18:12 It will happen, as soon as I am gone from you, that the Spirit of HASHEM will carry you I don't know where; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he can't find you, he will kill me. But I, your servant, have feared HASHEM from my youth. 
verse:18:13 Wasn't it told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of HASHEM, how I hid one hundred men of HASHEM's prophets with fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water? 
verse:18:14 Now you say, 'Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here;"' and he will kill me."
verse:18:15 Elijah said, "As HASHEM of Hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today." 
verse:18:16 So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah. 
verse:18:17 It happened, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, "Is that you, you troubler of Israel?"
verse:18:18 He answered, "I have not troubled Israel; but you, and your father's house, in that you have forsaken the commandments of HASHEM, and you have followed the Baals. 
verse:18:19 Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to Mount Carmel, and four hundred fifty of the prophets of Baal, and four hundred of the prophets of the Asherah, who eat at Jezebel's table."
verse:18:20 So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together to Mount Carmel. 
verse:18:21 Elijah came near to all the people, and said, "How long will you waver between the two sides? If HASHEM is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him."
The people answered him not a word.
verse:18:22 Then Elijah said to the people, "I, even I only, am left a prophet of HASHEM; but Baal's prophets are four hundred fifty men. 
verse:18:23 Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it. 
verse:18:24 You call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of HASHEM. The God who answers by fire, let him be God."
All the people answered, "It is well said."
verse:18:25 Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, "Choose one bull for yourselves, and dress it first; for you are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it."
verse:18:26 They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any who answered. They leaped about the altar which was made. 
verse:18:27 It happened at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, "Cry aloud; for he is a god. Either he is musing, or he has gone aside, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened."
verse:18:28 They cried aloud, and cut themselves in their way with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them. 
verse:18:29 It was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the offering; but there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any who regarded.
verse:18:30 Elijah said to all the people, "Come near to me;" and all the people came near to him. He repaired the altar of HASHEM that was thrown down. 
verse:18:31 Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of HASHEM came, saying, "Israel shall be your name." 
verse:18:32 With the stones he built an altar in the name of HASHEM. He made a trench around the altar, large enough to contain two measures of seed. 
verse:18:33 He put the wood in order, and cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood. 
verse:18:34 He said, "Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt offering, and on the wood." He said, "Do it a second time;" and they did it the second time. He said, "Do it a third time;" and they did it the third time. 
verse:18:35 The water ran around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.
verse:18:36 It happened at the time of the offering of the offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, "HASHEM, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word. 
verse:18:37 Hear me, HASHEM, hear me, that this people may know that you, HASHEM, are God, and that you have turned their heart back again."
verse:18:38 Then the fire of HASHEM fell, and consumed the burnt offering, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench. 
verse:18:39 When all the people saw it, they fell on their faces. They said, "HASHEM, he is God! HASHEM, he is God!"
portion:II Kings 4:1 - 4:37
verse:4:1 Now there cried a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets to Elisha, saying, "Your servant my husband is dead. You know that your servant feared HASHEM. Now the creditor has come to take for himself my two children to be slaves."
verse:4:2 Elisha said to her, "What shall I do for you? Tell me: what do you have in the house?"
She said, "Your handmaid has nothing in the house, except a pot of oil."
verse:4:3 Then he said, "Go, borrow containers from of all your neighbors, even empty containers. Don't borrow just a few. 
verse:4:4 You shall go in, and shut the door on you and on your sons, and pour out into all those containers; and you shall set aside that which is full."
verse:4:5 So she went from him, and shut the door on her and on her sons; they brought the containers to her, and she poured out. 
verse:4:6 It happened, when the containers were full, that she said to her son, "Bring me another container."
He said to her, "There isn't another container." The oil stopped flowing.
verse:4:7 Then she came and told the man of God. He said, "Go, sell the oil, and pay your debt; and you and your sons live on the rest."
verse:4:8 It fell on a day, that Elisha passed to Shunem, where there was a prominent woman; and she persuaded him to eat bread. So it was, that as often as he passed by, he turned in there to eat bread. 
verse:4:9 She said to her husband, "See now, I perceive that this is a holy man of God, that passes by us continually. 
verse:4:10 Please let us make a little room on the wall. Let us set for him there a bed, a table, a chair, and a lamp stand. It shall be, when he comes to us, that he shall turn in there."
verse:4:11 One day he came there, and he turned into the room and lay there. 
verse:4:12 He said to Gehazi his servant, "Call this Shunammite." When he had called her, she stood before him. 
verse:4:13 He said to him, "Say now to her, 'Behold, you have cared for us with all this care. What is to be done for you? Would you like to be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the army?'"
She answered, "I dwell among my own people."
verse:4:14 He said, "What then is to be done for her?"
Gehazi answered, "Most certainly she has no son, and her husband is old."
verse:4:15 He said, "Call her." When he had called her, she stood in the door. 
verse:4:16 He said, "At this season, when the time comes around, you will embrace a son."
She said, "No, my lord, you man of God, do not lie to your handmaid."
verse:4:17 The woman conceived, and bore a son at that season, when the time came around, as Elisha had said to her. 
verse:4:18 When the child was grown, it happened one day that he went out to his father to the reapers. 
verse:4:19 He said to his father, "My head! My head!"
He said to his servant, "Carry him to his mother."
verse:4:20 When he had taken him, and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees until noon, and then died. 
verse:4:21 She went up and laid him on the bed of the man of God, and shut the door on him, and went out. 
verse:4:22 She called to her husband, and said, "Please send me one of the servants, and one of the donkeys, that I may run to the man of God, and come again."
verse:4:23 He said, "Why would you want go to him today? It is neither new moon nor Sabbath."
She said, "It's alright."
verse:4:24 Then she saddled a donkey, and said to her servant, "Drive, and go forward! Don't slow down for me, unless I ask you to."
verse:4:25 So she went, and came to the man of God to Mount Carmel. It happened, when the man of God saw her afar off, that he said to Gehazi his servant, "Behold, there is the Shunammite. 
verse:4:26 Please run now to meet her, and ask her, 'Is it well with you? Is it well with your husband? Is it well with the child?'"
She answered, "It is well."
verse:4:27 When she came to the man of God to the hill, she caught hold of his feet. Gehazi came near to thrust her away; but the man of God said, "Leave her alone; for her soul is troubled within her; and HASHEM has hidden it from me, and has not told me."
verse:4:28 Then she said, "Did I desire a son of my lord? Didn't I say, Do not deceive me?"
verse:4:29 Then he said to Gehazi, "Tuck your cloak into your belt, take my staff in your hand, and go your way. If you meet any man, don't greet him; and if anyone greets you, don't answer him again. Then lay my staff on the face of the child."
verse:4:30 The mother of the child said, "As HASHEM lives, and as your soul lives, I will not leave you."
He arose, and followed her.
verse:4:31 Gehazi passed on before them, and laid the staff on the face of the child; but there was neither voice, nor hearing. Therefore he returned to meet him, and told him, saying, "The child has not awakened."
verse:4:32 When Elisha had come into the house, behold, the child was dead, and laid on his bed. 
verse:4:33 He went in therefore, and shut the door on them both, and prayed to HASHEM. 
verse:4:34 He went up, and lay on the child, and put his mouth on his mouth, and his eyes on his eyes, and his hands on his hands. He stretched himself on him; and the flesh of the child grew warm. 
verse:4:35 Then he returned, and walked in the house once back and forth; and went up, and stretched himself on him. Then the child sneezed seven times, and the child opened his eyes. 
verse:4:36 He called Gehazi, and said, "Call this Shunammite!" So he called her.
When she had come in to him, he said, "Take up your son."
verse:4:37 Then she went in, and fell at his feet, and bowed herself to the ground; and she took up her son, and went out.
portion:II Kings 4:42 - 5:19
verse:4:42 A man from Baal Shalishah came, and brought the man of God bread of the first fruits, twenty loaves of barley, and fresh ears of grain in his sack. He said, "Give to the people, that they may eat."
verse:4:43 His servant said, "What, should I set this before a hundred men?"
But he said, "Give the people, that they may eat; for thus says HASHEM, 'They will eat, and will have some left over.'"
verse:4:44 So he set it before them, and they ate, and left some of it, according to the word of HASHEM.
verse:5:1 Now Naaman, captain of the army of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honorable, because by him HASHEM had given victory to Syria: he was also a mighty man of valor, but he was a leper. 
verse:5:2 The Syrians had gone out in bands, and had brought away captive out of Eretz-Israel a little maiden; and she waited on Naaman's wife. 
verse:5:3 She said to her mistress, "I wish that my lord were with the prophet who is in Samaria! Then he would heal him of his leprosy."
verse:5:4 Someone went in, and told his lord, saying, "The maiden who is from Eretz-Israel said this."
verse:5:5 The king of Syria said, "Go now, and I will send a letter to the king of Israel."
He departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of clothing. 
verse:5:6 He brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying, "Now when this letter has come to you, behold, I have sent Naaman my servant to you, that you may heal him of his leprosy."
verse:5:7 It happened, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he tore his clothes, and said, "Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man sends to me to heal a man of his leprosy? But please consider and see how he seeks a quarrel against me."
verse:5:8 It was so, when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had torn his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, "Why have you torn your clothes? Let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel."
verse:5:9 So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariots, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha. 
verse:5:10 Elisha sent a messenger to him, saying, "Go and wash in the Jordan seven times, and your flesh shall come again to you, and you shall be clean."
verse:5:11 But Naaman was angry, and went away, and said, "Behold, I thought, 'He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of HASHEM his God, and wave his hand over the place, and heal the leper.' 
verse:5:12 Aren't Abanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? Couldn't I wash in them, and be clean?" So he turned and went away in a rage.
verse:5:13 His servants came near, and spoke to him, and said, "My father, if the prophet had asked you do some great thing, wouldn't you have done it? How much rather then, when he says to you, 'Wash, and be clean?'"
verse:5:14 Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in the Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God; and his flesh was restored like the flesh of a little child, and he was clean. 
verse:5:15 He returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him; and he said, "See now, I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel. Now therefore, please take a gift from your servant."
verse:5:16 But he said, "As HASHEM lives, before whom I stand, I will receive none."
He urged him to take it; but he refused. 
verse:5:17 Naaman said, "If not, then, please let two mules' burden of earth be given to your servant; for your servant will from now on offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice to other gods, but to HASHEM. 
verse:5:18 In this thing may HASHEM pardon your servant: when my master goes into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leans on my hand, and I bow myself in the house of Rimmon. When I bow myself in the house of Rimmon, may HASHEM pardon your servant in this thing."
verse:5:19 He said to him, "Go in peace." 
portion:II Kings 7:3 - 7:20
verse:7:3 Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate. They said one to another, "Why do we sit here until we die? 
verse:7:4 If we say, 'We will enter into the city,' then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there. If we sit still here, we also die. Now therefore come, and let us surrender to the army of the Syrians. If they save us alive, we will live; and if they kill us, we will only die."
verse:7:5 They rose up in the twilight, to go to the camp of the Syrians. When they had come to the outermost part of the camp of the Syrians, behold, there was no man there. 
verse:7:6 For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots, and a noise of horses, even the noise of a great army: and they said one to another, Behold, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of the Egyptians, to come on us. 
verse:7:7 Therefore they arose and fled in the twilight, and left their tents, and their horses, and their donkeys, even the camp as it was, and fled for their life. 
verse:7:8 When these lepers came to the outermost part of the camp, they went into one tent, and ate and drink, and carried there silver, and gold, and clothing, and went and hid it. Then they came back, and entered into another tent, and carried there also, and went and hid it. 
verse:7:9 Then they said one to another, "We aren't doing right. This day is a day of good news, and we keep silent. If we wait until the morning light, punishment will overtake us. Now therefore come, let us go and tell the king's household."
verse:7:10 So they came and called to the porter of the city; and they told them, saying, "We came to the camp of the Syrians, and, behold, there was no man there, neither voice of man, but the horses tied, and the donkeys tied, and the tents as they were."
verse:7:11 He called the porters; and they told it to the king's household within. 
verse:7:12 The king arose in the night, and said to his servants, "I will now show you what the Syrians have done to us. They know that we are hungry. Therefore are they gone out of the camp to hide themselves in the field, saying, 'When they come out of the city, we shall take them alive, and get into the city.'"
verse:7:13 One of his servants answered, "Please let some take five of the horses that remain, which are left in the city. Behold, they are like all the multitude of Israel who are left in it. Behold, they are like all the multitude of Israel who are consumed. Let us send and see."
verse:7:14 They took therefore two chariots with horses; and the king sent after the army of the Syrians, saying, "Go and see."
verse:7:15 They went after them to the Jordan; and behold, all the way was full of garments and vessels, which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. The messengers returned, and told the king. 
verse:7:16 The people went out, and plundered the camp of the Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel, and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to the word of HASHEM. 
verse:7:17 The king appointed the captain on whose hand he leaned to be in charge of the gate: and the people trod on him in the gate, and he died as the man of God had said, who spoke when the king came down to him. 
verse:7:18 It happened, as the man of God had spoken to the king, saying, "Two measures of barley for a shekel, and a measure of fine flour for a shekel, shall be tomorrow about this time in the gate of Samaria;" 
verse:7:19 and that captain answered the man of God, and said, "Now, behold, if HASHEM should make windows in heaven, might such a thing be?" and he said, "Behold, you shall see it with your eyes, but shall not eat of it." 
verse:7:20 It happened like that to him; for the people trod on him in the gate, and he died.
portion:Malachi 1:1-2:7
verse:1:1 An oracle: the word of HASHEM to Israel by Malachi.
verse:1:2 "I have loved you," says HASHEM.
Yet you say, "How have you loved us?"
"Wasn't Esau Jacob's brother?" says HASHEM, "Yet I loved Jacob; 
verse:1:3 but Esau I hated, and made his mountains a desolation, and gave his heritage to the jackals of the wilderness." 
verse:1:4 Whereas Edom says, "We are beaten down, but we will return and build the waste places;" thus says HASHEM of Hosts, "They shall build, but I will throw down; and men will call them 'The Wicked Land,' even the people against whom HASHEM shows wrath forever."
verse:1:5 Your eyes will see, and you will say, "HASHEM is great--even beyond the border of Israel!"
verse:1:6 "A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If I am a father, then where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is the respect due me? Says HASHEM of Hosts to you, priests, who despise my name. You say, 'How have we despised your name?' 
verse:1:7 You offer polluted bread on my altar. You say, 'How have we polluted you?' In that you say, 'HASHEM's table contemptible.' 
verse:1:8 When you offer the blind for sacrifice, isn't that evil? And when you offer the lame and sick, isn't that evil? Present it now to your governor! Will he be pleased with you? Or will he accept your person?" says HASHEM of Hosts.
verse:1:9 "Now, please entreat the favor of God, that he may be gracious to us. With this, will he accept any of you?" says HASHEM of Hosts.
verse:1:10 "Oh that there were one among you who would shut the doors, that you might not kindle fire on my altar in vain! I have no pleasure in you," says HASHEM of Hosts, "neither will I accept an offering at your hand. 
verse:1:11 For from the rising of the sun even to the going down of the same, my name is great among the nations, and in every place incense will be offered to my name, and a pure offering: for my name is great among the nations," says HASHEM of Hosts. 
verse:1:12 "But you profane it, in that you say, 'HASHEM's table is polluted, and its fruit, even its food, is contemptible.' 
verse:1:13 You say also, 'Behold, what a weariness it is!' and you have sniffed at it," says HASHEM of Hosts; "and you have brought that which was taken by violence, the lame, and the sick; thus you bring the offering. Should I accept this at your hand?" says HASHEM.
verse:1:14 "But the deceiver is cursed, who has in his flock a male, and vows, and sacrifices to the Lord a blemished thing; for I am a great King," says HASHEM of Hosts, "and my name is awesome among the nations."
verse:2:1 "Now, you priests, this commandment is for you. 
verse:2:2 If you will not listen, and if you will not lay it to heart, to give glory to my name," says HASHEM of Hosts, "then will I send the curse on you, and I will curse your blessings. Indeed, I have cursed them already, because you do not lay it to heart. 
verse:2:3 Behold, I will rebuke your seed, and will spread dung on your faces, even the dung of your feasts; and you will be taken away with it. 
verse:2:4 You will know that I have sent this commandment to you, that my covenant may be with Levi," says HASHEM of Hosts. 
verse:2:5 "My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him that he might be reverent toward me; and he was reverent toward me, and stood in awe of my name. 
verse:2:6 The law of truth was in his mouth, and unrighteousness was not found in his lips. He walked with me in peace and uprightness, and turned many away from iniquity. 
verse:2:7 For the priest's lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth; for he is the messenger of HASHEM of Hosts.
portion:Hosea 2:1 - 2:22
verse:2:1 Yet the number of the children of Israel will be as the sand of the sea, which can't be measured nor numbered; and it will come to pass that, in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not my people,' they will be called 'sons of the living God.' 
verse:2:2 The children of Judah and the children of Israel will be gathered together, and they will appoint themselves one head, and will go up from the land; for great will be the day of Jezreel.
verse:2:3 "Say to your brothers, 'My people!' and to your sisters, 'My loved one!' 
verse:2:4 Contend with your mother! Contend, for she is not my wife, neither am I her husband; and let her put away her prostitution from her face, and her adulteries from between her breasts; 
verse:2:5 Lest I strip her naked, and make her bare as in the day that she was born, and make her like a wilderness, and set her like a dry land, and kill her with thirst. 
verse:2:6 Indeed, on her children I will have no mercy; for they are children of unfaithfulness; 
verse:2:7 For their mother has played the prostitute. She who conceived them has done shamefully; for she said, 'I will go after my lovers, who give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.' 
verse:2:8 Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns, and I will build a wall against her, that she can't find her way. 
verse:2:9 She will follow after her lovers, but she won't overtake them; and she will seek them, but won't find them. Then she will say, 'I will go and return to my first husband; for then was it better with me than now.' 
verse:2:10 For she did not know that I gave her the grain, the new wine, and the oil, and multiplied to her silver and gold, which they used for Baal. 
verse:2:11 Therefore I will take back my grain in its time, and my new wine in its season, and will pluck away my wool and my flax which should have covered her nakedness. 
verse:2:12 Now I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, and no one will deliver her out of my hand. 
verse:2:13 I will also cause all her celebrations to cease: her feasts, her new moons, her Sabbaths, and all her solemn assemblies. 
verse:2:14 I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees, about which she has said, 'These are my wages that my lovers have given me; and I will make them a forest,' and the animals of the field shall eat them. 
verse:2:15 I will visit on her the days of the Baals, to which she burned incense, when she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, and went after her lovers, and forgot me," says HASHEM. 
verse:2:16 "Therefore, behold, I will allure her, and bring her into the wilderness, and speak tenderly to her. 
verse:2:17 I will give her vineyards from there, and the valley of Achor for a door of hope; and she will respond there, as in the days of her youth, and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt. 
verse:2:18 It will be in that day," says HASHEM, "that you will call me 'my husband,' and no longer call me 'my master.' 
verse:2:19 For I will take away the names of the Baals out of her mouth, and they will no longer be mentioned by name. 
verse:2:20 In that day I will make a covenant for them with the animals of the field, and with the birds of the sky, and with the creeping things of the ground. I will break the bow, the sword, and the battle out of the land, and will make them lie down safely. 
verse:2:21 I will betroth you to me forever. Yes, I will betroth you to me in righteousness, in justice, in loving kindness, and in compassion. 
verse:2:22 I will even betroth you to me in faithfulness; and you shall know HASHEM. 
portion:Hosea 12:13 - 14:10
verse:12:13 Jacob fled into the country of Aram, and Israel served to get a wife, and for a wife he tended flocks and herds. 
verse:12:14 By a prophet HASHEM brought Israel up out of Egypt, and by a prophet he was preserved. 
verse:12:15 Ephraim has bitterly provoked anger. Therefore his blood will be left on him, and his Lord will repay his contempt. 
verse:13:1 When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling. He exalted himself in Israel, but when he became guilty in Baal, he died. 
verse:13:2 Now they sin more and more, and have made themselves molten images of their silver, even idols according to their own understanding, all of them the work of the craftsmen. They say of them, 'They offer human sacrifice and kiss the calves.' 
verse:13:3 Therefore they will be like the morning mist, and like the dew that passes away early, like the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the threshing floor, and like the smoke out of the chimney.
verse:13:4 "Yet I am HASHEM your God from the land of Egypt; and you shall acknowledge no god but me, and besides me there is no savior. 
verse:13:5 I knew you in the wilderness, in the land of great drought. 
verse:13:6 According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted. Therefore they have forgotten me. 
verse:13:7 Therefore I am like a lion to them. Like a leopard, I will lurk by the path. 
verse:13:8 I will meet them like a bear that is bereaved of her cubs, and will tear the covering of their heart. There I will devour them like a lioness. The wild animal will tear them. 
verse:13:9 You are destroyed, Israel, because you are against me, against your help. 
verse:13:10 Where is your king now, that he may save you in all your cities? And your judges, of whom you said, 'Give me a king and princes?' 
verse:13:11 I have given you a king in my anger, and have taken him away in my wrath. 
verse:13:12 The guilt of Ephraim is stored up. His sin is stored up. 
verse:13:13 The sorrows of a travailing woman will come on him. He is an unwise son; for when it is time, he doesn't come to the opening of the womb. 
verse:13:14 I will ransom them from the power of Sheol. I will redeem them from death! Death, where are your plagues? Sheol, where is your destruction?
"Compassion will be hidden from my eyes. 
verse:13:15 Though he is fruitful among his brothers, an east wind will come, the breath of HASHEM coming up from the wilderness; and his spring will become dry, and his fountain will be dried up. He will plunder the storehouse of treasure. 
verse:14:1 Samaria will bear her guilt; for she has rebelled against her God. They will fall by the sword. Their infants will be dashed in pieces, and their pregnant women will be ripped open."
verse:14:2 Israel, return to HASHEM your God; for you have fallen because of your sin. 
verse:14:3 Take words with you, and return to HASHEM. Tell him, "Forgive all our sins, and accept that which is good: so we offer our lips like bulls. 
verse:14:4 Assyria can't save us. We won't ride on horses; neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, 'Our gods!' for in you the fatherless finds mercy."
verse:14:5 "I will heal their waywardness. I will love them freely; for my anger is turned away from him. 
verse:14:6 I will be like the dew to Israel. He will blossom like the lily, and send down his roots like Lebanon. 
verse:14:7 His branches will spread, and his beauty will be like the olive tree, and his fragrance like Lebanon. 
verse:14:8 Men will dwell in his shade. They will revive like the grain, and blossom like the vine. Their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon. 
verse:14:9 Ephraim, what have I to do any more with idols? I answer, and will take care of him. I am like a green fir tree; from me your fruit is found."
verse:14:10 Who is wise, that he may understand these things? Who is prudent, that he may know them? For the ways of HASHEM are right, and the righteous walk in them; But the rebellious stumble in them. 
portion:Obadiah 1:1 - 1:21
verse:1:1 The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord HASHEM says about Edom. We have heard news from HASHEM, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, "Arise, and let's rise up against her in battle. 
verse:1:2 Behold, I have made you small among the nations. You are greatly despised. 
verse:1:3 The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high, who says in his heart, 'Who will bring me down to the ground?' 
verse:1:4 Though you mount on high as the eagle, and though your nest is set among the stars, I will bring you down from there," says HASHEM. 
verse:1:5 "If thieves came to you, if robbers by night--oh, what disaster awaits you--wouldn't they only steal until they had enough? If grape pickers came to you, wouldn't they leave some gleaning grapes? 
verse:1:6 How Esau will be ransacked! How his hidden treasures are sought out! 
verse:1:7 All the men of your alliance have brought you on your way, even to the border. The men who were at peace with you have deceived you, and prevailed against you. Friends who eat your bread lay a snare under you. There is no understanding in him."
verse:1:8 "Won't I in that day," says HASHEM, "destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of the mountain of Esau? 
verse:1:9 Your mighty men, Teman, will be dismayed, to the end that everyone may be cut off from the mountain of Esau by slaughter. 
verse:1:10 For the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame will cover you, and you will be cut off forever. 
verse:1:11 In the day that you stood on the other side, in the day that strangers carried away his substance, and foreigners entered into his gates, and cast lots for Jerusalem, even you were like one of them. 
verse:1:12 But don't look down on your brother in the day of his disaster, and don't rejoice over the children of Judah in the day of their destruction. Don't speak proudly in the day of distress. 
verse:1:13 Don't enter into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity. Don't look down on their affliction in the day of their calamity, neither seize their wealth on the day of their calamity. 
verse:1:14 Don't stand in the crossroads to cut off those of his who escape. Don't deliver up those of his who remain in the day of distress. 
verse:1:15 For the day of HASHEM is near all the nations! As you have done, it will be done to you. Your deeds will return upon your own head. 
verse:1:16 For as you have drunk on my holy mountain, so will all the nations drink continually. Yes, they will drink, swallow down, and will be as though they had not been. 
verse:1:17 But in Mount Zion, there will be those who escape, and it will be holy. The house of Jacob will possess their possessions. 
verse:1:18 The house of Jacob will be a fire, the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble. They will burn among them, and devour them. There will not be any remaining to the house of Esau." Indeed, HASHEM has spoken.
verse:1:19 Those of the South will possess the mountain of Esau, and those of the lowland, the Philistines. They will possess the field of Ephraim, and the field of Samaria. Benjamin will possess Gilead. 
verse:1:20 The captives of this army of the children of Israel, who are among the Canaanites, will possess even to Zarephath; and the captives of Jerusalem, who are in Sepharad, will possess the cities of the Negev. 
verse:1:21 Saviors will go up on Mount Zion to judge the mountains of Esau, and the kingdom will be HASHEM's.
portion:Habakkuk 3:1-19
verse:3:1 A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music. 
verse:3:2 HASHEM, I have heard of your fame. I stand in awe of your deeds, HASHEM. Renew your work in the midst of the years. In the midst of the years make it known. In wrath, you remember mercy. 
verse:3:3 God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah.
His glory covered the heavens, and his praise filled the earth. 
verse:3:4 His splendor is like the sunrise. Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden. 
verse:3:5 Plague went before him, and pestilence followed his feet. 
verse:3:6 He stood, and shook the earth. He looked, and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains were crumbled. The age-old hills collapsed. His ways are eternal. 
verse:3:7 I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction. The dwellings of the land of Midian trembled. 
verse:3:8 Was HASHEM displeased with the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers, or your wrath against the sea, that you rode on your horses, on your chariots of salvation? 
verse:3:9 You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. Selah. You split the earth with rivers. 
verse:3:10 The mountains saw you, and were afraid. The storm of waters passed by. The deep roared and lifted up its hands on high. 
verse:3:11 The sun and moon stood still in the sky, at the light of your arrows as they went, at the shining of your glittering spear. 
verse:3:12 You marched through the land in wrath. You threshed the nations in anger. 
verse:3:13 You went forth for the salvation of your people, for the salvation of your anointed. You crushed the head of the land of wickedness. You stripped them head to foot. Selah.
verse:3:14 You pierced the heads of his warriors with their own spears. They came as a whirlwind to scatter me, gloating as if to devour the wretched in secret. 
verse:3:15 You trampled the sea with your horses, churning mighty waters. 
verse:3:16 I heard, and my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place, because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, for the coming up of the people who invade us. 
verse:3:17 For though the fig tree doesn't flourish, nor fruit be in the vines; the labor of the olive fails, the fields yield no food; the flocks are cut off from the fold, and there is no herd in the stalls: 
verse:3:18 yet I will rejoice in HASHEM. I will be joyful in the God of my salvation! 
verse:3:19 HASHEM, my Lord, is my strength. He makes my feet like deer's feet, and enables me to go in high places.
For the music director, on my stringed instruments. 
portion:Amos 2:6 - 3:8
verse:2:6 Thus says HASHEM: "For three transgressions of Israel, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because they have sold the righteous for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes; 
verse:2:7 They trample on the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and deny justice to the oppressed; and a man and his father use the same maiden, to profane my holy name; 
verse:2:8 and they lay themselves down beside every altar on clothes taken in pledge; and in the house of their God they drink the wine of those who have been fined. 
verse:2:9 Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath. 
verse:2:10 Also I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and led you forty years in the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite. 
verse:2:11 I raised up some of your sons for prophets, and some of your young men for Nazirites. Isn't this true, you children of Israel?" says HASHEM. 
verse:2:12 "But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, and commanded the prophets, saying, 'Don't prophesy!' 
verse:2:13 Behold, I will crush you in your place, as a cart crushes that is full of grain. 
verse:2:14 Flight will perish from the swift; and the strong won't strengthen his force; neither shall the mighty deliver himself; 
verse:2:15 neither shall he stand who handles the bow; and he who is swift of foot won't escape; neither shall he who rides the horse deliver himself; 
verse:2:16 and he who is courageous among the mighty will flee away naked on that day," says HASHEM.
verse:3:1 Hear this word that HASHEM has spoken against you, children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up out of the land of Egypt, saying: 
verse:3:2 "You only have I chosen of all the families of the earth. Therefore I will punish you for all of your sins." 
verse:3:3 Do two walk together, unless they have agreed? 
verse:3:4 Will a lion roar in the thicket, when he has no prey? Does a young lion cry out of his den, if he has caught nothing? 
verse:3:5 Can a bird fall in a trap on the earth, where no snare is set for him? Does a snare spring up from the ground, when there is nothing to catch? 
verse:3:6 Does the shofar alarm sound in a city, without the people being afraid? Does evil happen to a city, and HASHEM hasn't done it? 
verse:3:7 Surely HASHEM GOD will do nothing, unless he reveals his secret to his servants the prophets. 
verse:3:8 The lion has roared. Who will not fear? The HASHEM GOD has spoken. Who can but prophesy? 
portion:Amos 9:7 - 9:15
verse:9:7 Are you not like the children of the Ethiopians to me, children of Israel?" says HASHEM. "Haven't I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir? 
verse:9:8 Behold, the eyes of HASHEM GOD are on the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the surface of the earth; except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob," says HASHEM. 
verse:9:9 "For, behold, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all the nations, as grain is sifted in a sieve, yet not the least kernel will fall on the earth. 
verse:9:10 All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, who say, 'Evil won't overtake nor meet us.' 
verse:9:11 In that day I will raise up the tent of David who is fallen, and close up its breaches, and I will raise up its ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old; 
verse:9:12 that they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all the nations who are called by my name," says HASHEM who does this. 
verse:9:13 "Behold, the days come," says HASHEM, "that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the one treading grapes him who sows seed; and sweet wine will drip from the mountains, and flow from the hills. 
verse:9:14 I will bring my people Israel back from captivity, and they will rebuild the ruined cities, and inhabit them; and they will plant vineyards, and drink wine from them. They shall also make gardens, and eat their fruit. 
verse:9:15 I will plant them on their land, and they will no more be plucked up out of their land which I have given them," says HASHEM your God.
portion:Micah 5:6 - 6:8
verse:5:6 The remnant of Jacob will be in the midst of many peoples, like dew from HASHEM, like showers on the grass, that don't wait for man, nor wait for the sons of men. 
verse:5:7 The remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep; who, if he goes through, treads down and tears in pieces, and there is no one to deliver. 
verse:5:8 Let your hand be lifted up above your adversaries, and let all of your enemies be cut off. 
verse:5:9 "It will happen in that day," says HASHEM, "That I will cut off your horses out of the midst of you, and will destroy your chariots. 
verse:5:10 I will cut off the cities of your land, and will tear down all your strongholds. 
verse:5:11 I will destroy witchcraft from your hand; and you shall have no soothsayers. 
verse:5:12 I will cut off your engraved images and your pillars out of your midst; and you shall no more worship the work of your hands. 
verse:5:13 I will uproot your Asherim out of your midst; and I will destroy your cities. 
verse:5:14 I will execute vengeance in anger, and wrath on the nations that didn't listen."
verse:6:1 Listen now to what HASHEM says: "Arise, plead your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear what you have to say. 
verse:6:2 Hear, you mountains, HASHEM's controversy, and you enduring foundations of the earth; for HASHEM has a controversy with his people, and he will contend with Israel.
