verse:6:3 My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me! 
verse:6:4 For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you out of the house of bondage. I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam. 
verse:6:5 My people, remember now what Balak king of Moab devised, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim to Gilgal, that you may know the righteous acts of HASHEM."
verse:6:6 How shall I come before HASHEM, and bow myself before the exalted God? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old? 
verse:6:7 Will HASHEM be pleased with thousands of rams? With tens of thousands of rivers of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my disobedience? The fruit of my body for the sin of my soul? 
verse:6:8 He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does HASHEM require of you, but to act justly, to love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?
portion:Zechariah 2:14 - 4:7
verse:2:14 Sing and rejoice, daughter of Zion; for, behold, I come, and I will dwell in the midst of you,' says HASHEM. 
verse:2:15 Many nations shall join themselves to HASHEM in that day, and shall be my people; and I will dwell in the midst of you, and you shall know that HASHEM of Hosts has sent me to you. 
verse:2:16 HASHEM will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land, and will again choose Jerusalem. 
verse:2:17 Be silent, all flesh, before HASHEM; for he has roused himself from his holy habitation!"
verse:3:1 He showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of HASHEM, and Satan standing at his right hand to be his adversary. 
verse:3:2 HASHEM said to Satan, "HASHEM rebuke you, Satan! Yes, HASHEM who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Isn't this a burning stick plucked out of the fire?"
verse:3:3 Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and was standing before the angel. 
verse:3:4 He answered and spoke to those who stood before him, saying, "Take the filthy garments off of him." To him he said, "Behold, I have caused your iniquity to pass from you, and I will clothe you with rich clothing."
verse:3:5 I said, "Let them set a clean turban on his head."
So they set a clean turban on his head, and clothed him; and the angel of HASHEM was standing by. 
verse:3:6 The angel of HASHEM protested to Joshua, saying, 
verse:3:7 "Thus says HASHEM of Hosts: 'If you will walk in my ways, and if you will follow my instructions, then you also shall judge my house, and shall also keep my courts, and I will give you a place of access among these who stand by. 
verse:3:8 Hear now, Joshua the high priest, you and your fellows who sit before you; for they are men who are a sign: for, behold, I will bring forth my servant, the Branch. 
verse:3:9 For, behold, the stone that I have set before Joshua; on one stone are seven eyes: behold, I will engrave its engraving,' says HASHEM of Hosts, 'and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day. 
verse:3:10 In that day,' says HASHEM of Hosts, 'you will invite every man his neighbor under the vine and under the fig tree.'"
verse:4:1 The angel who talked with me came again, and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep. 
verse:4:2 He said to me, "What do you see?"
I said, "I have seen, and behold, a menorah all of gold, with its bowl on the top of it, and its seven lamps thereon; there are seven pipes to each of the lamps, which are on the top of it; 
verse:4:3 and two olive trees by it, one on the right side of the bowl, and the other on the left side of it."
verse:4:4 I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, "What are these, my lord?"
verse:4:5 Then the angel who talked with me answered me, "Don't you know what these are?"
I said, "No, my lord."
verse:4:6 Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, "This is the word of HASHEM to Zerubbabel, saying, 'Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit,' says HASHEM of Hosts. 
verse:4:7 Who are you, great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you are a plain; and he will bring out the capstone with shouts of 'Grace, grace, to it!'"
portion:Zechariah 14:1-21
verse:14:1 Behold, a day of HASHEM comes, when your spoil will be divided in your midst. 
verse:14:2 For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city will be taken, the houses rifled, and the women ravished. Half of the city will go out into captivity, and the rest of the people will not be cut off from the city. 
verse:14:3 Then HASHEM will go out and fight against those nations, as when he fought in the day of battle. 
verse:14:4 His feet will stand in that day on the Mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives will be split in two, from east to west, making a very great valley. Half of the mountain will move toward the north, and half of it toward the south. 
verse:14:5 You shall flee by the valley of my mountains; for the valley of the mountains shall reach to Azel; yes, you shall flee, just like you fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. HASHEM my God will come, and all the holy ones with you. 
verse:14:6 It will happen in that day, that there will not be light, cold, or frost. 
verse:14:7 It will be a unique day which is known to HASHEM; not day, and not night; but it will come to pass, that at evening time there will be light.
verse:14:8 It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter will it be.
verse:14:9 HASHEM will be King over all the earth. In that day HASHEM will be one, and his name one. 
verse:14:10 All the land will be made like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and she will be lifted up, and will dwell in her place, from Benjamin's gate to the place of the first gate, to the corner gate, and from the tower of Hananel to the king's winepresses. 
verse:14:11 Men will dwell therein, and there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will dwell safely. 
verse:14:12 This will be the plague with which HASHEM will strike all the peoples who have warred against Jerusalem: their flesh will consume away while they stand on their feet, and their eyes will consume away in their sockets, and their tongue will consume away in their mouth. 
verse:14:13 It will happen in that day, that a great panic from HASHEM will be among them; and they will lay hold everyone on the hand of his neighbor, and his hand will rise up against the hand of his neighbor. 
verse:14:14 Judah also will fight at Jerusalem; and the wealth of all the surrounding nations will be gathered together: gold, and silver, and clothing, in great abundance.
verse:14:15 So will be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the donkey, and of all the animals that will be in those camps, as that plague. 
verse:14:16 It will happen that everyone who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem will go up from year to year to worship the King, HASHEM of Hosts, and to keep the feast of booths. 
verse:14:17 It will be, that whoever of all the families of the earth doesn't go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, HASHEM of Hosts, on them there will be no rain. 
verse:14:18 If the family of Egypt doesn't go up, and doesn't come, neither will it rain on them. This will be the plague with which HASHEM will strike the nations that don't go up to keep the feast of booths. 
verse:14:19 This will be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all the nations that don't go up to keep the feast of booths. 
verse:14:20 In that day there will be on the bells of the horses, "HOLY TO THE HASHEM;" and the pots in HASHEM's house will be like the bowls before the altar. 
verse:14:21 Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to HASHEM of Hosts; and all those who sacrifice will come and take of them, and cook in them. In that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of HASHEM of Hosts.
portion:I Samuel 1:1 - 2:10
verse:1:1 Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite: 
verse:1:2 and he had two wives; the name of the one was Hannah, and the name of other Peninnah: and Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children. 
verse:1:3 This man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice to HASHEM of Hosts in Shiloh. The two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests to HASHEM, were there. 
verse:1:4 When the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave to Peninnah his wife, and to all her sons and her daughters, portions: 
verse:1:5 but to Hannah he gave a double portion; for he loved Hannah, but HASHEM had shut up her womb. 
verse:1:6 Her rival provoked her severely, to make her fret, because HASHEM had shut up her womb. 
verse:1:7 As he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of HASHEM, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and didn't eat. 
verse:1:8 Elkanah her husband said to her, "Hannah, why do you weep? Why don't you eat? Why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?"
verse:1:9 So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of the temple of HASHEM. 
verse:1:10 She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to HASHEM, and wept bitterly. 
verse:1:11 She vowed a vow, and said, "HASHEM of Hosts, if you will indeed look on the affliction of your handmaid, and remember me, and not forget your handmaid, but will give to your handmaid a boy, then I will give him to HASHEM all the days of his life, and no razor shall come on his head."
verse:1:12 It happened, as she continued praying before HASHEM, that Eli saw her mouth. 
verse:1:13 Now Hannah spoke in her heart. Only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she had been drunken. 
verse:1:14 Eli said to her, "How long will you be drunken? Put away your wine from you."
verse:1:15 Hannah answered, "No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit. I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but I poured out my soul before HASHEM. 
verse:1:16 Don't count your handmaid for a wicked woman; for I have been speaking out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation."
verse:1:17 Then Eli answered, "Go in peace; and may the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him."
verse:1:18 She said, "Let your handmaid find favor in your sight." So the woman went her way, and ate; and her facial expression wasn't sad any more. 
verse:1:19 They rose up in the morning early, and worshiped before HASHEM, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and HASHEM remembered her.
verse:1:20 It happened, when the time had come, that Hannah conceived, and bore a son; and she named him Samuel, saying, "Because I have asked him of HASHEM."
verse:1:21 The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to HASHEM the yearly sacrifice, and his vow. 
verse:1:22 But Hannah didn't go up; for she said to her husband, "Not until the child is weaned; then I will bring him, that he may appear before HASHEM, and stay there forever."
verse:1:23 Elkanah her husband said to her, "Do what seems good to you. Wait until you have weaned him; only may HASHEM establish his word."
So the woman waited and nursed her son, until she weaned him. 
verse:1:24 When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, and one efah of meal, and a bottle of wine, and brought him to HASHEM's house in Shiloh. The child was young. 
verse:1:25 They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli. 
verse:1:26 She said, "Oh, my lord, as your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to HASHEM. 
verse:1:27 For this child I prayed; and HASHEM has given me my petition which I asked of him. 
verse:1:28 Therefore also I have granted him to HASHEM. As long as he lives he is granted to HASHEM." He worshiped HASHEM there.
verse:2:1 Hannah prayed, and said: "My heart exults in HASHEM! My horn is exalted in HASHEM. My mouth is enlarged over my enemies, because I rejoice in your salvation. 
verse:2:2 There is no one as holy as HASHEM, For there is no one besides you, nor is there any rock like our God.
verse:2:3 "Talk no more so exceeding proudly. Don't let arrogance come out of your mouth, For HASHEM is a God of knowledge. By him actions are weighed.
verse:2:4 "The bows of the mighty men are broken. Those who stumbled are armed with strength. 
verse:2:5 Those who were full have hired themselves out for bread. Those who were hungry are satisfied. Yes, the barren has borne seven. She who has many children languishes.
verse:2:6 "HASHEM kills, and makes alive. He brings down to Sheol, and brings up. 
verse:2:7 HASHEM makes poor, and makes rich. He brings low, he also lifts up. 
verse:2:8 He raises up the poor out of the dust. He lifts up the needy from the dunghill, To make them sit with princes, and inherit the throne of glory. For the pillars of the earth are HASHEM's. He has set the world on them. 
verse:2:9 He will keep the feet of his holy ones, but the wicked shall be put to silence in darkness; for no man shall prevail by strength. 
verse:2:10 Those who strive with HASHEM shall be broken to pieces. He will thunder against them in the sky.
"HASHEM will judge the ends of the earth. He will give strength to his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed." 
portion:I Samuel 11:14 - 12:22
verse:11:14 Then Samuel said to the people, "Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there." 
verse:11:15 All the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before HASHEM in Gilgal; and there they offered sacrifices of peace offerings before HASHEM; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
verse:12:1 Samuel said to all Israel, "Behold, I have listened to your voice in all that you said to me, and have made a king over you. 
verse:12:2 Now, behold, the king walks before you; and I am old and gray-headed; and behold, my sons are with you: and I have walked before you from my youth to this day. 
verse:12:3 Here I am. Witness against me before HASHEM, and before his anointed. Whose ox have I taken? Whose donkey have I taken? Whom have I defrauded? Whom have I oppressed? Of whose hand have I taken a ransom to blind my eyes therewith? I will restore it to you."
verse:12:4 They said, "You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither have you taken anything of any man's hand."
verse:12:5 He said to them, "HASHEM is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand."
They said, "He is witness." 
verse:12:6 Samuel said to the people, "It is HASHEM who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt. 
verse:12:7 Now therefore stand still, that I may plead with you before HASHEM concerning all the righteous acts of HASHEM, which he did to you and to your fathers.
verse:12:8 "When Jacob had come into Egypt, and your fathers cried to HASHEM, then HASHEM sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your fathers out of Egypt, and made them to dwell in this place.
verse:12:9 "But they forgot HASHEM their God; and he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the army of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab; and they fought against them. 
verse:12:10 They cried to HASHEM, and said, 'We have sinned, because we have forsaken HASHEM, and have served the Baals and the Ashtaroth: but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve you.' 
verse:12:11 HASHEM sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and you lived in safety.
verse:12:12 "When you saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, you said to me, 'No, but a king shall reign over us;' when HASHEM your God was your king. 
verse:12:13 Now therefore see the king whom you have chosen, and whom you have asked for: and behold, HASHEM has set a king over you. 
verse:12:14 If you will fear HASHEM, and serve him, and listen to his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of HASHEM, then both you and also the king who reigns over you are followers of HASHEM your God. 
verse:12:15 But if you will not listen to the voice of HASHEM, but rebel against the commandment of HASHEM, then will the hand of HASHEM be against you, as it was against your fathers.
verse:12:16 "Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which HASHEM will do before your eyes. 
verse:12:17 Isn't it wheat harvest today? I will call to HASHEM, that he may send thunder and rain; and you shall know and see that your wickedness is great, which you have done in the sight of HASHEM, in asking for a king."
verse:12:18 So Samuel called to HASHEM; and HASHEM sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people greatly feared HASHEM and Samuel.
verse:12:19 All the people said to Samuel, "Pray for your servants to HASHEM your God, that we not die; for we have added to all our sins this evil, to ask us a king."
verse:12:20 Samuel said to the people, "Don't be afraid. You have indeed done all this evil; yet don't turn aside from following HASHEM, but serve HASHEM with all your heart. 
verse:12:21 Don't turn aside to go after vain things which can't profit nor deliver, for they are vain. 
verse:12:22 For HASHEM will not forsake his people for his great name's sake, because it has pleased HASHEM to make you a people to himself.
portion:I Samuel 20:18 - 20:4220:18} Then Jonathan said to him, "Tomorrow is the new moon: and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty. 
verse:20:19 When you have stayed three days, you shall go down quickly, and come to the place where you hid yourself when this started, and shall remain by the stone Ezel. 
verse:20:20 I will shoot three arrows on its side, as though I shot at a mark. 
verse:20:21 Behold, I will send the boy, saying, 'Go, find the arrows!' If I tell the boy, 'Behold, the arrows are on this side of you. Take them;' then come; for there is peace to you and no hurt, as HASHEM lives. 
verse:20:22 But if I say this to the boy, 'Behold, the arrows are beyond you;' then go your way; for HASHEM has sent you away. 
verse:20:23 Concerning the matter which you and I have spoken of, behold, HASHEM is between you and me forever."
verse:20:24 So David hid himself in the field: and when the new moon had come, the king sat him down to eat food. 
verse:20:25 The king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul's side: but David's place was empty. 
verse:20:26 Nevertheless Saul didn't say anything that day: for he thought, "Something has happened to him. He is not clean. Surely he is not clean."
verse:20:27 It happened on the next day after the new moon, the second day, that David's place was empty. Saul said to Jonathan his son, "Why doesn't the son of Jesse come to eat, neither yesterday, nor today?"
verse:20:28 Jonathan answered Saul, "David earnestly asked leave of me to go to Bethlehem. 
verse:20:29 He said, 'Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city. My brother has commanded me to be there. Now, if I have found favor in your eyes, please let me go away and see my brothers.' Therefore he has not come to the king's table."
verse:20:30 Then Saul's anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said to him, "You son of a perverse rebellious woman, don't I know that you have chosen the son of Jesse to your own shame, and to the shame of your mother's nakedness? 
verse:20:31 For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, you shall not be established, nor your kingdom. Therefore now send and bring him to me, for he shall surely die!"
verse:20:32 Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said to him, "Why should he be put to death? What has he done?"
verse:20:33 Saul cast his spear at him to strike him. By this Jonathan knew that his father was determined to put David to death. 
verse:20:34 So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and ate no food the second day of the month; for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame. 
verse:20:35 It happened in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little boy with him. 
verse:20:36 He said to his boy, "Run, find now the arrows which I shoot." As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him. 
verse:20:37 When the boy had come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the boy, and said, "Isn't the arrow beyond you?" 
verse:20:38 Jonathan cried after the boy, "Go fast! Hurry! Don't delay!" Jonathan's boy gathered up the arrows, and came to his master. 
verse:20:39 But the boy didn't know anything. Only Jonathan and David knew the matter. 
verse:20:40 Jonathan gave his weapons to his boy, and said to him, "Go, carry them to the city."
verse:20:41 As soon as the boy was gone, David arose out of the south, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times. They kissed one another, and wept one with another, and David wept the most. 
verse:20:42 Jonathan said to David, "Go in peace, because we have both sworn in the name of HASHEM, saying, 'HASHEM shall be between me and you, and between my seed and your seed, forever.'" 
portion:II Samuel 6:1 - 7:17
verse:6:1 David again gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand. 
verse:6:2 David arose, and went with all the people who were with him, from Baale Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God, which is called by the Name, even the name of HASHEM of Hosts who sits above the cherubim. 
verse:6:3 They set the ark of God on a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that was in the hill: and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, drove the new cart. 
verse:6:4 They brought it out of the house of Abinadab, which was in the hill, with the ark of God: and Ahio went before the ark. 
verse:6:5 David and all the house of Israel played before HASHEM with all kinds of instruments made of fir wood, and with harps, and with stringed instruments, and with tambourines, and with castanets, and with cymbals. 
verse:6:6 When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached for the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the cattle stumbled. 
verse:6:7 The anger of HASHEM was kindled against Uzzah; and God struck him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God. 
verse:6:8 David was displeased, because HASHEM had broken forth on Uzzah; and he called that place Perez Uzzah, to this day. 
verse:6:9 David was afraid of HASHEM that day; and he said, "How shall the ark of HASHEM come to me?" 
verse:6:10 So David would not move the ark of HASHEM to be with him in the city of David; but David carried it aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite. 
verse:6:11 The ark of HASHEM remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite three months: and HASHEM blessed Obed-Edom, and all his house. 
verse:6:12 It was told king David, saying, "HASHEM has blessed the house of Obed-Edom, and all that pertains to him, because of the ark of God."
David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom into the city of David with joy. 
verse:6:13 It was so, that, when those who bore the ark of HASHEM had gone six paces, he sacrificed an ox and a fattened calf. 
verse:6:14 David danced before HASHEM with all his might; and David was clothed in a linen ephod. 
verse:6:15 So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of HASHEM with shouting, and with the sound of the shofar. 
verse:6:16 It was so, as the ark of HASHEM came into the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David leaping and dancing before HASHEM; and she despised him in her heart. 
verse:6:17 They brought in the ark of HASHEM, and set it in its place, in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it; and David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before HASHEM. 
verse:6:18 When David had made an end of offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of HASHEM of Hosts. 
verse:6:19 He gave to all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to everyone a portion of bread, dates, and raisins. So all the people departed everyone to his house. 
verse:6:20 Then David returned to bless his household. Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, "How glorious the king of Israel was today, who uncovered himself today in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovers himself!"
verse:6:21 David said to Michal, "It was before HASHEM, who chose me above your father, and above all his house, to appoint me prince over the people of HASHEM, over Israel. Therefore will I celebrate before HASHEM. 
verse:6:22 I will be yet more vile than this, and will be base in my own sight. But of the handmaids of whom you have spoken, they shall honor me." 
verse:6:23 Michal the daughter of Saul had no child to the day of her death.
verse:7:1 It happened, when the king lived in his house, and HASHEM had given him rest from all his enemies all around, 
verse:7:2 that the king said to Nathan the prophet, "See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of God dwells within curtains."
verse:7:3 Nathan said to the king, "Go, do all that is in your heart; for HASHEM is with you."
verse:7:4 It happened the same night, that the word of HASHEM came to Nathan, saying, 
verse:7:5 "Go and tell my servant David, 'Thus says HASHEM, "Shall you build me a house for me to dwell in? 
verse:7:6 For I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have moved around in a tent and in a tabernacle. 
verse:7:7 In all places in which I have walked with all the children of Israel, did I say a word to any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people Israel, saying, 'Why have you not built me a house of cedar?'"' 
verse:7:8 Now therefore you shall tell my servant David this, 'Thus says HASHEM of Hosts, "I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, that you should be prince over my people, over Israel. 
verse:7:9 I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. I will make you a great name, like the name of the great ones who are in the earth. 
verse:7:10 I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as at the first, 
verse:7:11 and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I will cause you to rest from all your enemies. Moreover HASHEM tells you that HASHEM will make you a house. 
verse:7:12 When your days are fulfilled, and you shall sleep with your fathers, I will set up your seed after you, who shall proceed out of your bowels, and I will establish his kingdom. 
verse:7:13 He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever. 
verse:7:14 I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commits iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men; 
verse:7:15 but my loving kindness shall not depart from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before you. 
verse:7:16 Your house and your kingdom shall be made sure forever before you. Your throne shall be established forever."'" 
verse:7:17 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
portion:II Samuel 22:1-51
verse:22:1 David spoke to HASHEM the words of this song in the day that HASHEM delivered him out of the hand of all his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul: 
verse:22:2 and he said, "HASHEM is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer, even mine; 
verse:22:3 God, my rock, in him I will take refuge; my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge. My savior, you save me from violence. 
verse:22:4 I will call on HASHEM, who is worthy to be praised: So shall I be saved from my enemies. 
verse:22:5 For the waves of death surrounded me. The floods of ungodliness made me afraid. 
verse:22:6 The cords of [Sheol were around me. The snares of death caught me. 
verse:22:7 In my distress I called on HASHEM. Yes, I called to my God. He heard my voice out of his temple. My cry came into his ears. 
verse:22:8 Then the earth shook and trembled. The foundations of heaven quaked and were shaken, because he was angry. 
verse:22:9 Smoke went up out of his nostrils. Fire out of his mouth devoured. Coals were kindled by it. 
verse:22:10 He bowed the heavens also, and came down. Thick darkness was under his feet. 
verse:22:11 He rode on a cherub, and flew. Yes, he was seen on the wings of the wind. 
verse:22:12 He made darkness pavilions around himself: gathering of waters, and thick clouds of the skies. 
verse:22:13 At the brightness before him, coals of fire were kindled. 
verse:22:14 HASHEM thundered from heaven. The Most High uttered his voice. 
verse:22:15 He sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and confused them. 
verse:22:16 Then the channels of the sea appeared. The foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of HASHEM, At the blast of the breath of his nostrils. 
verse:22:17 He sent from on high and he took me. He drew me out of many waters. 
verse:22:18 He delivered me from my strong enemy, from those who hated me, for they were too mighty for me. 
verse:22:19 They came on me in the day of my calamity, but HASHEM was my support. 
verse:22:20 He also brought me out into a large place. He delivered me, because he delighted in me. 
verse:22:21 HASHEM rewarded me according to my righteousness. He rewarded me according to the cleanness of my hands. 
verse:22:22 For I have kept the ways of HASHEM, and have not wickedly departed from my God. 
verse:22:23 For all his ordinances were before me. As for his statutes, I did not depart from them. 
verse:22:24 I was also perfect toward him. I kept myself from my iniquity. 
verse:22:25 Therefore HASHEM has rewarded me according to my righteousness, According to my cleanness in his eyesight. 
verse:22:26 With the merciful you will show yourself merciful. With the perfect man you will show yourself perfect. 
verse:22:27 With the pure you will show yourself pure. With the crooked you will show yourself shrewd. 
verse:22:28 You will save the afflicted people, But your eyes are on the haughty, that you may bring them down. 
verse:22:29 For you are my lamp, HASHEM. HASHEM will light up my darkness. 
verse:22:30 For by you, I run against a troop. By my God, I leap over a wall. 
verse:22:31 As for God, his way is perfect. The word of HASHEM is tested. He is a shield to all those who take refuge in him. 
verse:22:32 For who is God, besides HASHEM? Who is a rock, besides our God? 
verse:22:33 God is my strong fortress. He makes my way perfect. 
verse:22:34 He makes his feet like hinds' feet, and sets me on my high places. 
verse:22:35 He teaches my hands to war, so that my arms bend a bow of brass. 
verse:22:36 You have also given me the shield of your salvation. Your gentleness has made me great. 
verse:22:37 You have enlarged my steps under me. My feet have not slipped. 
verse:22:38 I have pursued my enemies and destroyed them. I didn't turn again until they were consumed. 
verse:22:39 I have consumed them, and struck them through, so that they can't arise. Yes, they have fallen under my feet. 
verse:22:40 For you have armed me with strength for the battle. You have subdued under me those who rose up against me. 
verse:22:41 You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, that I might cut off those who hate me. 
verse:22:42 They looked, but there was none to save; even to HASHEM, but he didn't answer them. 
verse:22:43 Then I beat them as small as the dust of the earth. I crushed them as the mire of the streets, and spread them abroad. 
verse:22:44 You also have delivered me from the strivings of my people. You have kept me to be the head of the nations. A people whom I have not known will serve me. 
verse:22:45 The foreigners will submit themselves to me. As soon as they hear of me, they will obey me. 
verse:22:46 The foreigners will fade away, and will come trembling out of their close places. 
verse:22:47 HASHEM lives! Blessed be my rock! Exalted be God, the rock of my salvation, 
verse:22:48 even the God who executes vengeance for me, who brings down peoples under me, 
verse:22:49 who brings me away from my enemies. Yes, you lift me up above those who rise up against me. You deliver me from the violent man. 
verse:22:50 Therefore I will give thanks to you, HASHEM, among the nations. Will sing praises to your name. 
verse:22:51 He gives great deliverance to his king, and shows loving kindness to his anointed, to David and to his seed, forevermore." 
portion:Jeremiah 1:1 - 2:3
verse:1:1 The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin: 
verse:1:2 to whom the word of HASHEM came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign. 
verse:1:3 It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, to the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, to the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month. 
verse:1:4 Now the word of HASHEM came to me, saying, 
verse:1:5 "Before I formed you in the belly, I knew you. Before you came forth out of the womb, I sanctified you. I have appointed you a prophet to the nations." 
verse:1:6 Then I said, "Ah, my Lord HASHEM! Behold, I don't know how to speak; for I am a child."
verse:1:7 But HASHEM said to me, "Don't say, 'I am a child;' for to whoever I shall send you, you shall go, and whatever I shall command you, you shall speak. 
verse:1:8 Don't be afraid because of them; for I am with you to deliver you," says HASHEM. 
verse:1:9 Then HASHEM put forth his hand, and touched my mouth; and HASHEM said to me, "Behold, I have put my words in your mouth. 
verse:1:10 Behold, I have this day set you over the nations and over the kingdoms, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy and to overthrow, to build and to plant." 
verse:1:11 Moreover the word of HASHEM came to me, saying, "Jeremiah, what do you see?"
I said, "I see a branch of an almond tree."
verse:1:12 Then HASHEM said to me, "You have seen well; for I watch over my word to perform it."
verse:1:13 The word of HASHEM came to me the second time, saying, "What do you see?"
I said, "I see a boiling caldron; and it is tipping away from the north."
verse:1:14 Then HASHEM said to me, "Out of the north evil will break out on all the inhabitants of the land. 
verse:1:15 For, behold, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north," says HASHEM; "and they shall come, and they shall each set his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all its walls all around, and against all the cities of Judah. 
verse:1:16 I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, and worshiped the works of their own hands.
verse:1:17 "You therefore put your belt on your waist, arise, and speak to them all that I command you. Don't be dismayed at them, lest I dismay you before them. 
verse:1:18 For, behold, I have made you this day a fortified city, and an iron pillar, and bronze walls, against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against its princes, against its priests, and against the people of the land. 
verse:1:19 They will fight against you; but they will not prevail against you; for I am with you," says HASHEM, "to deliver you."
verse:2:1 The word of HASHEM came to me, saying, 
verse:2:2 "Go, and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, 'Thus says HASHEM, "I remember for you the kindness of your youth, the love of your weddings; how you went after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown. 
verse:2:3 Israel was holiness to HASHEM, the first fruits of his increase. All who devour him shall be held guilty. Evil shall come on them,"' says HASHEM."
portion:Jeremiah 2:4 - 28; 3:42:4} Hear the word of HASHEM, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel! 
verse:2:5 Thus says HASHEM, "What unrighteousness have your fathers found in me, that they have gone far from me, and have walked after vanity, and are become vain? 
verse:2:6 Neither did they say, 'Where is HASHEM who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that none passed through, and where no man lived?' 
verse:2:7 I brought you into a plentiful land, to eat its fruit and its goodness; but when you entered, you defiled my land, and made my heritage an abomination. 
verse:2:8 The priests didn't say, 'Where is HASHEM?' and those who handle the law didn't know me. The rulers also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.
verse:2:9 "Therefore I will yet contend with you," says HASHEM, "and I will contend with your children's children. 
verse:2:10 For pass over to the islands of Kittim, and see; and send to Kedar, and consider diligently; and see if there has been such a thing. 
verse:2:11 Has a nation changed its gods, which really are no gods? But my people have changed their glory for that which does not profit.
verse:2:12 "Be astonished, you heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid. Be very desolate," says HASHEM. 
verse:2:13 "For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me, the spring of living waters, and cut them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water. 
verse:2:14 Is Israel a servant? Is he a native-born slave? Why has he become a prey? 
verse:2:15 The young lions have roared at him, and yelled. They have made his land waste. His cities are burned up, without inhabitant. 
verse:2:16 The children also of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of your head.
verse:2:17 "Haven't you procured this to yourself, in that you have forsaken HASHEM your God, when he led you by the way? 
verse:2:18 Now what have you to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? Or what have you to do in the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
verse:2:19 "Your own wickedness shall correct you, and your backsliding shall reprove you. Know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and a bitter, that you have forsaken HASHEM your God, and that my fear is not in you," says the Lord, HASHEM of Hosts. 
verse:2:20 "For of old time I have broken your yoke, and burst your bonds; and you said, 'I will not serve;' for on every high hill and under every green tree you bowed yourself, playing the prostitute. 
verse:2:21 Yet I had planted you a noble vine, wholly a right seed. How then have you turned into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine to me? 
verse:2:22 For though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap, yet your iniquity is marked before me," says HASHEM GOD.
verse:2:23 "How can you say, 'I am not defiled. I have not gone after the Baals'? See your way in the valley. Know what you have done. You are a swift dromedary traversing her ways; 
verse:2:24 a wild donkey used to the wilderness, that snuffs up the wind in her desire. When she is in heat, who can turn her away? All those who seek her will not weary themselves. In her month, they will find her.
verse:2:25 "Withhold your foot from being unshod, and your throat from thirst. But you said, 'It is in vain. No, for I have loved strangers, and I will go after them.' 
verse:2:26 As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets; 
verse:2:27 who tell wood, 'You are my father;' and a stone, 'You have brought me out:' for they have turned their back to me, and not their face; but in the time of their trouble they will say, 'Arise, and save us.'
verse:2:28 "But where are your gods that you have made for yourselves? Let them arise, if they can save you in the time of your trouble: for according to the number of your cities are your gods, Judah.
verse:3:4 Will you not from this time cry to me, 'My Father, you are the guide of my youth?'
portion:Jeremiah 7:21 - 8:3; 9:22 - 9:23
verse:7:21 Thus says HASHEM of Hosts, the God of Israel: Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices, and eat meat. 
verse:7:22 For I didn't speak to your fathers, nor command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices: 
verse:7:23 but this thing I commanded them, saying, Listen to my voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be my people; and walk in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you. 
verse:7:24 But they didn't listen nor turn their ear, but walked in their own counsels and in the stubbornness of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward. 
verse:7:25 Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt to this day, I have sent to you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them: 
verse:7:26 yet they didn't listen to me, nor inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff: they did worse than their fathers. 
verse:7:27 You shall speak all these words to them; but they will not listen to you: you shall also call to them; but they will not answer you. 
verse:7:28 You shall tell them, This is the nation that has not listened to the voice of HASHEM their God, nor received instruction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth. 
verse:7:29 Cut off your hair, and throw it away, and take up a lamentation on the bare heights; for HASHEM has rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath. 
verse:7:30 For the children of Judah have done that which is evil in my sight, says HASHEM: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it. 
verse:7:31 They have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I didn't command, nor did it come into my mind. 
verse:7:32 Therefore, behold, the days come, says HASHEM, that it shall no more be called Topheth, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter: for they shall bury in Topheth, until there is no place to bury. 
verse:7:33 The dead bodies of this people shall be food for the birds of the sky, and for the animals of the earth; and none shall frighten them away. 
verse:7:34 Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride; for the land shall become a waste.
verse:8:1 At that time, says HASHEM, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves; 
verse:8:2 and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the army of the sky, which they have loved, and which they have served, and after which they have walked, and which they have sought, and which they have worshiped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried, they shall be for dung on the surface of the earth. 
verse:8:3 Death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places where I have driven them, says HASHEM of Hosts.
verse:9:22 Thus says HASHEM, Don't let the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, don't let the rich man glory in his riches; 
verse:9:23 but let him who glories glory in this, that he has understanding, and knows me, that I am HASHEM who exercises loving kindness, justice, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, says HASHEM.
portion:Jeremiah 16:19 - 17:14
verse:16:19 HASHEM, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of affliction, to you shall the nations come from the ends of the earth, and shall say, Our fathers have inherited nothing but lies, vanity and things in which there is no profit. 
verse:16:20 Shall a man make to himself gods, which yet are no gods? 
verse:16:21 Therefore, behold, I will cause them to know, this once will I cause them to know my hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is HASHEM.
verse:17:1 The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is engraved on the tablet of their heart, and on the horns of your altars; 
verse:17:2 while their children remember their altars and their Asherim by the green trees on the high hills. 
verse:17:3 My mountain in the field, I will give your substance and all your treasures for a spoil, and your high places, because of sin, throughout all your borders. 
verse:17:4 You, even of yourself, shall discontinue from your heritage that I gave you; and I will cause you to serve your enemies in the land which you don't know: for you have kindled a fire in my anger which shall burn forever. 
verse:17:5 Thus says HASHEM: Cursed is the man who trusts in man, and makes flesh his arm, and whose heart departs from HASHEM. 
verse:17:6 For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good comes, but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited. 
verse:17:7 Blessed is the man who trusts in HASHEM, and whose trust HASHEM is. 
verse:17:8 For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters, who spreads out its roots by the river, and shall not fear when heat comes, but its leaf shall be green; and shall not be careful in the year of drought, neither shall cease from yielding fruit. 
verse:17:9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it? 
verse:17:10 I, HASHEM, search the mind, I try the heart, even to give every man according to his ways, according to the fruit of his doings. 
verse:17:11 As the partridge that sits on eggs which she has not laid, so is he who gets riches, and not by right; in the midst of his days they shall leave him, and at his end he shall be a fool. 
verse:17:12 A glorious throne, set on high from the beginning, is the place of our sanctuary. 
verse:17:13 HASHEM, the hope of Israel, all who forsake you shall be disappointed. Those who depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken HASHEM, the spring of living waters. 
verse:17:14 Heal me, O HASHEM, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for you are my praise.
portion:Jeremiah 32:6 - 32:27
verse:32:6 Jeremiah said, The word of HASHEM came to me, saying, 
verse:32:7 Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle shall come to you, saying, Buy my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is yours to buy it. 
verse:32:8 So Hanamel my uncle's son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of HASHEM, and said to me, Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption is yours; buy it for yourself. Then I knew that this was the word of HASHEM. 
verse:32:9 I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle's son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver. 
verse:32:10 I subscribed the deed, and sealed it, and called witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances. 
verse:32:11 So I took the deed of the purchase, both that which was sealed, containing the terms and conditions, and that which was open; 
verse:32:12 and I delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle's son, and in the presence of the witnesses who subscribed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the guard. 
verse:32:13 I commanded Baruch before them, saying, 
verse:32:14 Thus says HASHEM of Hosts, the God of Israel: Take these deeds, this deed of the purchase which is sealed, and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel; that they may continue many days. 
verse:32:15 For thus says HASHEM of Hosts, the God of Israel: Houses and fields and vineyards shall yet again be bought in this land. 
verse:32:16 Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to HASHEM, saying, 
verse:32:17 Ah HASHEM GOD! Behold, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm; there is nothing too hard for you, 
verse:32:18 who show loving kindness to thousands, and recompense the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them; the great, the mighty God, HASHEM of Hosts is his name; 
verse:32:19 great in counsel, and mighty in work; whose eyes are open on all the ways of the sons of men, to give everyone according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings: 
verse:32:20 who performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even to this day, both in Israel and among other men; and made yourself a name, as in this day; 
verse:32:21 and brought forth your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with great terror; 
verse:32:22 and gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey; 
verse:32:23 and they came in, and possessed it, but they didn't obey your voice, neither walked in your law; they have done nothing of all that you commanded them to do: therefore you have caused all this evil to come on them. 
verse:32:24 Behold, the mounds, they have come to the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Kasdim who fight against it, because of the sword, and of the famine, and of the pestilence; and what you have spoken has happened; and behold, you see it. 
verse:32:25 You have said to me, HASHEM GOD, Buy the field for money, and call witnesses; whereas the city is given into the hand of the Kasdim. 
verse:32:26 Then came the word of HASHEM to Jeremiah, saying, 
verse:32:27 Behold, I am HASHEM, the God of all flesh: is there anything too hard for me?
portion:Jeremiah 34:8 - 34:22; 33:25 - 33:26
verse:34:8 The word that came to Jeremiah from HASHEM, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them; 
verse:34:9 that every man should let his male servant, and every man his female servant, who is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free; that none should make bondservants of them, of a Jew his brother. 
verse:34:10 All the princes and all the people obeyed, who had entered into the covenant, that everyone should let his male servant, and everyone his female servant, go free, that none should make bondservants of them any more; they obeyed, and let them go: 
verse:34:11 but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids. 
verse:34:12 Therefore the word of HASHEM came to Jeremiah from HASHEM, saying, 
verse:34:13 Thus says HASHEM, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying, 
verse:34:14 At the end of seven years you shall let go every man his brother who is a Hebrew, who has been sold to you, and has served you six years, you shall let him go free from you: but your fathers didn't listen to me, neither inclined their ear. 
verse:34:15 You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name: 
verse:34:16 but you turned and profaned my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their pleasure, to return; and you brought them into subjection, to be to you for servants and for handmaids. 
verse:34:17 Therefore thus says HASHEM: you have not listened to me, to proclaim liberty, every man to his brother, and every man to his neighbor: behold, I proclaim to you a liberty, says HASHEM, to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth. 
verse:34:18 I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts; 
verse:34:19 the princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, who passed between the parts of the calf; 
verse:34:20 I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life; and their dead bodies shall be for food to the birds of the sky, and to the animals of the earth. 
verse:34:21 Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon's army, who have gone away from you. 
verse:34:22 Behold, I will command, says HASHEM, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
verse:33:25 Thus says HASHEM: If my covenant of day and night fails, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth; 
verse:33:26 then will I also cast away the seed of Jacob, and of David my servant, so that I will not take of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to return, and will have mercy on them.
portion:Jeremiah 46:13 - 46:28
verse:46:13 The word that HASHEM spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon should come and strike the land of Egypt. 
verse:46:14 Declare in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes: say, Stand forth, and prepare; for the sword has devoured around you. 
verse:46:15 Why are your strong ones swept away? they didn't stand, because HASHEM pushed them. 
verse:46:16 He made many to stumble, yes, they fell one on another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword. 
verse:46:17 They cried there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he has let the appointed time pass by. 
verse:46:18 As I live, says the King, whose name is HASHEM of Hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come. 
verse:46:19 You daughter who dwells in Egypt, furnish yourself to go into captivity; for Memphis shall become a desolation, and shall be burnt up, without inhabitant. 
verse:46:20 Egypt is a very beautiful heifer; but destruction out of the north has come, it has come. 
verse:46:21 Also her hired men in the midst of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they didn't stand: for the day of their calamity has come on them, the time of their visitation. 
verse:46:22 The sound of it shall go like the serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as wood cutters. 
verse:46:23 They shall cut down her forest, says HASHEM, though it can't be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable. 
verse:46:24 The daughter of Egypt shall be disappointed; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north. 
verse:46:25 HASHEM of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods, and her kings; even Pharaoh, and those who trust in him: 
verse:46:26 and I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, says HASHEM. 
verse:46:27 But don't you be afraid, Jacob my servant, neither be dismayed, Israel: for, behold, I will save you from afar, and your seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be quiet and at ease, and none shall make him afraid. 
verse:46:28 Don't you be afraid, O Jacob my servant, says HASHEM; for I am with you: for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have driven you; but I will not make a full end of you, but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.
portion:Joshua 1:1 - 1:18
verse:1:1 Now it happened after the death of Moses the servant of HASHEM, that HASHEM spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses' servant, saying, 
verse:1:2 "Moses my servant is dead; now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, you, and all this people, to the land which I give to them, even to the children of Israel. 
verse:1:3 I have given you every place that the sole of your foot will tread on, as I told Moses. 
verse:1:4 From the wilderness, and this Lebanon, even to the great river, the river Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, and to the great sea toward the going down of the sun, shall be your border. 
verse:1:5 No man will be able to stand before you all the days of your life. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not fail you nor forsake you.
verse:1:6 "Be strong and courageous; for you shall cause this people to inherit the land which I swore to their fathers to give them. 
verse:1:7 Only be strong and very courageous, to observe to do according to all the law, which Moses my servant commanded you. Don't turn from it to the right hand or to the left, that you may have good success wherever you go. 
verse:1:8 This scroll of the Torah shall not depart out of your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, that you may observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then you shall make your way prosperous, and then you shall have good success. 
verse:1:9 Haven't I commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Don't be afraid, neither be dismayed: for HASHEM your God is with you wherever you go."
verse:1:10 Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying, 
verse:1:11 "Pass through the midst of the camp, and command the people, saying, 'Prepare food; for within three days you are to pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land, which HASHEM your God gives you to possess it.'"
verse:1:12 Joshua spoke to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, saying, 
verse:1:13 "Remember the word which Moses the servant of HASHEM commanded you, saying, 'HASHEM your God gives you rest, and will give you this land. 
verse:1:14 Your wives, your little ones, and your livestock, shall live in the land which Moses gave you beyond the Jordan; but you shall pass over before your brothers armed, all the mighty men of valor, and shall help them 
verse:1:15 until HASHEM has given your brothers rest, as he has given you, and they have also possessed the land which HASHEM your God gives them. Then you shall return to the land of your possession, and possess it, which Moses the servant of HASHEM gave you beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise.'"
verse:1:16 They answered Joshua, saying, "All that you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go. 
verse:1:17 Just as we listened to Moses in all things, so will we listen to you. Only may HASHEM your God be with you, as he was with Moses. 
verse:1:18 Whoever rebels against your commandment, and doesn't listen to your words in all that you command him, he shall be put to death. Only be strong and courageous."
portion:Joshua 2:1 - 2:24
verse:2:1 Joshua the son of Nun secretly sent two men out of Shittim as spies, saying, "Go, view the land, including Jericho." They went and came into the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab, and slept there.
verse:2:2 The king of Jericho was told, "Behold, men of the children of Israel came in here tonight to spy out the land."
verse:2:3 The king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, "Bring out the men who have come to you, who have entered into your house; for they have come to spy out all the land."
verse:2:4 The woman took the two men and hid them. Then she said, "Yes, the men came to me, but I didn't know where they came from. 
verse:2:5 It happened about the time of the shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out. Where the men went, I don't know. Pursue them quickly; for you will overtake them." 
verse:2:6 But she had brought them up to the roof, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order on the roof. 
verse:2:7 The men pursued them the way to the Jordan to the fords: and as soon as those who pursued them had gone out, they shut the gate. 
verse:2:8 Before they had laid down, she came up to them on the roof; 
verse:2:9 and she said to the men, "I know that HASHEM has given you the land, and that the fear of you has fallen on us, and that all the inhabitants of the land melt away before you. 
verse:2:10 For we have heard how HASHEM dried up the water of the Sea of Suf before you, when you came out of Egypt; and what you did to the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan, to Sihon and to Og, whom you utterly destroyed. 
verse:2:11 As soon as we had heard it, our hearts melted, neither did there remain any more spirit in any man, because of you: for HASHEM your God, he is God in heaven above, and on earth beneath. 
verse:2:12 Now therefore, please swear to me by HASHEM, since I have dealt kindly with you, that you also will deal kindly with my father's house, and give me a true token; 
verse:2:13 and that you will save alive my father, my mother, my brothers, and my sisters, and all that they have, and will deliver our lives from death."
verse:2:14 The men said to her, "Our life for yours, if you don't talk about this business of ours; and it shall be, when HASHEM gives us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with you."
verse:2:15 Then she let them down by a cord through the window; for her house was on the side of the wall, and she lived on the wall. 
verse:2:16 She said to them, "Go to the mountain, lest the pursuers find you; and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers have returned. Afterward, you may go your way."
verse:2:17 The men said to her, "We will be guiltless of this your oath which you have made us to swear. 
verse:2:18 Behold, when we come into the land, you shall bind this line of scarlet thread in the window which you used to let us down. You shall gather to yourself into the house your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your father's household. 
verse:2:19 It shall be that whoever goes out of the doors of your house into the street, his blood will be on his head, and we will be guiltless. Whoever is with you in the house, his blood shall be on our head, if any hand is on him. 
verse:2:20 But if you talk about this business of ours, then we shall be guiltless of your oath which you have made us to swear."
verse:2:21 She said, "According to your words, so be it." She sent them away, and they departed. She tied the scarlet line in the window.
verse:2:22 They went, and came to the mountain, and stayed there three days, until the pursuers had returned. The pursuers sought them throughout all the way, but didn't find them. 
verse:2:23 Then the two men returned, descended from the mountain, passed over, and came to Joshua the son of Nun; and they told him all that had happened to them. 
verse:2:24 They said to Joshua, "Truly HASHEM has delivered into our hands all the land. Moreover, all the inhabitants of the land melt away before us."
portion:Joshua 5:2 - 6:1
verse:5:2 At that time, HASHEM said to Joshua, "Make flint knives, and circumcise again the children of Israel the second time." 
verse:5:3 Joshua made himself flint knives, and circumcised the children of Israel at the hill of the foreskins. 
verse:5:4 This is the reason Joshua circumcised: all the people who came out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way, after they came out of Egypt. 
verse:5:5 For all the people who came out were circumcised; but all the people who were born in the wilderness by the way as they came out of Egypt had not been circumcised. 
verse:5:6 For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, until all the nation, even the men of war who came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they didn't listen to the voice of HASHEM. HASHEM swore to them that he wouldn't let them see the land which HASHEM swore to their fathers that he would give us, a land flowing with milk and honey. 
verse:5:7 Their children, whom he raised up in their place, were circumcised by Joshua; for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them on the way. 
verse:5:8 It happened, when they were done circumcising all the nation, that they stayed in their places in the camp until they were healed.
verse:5:9 HASHEM said to Joshua, "Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you." Therefore the name of that place was called Gilgal, to this day. 
verse:5:10 The children of Israel encamped in Gilgal. They kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the plains of Jericho. 
verse:5:11 They ate unleavened cakes and parched grain of the produce of the land on the next day after the Passover, in the same day. 
verse:5:12 The manna ceased on the next day, after they had eaten of the produce of the land. The children of Israel didn't have manna any more; but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
verse:5:13 It happened, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, a man stood in front of him with his sword drawn in his hand. Joshua went to him, and said to him, "Are you for us, or for our adversaries?"
verse:5:14 He said, "No; but I have come now as commander of HASHEM's army."
Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and worshipped, and said to him, "What does my lord say to his servant?"
verse:5:15 The prince of HASHEM's army said to Joshua, "Take your shoes off of your feet; for the place on which you stand is holy." Joshua did so.
verse:6:1 Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel. No one went out, and no one came in.
portion:Judges 4:4 - 5:31
verse:4:4 Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, she judged Israel at that time. 
verse:4:5 She lived under the palm tree of Deborah between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment. 
verse:4:6 She sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh Naphtali, and said to him, "Hasn't HASHEM, the God of Israel, commanded, 'Go and draw to Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun? 
verse:4:7 I will draw to you, to the river Kishon, Sisera, the captain of Jabin's army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into your hand.'"
verse:4:8 Barak said to her, "If you will go with me, then I will go; but if you will not go with me, I will not go."
verse:4:9 She said, "I will surely go with you: nevertheless, the journey that you take shall not be for your honor; for HASHEM will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman." Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.
verse:4:10 Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali together to Kedesh; and there went up ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him. 
verse:4:11 Now Heber the Kenite had separated himself from the Kenites, even from the children of Hobab the brother-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent as far as the oak in Zaanannim, which is by Kedesh. 
verse:4:12 They told Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to Mount Tabor. 
verse:4:13 Sisera gathered together all his chariots, even nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people who were with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles, to the river Kishon.
verse:4:14 Deborah said to Barak, "Go; for this is the day in which HASHEM has delivered Sisera into your hand. Hasn't HASHEM gone out before you?" So Barak went down from Mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him. 
verse:4:15 HASHEM confused Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his army, with the edge of the sword before Barak; and Sisera alighted from his chariot, and fled away on his feet. 
verse:4:16 But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the army, to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the army of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; there was not a man left.
verse:4:17 However Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite. 
verse:4:18 Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said to him, "Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; don't be afraid." He came in to her into the tent, and she covered him with a rug.
verse:4:19 He said to her, "Please give me a little water to drink; for I am thirsty."
She opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.
verse:4:20 He said to her, "Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man comes and inquires of you, and says, 'Is there any man here?' that you shall say, 'No.'"
verse:4:21 Then Jael Heber's wife took a tent peg, and took a hammer in her hand, and went softly to him, and struck the pin into his temples, and it pierced through into the ground; for he was in a deep sleep; so he swooned and died. 
verse:4:22 Behold, as Barak pursued Sisera, Jael came out to meet him, and said to him, "Come, and I will show you the man whom you seek." He came to her; and behold, Sisera lay dead, and the tent peg was in his temples. 
verse:4:23 So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel. 
verse:4:24 The hand of the children of Israel prevailed more and more against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.
verse:5:1 Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying, 
verse:5:2 "Because the leaders took the lead in Israel, because the people offered themselves willingly, be blessed, HASHEM!
verse:5:3 "Hear, you kings! Give ear, you princes! I, even I, will sing to HASHEM. I will sing praise to HASHEM, the God of Israel.
verse:5:4 "HASHEM, when you went forth out of Seir, when you marched out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, the sky also dropped. Yes, the clouds dropped water. 
verse:5:5 The mountains quaked at the presence of HASHEM, even Sinai, at the presence of HASHEM, the God of Israel.
verse:5:6 "In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied. The travelers walked through byways. 
verse:5:7 The rulers ceased in Israel. They ceased until I, Deborah, arose; Until I arose a mother in Israel. 
verse:5:8 They chose new gods. Then war was in the gates. Was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel? 
verse:5:9 My heart is toward the governors of Israel, who offered themselves willingly among the people. Bless HASHEM!
verse:5:10 "Speak, you who ride on white donkeys, you who sit on rich carpets, and you who walk by the way. 
verse:5:11 Far from the noise of archers, in the places of drawing water, there they will rehearse the righteous acts of HASHEM, the righteous acts of his rule in Israel.
"Then the people of HASHEM went down to the gates. 
verse:5:12 'Awake, awake, Deborah! Awake, awake, utter a song! Arise, Barak, and lead away your captives, you son of Abinoam.'
verse:5:13 "Then a remnant of the nobles and the people came down. HASHEM came down for me against the mighty. 
verse:5:14 Those whose root is in Amalek came out of Ephraim, after you, Benjamin, among your peoples. Governors come down out of Machir. Those who handle the marshal's staff came out of Zebulun. 
verse:5:15 The princes of Issachar were with Deborah. As was Issachar, so was Barak. They rushed into the valley at his feet. By the watercourses of Reuben, there were great resolves of heart. 
verse:5:16 Why did you sit among the sheepfolds, To hear the whistling for the flocks? At the watercourses of Reuben There were great searchings of heart. 
verse:5:17 Gilead lived beyond the Jordan. Why did Dan remain in ships? Asher sat still at the haven of the sea, and lived by his creeks. 
verse:5:18 Zebulun was a people that jeopardized their lives to the deaths; Naphtali also, on the high places of the field.
verse:5:19 "The kings came and fought, then the kings of Canaan fought at Taanach by the waters of Megiddo. They took no plunder of silver. 
verse:5:20 From the sky the stars fought. From their courses, they fought against Sisera. 
verse:5:21 The river Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. My soul, march on with strength. 
verse:5:22 Then the horse hoofs stamped because of the prancings, the prancings of their strong ones. 
verse:5:23 'Curse Meroz,' said the angel of HASHEM. 'Curse bitterly its inhabitants, because they didn't come to help HASHEM, to help HASHEM against the mighty.'
verse:5:24 "Jael shall be blessed above women, the wife of Heber the Kenite; blessed shall she be above women in the tent. 
verse:5:25 He asked for water. She gave him milk. She brought him butter in a lordly dish. 
verse:5:26 She put her hand to the tent peg, and her right hand to the workmen's hammer. With the hammer she struck Sisera. She struck through his head. Yes, she pierced and struck through his temples. 
verse:5:27 At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay. At her feet he bowed, he fell. Where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
verse:5:28 "Through the window she looked out, and cried: Sisera's mother looked through the lattice. 'Why is his chariot so long in coming? Why do the wheels of his chariots wait?' 
verse:5:29 Her wise ladies answered her, Yes, she returned answer to herself, 
verse:5:30 'Have they not found, have they not divided the spoil? A lady, two ladies to every man; to Sisera a spoil of dyed garments, a spoil of dyed garments embroidered, of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the spoil?'
verse:5:31 "So let all your enemies perish, HASHEM, but let those who love him be as the sun when it rises forth in its strength."
Then the land had rest forty years.
portion:Judges 11:1 - 11:33
verse:11:1 Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor, and he was the son of a prostitute: and Gilead became the father of Jephthah. 
verse:11:2 Gilead's wife bore him sons; and when his wife's sons grew up, they drove out Jephthah, and said to him, "You shall not inherit in our father's house; for you are the son of another woman." 
verse:11:3 Then Jephthah fled from his brothers, and lived in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain fellows to Jephthah, and they went out with him. 
verse:11:4 It happened after a while, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel. 
verse:11:5 It was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to get Jephthah out of the land of Tob; 
verse:11:6 and they said to Jephthah, "Come and be our chief, that we may fight with the children of Ammon."
verse:11:7 Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, "Didn't you hate me, and drive me out of my father's house? Why have you come to me now when you are in distress?"
verse:11:8 The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, "Therefore we have turned again to you now, that you may go with us, and fight with the children of Ammon; and you shall be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead."
verse:11:9 Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, "If you bring me home again to fight with the children of Ammon, and HASHEM deliver them before me, shall I be your head?"
verse:11:10 The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, "HASHEM shall be witness between us; surely according to your word so will we do."
verse:11:11 Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and chief over them: and Jephthah spoke all his words before HASHEM in Mizpah.
verse:11:12 Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, "What have you to do with me, that you have come to me to fight against my land?"
verse:11:13 The king of the children of Ammon answered to the messengers of Jephthah, "Because Israel took away my land, when he came up out of Egypt, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and to the Jordan: now therefore restore that territory again peaceably."
verse:11:14 Jephthah sent messengers again to the king of the children of Ammon; 
verse:11:15 and he said to him, "Thus says Jephthah: Israel didn't take away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon, 
verse:11:16 but when they came up from Egypt, and Israel went through the wilderness to the Sea of Suf, and came to Kadesh; 
verse:11:17 then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, 'Please let me pass through your land;' but the king of Edom didn't listen. In the same way, he sent to the king of Moab; but he would not: and Israel stayed in Kadesh. 
verse:11:18 Then they went through the wilderness, and went around the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; but they didn't come within the border of Moab, for the Arnon was the border of Moab. 
verse:11:19 Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said to him, 'Please let us pass through your land to my place.' 
verse:11:20 But Sihon didn't trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel. 
verse:11:21 HASHEM, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they struck them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country. 
verse:11:22 They possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even to the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even to the Jordan. 
verse:11:23 So now HASHEM, the God of Israel, has dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and should you possess them? 
verse:11:24 Won't you possess that which Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So whoever HASHEM our God has dispossessed from before us, them will we possess. 
verse:11:25 Now are you anything better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them? 
verse:11:26 While Israel lived in Heshbon and its towns, and in Aroer and its towns, and in all the cities that are along by the side of the Arnon, three hundred years; why didn't you recover them within that time? 
verse:11:27 I therefore have not sinned against you, but you do me wrong to war against me. HASHEM, the Judge, be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon."
verse:11:28 However the king of the children of Ammon didn't listen to the words of Jephthah which he sent him. 
verse:11:29 Then the Spirit of HASHEM came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.
verse:11:30 Jephthah vowed a vow to HASHEM, and said, "If you will indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand, 
verse:11:31 then it shall be, that whatever comes forth from the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, it shall be HASHEM's, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering."
