verse:11:32 So Jephthah passed over to the children of Ammon to fight against them; and HASHEM delivered them into his hand. 
verse:11:33 He struck them from Aroer until you come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and to Abelcheramim, with a very great slaughter. So the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.
portion:Judges 13:2 - 13:25
verse:13:2 There was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and didn't bear. 
verse:13:3 The angel of HASHEM appeared to the woman, and said to her, "See now, you are barren, and don't bear; but you shall conceive, and bear a son. 
verse:13:4 Now therefore please beware and drink no wine nor strong drink, and don't eat any unclean thing: 
verse:13:5 for, behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb: and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines."
verse:13:6 Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, "A man of God came to me, and his face was like the face of the angel of God, very awesome; and I didn't ask him where he was from, neither did he tell me his name: 
verse:13:7 but he said to me, 'Behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.'"
verse:13:8 Then Manoah entreated HASHEM, and said, "Oh, Lord, please let the man of God whom you did send come again to us, and teach us what we shall do to the child who shall be born."
verse:13:9 God listened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again to the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah, her husband, wasn't with her. 
verse:13:10 The woman made haste, and ran, and told her husband, and said to him, "Behold, the man has appeared to me, who came to me that day."
verse:13:11 Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said to him, "Are you the man who spoke to the woman?"
He said, "I am."
verse:13:12 Manoah said, "Now let your words happen. What shall the child's way of life and mission be?"
verse:13:13 The angel of HASHEM said to Manoah, "Of all that I said to the woman let her beware. 
verse:13:14 She may not eat of anything that comes of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing; all that I commanded her let her observe."
verse:13:15 Manoah said to the angel of HASHEM, "Please, let us detain you, that we may make a young goat ready for you."
verse:13:16 The angel of HASHEM said to Manoah, "Though you detain me, I won't eat of your bread; and if you will prepare a burnt offering, you must offer it to HASHEM." For Manoah didn't know that he was the angel of HASHEM.
verse:13:17 Manoah said to the angel of HASHEM, "What is your name, that when your words happen, we may honor you?"
verse:13:18 The angel of HASHEM said to him, "Why do you ask about my name, since it is wonderful?"
verse:13:19 So Manoah took the young goat with the meal offering, and offered it on the rock to HASHEM. Then the angel did a wonderful thing as Manoah and his wife looked on. 
verse:13:20 For it happened, when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, that the angel of HASHEM ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground. 
verse:13:21 But the angel of HASHEM didn't appear to Manoah or to his wife any more. Then Manoah knew that he was the angel of HASHEM. 
verse:13:22 Manoah said to his wife, "We shall surely die, because we have seen God."
verse:13:23 But his wife said to him, "If HASHEM were pleased to kill us, he wouldn't have received a burnt offering and a meal offering at our hand, neither would he have shown us all these things, nor would at this time have told such things as these." 
verse:13:24 The woman bore a son, and named him Samson: and the child grew, and HASHEM blessed him. 
verse:13:25 The Spirit of HASHEM began to move him in Mahaneh Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
portion:Isaiah 1:1 - 1:27
verse:1:1 The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah. 
verse:1:2 Hear, heavens, and listen, earth; for HASHEM has spoken: "I have nourished and brought up children, and they have rebelled against me. 
verse:1:3 The ox knows his owner, and the donkey his master's crib; but Israel doesn't know, my people don't consider." 
verse:1:4 Ah sinful nation, a people loaded with iniquity, a seed of evildoers, children who deal corruptly! They have forsaken HASHEM. They have despised the Holy One of Israel. They are estranged and backward. 
verse:1:5 Why should you be beaten more, that you revolt more and more? The whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint. 
verse:1:6 From the sole of the foot even to the head there is no soundness in it: wounds, welts, and open sores. They haven't been closed, neither bandaged, neither soothed with oil. 
verse:1:7 Your country is desolate. Your cities are burned with fire. Strangers devour your land in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers. 
verse:1:8 The daughter of Zion is left like a shelter in a vineyard, like a hut in a field of melons, like a besieged city. 
verse:1:9 Unless HASHEM of Hosts had left to us a very small remnant, we would have been as Sodom; we would have been like Gomorrah. 
verse:1:10 Hear the word of HASHEM, you rulers of Sodom! Listen to the law of our God, you people of Gomorrah! 
verse:1:11 "What are the multitude of your sacrifices to me?," says HASHEM. "I have had enough of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed animals. I don't delight in the blood of bulls, or of lambs, or of male goats. 
verse:1:12 When you come to appear before me, who has required this at your hand, to trample my courts? 
verse:1:13 Bring no more vain offerings. Incense is an abomination to me; new moons, Sabbaths, and convocations: I can't bear with evil assemblies. 
verse:1:14 My soul hates your New Moons and your appointed feasts. They are a burden to me. I am weary of bearing them. 
verse:1:15 When you spread forth your hands, I will hide my eyes from you. Yes, when you make many prayers, I will not hear. Your hands are full of blood. 
verse:1:16 Wash yourselves, make yourself clean. Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes. Cease to do evil. 
verse:1:17 Learn to do well. Seek justice. Relieve the oppressed. Judge the fatherless. Plead for the widow."
verse:1:18 "Come now, and let us reason together," says HASHEM: "Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow. Though they be red like crimson, they shall be as wool. 
verse:1:19 If you are willing and obedient, you shall eat the good of the land; 
verse:1:20 but if you refuse and rebel, you shall be devoured with the sword; for the mouth of HASHEM has spoken it."
verse:1:21 How the faithful city has become a prostitute! She was full of justice; righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers. 
verse:1:22 Your silver has become dross, your wine mixed with water. 
verse:1:23 Your princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves. Everyone loves bribes, and follows after rewards. They don't judge the fatherless, neither does the cause of the widow come to them. 
verse:1:24 Therefore my Lord, HASHEM of Hosts, the Mighty One of Israel, says: "Ah, I will get relief from my adversaries, and avenge myself of my enemies; 
verse:1:25 and I will turn my hand on you, thoroughly purge away your dross, and will take away all your tin. 
verse:1:26 I will restore your judges as at the first, and your counselors as at the beginning. Afterward you shall be called 'The city of righteousness, a faithful town.' 
verse:1:27 Zion shall be redeemed with justice, and her converts with righteousness.
portion:Isaiah 6:1 - 7:6; 9:5 - 9:6
verse:6:1 In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw my Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple. 
verse:6:2 Above him stood the seraphim. Each one had six wings. With two he covered his face. With two he covered his feet. With two he flew. 
verse:6:3 One called to another, and said, "Holy, holy, holy, is HASHEM of Hosts! The whole earth is full of his glory!"
verse:6:4 The foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke. 
verse:6:5 Then I said, "Woe is me! For I am undone, because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for my eyes have seen the King, HASHEM of Hosts!"
verse:6:6 Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar. 
verse:6:7 He touched my mouth with it, and said, "Behold, this has touched your lips; and your iniquity is taken away, and your sin forgiven."
verse:6:8 I heard my Lord's voice, saying, "Whom shall I send, and who will go for us?"
Then I said, "Here I am. Send me!"
verse:6:9 He said, "Go, and tell this people, 'You hear indeed, but don't understand; and you see indeed, but don't perceive.' 
verse:6:10 Make the heart of this people fat. Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn again, and be healed."
verse:6:11 Then I said, "My Lord, how long?"
He answered, "Until cities are waste without inhabitant, and houses without man, and the land becomes utterly waste, 
verse:6:12 And HASHEM has removed men far away, and the forsaken places are many in the midst of the land. 
verse:6:13 If there is a tenth left in it, that also will in turn be consumed: as a terebinth, and as an oak, whose stock remains when they are felled; so the holy seed is its stock."
verse:7:1 It happened in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it. 
verse:7:2 It was told the house of David, saying, "Syria is allied with Ephraim." His heart trembled, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the forest tremble with the wind. 
verse:7:3 Then HASHEM said to Isaiah, "Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shearjashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fuller's field. 
verse:7:4 Tell him, 'Be careful, and keep calm. Don't be afraid, neither let your heart be faint because of these two tails of smoking torches, for the fierce anger of Rezin and Syria, and of the son of Remaliah. 
verse:7:5 Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have plotted evil against you, saying, 
verse:7:6 "Let's go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let's divide it among ourselves, and set up a king in its midst, even the son of Tabeel."
verse:9:5 For to us a child is born. To us a son is given; and the government will be on his shoulders. His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. 
verse:9:6 Of the increase of his government and of peace there shall be no end, on the throne of David, and on his kingdom, to establish it, and to uphold it with justice and with righteousness from that time on, even forever. The zeal of HASHEM of Hosts will perform this. 
portion:Isaiah 10:32 - 12:6
verse:10:32 This very day he will halt at Nob. He shakes his hand at the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem. 
verse:10:33 Behold, my Lord, HASHEM of Hosts, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low. 
verse:10:34 He will cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon will fall by the Mighty One.
verse:11:1 A shoot will come out of the stock of Jesse, and a branch out of his roots will bear fruit. 
verse:11:2 The Spirit of HASHEM will rest on him: the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of HASHEM. 
verse:11:3 His delight will be in the fear of HASHEM. He will not judge by the sight of his eyes, neither decide by the hearing of his ears; 
verse:11:4 but with righteousness he will judge the poor, and decide with equity for the humble of the earth. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth; and with the breath of his lips he will kill the wicked. 
verse:11:5 Righteousness will be the belt of his waist, and faithfulness the belt of his waist. 
verse:11:6 The wolf will live with the lamb, and the leopard will lie down with the young goat; The calf, the young lion, and the fattened calf together; and a little child will lead them. 
verse:11:7 The cow and the bear will graze. Their young ones will lie down together. The lion will eat straw like the ox. 
verse:11:8 The nursing child will play near a cobra's hole, and the weaned child will put his hand on the viper's den. 
verse:11:9 They will not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain; for the earth will be full of the knowledge of HASHEM, as the waters cover the sea.
verse:11:10 It will happen in that day that the nations will seek the root of Jesse, who stands as a banner of the peoples; and his resting place will be glorious. 
verse:11:11 It will happen in that day that my Lord will set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, from Egypt, from Pathros, from Cush, from Elam, from Shinar, from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea. 
verse:11:12 He will set up a banner for the nations, and will assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth. 
verse:11:13 The envy also of Ephraim will depart, and those who persecute Judah will be cut off. Ephraim won't envy Judah, and Judah won't persecute Ephraim. 
verse:11:14 They will fly down on the shoulders of the Philistines on the west. Together they will plunder the children of the east. They will extend their power over Edom and Moab, and the children of Ammon will obey them. 
verse:11:15 HASHEM will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his scorching wind he will wave his hand over the River, and will split it into seven streams, and cause men to march over in sandals. 
verse:11:16 There will be a highway for the remnant that is left of his people from Assyria, like there was for Israel in the day that he came up out of the land of Egypt.
verse:12:1 In that day you will say, "I will give thanks to you, HASHEM; for though you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you comfort me. 
verse:12:2 Behold, God is my salvation. I will trust, and will not be afraid; for HASHEM, HASHEM, is my strength and song; and he has become my salvation [yeshu`ah]." 
verse:12:3 Therefore with joy you will draw water out of the wells of salvation [yeshu`ah]. 
verse:12:4 In that day you will say, "Give thanks to HASHEM! Call on his name. Declare his doings among the peoples. Proclaim that his name is exalted! 
verse:12:5 Sing to HASHEM, for he has done excellent things! Let this be known in all the earth! 
verse:12:6 Cry aloud and shout, you inhabitant of Zion; for the Holy One of Israel is great in the midst of you!"
portion:Isaiah 27:6 - 28:13; 29:22 - 29:23
verse:27:6 In days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bud. They will fill the surface of the world with fruit. 
verse:27:7 Has he struck them as he struck those who struck them? Or are they killed like those who killed them were killed? 
verse:27:8 In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind. 
verse:27:9 Therefore, by this the iniquity of Jacob will be forgiven, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: that he makes all the stones of the altar as chalk stones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherim and the incense altars shall rise no more. 
verse:27:10 For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches. 
verse:27:11 When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off. The women will come and set them on fire, for they are a people of no understanding. Therefore he who made them will not have compassion on them, and he who formed them will show them no favor. 
verse:27:12 It will happen in that day, that HASHEM will thresh from the flowing stream of the Euphrates to the brook of Egypt; and you will be gathered one by one, children of Israel. 
verse:27:13 It will happen in that day that a great shofar will be blown; and those who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and those who were outcasts in the land of Egypt, shall come; and they will worship HASHEM in the holy mountain at Jerusalem.
verse:28:22 Now therefore don't be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from my Lord, HASHEM of Hosts, on the whole earth.
verse:28:23 Give ear, and hear my voice! Listen, and hear my speech!
portion:Isaiah 40:1 - 40:26
verse:40:1 "Comfort, comfort my people," says your God. 
verse:40:2 "Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of HASHEM's hand double for all her sins."
verse:40:3 The voice of one who calls out, "Prepare the way of HASHEM in the wilderness! Make a level highway in the desert for our God. 
verse:40:4 Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low. The uneven shall be made level, and the rough places a plain. 
verse:40:5 The glory of HASHEM shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together; for the mouth of HASHEM has spoken it." 
verse:40:6 The voice of one saying, "Cry!" One said, "What shall I cry?" "All flesh is like grass, and all its glory is like the flower of the field. 
verse:40:7 The grass withers, the flower fades, because HASHEM's breath blows on it. Surely the people are like grass. 
verse:40:8 The grass withers, the flower fades; but the word of our God stands forever."
verse:40:9 You who tell good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who tell good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength. Lift it up. Don't be afraid. Say to the cities of Judah, "Behold, your God!" 
verse:40:10 Behold, HASHEM GOD will come as a mighty one, and his arm will rule for him. Behold, his reward is with him, and his recompense before him. 
verse:40:11 He will feed his flock like a shepherd. He will gather the lambs in his arm, and carry them in his bosom. He will gently lead those who have their young.
verse:40:12 Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and marked off the sky with his span, and calculated the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance? 
verse:40:13 Who has directed the Spirit of HASHEM, or has taught him as his counselor? 
verse:40:14 Who did he take counsel with, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of justice, and taught him knowledge, and showed him the way of understanding? 
verse:40:15 Behold, the nations are like a drop in a bucket, and are regarded as a speck of dust on a balance. Behold, he lifts up the islands like a very little thing. 
verse:40:16 Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor its animals sufficient for a burnt offering. 
verse:40:17 All the nations are like nothing before him. They are regarded by him as less than nothing, and vanity. 
verse:40:18 To whom then will you liken God? Or what likeness will you compare to him? 
verse:40:19 A workman has cast an image, and the goldsmith overlays it with gold, and casts silver chains for it. 
verse:40:20 He who is too impoverished for such an offering chooses a tree that will not rot. He seeks a skillful workman to set up an engraved image for him that will not be moved.
verse:40:21 Haven't you known? Haven't you heard, yet? Haven't you been told from the beginning? Haven't you understood from the foundations of the earth? 
verse:40:22 It is he who sits above the circle of the earth, and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers; who stretches out the heavens like a curtain, and spreads them out like a tent to dwell in; 
verse:40:23 who brings princes to nothing; who makes the judges of the earth like meaningless. 
verse:40:24 They are planted scarcely. They are sown scarcely. Their stock has scarcely taken root in the ground. He merely blows on them, and they wither, and the whirlwind takes them away as stubble.
verse:40:25 "To whom then will you liken me? Who is my equal?" says the Holy One. 
verse:40:26 Lift up your eyes on high, and see who has created these, who brings out their army by number. He calls them all by name. by the greatness of his might, and because he is strong in power, Not one is lacking.
portion:Isaiah 43:21 - 44:23
verse:43:21 the people which I formed for myself, that they might set forth my praise. 
verse:43:22 Yet you have not called on me, Jacob; but you have been weary of me, Israel. 
verse:43:23 You have not brought me of your sheep for burnt offerings; neither have you honored me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with offerings, nor wearied you with frankincense. 
verse:43:24 You have bought me no sweet cane with money, nor have you filled me with the fat of your sacrifices; but you have burdened me with your sins. You have wearied me with your iniquities. 
verse:43:25 I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake; and I will not remember your sins. 
verse:43:26 Put me in remembrance. Let us plead together. Set forth your case, that you may be justified. 
verse:43:27 Your first father sinned, and your teachers have transgressed against me. 
verse:43:28 Therefore I will profane the princes of the sanctuary; and I will make Jacob a curse, and Israel an insult."
verse:44:1 Yet listen now, Jacob my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen. 
verse:44:2 This is what HASHEM who made you, and formed you from the womb, who will help you says: "Don't be afraid, Jacob my servant; and you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen. 
verse:44:3 For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground. I will pour my Spirit on your seed, and my blessing on your offspring: 
verse:44:4 and they will spring up among the grass, as willows by the watercourses. 
verse:44:5 One will say, 'I am HASHEM's;' and another will be called by the name of Jacob; and another will write with his hand 'to HASHEM,' and honor the name of Israel."
verse:44:6 This is what HASHEM, the King of Israel, and his Redeemer, HASHEM of Hosts, says: "I am the first, and I am the last; and besides me there is no God. 
verse:44:7 Who is like me? Who will call, and will declare it, and set it in order for me, since I established the ancient people? Let them declare the things that are coming, and that will happen. 
verse:44:8 Don't fear, neither be afraid. Haven't I declared it to you long ago, and shown it? You are my witnesses. Is there a God besides me? Indeed, there is not. I don't know any other Rock."
verse:44:9 Everyone who makes an engraved image is vain. The things that they delight in will not profit. Their own witnesses don't see, nor know, that they may be disappointed. 
verse:44:10 Who has fashioned a god, or molds an image that is profitable for nothing? 
verse:44:11 Behold, all his fellows will be disappointed; and the workmen are mere men. Let them all be gathered together. Let them stand up. They will fear. They will be put to shame together. 
verse:44:12 The blacksmith takes an axe, works in the coals, fashions it with hammers, and works it with his strong arm. He is hungry, and his strength fails; he drinks no water, and is faint. 
verse:44:13 The carpenter stretches out a line. He marks it out with a pencil. He shapes it with planes. He marks it out with compasses, and shapes it like the figure of a man, with the beauty of a man, to reside in a house. 
verse:44:14 He cuts down cedars for himself, and takes the cypress and the oak, and strengthens for himself one among the trees of the forest. He plants a fir tree, and the rain nourishes it. 
verse:44:15 Then it will be for a man to burn; and he takes some of it, and warms himself. Yes, he burns it, and bakes bread. Yes, he makes a god, and worships it; he makes it an engraved image, and falls down to it. 
verse:44:16 He burns part of it in the fire. With part of it, he eats meat. He roasts a roast, and is satisfied. Yes, he warms himself, and says, "Aha! I am warm. I have seen the fire." 
verse:44:17 The rest of it he makes into a god, even his engraved image. He bows down to it and worships, and prays to it, and says, "Deliver me; for you are my god!" 
verse:44:18 They don't know, neither do they consider: for he has shut their eyes, that they can't see; and their hearts, that they can't understand. 
verse:44:19 No one thinks, neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say, "I have burned part of it in the fire. Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals. I have roasted meat and eaten it. Shall I make the rest of it into an abomination? Shall I bow down to a tree trunk?" 
verse:44:20 He feeds on ashes. A deceived heart has turned him aside; and he can't deliver his soul, nor say, "Isn't there a lie in my right hand?" 
verse:44:21 Remember these things, Jacob and Israel; for you are my servant. I have formed you. You are my servant. Israel, you will not be forgotten by me. 
verse:44:22 I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.
verse:44:23 Sing, you heavens, for HASHEM has done it! Shout, you lower parts of the earth! Break out into singing, you mountains, O forest, all of your trees, for HASHEM has redeemed Jacob, and will glorify himself in Israel.
portion:Isaiah 49:14 - 51:3
verse:49:14 But Zion said, "HASHEM has forsaken me, and my Lord has forgotten me."
verse:49:15 "Can a woman forget her nursing child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb? Yes, these may forget, yet I will not forget you! 
verse:49:16 Behold, I have engraved you on the palms of my hands; your walls are continually before me. 
verse:49:17 Your children make haste; your destroyers and those who made you waste shall go forth from you. 
verse:49:18 Lift up your eyes all around, and see: all these gather themselves together, and come to you. As I live," says HASHEM, "you shall surely clothe yourself with them all as with an ornament, and dress yourself with them, like a bride.
verse:49:19 "For, as for your waste and your desolate places, and your land that has been destroyed, surely now you shall be too small for the inhabitants, and those who swallowed you up shall be far away. 
verse:49:20 The children of your bereavement shall yet say in your ears, The place is too small for me; give place to me that I may dwell. 
verse:49:21 Then you will say in your heart, 'Who has conceived these for me, since I have been bereaved of my children, and am solitary, an exile, and wandering back and forth? Who has brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where were they?'"
verse:49:22 Thus says HASHEM GOD, "Behold, I will lift up my hand to the nations, and set up my banner to the peoples; and they shall bring your sons in their bosom, and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders. 
verse:49:23 Kings shall be your nursing fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers: they shall bow down to you with their faces to the earth, and lick the dust of your feet; and you shall know that I am HASHEM; and those who wait for me shall not be disappointed."
verse:49:24 Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives be delivered?
verse:49:25 But thus says HASHEM, "Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him who contends with you, and I will save your children. 
verse:49:26 I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I, HASHEM, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob."
verse:50:1 Thus says HASHEM, "Where is the bill of your mother's divorce, with which I have put her away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities were you sold, and for your transgressions was your mother put away. 
verse:50:2 Why, when I came, was there no man? when I called, was there none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that it can't redeem? or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stink, because there is no water, and die for thirst. 
verse:50:3 I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering."
verse:50:4 HASHEM GOD has given me the tongue of those who are taught, that I may know how to sustain with words him who is weary: he wakens morning by morning, he wakens my ear to hear as those who are taught. 
verse:50:5 HASHEM GOD has opened my ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away backward. 
verse:50:6 I gave my back to the strikers, and my cheeks to those who plucked off the hair; I didn't hide my face from shame and spitting. 
verse:50:7 For HASHEM GOD will help me; therefore I have not been confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be disappointed. 
verse:50:8 He is near who justifies me; who will bring charges against me? Let us stand up together: who is my adversary? Let him come near to me. 
verse:50:9 Behold, HASHEM GOD will help me; who is he who shall condemn me? Behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, the moth shall eat them up. 
verse:50:10 Who is among you who fears HASHEM, who obeys the voice of his servant? He who walks in darkness, and has no light, let him trust in the name of HASHEM, and rely on his God. 
verse:50:11 Behold, all you who kindle a fire, who adorn yourselves with torches around yourselves; walk in the flame of your fire, and among the brands that you have kindled. You shall have this of my hand; you shall lie down in sorrow.
verse:51:1 "Listen to me, you who follow after righteousness, you who seek HASHEM: look to the rock you were cut from, and to the hold of the pit you were dug from. 
verse:51:2 Look to Abraham your father, and to Sarah who bore you; for when he was but one I called him, and I blessed him, and made him many. 
verse:51:3 For HASHEM has comforted Zion; he has comforted all her waste places, and has made her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of HASHEM; joy and gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving, and the voice of melody.
portion:Isaiah 54:11 - 55:5
verse:54:11 "You afflicted, tossed with storms, and not comforted, behold, I will set your stones in beautiful colors, and lay your foundations with sapphires. 
verse:54:12 I will make your pinnacles of rubies, and your gates of sparkling jewels, and all your walls of precious stones. 
verse:54:13 All your children shall be taught of HASHEM; and great shall be the peace of your children. 
verse:54:14 In righteousness you shall be established: you shall be far from oppression, for you shall not be afraid; and from terror, for it shall not come near you. 
verse:54:15 Behold, they may gather together, but not by me: whoever shall gather together against you shall fall because of you.
verse:54:16 "Behold, I have created the smith who blows the fire of coals, and brings forth a weapon for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy. 
verse:54:17 No weapon that is formed against you will prevail; and you will condemn every tongue that rises against you in judgment. This is the heritage of the servants of HASHEM, and their righteousness which is of me," says HASHEM.
verse:55:1 "Come, everyone who thirsts, to the waters! Come, he who has no money, buy, and eat! Yes, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price. 
verse:55:2 Why do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labor for that which doesn't satisfy? listen diligently to me, and eat you that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness. 
verse:55:3 Turn your ear, and come to me; hear, and your soul shall live: and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David. 
verse:55:4 Behold, I have given him for a witness to the peoples, a leader and commander to the peoples. 
verse:55:5 Behold, you shall call a nation that you don't know; and a nation that didn't know you shall run to you, because of HASHEM your God, and for the Holy One of Israel; for he has glorified you."
portion:Isaiah 51:12 - 52:12
verse:51:12 "I, even I, am he who comforts you: who are you, that you are afraid of man who shall die, and of the son of man who shall be made as grass; 
verse:51:13 and have forgotten HASHEM your Maker, who stretched forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth; and fear continually all the day because of the fury of the oppressor, when he makes ready to destroy? and where is the fury of the oppressor? 
verse:51:14 The captive exile shall speedily be freed; and he shall not die and go down into the pit, neither shall his bread fail. 
verse:51:15 For I am HASHEM your God, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar: HASHEM of Hosts is his name. 
verse:51:16 I have put my words in your mouth, and have covered you in the shadow of my hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the foundations of the earth, and tell Zion, 'You are my people.'"
verse:51:17 Awake, awake, stand up, Jerusalem, that have drunk at the hand of HASHEM the cup of his wrath; you have drunken the bowl of the cup of staggering, and drained it. 
verse:51:18 There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she has brought forth; neither is there any who takes her by the hand among all the sons who she has brought up. 
verse:51:19 These two things have happened to you. Who will bemoan you? Desolation and destruction, and the famine and the sword; how shall I comfort you? 
verse:51:20 Your sons have fainted, they lie at the head of all the streets, as an antelope in a net; they are full of the wrath of HASHEM, the rebuke of your God. 
verse:51:21 Therefore hear now this, you afflicted, and drunken, but not with wine: 
verse:51:22 Thus says HASHEM GOD, and your God who pleads the cause of his people, "Behold, I have taken out of your hand the cup of staggering, even the bowl of the cup of my wrath; you shall no more drink it again: 
verse:51:23 and I will put it into the hand of those who afflict you, who have said to your soul, 'Bow down, that we may walk over you;' and you have laid your back as the ground, and as the street, to those who walk over."
verse:52:1 Awake, awake, put on your strength, Zion; put on your beautiful garments, Jerusalem, the holy city: for henceforth there shall no more come into you the uncircumcised and the unclean. 
verse:52:2 Shake yourself from the dust! Arise, sit up, Jerusalem! Release yourself from the bonds of your neck, captive daughter of Zion! 
verse:52:3 For thus says HASHEM, "You were sold for nothing; and you shall be redeemed without money."
verse:52:4 For thus says HASHEM GOD, "My people went down at the first into Egypt to live there: and the Assyrian has oppressed them without cause.
verse:52:5 "Now therefore, what do I do here," says HASHEM, "seeing that my people are taken away for nothing? Those who rule over them mock," says HASHEM, "and my name continually all the day is blasphemed. 
verse:52:6 Therefore my people shall know my name. Therefore they shall know in that day that I am he who speaks; behold, it is I."
verse:52:7 How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace, who brings good news of good, who publishes salvation, who says to Zion, "Your God reigns!" 
verse:52:8 The voice of your watchmen! they lift up the voice, together do they sing; for they shall see eye to eye, when HASHEM returns to Zion. 
verse:52:9 Break forth into joy, sing together, you waste places of Jerusalem; for HASHEM has comforted his people, he has redeemed Jerusalem. 
verse:52:10 HASHEM has made bare his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
verse:52:11 Depart, depart, go out from there, touch no unclean thing! Go out of the midst of her! Cleanse yourselves, you who bear the vessels of HASHEM. 
verse:52:12 For you shall not go out in haste, neither shall you go by flight: for HASHEM will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
portion:Isaiah 54:1 - 54:10
verse:54:1 "Sing, barren, you who didn't bear; break forth into singing, and cry aloud, you who did not travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife," says HASHEM. 
verse:54:2 "Enlarge the place of your tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of your habitations; don't spare: lengthen your cords, and strengthen your stakes. 
verse:54:3 For you shall spread out on the right hand and on the left; and your seed shall possess the nations, and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.
verse:54:4 "Don't be afraid; for you shall not be ashamed: neither be confounded; for you shall not be disappointed: for you shall forget the shame of your youth; and the reproach of your widowhood you shall remember no more. 
verse:54:5 For your Maker is your husband; HASHEM of Hosts is his name: and the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer; the God of the whole earth shall he be called. 
verse:54:6 For HASHEM has called you as a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit, even a wife of youth, when she is cast off," says your God.
verse:54:7 "For a small moment have I forsaken you; but with great mercies will I gather you. 
verse:54:8 In overflowing wrath I hid my face from you for a moment; but with everlasting loving kindness will I have mercy on you," says HASHEM your Redeemer.
verse:54:9 "For this is like the waters of Noah to me; for as I have sworn that the waters of Noah shall no more go over the earth, so have I sworn that I will not be angry with you, nor rebuke you. 
verse:54:10 For the mountains may depart, and the hills be removed; but my loving kindness shall not depart from you, neither shall my covenant of peace be removed," says HASHEM who has mercy on you.
portion:Isaiah 57:14 - 58:14
verse:57:14 He will say, "Cast up, cast up, prepare the way, take up the stumbling-block out of the way of my people." 
verse:57:15 For thus says the high and lofty One who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy: "I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also who is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite. 
verse:57:16 For I will not contend forever, neither will I be always angry; for the spirit would faint before me, and the souls who I have made. 
verse:57:17 For the iniquity of his covetousness was I angry, and struck him; I hid myself and was angry; and he went on backsliding in the way of his heart. 
verse:57:18 I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts to him and to his mourners. 
verse:57:19 I create the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace, to him who is far off and to him who is near," says HASHEM; "and I will heal them." 
verse:57:20 But the wicked are like the troubled sea; for it can't rest, and its waters cast up mire and dirt. 
verse:57:21 "There is no peace," says my God, "for the wicked."
verse:58:1 "Cry aloud, don't spare, lift up your voice like a shofar, and declare to my people their disobedience, and to the house of Jacob their sins. 
verse:58:2 Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways: as a nation that did righteousness, and didn't forsake the ordinance of their God, they ask of me righteous judgments; they delight to draw near to God. 
verse:58:3 'Why have we fasted,' say they, 'and you don't see? Why have we afflicted our soul, and you take no knowledge?'
"Behold, in the day of your fast you find pleasure, and exact all your labors. 
verse:58:4 Behold, you fast for strife and contention, and to strike with the fist of wickedness: you don't fast this day so as to make your voice to be heard on high. 
verse:58:5 Is such the fast that I have chosen? the day for a man to afflict his soul? Is it to bow down his head as a rush, and to spread sackcloth and ashes under him? Will you call this a fast, and an acceptable day to HASHEM?
verse:58:6 "Isn't this the fast that I have chosen: to release the bonds of wickedness, to undo the bands of the yoke, and to let the oppressed go free, and that you break every yoke? 
verse:58:7 Isn't it to distribute your bread to the hungry, and that you bring the poor who are cast out to your house? When you see the naked, that you cover him; and that you not hide yourself from your own flesh? 
verse:58:8 Then your light shall break forth as the morning, and your healing shall spring forth speedily; and your righteousness shall go before you; the glory of HASHEM shall be your rear guard. 
verse:58:9 Then you shall call, and HASHEM will answer; you shall cry, and he will say, 'Here I am.'
"If you take away from the midst of you the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking wickedly; 
verse:58:10 and if you draw out your soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul: then your light shall rise in darkness, and your obscurity be as the noonday; 
verse:58:11 and HASHEM will guide you continually, and satisfy your soul in dry places, and make strong your bones; and you shall be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters don't fail. 
verse:58:12 Those who shall be of you shall build the old waste places; you shall raise up the foundations of many generations; and you shall be called The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.
verse:58:13 "If you turn away your foot from the Sabbath, from doing your pleasure on my holy day; and call the Sabbath a delight, and the holy of HASHEM honorable; and shall honor it, not doing your own ways, nor finding your own pleasure, nor speaking your own words: 
verse:58:14 then you shall delight yourself in HASHEM; and I will make you to ride on the high places of the earth; and I will feed you with the heritage of Jacob your father:" for the mouth of HASHEM has spoken it.
portion:Isaiah 60:1 - 60:22
verse:60:1 "Arise, shine; for your light has come, and the glory of HASHEM is risen on you. 
verse:60:2 For, behold, darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the peoples; but HASHEM will arise on you, and his glory shall be seen on you. 
verse:60:3 Nations shall come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your rising.
verse:60:4 "Lift up your eyes all around, and see: they all gather themselves together, they come to you; your sons shall come from far, and your daughters shall be carried in the arms. 
verse:60:5 Then you shall see and be radiant, and your heart shall thrill and be enlarged; because the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, the wealth of the nations shall come to you. 
verse:60:6 The multitude of camels shall cover you, the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; all they from Sheba shall come; they shall bring gold and frankincense, and shall proclaim the praises of HASHEM. 
verse:60:7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, the rams of Nebaioth shall minister to you; they shall come up with acceptance on my altar; and I will glorify the house of my glory.
verse:60:8 "Who are these who fly as a cloud, and as the doves to their windows? 
verse:60:9 Surely the islands shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring your sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, for the name of HASHEM your God, and for the Holy One of Israel, because he has glorified you.
verse:60:10 "Foreigners shall build up your walls, and their kings shall minister to you: for in my wrath I struck you, but in my favor have I had mercy on you. 
verse:60:11 Your gates also shall be open continually; they shall not be shut day nor night; that men may bring to you the wealth of the nations, and their kings led captive. 
verse:60:12 For that nation and kingdom that will not serve you shall perish; yes, those nations shall be utterly wasted.
verse:60:13 "The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the fir tree, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious. 
verse:60:14 The sons of those who afflicted you shall come bending to you; and all those who despised you shall bow themselves down at the soles of your feet; and they shall call you The city of HASHEM, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
verse:60:15 "Whereas you have been forsaken and hated, so that no man passed through you, I will make you an eternal excellency, a joy of many generations. 
verse:60:16 You shall also drink the milk of the nations, and shall nurse from royal breasts; and you shall know that I, HASHEM, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob. 
verse:60:17 For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron. I will also make your officers peace, and righteousness your ruler. 
verse:60:18 Violence shall no more be heard in your land, desolation nor destruction within your borders; but you shall call your walls Salvation, and your gates Praise. 
verse:60:19 The sun shall be no more your light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light to you: but HASHEM will be to you an everlasting light, and your God your glory. 
verse:60:20 Your sun shall no more go down, neither shall your moon withdraw itself; for HASHEM will be your everlasting light, and the days of your mourning shall be ended. 
verse:60:21 Your people also shall be all righteous; they shall inherit the land forever, the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, that I may be glorified. 
verse:60:22 The little one shall become a thousand, and the small one a strong nation; I, HASHEM, will hasten it in its time."
portion:Isaiah 61:10 - 63:9
verse:61:10 I will greatly rejoice in HASHEM, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for he has clothed me with the garments of salvation, he has covered me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decks himself with a garland, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels. 
verse:61:11 For as the earth brings forth its bud, and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so HASHEM GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
verse:62:1 For Zion's sake will I not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem's sake I will not rest, until her righteousness go forth as brightness, and her salvation as a lamp that burns. 
verse:62:2 The nations shall see your righteousness, and all kings your glory, and you shall be called by a new name, which the mouth of HASHEM shall name. 
verse:62:3 You shall also be a crown of beauty in the hand of HASHEM, and a royal diadem in the hand of your God. 
verse:62:4 You shall no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall your land any more be termed Desolate: but you shall be called Hephzibah, and your land Beulah; for HASHEM delights in you, and your land shall be married. 
verse:62:5 For as a young man marries a virgin, so your sons shall marry you; and as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so your God will rejoice over you. 
verse:62:6 I have set watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem; they shall never hold their peace day nor night: you who call on HASHEM, take no rest, 
verse:62:7 and give him no rest, until he establishes, and until he makes Jerusalem a praise in the earth.
verse:62:8 HASHEM has sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, "Surely I will no more give your grain to be food for your enemies; and foreigners shall not drink your new wine, for which you have labored: 
verse:62:9 but those who have garnered it shall eat it, and praise HASHEM; and those who have gathered it shall drink it in the courts of my sanctuary."
verse:62:10 Go through, go through the gates! Prepare the way of the people! Cast up, cast up the highway! Gather out the stones! Lift up a banner for the peoples. 
verse:62:11 Behold, HASHEM has proclaimed to the end of the earth, "Say to the daughter of Zion, 'Behold, your salvation comes. Behold, his reward is with him, and his recompense before him.'" 
verse:62:12 They shall call them The holy people, The redeemed of HASHEM: and you shall be called Sought out, A city not forsaken.
verse:63:1 Who is this who comes from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this who is glorious in his clothing, marching in the greatness of his strength? "It is I who speak in righteousness, mighty to save." 
verse:63:2 Why are you red in your clothing, and your garments like him who treads in the wine vat?
verse:63:3 "I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the peoples there was no man with me: yes, I trod them in my anger, and trampled them in my wrath; and their lifeblood is sprinkled on my garments, and I have stained all my clothing. 
verse:63:4 For the day of vengeance was in my heart, and the year of my redeemed has come. 
verse:63:5 I looked, and there was none to help; and I wondered that there was none to uphold: therefore my own arm brought salvation to me; and my wrath, it upheld me. 
verse:63:6 I trod down the peoples in my anger, and made them drunk in my wrath, and I poured out their lifeblood on the earth."
verse:63:7 I will make mention of the loving kindnesses of HASHEM and the praises of HASHEM, according to all that HASHEM has bestowed on us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he has bestowed on them according to his mercies, and according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses. 
verse:63:8 For he said, "Surely, they are my people, children who will not deal falsely:" so he was their Savior. 
verse:63:9 In all their affliction he was afflicted, and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bore them, and carried them all the days of old.
portion:Isaiah 66:1 - 66:24
verse:66:1 Thus says HASHEM, "Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: what kind of house will you build to me? and what place shall be my rest? 
verse:66:2 For all these things has my hand made, and so all these things came to be," says HASHEM: "but to this man will I look, even to him who is poor and of a contrite spirit, and who trembles at my word. 
verse:66:3 He who kills an ox is as he who kills a man; he who sacrifices a lamb, as he who breaks a dog's neck; he who offers an offering, as he who offers pig's blood; he who burns frankincense, as he who blesses an idol. Yes, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delights in their abominations: 
verse:66:4 I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears on them; because when I called, no one answered; when I spoke, they didn't listen; but they did that which was evil in my eyes, and chose that in which I didn't delight."
verse:66:5 Hear the word of HASHEM, you who tremble at his word: "Your brothers who hate you, who cast you out for my name's sake, have said, 'Let HASHEM be glorified, that we may see your joy;' but it is those who shall be disappointed. 
verse:66:6 A voice of tumult from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of HASHEM that renders recompense to his enemies.
verse:66:7 "Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she delivered a son. 
verse:66:8 Who has heard such a thing? who has seen such things? Shall a land be born in one day? shall a nation be brought forth at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children. 
verse:66:9 Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth?" says HASHEM: "shall I who cause to bring forth shut the womb?" says your God. 
verse:66:10 "Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad for her, all you who love her: rejoice for joy with her, all you who mourn over her; 
verse:66:11 that you may nurse and be satisfied at the comforting breasts; that you may drink deeply, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory."
verse:66:12 For thus says HASHEM, "Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream: and you will nurse. You will be carried on her side, and will be dandled on her knees. 
verse:66:13 As one whom his mother comforts, so will I comfort you; and you will be comforted in Jerusalem."
verse:66:14 You will see it, and your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like the tender grass: and the hand of HASHEM shall be known toward his servants; and he will have indignation against his enemies. 
verse:66:15 For, behold, HASHEM will come with fire, and his chariots shall be like the whirlwind; to render his anger with fierceness, and his rebuke with flames of fire. 
verse:66:16 For by fire will HASHEM execute judgment, and by his sword, on all flesh; and the slain of HASHEM shall be many.
verse:66:17 "Those who sanctify themselves and purify themselves to go to the gardens, behind one in the midst, eating pig's flesh, and the abomination, and the mouse, they shall come to an end together," says HASHEM.
verse:66:18 "For I know their works and their thoughts: the time comes, that I will gather all nations and languages; and they shall come, and shall see my glory.
verse:66:19 "I will set a sign among them, and I will send such as escape of them to the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, who draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, to the islands afar off, who have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the nations. 
verse:66:20 They shall bring all your brothers out of all the nations for an offering to HASHEM, on horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and on mules, and on dromedaries, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says HASHEM, as the children of Israel bring their offering in a clean vessel into the house of HASHEM. 
verse:66:21 Of them also will I take for priests and for Levites," says HASHEM.
verse:66:22 "For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me," says HASHEM, "so your seed and your name shall remain. 
verse:66:23 It shall happen, that from one new moon to another, and from one Sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship before me," says HASHEM. 
verse:66:24 "They shall go forth, and look on the dead bodies of the men who have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they will be loathsome to all mankind."
portion:Ezekiel 1:1-28; 3:12
verse:1:1 Now it happened in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth of the month, as I was among the captives by the river Chebar, that the heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God. 
verse:1:2 In the fifth of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin's captivity, 
verse:1:3 the word of HASHEM came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Kasdim by the river Chebar; and the hand of HASHEM was there on him. 
verse:1:4 I looked, and behold, a stormy wind came out of the north, a great cloud, with flashing lightning, and a brightness around it, and out of its midst as it were glowing metal, out of the midst of the fire. 
verse:1:5 Out of its midst came the likeness of four living creatures. This was their appearance: they had the likeness of a man. 
verse:1:6 Everyone had four faces, and each one of them had four wings. 
verse:1:7 Their feet were straight feet; and the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf's foot; and they sparkled like burnished brass. 
verse:1:8 They had the hands of a man under their wings on their four sides; and the four of them had their faces and their wings thus: 
verse:1:9 their wings were joined one to another; they didn't turn when they went; each one went straight forward. 
verse:1:10 As for the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man; and the four of them had the face of a lion on the right side; and the four of them had the face of an ox on the left side; the four of them also had the face of an eagle. 
verse:1:11 Such were their faces. Their wings were spread out above. Two wings of each one touched another, and two covered their bodies. 
verse:1:12 Each one went straight forward: where the spirit was to go, they went; they didn't turn when they went. 
verse:1:13 As for the likeness of the living creatures, their appearance was like burning coals of fire, like the appearance of torches: the fire went up and down among the living creatures; and the fire was bright, and out of the fire went forth lightning. 
verse:1:14 The living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning. 
verse:1:15 Now as I saw the living creatures, behold, one wheel on the earth beside the living creatures, for each of the four faces of it. 
verse:1:16 The appearance of the wheels and their work was like a beryl: and the four of them had one likeness; and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel. 
verse:1:17 When they went, they went in their four directions: they didn't turn when they went. 
verse:1:18 As for their rims, they were high and dreadful; and the four of them had their rims full of eyes all around. 
verse:1:19 When the living creatures went, the wheels went beside them; and when the living creatures were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up. 
verse:1:20 Wherever the spirit was to go, they went; there was the spirit to go: and the wheels were lifted up beside them; for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels. 
verse:1:21 When those went, these went; and when those stood, these stood; and when those were lifted up from the earth, the wheels were lifted up beside them: for the spirit of the living creature was in the wheels. 
verse:1:22 Over the head of the living creature there was the likeness of an expanse, like the awesome crystal to look on, stretched forth over their heads above. 
verse:1:23 Under the expanse were their wings straight, the one toward the other: each one had two which covered on this side, and every one had two which covered on that side, their bodies. 
verse:1:24 When they went, I heard the noise of their wings like the noise of great waters, like the voice of the Almighty, a noise of tumult like the noise of an army: when they stood, they let down their wings. 
verse:1:25 There was a voice above the expanse that was over their heads: when they stood, they let down their wings. 
verse:1:26 Above the expanse that was over their heads was the likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone; and on the likeness of the throne was a likeness as the appearance of a man on it above. 
verse:1:27 I saw as it were glowing metal, as the appearance of fire within it all around, from the appearance of his waist and upward; and from the appearance of his waist and downward I saw as it were the appearance of fire, and there was brightness around him. 
verse:1:28 As the appearance of the rainbow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness all around. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of HASHEM. When I saw it, I fell on my face, and I heard a voice of one that spoke.
verse:3:12 Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me the voice of a great rushing, saying, Blessed be the glory of HASHEM from his place.
portion:Ezekiel 28:25 - 29:21
verse:28:25 Thus says HASHEM GOD: When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then shall they dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob. 
verse:28:26 They shall dwell securely therein; yes, they shall build houses, and plant vineyards, and shall dwell securely, when I have executed judgments on all those who do them despite all around them; and they shall know that I am HASHEM their God.
verse:29:1 In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of HASHEM came to me, saying, 
verse:29:2 "Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt. 
verse:29:3 Speak and say, 'Thus says HASHEM GOD: "Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his rivers, that has said, 'My river is my own, and I have made it for myself.' 
verse:29:4 I will put hooks in your jaws, and I will make the fish of your rivers stick to your scales; and I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, with all the fish of your rivers which stick to your scales. 
verse:29:5 I'll cast you forth into the wilderness, you and all the fish of your rivers. You'll fall on the open field. You won't be brought together, nor gathered. I have given you for food to the animals of the earth and to the birds of the sky. 
verse:29:6 All the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am HASHEM, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel. 
verse:29:7 When they took hold of you by your hand, you broke, and tore all their shoulders; and when they leaned on you, you broke, and paralyzed all of their thighs." 
verse:29:8 Therefore thus says HASHEM GOD: "Behold, I will bring a sword on you, and will cut off man and animal from you. 
verse:29:9 The land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste; and they shall know that I am HASHEM. Because he has said, 'The river is mine, and I have made it;' 
verse:29:10 therefore, behold, I am against you, and against your rivers, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from the tower of Seveneh even to the border of Ethiopia. 
verse:29:11 No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of animal shall pass through it, neither shall it be inhabited forty years. 
verse:29:12 I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be a desolation forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries." 
verse:29:13 For thus says HASHEM GOD: "At the end of forty years will I gather the Egyptians from the peoples where they were scattered; 
verse:29:14 and I will bring back the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their birth; and they shall be there a base kingdom. 
verse:29:15 It shall be the base of the kingdoms; neither shall it any more lift itself up above the nations: and I will diminish them, that they shall no more rule over the nations. 
verse:29:16 It shall be no more the confidence of the house of Israel, bringing iniquity to memory, when they turn to look after them: and they shall know that I am HASHEM GOD."'" 
verse:29:17 It came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first [month], in the first [day] of the month, the word of HASHEM came to me, saying, 
verse:29:18 Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon caused his army to serve a great service against Tyre: every head was made bald, and every shoulder was worn; yet had he no wages, nor his army, from Tyre, for the service that he had served against it. 
verse:29:19 Therefore thus says HASHEM GOD: Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he shall carry off her multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the wages for his army. 
verse:29:20 I have given him the land of Egypt as his recompense for which he served, because they worked for me, says HASHEM GOD. 
verse:29:21 In that day will I cause a horn to bud forth to the house of Israel, and I will give you the opening of the mouth in their midst; and they shall know that I am HASHEM.
portion:Ezekiel 37:1 - 37:14
verse:37:1 The hand of HASHEM was on me, and he brought me out in the Spirit of HASHEM, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones. 
verse:37:2 He caused me to pass by them all around: and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and behold, they were very dry. 
verse:37:3 He said to me, Son of man, can these bones live? I answered, HASHEM GOD, you know. 
verse:37:4 Again he said to me, Prophesy over these bones, and tell them, you dry bones, hear the word of HASHEM. 
verse:37:5 Thus says HASHEM GOD to these bones: Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and you shall live. 
verse:37:6 I will lay sinews on you, and will bring up flesh on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you shall live; and you shall know that I am HASHEM. 
verse:37:7 So I prophesied as I was commanded: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and behold, an earthquake; and the bones came together, bone to its bone. 
verse:37:8 I saw, and, behold, there were sinews on them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them above; but there was no breath in them. 
verse:37:9 Then he said to me, Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and tell the wind, Thus says HASHEM GOD: Come from the four winds, breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live. 
verse:37:10 So I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived, and stood up on their feet, an exceedingly great army. 
verse:37:11 Then he said to me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost; we are clean cut off. 
verse:37:12 Therefore prophesy, and tell them, Thus says HASHEM GOD: Behold, I will open your graves, and cause you to come up out of your graves, my people; and I will bring you into Eretz-Israel. 
verse:37:13 You shall know that I am HASHEM, when I have opened your graves, and caused you to come up out of your graves, my people. 
verse:37:14 I will put my Spirit in you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land: and you shall know that I, HASHEM, have spoken it and performed it, says HASHEM.
portion:Ezekiel 37:15 - 37:28
verse:37:15 The word of HASHEM came again to me, saying, 
verse:37:16 You, son of man, take one stick, and write on it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write on it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim, and [for] all the house of Israel his companions: 
verse:37:17 and join them for you one to another into one stick, that they may become one in your hand. 
verse:37:18 When the children of your people shall speak to you, saying, Will you not show us what you mean by these? 
verse:37:19 tell them, Thus says HASHEM GOD: Behold, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his companions; and I will put them with it, [even] with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they shall be one in my hand. 
verse:37:20 The sticks whereon you write shall be in your hand before their eyes. 
verse:37:21 Say to them, Thus says HASHEM GOD: Behold, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, where they are gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring them into their own land: 
verse:37:22 and I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king shall be king to them all; and they shall be no more two nations, neither shall they be divided into two kingdoms any more at all; 
verse:37:23 neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places, in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God. 
verse:37:24 My servant David shall be king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my ordinances, and observe my statutes, and do them. 
verse:37:25 They shall dwell in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, in which your fathers lived; and they shall dwell therein, they, and their children, and their children's children, forever: and David my servant shall be their prince for ever. 
verse:37:26 Moreover I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them; and I will place them, and multiply them, and will set my sanctuary in their midst forevermore. 
verse:37:27 My tent also shall be with them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people. 
verse:37:28 The nations shall know that I am HASHEM who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in their midst forevermore.
portion:Ezekiel 38:18 - 39:16
verse:38:18 It shall happen in that day, when Gog shall come against Eretz-Israel, says HASHEM GOD, that my wrath shall come up into my nostrils. 
verse:38:19 For in my jealousy and in the fire of my wrath have I spoken, Surely in that day there shall be a great shaking in Eretz-Israel; 
verse:38:20 so that the fish of the sea, and the birds of the sky, and the animals of the field, and all creeping things who creep on the earth, and all the men who are on the surface of the earth, shall shake at my presence, and the mountains shall be thrown down, and the steep places shall fall, and every wall shall fall to the ground. 
verse:38:21 I will call for a sword against him to all my mountains, says HASHEM GOD: every man's sword shall be against his brother. 
verse:38:22 With pestilence and with blood will I enter into judgment with him; and I will rain on him, and on his hordes, and on the many peoples who are with him, an overflowing shower, and great hailstones, fire, and sulfur. 
verse:38:23 I will magnify myself, and sanctify myself, and I will make myself known in the eyes of many nations; and they shall know that I am HASHEM.
verse:39:1 You, son of man, prophesy against Gog, and say, Thus says HASHEM GOD: Behold, I am against you, Gog, prince of Rosh, Meshech, and Tubal: 
verse:39:2 and I will turn you around, and will lead you on, and will cause you to come up from the uttermost parts of the north; and I will bring you on the mountains of Israel; 
verse:39:3 and I will strike your bow out of your left hand, and will cause your arrows to fall out of your right hand. 
verse:39:4 You shall fall on the mountains of Israel, you, and all your hordes, and the peoples who are with you: I will give you to the ravenous birds of every sort, and to the animals of the field to be devoured. 
verse:39:5 You shall fall on the open field; for I have spoken it, says HASHEM GOD. 
verse:39:6 I will send a fire on Magog, and on those who dwell securely in the islands; and they shall know that I am HASHEM. 
verse:39:7 My holy name will I make known in the midst of my people Israel; neither will I allow my holy name to be profaned any more: and the nations shall know that I am HASHEM, the Holy One in Israel. 
verse:39:8 Behold, it comes, and it shall be done, says HASHEM GOD; this is the day about which I have spoken. 
verse:39:9 Those who dwell in the cities of Israel shall go forth, and shall make fires of the weapons and burn them, both the shields and the bucklers, the bows and the arrows, and the war clubs, and the spears, and they shall make fires of them seven years; 
verse:39:10 so that they shall take no wood out of the field, neither cut down any out of the forests; for they shall make fires of the weapons; and they shall plunder those who plundered them, and rob those who robbed them, says HASHEM GOD. 
verse:39:11 It shall happen in that day, that I will give to Gog a place for burial in Israel, the valley of those who pass through on the east of the sea; and it shall stop those who pass through: and there shall they bury Gog and all his multitude; and they shall call it The valley of Hamon Gog. 
verse:39:12 Seven months shall the house of Israel be burying them, that they may cleanse the land. 
verse:39:13 Yes, all the people of the land shall bury them; and it shall be to them a renown in the day that I shall be glorified, says HASHEM GOD. 
verse:39:14 They shall set apart men of continual employment, who shall pass through the land, and, with those who pass through, those who bury those who remain on the surface of the land, to cleanse it: after the end of seven months shall they search. 
verse:39:15 Those who pass through the land shall pass through; and when any sees a man's bone, then shall he set up a sign by it, until the undertakers have buried it in the valley of Hamon Gog. 
verse:39:16 Hamonah shall also be the name of a city. Thus shall they cleanse the land.
portion:Ezekiel 43:10 - 43:27
verse:43:10 You, son of man, show the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the pattern. 
verse:43:11 If they be ashamed of all that they have done, make known to them the form of the house, and its fashion, and its exits, and its entrances, and all its forms, and all its ordinances, and all its forms, and all its laws; and write it in their sight; that they may keep the whole form of it, and all its ordinances, and do them. 
verse:43:12 This is the law of the house: on the top of the mountain the whole limit around it shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house. 
verse:43:13 These are the measures of the altar by cubits (the cubit is a cubit and a handbreadth): the bottom shall be a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and its border around its edge a span; and this shall be the base of the altar. 
verse:43:14 From the bottom on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits, and the breadth a cubit. 
verse:43:15 The upper altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar hearth and upward there shall be four horns. 
verse:43:16 The altar hearth shall be twelve [cubits] long by twelve broad, square in the four sides of it. 
verse:43:17 The ledge shall be fourteen [cubits] long by fourteen broad in the four sides of it; and the border about it shall be half a cubit; and its bottom shall be a cubit around; and its steps shall look toward the east. 
verse:43:18 He said to me, Son of man, thus says HASHEM GOD: These are the ordinances of the altar in the day when they shall make it, to offer burnt offerings thereon, and to sprinkle blood thereon. 
verse:43:19 You shall give to the priests the Levites who are of the seed of Zadok, who are near to me, to minister to me, says HASHEM GOD, a young bull for a sin offering. 
verse:43:20 You shall take of its blood, and put it on the four horns of it, and on the four corners of the ledge, and on the border all around: thus you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it. 
verse:43:21 You shall also take the bull of the sin offering, and it shall be burnt in the appointed place of the house, outside of the sanctuary. 
verse:43:22 On the second day you shall offer a male goat without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they cleansed it with the bull. 
verse:43:23 When you have finished cleansing it, you shall offer a young bull without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without blemish. 
verse:43:24 You shall bring them near to HASHEM, and the priests shall cast salt on them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering to HASHEM. 
verse:43:25 Seven days you shall prepare every day a goat for a sin offering: they shall also prepare a young bull, and a ram out of the flock, without blemish. 
verse:43:26 Seven days shall they make atonement for the altar and purify it; so shall they consecrate it. 
verse:43:27 When they have accomplished the days, it shall be that on the eighth day, and forward, the priests shall make your burnt offerings on the altar, and your peace offerings; and I will accept you, says HASHEM GOD.
portion:Ezekiel 44:15 - 44:31
verse:44:15 But the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok, who performed the duty of my sanctuary when the children of Israel went astray from me, they shall come near to me to minister to me; and they shall stand before me to offer to me the fat and the blood, says HASHEM GOD: 
verse:44:16 they shall enter into my sanctuary, and they shall come near to my table, to minister to me, and they shall keep my instruction. 
verse:44:17 It shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come on them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within. 
verse:44:18 They shall have linen tires on their heads, and shall have linen breeches on their waists; they shall not clothe themselves with [anything that causes] sweat. 
verse:44:19 When they go forth into the outer court, even into the outer court to the people, they shall put off their garments in which they minister, and lay them in the holy rooms; and they shall put on other garments, that they not sanctify the people with their garments. 
verse:44:20 Neither shall they shave their heads, nor allow their locks to grow long; they shall only cut off the hair of their heads. 
verse:44:21 Neither shall any of the priests drink wine, when they enter into the inner court. 
verse:44:22 Neither shall they take for their wives a widow, nor her who is put away; but they shall take virgins of the seed of the house of Israel, or a widow who is the widow of a priest. 
verse:44:23 They shall teach my people the difference between the holy and the common, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean. 
verse:44:24 In a controversy they shall stand to judge; according to my ordinances shall they judge it: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts; and they shall make my Sabbaths holy. 
verse:44:25 They shall go in to no dead person to defile themselves; but for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother, or for sister who has had no husband, they may defile themselves. 
verse:44:26 After he is cleansed, they shall reckon to him seven days. 
verse:44:27 In the day that he goes into the sanctuary, into the inner court, to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering, says HASHEM GOD. 
verse:44:28 They shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no possession in Israel; I am their possession. 
verse:44:29 They shall eat the meal offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; and every devoted thing in Israel shall be theirs. 
verse:44:30 The first of all the first fruits of every thing, and every offering of everything, of all your offerings, shall be for the priest: you shall also give to the priests the first of your dough, to cause a blessing to rest on your house. 
verse:44:31 The priests shall not eat of anything that dies of itself, or is torn, whether it be bird or animal.
portion:Numbers 28:9 - 28:15
verse:28:9 "'On the Sabbath day two male lambs a year old without blemish, and two tenth parts of an efah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with oil, and the drink offering of it: 
verse:28:10 this is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, besides the continual burnt offering, and the drink offering of it.
verse:28:11 "'In the beginnings of your months you shall offer a burnt offering to HASHEM: two young bulls, and one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish; 
verse:28:12 and three tenth parts of an efah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with oil, for each bull; and two tenth parts of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with oil, for the one ram; 
verse:28:13 and a tenth part of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering to every lamb; for a burnt offering of a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to HASHEM.
